review_body: This hotel needs a face lift in the inside but I liked my room overall. I liked the convenience of the location and that there was a restaurant in the building. All the rooms have a balcony and a view of the canal. The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki. The gym is run down and needs work. The pool and hot tub is a perk and a high light. There is free parking on the street and valet at the hotel. It is hard to get the free parking on the street but its possible.

I just returned home from a 9 day stay at Waikiki Sand Villa. I am a budget traveler so finding a room in central Waikiki under $200/night is a challenge. But Sand Villa ticks all my boxes, and then some. Their pool area is nicer than many of the fancy places. Because I stayed a week I got the buffet breakfast free each morning, and free shuttle from and back to the airport (they contract with Robert's). Also free Star Advertiser (local newspaper) available in the lobby each morning. Pool/beach towels available by honor check out on the hospitality floor.The staff was amazing, in all parts of the hotel operation... front desk, bar/restaurant, maids, maintenance, everyone was welcoming and friendly. I knew from one previous stay that it can be noisy from the traffic along the Ala Wai canal, so did pay a small amount more to be up higher in the building (that's how their room categories go, on the 8th floor, and where I saw sunrise over the canal each morning. The room was perfect for me. I was solo and with a comfy king bed. Decent linens and towels. Everything kept very clean. I used the undercounter frig. There is also a coffee maker, but I just went down and had breakfast on the patio each morning.I walked around for a look/see at the other hotels that had been on my list of possibilities but none, in that price range, beat what I found at Sand Villa. They give a 10% discount coupon for return visitors with no expiration date. They will see me again the next time I'm in Waikiki.Will try to add a few photos, but the ones on their website are accurate. Feel free to PM me thru TA if you have any questions about this wonderful place to stay.

About three blocks from the beach, this hotel is clean, and the lobby has the right amount of Hawaiian charm. The Ala Wai canal is very walkable and just across the street. Staff is friendly and helpful. Hotel could use a bit of fresh paint. Stores and restaurants are nearby. Bus stops are conveniently a block away. There is a secluded 70' pool, nice jacuzzi, and foot spa. The hotel supplies hand soap,shampoo, and body wash from soap dispensers. Bring your own bar soap, if you are particular about your shampoo bring your own. Don't forget your conditioner. Hotel has a bar plus a restaurant. When we've seen resort fees from $17 to $50/day at other hotels, this great hotel chooses not to charge a resort fee--a refreshing change!

I chose this hotel based on multiple recommendations in the "stickies", which, if you use a phone or tablet, you may not even know exist. This is an older property and a bit of a hike to the beach (10-15 minutes), about 6 minutes to the International Market Place, and various restaurants. There is a bar and grill on site with not one, but two, happy hours!. The staff is 5* friendly and helpful. There is a nice mix of locals and guests in the bar, and usually some lively conversation. I watched the Super Bowl here, and thought the drinks and food were good, especially the ahi poke bowl..My room was clean, there were two waters and two guava juices in the fridge (complimentary) and a nice two mug coffee maker and kona blend coffee. The amenities are, unfortunately, in the newly mandated bulk style. Bathroom is small but OK, no grab bar in tub. Lighting just OK. The lighting in the room itself is good, especially the sliding door to the balcony! Also bedside lamps, one over the table, and a stray floor lamp that was not plugged in that I guess you could move to where needed. There is no available outlet at the head of the bed, but a completely free four outlet fixture by the table. I had no problems with the free wifi and my phone automatically connected when I walked back to the property. I think it's a first that I only had to log on once in five days!The pool is very nice, and they have a foot spa, which I didn't use. Rumor has it there's a fitness center, and there's a self service laundry on the second floor.This room would be a definite squeeze for 4 people. Two cons: skip the breakfast buffet--it costs $12.57 and is on par with the free breakfasts that, for example, the Choice Hotel chains offer. (Instead walk to the Kona Coffee Purveyor next to the International Market Place, Kuhio Ave entrance.) Also, I never did see a towel at the pool towel dispensary box (but I didn't go ask for one either).If you're looking for upscale, a special occasion trip, or a "heart of the action" place, look elsewhere. As a solo traveler it fit the bill and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Second time at this hotel, and with the construction going on they upgraded our room. Pool and hot tub are available for hotel guests until 9pm, and the foot spa is open until midnight. Free breakfast is something that is almost unheard of in Waikiki, so that is an added bonus. Coffee is great! If booked directly through them, car parking is half priced, and if booked 4 nights or longer, free shuttle to and from the airport. Think i have found my new go to hotel when on island.

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel at least 5 times.While it is not on the beach, it is only 3 blocks away. It is unassuming but clean and safe. We are really active, and we’ve been to Waikiki many times. So we don’t fit the “normal”tourist. We don’t need a lot from a hotel, but every request we have is always treated with respect and taken care of immediately.Why we like it:We like to walk up diamond head every day and it’s a perfect distanceIt’s close to surfing on Waikiki beachWe like to walk or bus to ala moana to swim every dayIt does not have a “resort fee”If you book through the hotel and stay for 3 or 4 days (I forget which) you get breakfastThe staff is extremely nice and helpfulThe staff is personableWe really like the staff!!The rooms are cleanNice pool and hot tubVery safe locationShuttle from the airport included (however, if you have oversized luggage - like bikes, surf board, etc-there is an extra charge from the bus company)Did I mention that the staff is awesome?It is not fancy but it works.It’s far enough away from the “busy”ness of kalakaua and kuhio. Close enough to both those streets to be convenient.What we don’t likeI can’t think of anythingI you want to pay more for super fancy, go somewhere else. If you want an amazing staff, clean, safe and affordable this is the place!Aloha!

I was lucky enough to return here in November for a brief stay. The hotel was as welcoming as ever. Lots of international visitors. Great happy hour with food and drink specials, too. Complimentary shuttle to and from the airport is an included perk.My room was comfy and had a nice view of Ali Wai canal and the mountains. The pool was a nice spot to unwind after a busy day out and about. Breakfast was included, both Asian and US dishes. I loved the miso broth. The in-room fridge and coffee maker were much appreciated, too.The hotel is classic mid-century design, in a neighborhood filled with architectural delights. It's just a quick stroll to Kalakua Avenue and the beach, and TheBus stops right around the corner.Also used One's Car Rental, which is on the premises. Fine car, no issues, fair prices.I look forward to a return trip in the future.

I was happy with this hotel as far as price, location, check in and employees at the front desk. I would have given them a higher rating. However, we asked an employee ( a male) who appeared to be pushing a laundry cart through the lobby for directions to the double decker tour bus stop. He did not even attempt to be helpful. As we turned to get on the elevator. He turned to another male employee and referred to us by what is known a a derogatory name for tourists in Hawaiian. The tone he used and the rolling of his eyes made it clear that it was intended as an insult. He then got on the elevator with us. The term he used was 'haole'. It is a word arising from a distrust of foreigners or outsiders (a term used in Hawaii to refer to a white person.) I made a point of making sure he knew before I walked away that I knew exactly what the word meant and that he was rude and the name calling was totally inappropriate. He made no attempt to apologize. Just smirked and walked away. I will not stay here again and will not recommend this place to others. The elevators were also not working properly the day we stayed. There was a very long wait.

For the price, this hotel was amazing. if you want somewhere in a great location, walkable distance to central Waikiki, and still want the hotel experience (pool, jacuzzi, valet etc), don't hesitate to book here. We booked through the website and got super cheap valet parking and free breakfast and free airport transport. The view of the canal was nice too, and we got to sit on little balcony as well. The rooms are a little bit dated, but for the price, it is amazing value.

Waikiki sand villa is one of those secrets tips in Honolulu if your looking for a good deal and still want the hotel experience. The pool is great , the staff is very friendly and professional. The location is great. Right on the canal and if you ask for a corner suit you get a view of Diamond Head. Big palms right outside your window. The ac works very well. Medium size fridge ,coffee maker and a Japanese Toilet. The breakfast is included if you book direct with the hotel. I would recommend that for sure they always have deals. Also the hotel has one of those smaller rental car outlets in the lobby that offer great rates . Let me tell everyone that is a big deal because rental cars are expensive in Honolulu. The hotel is in walking distance (5min) to Waikiki beach.Also lots of shopping around for food and everything else you need. Hawaii is a dream vacation so much so that a affordable hotel can make all the difference if you can go our not, so everyone have a great stay. Aloha

Had a lovely time at this hotel, only one problem, the noise from the road, which they cannot do anything about.Had a problem with my room but they relocated me promptly.The staff were lovely and helpful, couldn’t fault them at all.The pool and spa etc were always clean and well maintained.Had a massage at the hotel - brilliant.

Clean & inexpensive place to chill without being hit with resort fees and outrageous parking! If you don't need the full resort pampering and amenities this is a great place. Staff is awesome and take very good care of me. I'll be back!

Friendly and helpful staff at front counter and housekeeping. The hotel is located within walking distance of shopping, restaurants and the beach or canal. We had a nice view of the canal from our room and deck. It was convenient to have an in-room safe. We managed to enjoy the hot tub on three afternoons before they closed it off the day before we left for home. We were so looking forward to a bit of relaxation there on our last day there. We enjoyed a lunch and another day had appies/wine for an afternoon break at the Sand Bar & Grill. Service was good and food was tasty.The carpet in the hallways was in poor condition and should be removed/replaced. Room was quite small and in need of updating. Curtains were deteriorating. The beds and pillows were not comfortable. No where to place our large suitcase so we ended up placing in on the small round bistro table for easy access. Not enough lighting in the bathroom to see when trying to put on makeup. Would prefer bars of soap and small containers of shampoo and conditioner. Did not like using the shampoo or body wash dispenser. Do not use body wash and if the shampoo doesn't include conditioner, then the conditioner should be supplied for the many of us that like to use it. There was constant loud noise from the traffic down below and no soundproofing when the sliding door is closed. It was hard to relax in the room or on the deck with so much noise from the constant traffic or work going on nearby. Double glazed windows and doors might slightly help to reduce the loud volume of noise.

Anyone who has stated this is a great hotel really don't know what quality is. I decided to get this room based on customer service replies to fix the complaints. During my stay I did notice the same things . AC barely worked. Filters need to be cleaned. Floors in room and hall ways need to be cleaned.(shampooed once a week) vacuumed 3 times a day) TV was small. TV was old and barely working . Bathrooms were nasty. Wall paper needed changed. Tubs need to be scrubbed . Shower was spitting out black dirt. Compared to other hotels that are 3 star this one should have not been considered a 1 star. 1 elevator working. Pool also needed to be cleaned. Hot Tub was not hot at all was lukewarm and jets barely working as well. Pride and Professional of the workers at this location was sub-par compared to other 3 star hotels based on the cleanliness of the hotel alone. Whoever owns this property really doesn't care about it otherwise he or she would of addressed the issues by now. Sounds like people need to be fired.

The location of this hotel is great and within walking distance to everything we needed. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and the breakfast is also quite good. I enjoyed having drinks and eating at the bar and it has a decent pool and foot spa. No resort fee is a bonus and I think the hotel is above average considering the rates per night. A free shuttle to and from the airport was also provided which was very convenient. I highly recommend this hotel to others on a budget.

this hotel for food and drink was good price and the staff were good company we spent many nights and days having cocktails and beers we will go here again when we visit waikiki on our next vacation soon

Rooms are always cleaned, very lovely staff, room had seperate a/c. Breakfast was only veggie noodles, scrambled eggs sometime runny,little snags, potato gems, rice & on and off chicken nuggets or fried salami. They also had a soup of some kind. Coffee and juice was included and tea drinkers had to pay.Pool was very nice, happy hour was very good and the meals were not too dear either.The view of the mountains was good and occasionally you could see the clouds coming in.Very close to everything and meeting points for tour pickups.Shops are close and local busses are $5.50 for all day travel hop on off.

Staff was great, helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is a bit dated, needs a refurbishment. The bar was good. The major ding I would say about this establishment is the poor quality of the food. Advertised as breakfast, lunch and dinner being served, the only time you will see anyone eating in this restaurant will be in the morning. This is because the fair being served for lunch and dinner are hardly edible. We, (my wife and myself) gave this place our business three times and found it completely lacking. Too bad because it would have been so much nicer to be able to catch a quick bite before or after the days activities.

We are currently here in the hotel, we paid $1300 US for 10 nights which with the Australian dollar not being good at all worked well into my budget, the free breakfast is fine for the price I paid which was zero as it was included in my room rate as I booked direct with the hotel, the room is on the small side but works well for myself and my 2 teenagers, the walk to the main drag in Waikiki is not even 10 mins and there is an ABC store on the corner up from the hotel, the pool looks massive but we haven’t tried it yet. If your budget conscious then this hotel is perfect. It is older it’s not 5 stars and the age is definitely showing but how much time do you spend in the room? Definitely recommended. The staff and housekeeping are great aswell.

I stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed this hotel. Yes, it's older and bit a luxurious resort, but my room was comfortable (and recently refurbished with hardwood floors), the view over Ali Wai Canal was beautiful, and the facilities more than adequate. There's a coffee maker and a mini fridge in the rooms, very useful.It's a quick stroll to Kalakaua Avenue and all its offerings, but the hotel is set back from the busy, noisy vibe there. The neighborhood also has residential buildings and a fabulous collection of mid century modern architecture. Yes, you might hear traffic from the street below. But I'm used to city noise (I live next to LAX) and slept with the lanai door open most nights.Breakfast is included, and is a mix of US and Asian offerings. I enjoyed the miso broth a few times. There's also a restaurant (good happy hour drinks and pupus) and a separate wine bar. I took advantage of the car rental service and the pick up and drop off went smoothly. The hotel gives a 50% discount on overnight parking for rental customers, too.The pool setting is tranquil and there's a saltwater hot tub. And a new solar powered foot soa is available free to guests, a welcome relief after a long day of walking.There were visitors from Japan, Canada, the UK and Australia staying at the hotel. It's good value for money and a nice smaller property. If that's what you're looking for, this hotel is for you.

Booked a hotel for one night online when back in Waikiki,but upon arrival it turns out we booked the wrong day. Non refundable as it is “last minute cancellation”, our bad. Tired from the road from North Shore, was nothing more for them to do as offer to try get us a room as they said it was almost fully booked. Receptionist was wonderful, did her best and got a room, checked us in, gave instructions, said that there is complimentary breakfast for as included as well from 6:30am to 10:00am. The rooms-kind of clean (don’t put or loose anything under the bed-dusty),bit outdated. AC was working great,but had to leave one of the keys in the room to keep it cool, when we went out. In the fridge 2 bottles of water and soda complimentary on the first day! Ice machine in the hall. Great! Guest laundry with coins on hospitality floor was a good thing,got all clothes clean before packing.So to my disappointment in the morning,went to buffet to check what they got there for breakfast, said my room nr to hostess as instructed upon arrival,they checked their book of entry, pointed at the buffet and said that I can pay after and it will be $12,50. What does complimentary mean? Misunderstanding? Maybe. Didn’t engage to clarify as I wasn’t impressed with the offer, went somewhere else. Overall good, but for the price of the room next time in Waikiki will choose other hotel options.

We usually stay at The Ilima a few blocks down but thought we would try this hotel out since they have a bigger pool, a little closer to Waikiki beach, and it seems like there are a lot of repeat customers. We stayed here for 4 nights and it was not a relaxing stay. My family hated it and wanted to leave. But we stuck it out.Pros:The swimming pool is nice, large, perfect temperature, not crowded, with plants and flowers. There's enough chairs and lounges around the pool with umbrellas. It is nice to come back from a hot day and be able to swim in a relaxing pool. They have a jacuzzi. Granted that it needs to be painted (the sides look blackish, from mold?). The area around the pool needs to be maintained. There is a door, near the bathroom, that is COMPLETELY RUSTED. How is it like that? Does no one notice? The women's bathroom by the pool was out of service the whole time I was there. I doubt anyone was coming to fix it.The location of the hotel is good. Two blocks down and you are right on Waikiki beach (by the police station). Nice easy walk.We got discounted valet parking. It is narrow going up that ramp with cars parked on one side. Most of the time we did not have a problem leaving and getting our car. But one evening, there were 3 cars just parked in front of the hotel and abandoned on the ramp, and no one was tending to the valet service. I had to go to the front desk to tell them and still no valet person came. Finally someone came and he was so slow and definitely not in a hurry to move anything. My husband waited on the ramp for more than 30 minutes. Ridiculous and unprofessional!We had free breakfast there. It was okay, and free, and had consisted of yogurt, rice, miso soup, a type of meat (sausages, etc...), mixed vegetables, juice and coffee. Not bad, not great.CONS:The hotel lobby is open air and sort of busy and stressful. The elevators are awful looking - ripped carpet, just really old. We were on the 10th floor, and the hallway looked like something from an old hospital institution from the 1950s. It was scary looking, dim, and the carpet looked so stained, like from a horror movie. How can a hotel be in operation with hallways like that?? Our room was tiny, and the AC only works when you put the key in, so make sure you keep that key in there when you leave the room. Even though the AC is on, you can barely feel anything, and we had it on the lowest temperate and high speed. It just barely works. We had a corner room with sliding doors on both sides, so we opened the doors and it was hot even with trade winds. It was quite windy (but a hot windy) and very noisy below. We ultimately had to close the doors and suffered the heat in the stifling room with a barely functioning AC. the room was cramped, and the tv was small, and I think i got a renovated room but you couldn't really tell.Oh, and if you need a pool towel, good luck and go to the2nd floor which is like a scary factory with tons of workers and laundry machines. You have to go there to sign in and return the towels. They also have a hospitality "suite" where you can change if your flight is later. Note that you have to share this room so anyone else can be in there.No offense to this hotel but honestly, how are you still in business? Your hotel is in absolute disrepair and none of your air conditioners work. Do you not notice the problems?? We survived the hotel but would never recommend this hotel and will never be going back. the only saving grace is the nice pool. There are too many better hotels out there. This one caused discomfort, and stress... It was not a pleasant nor relaxing stay at all.

Staff are friendly and it has a nice outdoor ambiance. It’s close to everything. I was very happy with the location.I do not recommend this hotel when it is super hot. We were there during an unusual heat wave. Our hotel room was 80 degrees upon arrival. The air conditioner won’t work without the room key, so make sure you get at least 2. After 4 hours, it only got down to 79 degrees, so I requested another room. Others told me their air didn’t work either. We were moved to another room next day. With 4 hours to kill between rooms, we enjoyed the pool. It was very refreshing and I heard one of the biggest in the area. We didn’t need to worry about our belongings like we did at the beach.Our 2nd room got down to 74, so we were happy. Unfortunately, there was an ice machine about 20 feet away the hotel staff used to fill plastic containers all hours of the night. It seemed to go on forever, was very noisy and woke me several times.The rooms were old and outdated, but fine for the price if not for the heat. They do not clean under the beds, so don’t lose anything unless you want to fight the dust bunnies for it.They have a breakfast buffet, but for $1/per person more you can get much better around the corner at TR Fire Grill in the Hilton Garden Inn. Absolutely no comparison and your food won’t get attacked by birds when you get up to get coffee.Will I stay there again? – most likely not unless I’m on a severely strict budget.

The Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel is perfectly located near the Royal Hawaiian Center and Waikiki Beach. I recommend asking for a high-up room that overlooks the canal because it is a gorgeous view. The hotel has a pool and "foot spa" (aka, a separated area with hot water - not really a spa). The rooms are inside with air conditioning but, in true Hawaii fashion, the rest of the hotel (reception, restaurant, etc) are outside with no air conditioning. There is also only valet parking so don't be surprised if you have a nightly charge added to your bill.

We enjoyed our stay here, lovely hotel, perfect location, rooms had everything we needed, lovely pool area, friendly staff. We booked direct got the best price as well as free airport transfers and breakfast. Will definately stay here next time we go :)

We stayed here for two nights before heading off to the 'Big Island' and stayed here again for our last night before flying out. It's not the flashest place to stay in Waikiki but it was clean, well maintained and great value for money in an ideal position. We even had a room with a terrific view! A great pool, free, quality breakfast and no hidden charges, like resort fees that most hotels seem to add on when you get to the 'payment' part of the booking process.The staff were friendly and helpful. All up, a very pleasant stay right in the middle of Waikiki. Would definitely stay here again.

We rented two rooms and stayed 6 days. First thing we noticed was how hot the rooms were. So we adjusted the temperatures and went out for a few hours. Noticed that the temperature did not get below 75 degrees. We called the front desk to please fix the AC. First time they just adjusted from auto to fan and said fixed. It did not obviously fix the problem so we called again. They said it might be the filter but they don't have any filters. Then they said it cannot be fixed but since the hotel was booked full there is nothing they can do. So we had to put up with the hot room. The floor corridors are absolutely filthy and seems they never replaced the carpet from the 70's. Yellow and once green now grey carpeting. Horrible stains. So NO we would not recommend the hotel sadly. However, the people are very friendly and the location is fairly close to the beach.

This hotel is not fancy, but you will have all you need and the staff is very helpful, pleasant and friendly. We had a full breakfast, valet parking, beach towels, coffee machine in the room with all the fixings and there is a pool. It is walking distance to the main drag and all the shops. We truly enjoyed our stay and are glad we booked directly with the hotel as it saved us money.

We stayed here for ten nights and found it convenient and comfortable. It was a short walk to the beach, shops and restaurant but out of the hustle and bustle when we wanted to relax. Our balcony had views over the canal and beautiful sunrises. We appreciated the complimentary buffet breakfast and airport transfers. It is not a new building and is showing its age in some respects, but the amenities were all we required. We often had the pool to ourselves, and a mai tai in the foot spa was a great way to end the day. The beds were comfortable with good bed linen, and though we could hear sirens and street noises they did not disturb our sleep. Staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

The hotel is well located, about 5 minutes walk from Waikiki main beach, shops, bus stops. If you are staying for a week or more, they will organise an airport transfer for you. The decor/amenities were slightly dated (eg safe requires a key from reception) but the room was clean. The included breakfast buffet is somewhat limited, eg there is no cereal, but there is toast, rice, miso soup, fruit etc, so it should meet most people's needs. There is no concierge desk but staff will look up bus etc timetables for you. The room could be a bit noisy with the window/door open, but was fine with it closed.

Outside noise vehicles, loud voices yelling etcRooms paper thin can hear those above banging around, we were on 5th floor room 506.Shower water never hot quite hit n miss Beds small double caved in middle Rooms have 2xdouble but even with 2 people we were constantly walking around each otherLighting in bath room was awful couldn't see a thing, room tinyBar was one of a handful allowed to open late I.e. early hours of morningBreakfast buffet included for us was perfect, although being on several times on self and on food and in drinks not ideal, as the birds just fly in.No tour desk only a car hire place targeting the Japanese.Location was good a 5min walk to beachWouldn't stay again if I was ever in Waikiki would try elsewhere.

We stayed here in June as pictures looked nice and though it wasn’t the cheapest of places to stay , nor the most expensive- we went with it as parking wasn’t bad compared to other places. The hotel was extremely old and dated, which i am just mentioning though it really isn’t a main issue at all. My issue was the cleanliness of the room - the floor was filthy - my toddler was crawling around picking up previous guests hair, dirt and bits off the floor. Which was disgusting. Under the bed we found some of the previous guests belongings that had been left and the maid had not even checked under the beds to brush them/ vacuume otherwise she would of noticed - my feet were filthy black even after just getting out the shower. All the runners on the balcony doors had dirt and rubbish in them , again my toddler was picking things out. Just to mention as well That the hotel is on one of the busiest/ noisiest streets in town , cars go up and down it all night long : so don’t expect a nice relaxing nights sleep. We left way before check out after the first night and booked a different hotel for our second night - the pictures and information about the hotel isn’t very accurate. All in all We were very disappointed with our stay. On returning home we had a email off the hotel asking us if we were happy with our stay and if we were then to kindly leave them a good review on trip advisor , if we were not happy with our stay then please can we email directly to address why - when I received the email I thought ok, I’ll email them back and let them know we were really disappointed and explain why. 3 weeks on and I have had no reply to the email I sent them, so I guess their customer service isn’t that great either if they are unable to reply to my email. When it was them who emailed me in the first place asking me to rate them on trip advisor. All in all , I wouldn’t stay there again.. there are cheaper hotels that I am sure are up to a sufficient standand of cleanliness - this is not one of them.

Stayed a week, .Very good location, with nice clean rooms. Pool was OK could do with more sitting with more shade.Ate twice food not the best here.Room attendant & Joel at the front entrance very helpful & friendly, but found the rest of the staff unfriendly.No electricity no aircon plus broken down one lift for about half a day.We asked for a free shuttle to air port for our inconvenience but were refused, might have been nice to have been offered even a free drink

My fiancé and I had a wonderful time at the Waikiki Sand Villa. I came across it by reading a review just like this, so it’s great to see how on point the feedback was from other reviewers. We stayed for 8 nights and enjoyed every minute. Check-in was simple, they accepted a package for us in advance, and we were good to go. It does not boast to be overly modern, or fancy, but it’s charm lies in the quiet atmosphere and historic feel. If you’re anything like us, you’ll enjoy it there because it is appreciated by locals (the restaurant called the Loco House has been a haunt for Honolulu residents for decades). Would absolutely stay again and listed some of the top s for us below: - The Loco House - amazing happy hour, super friendly prices, awesome staff, convenient to the max. There is also complimentary breakfast (subject to the number of nights you stay)- Location - you have the ability to walk everywhere in Waikiki without the droves of people (we stepped foot into the Hilton and were beyond overwhelmed)- Lanai - we hadn’t anticipated having a balcony, but we did and had a nice view of the canal. We found ourselves having drinks and leftovers out there quite often (would ask about that as might not be a feature of all rooms) - Pool facilities - It’s a great pool and on multiple occasions when we went we had it to ourselves. Even when we didn’t it was quiet and tranquil- Laundry - it’s not sexy, but being able to do our laundry midway through the trip was really helpful - Shuttle transport - we were able to book free transport through the hotel for both legs of the trip (only eligible if you stay a certain number of nights though so check before booking)
user_name:
carranzaromanza
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa for a week and a half and I loved it.First of all, the location was very centralized for Waikiki Beach. There were multiple ABC Stores nearby, the Waikiki Trolley hub was only a few blocks away, the beach was within a 10 min walk, and the Ala Wai Canal is across the street and so nice to walk along in the evening. There are multiple restaurants and take out food vendors nearby. Public transit is very accessible and convenient. The hotel was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. There was a mini fridge and a coffee maker in our room. The tv was a nice size, not that we used it alot. I really liked that the shower head had adjustable settings and was on a hose. The hotel could use a facelift in the hallways and guest rooms, as you could see where some doors had replacement doorknobs and were plastered, and the hallways were a bit darker, but the room was very bright and had both black out curtains and a sheer curtain, so you can block out as much of the city light as you want. I felt very safe and comfortable there. The hotel pool was a good size and clean. The hot tub and foot spa was nice too. The pool area never really seemed too busy, which I really liked. The greenery around the pool was nice also. Made it feel much more tropical than looking at the walls the the neighboring buildings.The restaurant Loco House was good. In the morning we had free buffet breakfast because we booked direct on their website. There was a decent mix of food there. The restaurant menu for the rest of the day was limited but good. The service was always good and quick and portion sizes were great. The staff was also great.Also, we got a free shuttle to and from the airport because we booked direct with the hotel, which they offer for up to 2 guests per room for 4 or more nights. There was a small car rental place in the lobby which was great. They were open until 7, and if you rent through them the hotel discounts your parking. If they are booked up, there is an Alamo around the corner also opened til about 7. Most other places close at 3. We only wanted a day rental so it was convenient to bring the vehicle back same day without paying for parking.There was a laundry room on site which is coin operated, and a hospitality room to relax after checking out our to get a shower and changing before heading to the airport. They even have pay per use massage chairs, $1 per 5 mins.In full disclosure, we were on the 7 the floor, and there was some street noise, because of the location of the hotel, mostly emergency vehicles. However, it wasn't my first time in Waikiki, and the last trip we stayed in a higher end hotel across from the beach and I found it much the same and we were on a much higher floor. So I feel like you may find that anywhere on the main drag in Waikiki.Last but certainly not least, the staff were amazing. They were so accommodating and so helpful in helping us find things and giving suggestions of things to do and see. Everyday getting us as we would come and go, and making sure everything was to our satisfaction. Overall, the price was excellent, and I would go back in a heartbeat.

We stayed 9 nights at the Waikiki Sand Villa hotel. Our view overlooked Ala Wai Canal & just minutes walk to Waikiki Beach, the zoo, shopping... Great location, we walked everywhere. The staff were 5 star, from the minute we checked in to the day we left. Front desk staff were always helpful. Housekeeping were great, as well as the Restaurant staff & Security. The menu at Loco House Restaurant was small, but food was good. You get a free breakfast when you book direct with hotel. We also received free airport shuttle by booking direct. Hotel also has laundry facility & there's a car rental right in the lobby. The room itself was visibly dated (old doors, fixtures ect) but it was Very Clean & Comfortable. You can see where there have been repairs done by the poor paint & plaster jobs. There is a fridge & coffee maker in the room, & the hotel has a hospitality room with a microwave if you wanted to heat up anything. Our flight home was in the evening, the hotel accommodated a late check out & held our bags until we were ready to leave. Also, there are showers in the hospitality room that we took advantage of, to freshen up before our flight. One issue that you may want to be aware of, is the hotel is on a corner, & there is a lot of traffic noise.Over all, If you're looking for 5 star luxury accommodations, this is not for you. But if you want a Clean, Comfortable & Affordable room in Waikiki, with friendly staff,.. I highly recommend this hotel. We would stay there again.

We stayed one night at the Waikiki Sand Villa. It was a short walk to the beach, shops, restaurants and bars. No resort fee. Hotel is a bit tired, but clean and great location. Good value and a nice end to our trip to 3 of the Hawaiian Islands.

My 2nd stay & I'm stoked on this place. Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location & by booking direct I get the best price with no resort fee, $12.50 parking and free breakfast. As long as they continue doing that, I'll keep booking it.

All we wanted was a clean, safe hotel that was close to everything. This place fit the bill. The fact that you don’t pay a resort fee is a plus for me. Hallways were dated but the room was clean. I appreciated the complimentary water and juice. Would stay again for sure if your on a tight budget.

Both my husband and I just recently returned from Oahu, for the past several years we have always stayed at this hotel, we will continue to do so in the near future (3 mo. from now).In pool area the jacuzzi is starting to turn black, possibly black mold all around the top of the rim of the jacuzzi. We are very happy that the fish and chips are back on the menu Yay! We have sent our friends, co-workers and our family to this wonderful hotel and they all have positive good feedback and they loved the hotel.Please bring back the hot noodle soup that was served in the hotel and We were disappointed that powder eggs was not fully cooked, tasted grainy had a funny taste to it. Did not taste good. The scrambled eggs was gooey and runny.Everything else was very good and miss all of you!

Prompt check in. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean rooms. Lovely pool and spa. Ideal location - a short walk to Waikiki Beach, ABC store, International Market Place & other great shopping, restaurants and cafes. Great value. Will certainly stay at the Waikiki Sand Villa on our next Hawaiian holiday.

I love this place. Wiakiki Sand Villa, is an amazing place to stay. Only 4 blocks from the beach. The staff is incredible, friendly, helpful and accommodating. Amenities are just perfect, beautiful, clean pool and Jacuzzi. A unique foot spa was fun. Awesome bar, with locals who regularly visit and get to know vacationers. Wonderful restraunt, with a variety of culinary delights. I could go on and on... definitely recommend a stay at Waikiki Sand Villa...

Our room was clean with great views of canal and mountains.The pool good size however this hotel is old.Needs major renovations the hospitality room was disgraceful old and awful.Service was friendly but ordinary overall I wouldn't go back breakfast is basic and mainly for the Japanese tourist. The room came with the worst coffee and no tea.Carpets smelt in the hallway and need to be replaced.

Came to this hotel for my honeymoon, the greeting was good. upon getting to the hotel suite was a disappointment, room was in need a very good upgrade, bathroom was in need of a major update. a/c was controlled by your card and had to be inserted upon arrival at the room. a second card needed to keep the a/c running. breakfast was a disappointment, very little choice of breakfast items. would not go back to this hotel again.

This place is great for travelers on a budget. The price wasn't huge, but the property is clean, well-maintained and centrally-located. The staff is really helpful and friendly, and the hotel is a short walk to the beach.

I found this hotel very good for a budget. The included breakfast was more than adequate, and the fifth floor room was clean and quiet. The location was convenient. The staff were very friendly and helpful.Recommended for those on a budget.

The Waikiki Sand Villa has maintained itself very well over the past several decades, providing clean comfortable rooms near the center of Waikiki. It's not a luxury hotel, but it's very nice, and it's a short walk to everything, including Waikiki Beach.

Had 2 short stays here, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is handy to the beach and the shops. Nice view of the Ala Wai Canal. The rooms are sufficient. Nice spa pool to relax in after a day of lots of walking.

This is an older hotel, but it's very well maintained and has a very professional staff. The hotel is clean and cozy and takes care of all of the usual requirements of a regular tourist (even though it's certainly not as swanky/flashy as many of the other hotels in Waikiki). The Hospitality Room is also a really great bonus, especially if you arrive before check-in time or have to depart after the usual check-out time (11 AM). The left-luggage section is good, too. If there are any suggestions that I could give the management, they are - 1) the front desk staff (although they were totally professional and competent) could have friendlier dispositions (esp. considering that the housekeeping staff and breakfast staff were extremely friendly at all times), 2) the breakfast buffet would be better if the exact same food items were to be available from the start of the breakfast buffet service to the end of the service (on each day), and 3) the street noise was a nuisance on several nights, and if there are rooms where the noise is less, that info could maybe be mentioned to potential guests at booking time. The bottom line is - for the price, this is a fine hotel!

OK. First. I hate writing reviews. Vacation is in the books. However this place deserves good marks should you (the reader) be looking for a place to stay. This was the ONLY hotel I could find with NO resort fee. NONE. Amazing! Also. Please book directly with the resort. They will give you free breakfast! Each and every morning. WOW! Dang good breakfast too. Buffet style with lots of good choices. This would easily cost $15-$20 per person at other resorts. This place also has a GREAT pool. During our stay nobody was using the pool. Why? Probably because World Famous Waikiki Beach is a 5 minute walk!!!! OMG! It's so close! If you jog it's closer. The staff here is also super super friendly. I stress this because we stopped in the Hyatt Regency right on the beach. Corporate run hotel with sadly an unfriendly staff. They did not want to be bothered by tourists. Why visitors are OK with paying $300+ per night PLUS resort fee and NO free breakfast to be treated this way was beyond us? Did I mention how AWESOME the staff at the Sand Villa Hotel is? Enough writing. Just book your room here and Hawaii will change your life forever. Aloha!

Choose this hotel over the Waikiki Coconut as the Sand Villa has a lot better pool.The price is reasonable for Waikiki and we took a superior room to get further away from the road, but the road is still noisy as the hotel is close to the corner with a major road.I wonder if the other side is quieter?Our first introduction was to the hospitality suite as we arrived way to early for our room. The hospitality suite is functional but closer to two stars. Still glad of it so we could freshen up and change in the meantime.We had to wait until nearer 2pm for our room after arriving about 8am.The room was tidy with 2 double beds, a nice small balcony looking over the road and towards town and across the canal.Beds were comfortable and air conditioning was good.We had a lockable safe which is always useful.The bathroom had some minor patching/repairs and was on the small side, but clean with a fancy bidet style Japanese toilet.It also had a shower over the bath, with reasonable water pressure.The shampoo and body wash were fine..Breakfast was plain and limited but happy to eat it.No cereals available, just yoghurt and one fruit. Juices were not fresh, but coffee was good if you could keep it hot!There was plain white bread or croissants with grape jelly.No tea available or fancy coffees that were listed nearby.The hot food consisted of scrambled eggs, breakfast sausages,Slices of some larger sausage, fried rice, and a mixed hash.Being a typical Hawaiian hotel there were nothing to stop the sparrows coming in so you had to be careful not to leave food unattended.The pool is great with shade on at least one or two side depending on the direction of the sun.Pool temperature was fine - warm enough to get in but cold enough to refresh you.The condition of the pool and surrounding area was good except the sun Loungers are from the seventies!Oddly, you have to go the hospitality level and sign for pool towels! A bit antiquated if you ask me!We were annoyed that the better coffees were not available for most of the time we would be in - before 10am and after 1pm (the barrister gone!)Customer service was mixed but generally ok.There I’d s free shuttle to the airport we found out belatedly, but it will want to pick you up 5 hours before your flight as it picks up other travellers on its way. We booked it then wanted to cancel - the hotel wanted to charge us if we cancelled the free shuttle! My advice is to pay the $23 for a service that just takes your party and will pick you up at 3hours before your flight approximately (Try Hawaii23).Checking in and out was easy.The hotel is only 5 minutes from the beach, the international shopping market, several ABC stores are closer than that, and a food pantry supermarket is also within 5 minutes.For everything else take the local buses - $5.50 for a day pass!Uber would be great for 4 or more people. Bus stop only a few minutes away.We would happily stay here again.

Love this hotel! It was affordable and the location was pretty good. It’s on the back side of Waikiki so I was steps away from everything! The beds were a little hard but everything else was great! Jasmine at the front desk was so professional and friendly!

We have stayed at this property many times over the years and have always had a positive experience. The pool and hot tub are lovely, the staff is always friendly and helpful and the free breakfast is good. The food in the small restaurant good.We like the location back on the Ali Wai Canal but that may not be for everyone because it makes for a longer walk to the beach.Rooms are small but clean and every room has a lanai. A majority of the guests these days seem to be Japanese and so you don't hear much English being spoken around the pool. This is fine with my wife and I and although we speak only English we have fun trying to communicate with anyone who is willing to try to communicate with us. The hotel provides a very safe and friendly atmosphere and as I said we have been there many times and will go back again.

We stayed here 2 nights in January. The hotel is in a great location. It is a couple blocks to the ocean, I would rather save money and walk to the ocean. It does overlook the canal. You can walk to anywhere in the heart of Waikiki from here. The rooms were fine. For our purposes, this trip was about being out and about, not in the room. Our room had a very fancy toilet, seat heaters, bidet functions, etc.We paid the rate that included a breakfast buffet that was very good. We had a drink in Il Buco, the wine bar in the hotel. We really wished we had dinner there. The food looked amazing. We checked out early our last morning there, and they stored our luggage free of charge until late after noon.

Ok, let’s get this out there first. I gave it four stars. It’s not a four star hotel by any means, but it is clean comfortable and close to everywhere in Waikiki. The pool is great,only problem they close it at 9pm an hour later would be nice. We live on the Big Island and visit Oahu three - four times a year and stay at the Sand Villa. The hotel caters to the Japanese tourist and like the Japanese the rooms are simple and small but comfortable. Restaurant downstairs is fine , nothing special and there is a bar that stays open late alone with a cozy wine cafe next to pool. The Sand Villa is a good choice to save some of your travel dollars and be close to all the sights of Waikiki.

While this is not a fancy hotel, it’s clean, the beds are comfy and the staff were very friendly. My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights at the end of January/beginning of February. We were glad we booked directly on the hotels website as it saved us extra money. They offer free breakfast and a free shuttle to and from the airport as well as waive the resort fee that all the Waikiki hotels charge, but only if you book directly with them. The location of this hotel is awesome. It’s close to so many restaurants and shops as well as bus stops. They do charge for parking, however, they don’t charge as much as a lot of the other hotels in the area.

Our friends recommended this hotel to stay at. We were here for a wedding in Sept 2014 and our rooms were over looking the poem on second floor. The people are so lovely, beds are very comfortable and it's just walking distance to everything. We enjoyed our stay here and we will stay here again.

Spent 11 nights. Had room overlooking golf course/canal(very pretty view.) Hotel is close to all amenties. Easy 5-10 min walk to beach. Pool is huge, but a bit cool and area around nicely landscaped. This is not a 5 star hotel which I knew. It is budget friendly offering value for your money. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are absolutely amazing. Housekeeping ensure rooms are spotless, laundry gives you fresh beach towels whenever you want and the front desk helped me print out vouchers for tours and readily addressed all questions and concerns. Rooms are quite small but when in Hawaii your out most of the time. Bathrooms are updated with bidets. They are in the process of updating hallways and doors which are dated(not a issue). Free breakfast offered with direct booking was nice options but a bit repetitive by Day 11. No issue with free shuttle offered. There is a sign between the elevators that says home away from home. That is exactly how I would describe this hotel and their staff are their biggest asset. They are professional, friendly, courteous. Yes I would book again next year. A very comfortable stay. You do have to contend with occassional ambulance sirens but this was not a big issue for us. Mahola Sand Villa.

We decided to spend one more night in Waikiki before we headed home from our honeymoon and stayed here. We got a good deal through their website, which included a great deal for daily parking. We were on the top floor, which is currently being renovated. The renovations went pretty late (9pm) which didn't bother us, but just a head's up for anyone with small kids. The lanai was great with a nice view of the Ala Wai Canal. Location is great, right down the street from downtown Waikiki. The pool, hot tub and foot spa were excellent. The staff were very accommodating and helpful, especially the valet. Our bathroom had a bidet, which was cool! There was a complimentary breakfast in the morning, which was nice, not the most filling, but it was free so I'm not complaining. Overall it was just a nice, relaxing stay and end to our vacation. We would come back!!

This hotel is in a great location and is at a great price. Tidy and friendly staff. Is great for those traveling on a budget. Those who want high end accommodation should book somewhere else and pay for it.

This aging hotel needs a lot of work. The carpets are worn and dirty looking. There were unfinished repairs on each room door. The rooms are really tiny, the air conditioner in the room is incredibly noisy, and the wi-fi was very poor and half the time it didn't work at all. The hotel is in a noisy area, probably near a hospital since we heard sirens regularly throughout the day and night, and the balcony door provided no insulation against the noise either. The parking at this place is valet only. While the valet guys were friendly and quick, it cost extra for the service and there was no other choice. Finally, the pool and hot tub close at 9 pm. But it had one redeeming quality: a little wine bar hidden back by the pool with great food.

Our 5th trip to Hawaii. Used to stay in hotels on the beach however those hotels can be quite expensive, especially with the A$ issue now. We had visited the Sand Villa Hotel for a couple of meals and drinks on previous trips so thought we would stay there this time. Although no beach views, it is only a 3 minute walk to Waikiki beach and we had a great view across the golf course to the mountains behind Honolulu. Staff were all very friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. Specifically the restaurant and bar staff were great and David Shields, the 'activities' guy was excellent. We will definitely be back in 2019 and won't be looking to stay anywhere else.

Ok folks let's face it Hawaii can get pricey! I picked this hotel for the complimentary valet parking & hot breakfast! If you book directly through their reservation center or website rates are cheaper and complimentary valet parking is included, because they don't have share their profits with those travel web sites. Other hotels charge $35 - 40 per day for valet parking and in Hawaii a vehicle is a must for sightseeing! My GF is a 5 star queen and she was comfortable at this location! You are walking distance to the beach, Kalakaua Blvd, car rentals, malls, entertainment, restaurants, food trucks and free on street parking (Ala Wai Blvd). The hotel itself is clean and staff were friendly through out the whole stay. GF comments: I would stay here again for the value & convinence within Waikiki :) Can't go wrong if you are looking for great value without being ripped off! 95% of the hotels in Waikiki are older buildings so why pay $$$$$ when you can get better value 300 meters from Kalakaua Ave

We stayed here on our way back home to New Zealand on our way back from New York. In comparison to what we stayed in on the 'mainland', this was nice. It was spacious enough for the two of us, it has a balcony big enough for my partner to lay out on and enjoy the scenery. It was dated but not enough for me to complain about, and it was a block away from the shops for us to purchase items for souvenirs and food if need be. We would definitely stay here again if we needed a place to stay rather than a resort as it also encouraged us to stay outdoors and explore rather than being stuck in a resort the whole time and not experience Hawai'i!

The Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel is a friendly hotel overlooking the canal and an eight minute walk to the beach. It has a fantastic pool and hot tub set in a garden on the ground floor which is a great place to relax. The rooms are compact but very clean and comfortable. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. We have stayed at other hotels in Waikiki but the Sand Villa is by far our favourite.

Sand Villa is one of the best hotels I’ve stayed in in Honolulu. I have been 3 times now and stayed in various hotels but I genuinely thought this was one of the best. Even after having stayed in resorts before. The staff were amazing and the rooms were clean (and cleaned everyday) not huge but spacious enough for us as a couple. The pool was gorgeous and was never overly full of people so we were able to relax in peace. The breakfast was free with our room and it was amazing as well! So helpful and budget friendly to have breakfast included because it saved us having to pay extra $$ for breakfasts in restaurants. The breakfast itself was also really nice (eggs, ham, potato gems, nuggets, sausages, fruit, coffee, soups, salads etc - only this was no bacon which we love hahaha). I will 110% be staying with Sand Villa again when I come to Hawaii again and couldn’t recommend them more!!

One of the best things about Hawaii are the people!..The staff were friendly and excellent, and always happy and smiling!!... ALL OF THEM!!>.but they couldn't make up for the room!!>..It was gross, dated, and sorrily laid out!!...the bathroom had been upgraded...but the room...needed an overhaul!!... not what we expected for a 3.5 star hotel...the crazy thing is...the pool...was one of the nicest pools..we've seen!!....the carpets and hallways look like a gross cheap motel and smell so bad...! I mean bad!!!....and they've not been cleaned professionally in YEARS!!......shampoo / conditioner in prefilled containers on the bathroom wall..(gross!) and safe in room would fit an iphone not an ipad!! with a KEY!!....what a joke!!.....too bad...location was good....and parking valet was great!!...but if owners are reading this.....SPEND THE MONEY AND UPGRADE THE ROOMS!!!...and for crying out loud...put some luggage racks in the room so you don't have to put your luggage on the floor!!

Hotel location was great, minutes from the beach, shops and restaurants. The pool area was very nice, hot tub was a bit too hot. Towels available for beach/pool. Staff was very friendly. Room was spacious and very clean. Located on the sixth floor could still hear some street noise but not too bad. Also, could hear talking through the joining room door, but the guests were not overly loud. Beds were a bit firm for my liking but overall a nice few days spent in Waikiki. Price point and no resort fee make this property attractive

Arrived at 7am after a 10 hour flight, unable to check-in however, it was so good to be able to use hospitality room to take a shower and freshen up. Rooms were clean and a good size, coffee making machine but no tea . Free breakfast was below average, liquid eggs - awful.

Concierge parking, clean, friendly staff, bidet on toilet seat. Nice location in easy walk down two to three blocks to beach, lovely outlook to hills and golf course across canal. We had a corner room with ocean views also. Value for money. Extremely happy. I would return and stay again, but I would want our high corner room again (I think it was level 12).

This is a good value hotel with a great bar and pool area. The rooms are clean and functional but somewhat a little tired. The staff are very helpful and accommodating. Our air con wasn’t working and it was dealt with immediately. So you can’t ask for more than that.Location is great, 2 streets from the beach, great views across the golf course and to the hills. I’d happily come back as the room and the hotel provide you with everything you need.

Was really disappointed with this hotel. We were there for 11 days and I was expecting a decent room. We got to our room and it was right across the elevator. I have a 3 year old who happens to be a light sleeper. I called the front desk right away and asked if she can move us to a different room. She told me that they had a group in house and to check the following day as they will have available rooms to move into. We did not want to go thru the hassle of unpacking and packing again so we decided not to move. It wasn’t noisy at all (guests wise) however, when the maids are cleaning the rooms, they talk loudly to each other and it’s hard to put my toddler for a nap. 8 days into our stay we found out about their bigger units. They did not inform me about these units at check in or when I asked to be moved to a different room. I would have paid more to be upgraded. I know your property is not an extended stay hotel but if you have a guest staying more than seven days, you should up-sell. It’s a win win situation for the hotel and guests as they will pay more money to have a larger room and thats an extra revenue for the hotel. I also informed the front desk manager (forgot to get her name) about this but she did not seem to care. She checked us out at the end of our stay but did not even thank us for staying nor apologize for the inconvenience. Oh and I almost forgot to mention, you should have your elevator checked. The door closed on us unexpectedly as we were entering the elevator. Thank goodness no one got hurt. Most of the staff are nice and attentive especially the valet staff. Location wise, its closed to everything in Waikiki. We are not looking for any compensations. I am just sharing our experience at this hotel property.

i had to rebook my flight a day before my schedule due to travel alerts/advisory for hurricane lane. airline rebooked with no problem. next step was to rebook the hotel. i tried to rebook with same hotel but has no room available for the dates/same # of days i have originally reserved. hotel states that it is only an alert and refused a cancellation and charged me 1 night to cancel. i will not recommend nor will not even bother looking at this hotel on future visits. very inconsiderate!

My wife and I stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel from Aug. 27-29, 2018. (This was about a week after Hurricane Lane visited the islands.) We are from Birmingham, AL, and this was the first leg of our honeymoon. We wanted to see as much of Oahu as possible and used the hotel as a place to sleep and eat the breakfast buffet. Luxury hotel, no. Accommodating to our needs, absolutely. The hotel was clean. We did not experience the issues some of the other reviews cited (i.e., ants, broken AC, loud due to thin walls). The staff was lovely. The affordability with respect to the location in Waikiki is the hotel’s strongest asset. The breakfast buffet was okay. The on-site restaurant, Loco House was surprisingly good. The ahi poke don can stand with many of the popular poke restaurants in Oahu. Mahalo, Sand Villa Hotel.

The hotel is walking distance from anything you would ever need, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean, well kept and private. The pool was never too crowded and the car rental service in the lobby was very convenient for our last-minute road trip through the island. We would certainly stay here again!

My Husband and I recently spent a week at Waikiki Sand Villa hotel it was a great location within a 5 minute walk to the main beach area and easy access to bus services. It is a mid range cost Hotel. There is an ABC shop located within an easy walk that has various food options, juice & soda drinks, alcohol and souvenirs. There is also a Food Pantry shop just around the corner that is more like Australian grocery store. There is a bus stop located on Kuhio Avenue if you walk in either direction where most buses stop - Pink Line buses take you most places for $2USD one way and there are more bus options for further afield. Daily room service was excellent - just note if you are a Tea drinker there are no facilities in the room to boil water the room is supplied with a coffee machine and ground Kona coffee. We went off to Walmart and purchased an electric jug and teabags. There is a great pool area, heated foot spa and limited gym. The bar area is always lively during their daily two happy hours where drinks are cheaper. Food was ok - but there were so many more options close by that we tended to eat out and the area was really safe to walk around at night the streets really come alive after 6pm with 100s of people out and about, buskers and markets. I thought the $19USD breakfast was average with mostly fried food and very little fresh fruit and few options. We tended to buy muffins at the ABC shop and have them in our room before we ventured out. Easy walking distance to the Zoo, International Market Place and Royal Hawaiian Center.

This hotel is about 3 blocks from beach. The reception desk was courteous and friendly. If you have a car, you must valet park. Valets were also courteous and friendly. Check-in was easy. When making reservations, were not told that there is a $75 security deposit required at check-in, for room charges/damages, but you get that back (we had the parking fee of $25/night deducted only). There is a $35 deposit on safe key, which you get back if the key is returned. The hotel is in need of some renovation, but it was very clean. Our room was small, but the beds were comfy and the TV worked, and there is coffee (no decaf) and complimentary juice and water (2 of each in fridge). The bathroom has a Japanese style toilet with all the gadgets. Everything worked well, except A/C, which takes a long time to cool room. You need to put one room card in the slot by the door to turn on lights and A/C. I'd advise leaving a key in when you're gone, so room will stay relatively cool. The breakfast buffet is decent, for the price, offering salad, miso soup, and eggs, sausage, toast, pastry, croissants, and fresh fruit. You get a 1x 15% discount coupon at checkin for dining and breakfast. There is a full bar, and lots of TVs in the eating area. All in all, if we had to stay in Waikiki and wanted inexpensive, this is the place. It's a basic hotel, little run-down, but clean and friendly. Pool area is lovely, and there is, besides the restaurant, a wine bar which surprised us. If you don't want to pay exorbitant prices for proximity to beach, get this place, which overlooks the Ala Wai Canal and golf course, and has view of mountains.

The hotel is very old and appears as though it has not been modernized in any way since it was built probably in the 1960s. The rooms are small with two double beds (barely) and the A/C hardly works making the room uncomfortably warm. The wind comes through the sliding glass door and it rattles constantly. While the room appeared to be clean, when looking more closely at the A/C vent to try to improve the air, the black dirt and dust that was in it was disgusting. On the positive side, the staff were very friendly and welcoming and the location is very central in Waikiki; close to shopping, the beach, and all area attractions.I would not book this hotel again. I would pay a bit more for a better quality option.

How are yall rating this more then 1 star? It's seriously dated. The TV has cut off and said scrambled channels multiple times in the 1St 20 minutes of being here. The "a/c" is always I'm power save mode, making it to where you can't make the room comfortable in the heat. Had the room with the walk in shower, had water running from the bathroom into the hallway. Night desk staff just blew me off when I was trying to tell me all the problems, proving that staff is incapable of making a decision. For a hotel that is worse then any motel 6, for atleast twice the cost. Has the hotel standards in Hawaii really fallen this far? Stay away from this hotel, my dog is staying in a nicer kennel then this.

The Waikiki Sand Villa was probably new back in the 1970s but is still kept very clean and the staff is helpful and friendly. Our room #1109 was next to the elevators but there was no noise problem there. The room was large enough but the bathroom has little counter space. Also the beds were a bit too soft. Additionally, the WiFi was slow. A big plus was a car rental office in the lobby which we utilized for a one-day rental of only $90. The other days we depended on public transportation (TheBus) and got around the city just fine. If the price was right we would come back again.

Valet parking with a great staff, a very beautiful new swimming pool area with a great hot tub. Morning breakfast, a massage center, a computer center and very new, and nice rooms at a reasonable price.

Check in 3pm, we arrived after 10 hour flight at 7am. No problem, the friendly staff pointed out their hospitality room that enabled us to freshen up before the hotel stored our luggage so we could go and explore Waikiki. Nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were clean and generous in size. Pool, spa and foot spa were great. When asked, a hot water kettle was available, breakfast was simple yet delicious. Location, off the busy Main Street, was perfect for us. Short walks to everything, including beach, trolley drop offs and inland tour starting points. I recommend for singles, couples and families.

I stayed at this hotel in June of this year. From the moment our shuttle dropped us of, we were treated as if we were the only guests there. The staff is very friendly and very accommodating to your needs. Though the hotel is older, the rooms and hotel itself are kept very clean! The pool is nice and clean. We had a late flight the day we left. We checked out and they stored our luggage in a locked room while we enjoyed an island tour and snorkel session. When we returned we were able to shower in their hospitality room before catching our shuttle to the airport. This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but still within walking distance of shopping, dining, and the beach. All within a couple of blocks away. Also, if your looking for fun things to do, go talk to David in the Lobby. He is super helpful and helps you schedule your island adventures. I would definitely stay here again.

I have been blessed to be visiting Hawaii for 27 years and have seen it change ALOT over that time. I have also stayed at many hotels with some that have gone and changed name and had facelifts. In that time, i have stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel and i can say that it perfect for my needs and honestly won't stay anywhere else. I love the 10% return policy they have which helps with the cost. I have stayed as a couple, family and have also recommended to other friends who equally enjoyed their stay. The room itself (as a couple) has 2 comfortable beds, ample cupboard space, large tv, clean bathroom and a lovely verandah to sit on and enjoy a drink or two. The staff are friendly especially the valet guys or would always say hi when we walked past. The pool of course is the huge stand out and one of the best in Oahu competing with the expensive hotels. We used it everyday and also the spa and foot spa. I must say the restaurant was nicer a few years ago but that is the joy with outside contractors. I haven't eaten there since the change for dinner but did use the included breakfast. Yes that was also ordinary but you have a saving of at least $12 AUD somewhere else and at least it is something to eat. Location is also great being closed to shops, the beach, bus transportation and pretty much central to everything.Our stay was just recently from the 19th June to the 3rd July 2018.I have no hesitation in staying again which i plan in the future and always happy to recommend to others. See you soon Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel.. Mahalo !!

This hotel looked much better in the pictures then it actually was. The first thing I can say is they need to get better signage for the hotel. It took us 45 minutes to find them due to the building did not have a sign on the outside where you could see it. The hotel also says they provide breakfast you are thinking sausage/bacon eggs maybe some fruit. Well fried shrimp, chicken nuggets and potato tots were not my idea of breakfast. The fruit was not very good only cantaloupe and pineapple it left much to be desired. The juice was watered down not what we r used to. Now the room very small the view was of the canal was ok the walls are paper thin and could use updating. Housekeeping took our blankets so all we had were sheets. We were scheduled for 10 days we ended up moving to a different place mid way through our trip. The parking entrance was in front of the hotel very tiny ramp up and down just not a quality hotel. I would look for a different hotel or go to VBRO.

We stayed here for 3 nights . The view was decent from the balcony and it’s about a 5 or 10 minute walk to the beach. Staff were nice, but very inflexible when we tried to book our free airport shuttle as it must be booked prior to 11am the day prior otherwise tough luck. The breakfast wasn’t that great at all, but better than being hungry or paying $10 USD at least for eggs on toastThe pool was one of the positives , pretty expansive and BYO drinks. I probably wouldn’t go here again but it was ok

had a great 3 nights stay at this pleasant hotel. though not expensive we had all we needed. arrived early and were allowed an early check in plus were upgraded to a nicer unit with a view of the pool. This hotel is very centrally located to the main Waikik beach & shops plus close to bus routes. very hospitable accommodation. nice pool. would stay again!.

Stayed 8 nights with my wife and 13 year old son. Location is great, just a short 5 minute stroll to the Waikiki beach, and close to all the main shops. There is an ABC on the corner and food market nearby.All the staff we encountered were really friendly,polite and helpful. The rooms where good and the daily cleaning was great. There was a bit of street noise but for me it just added to the experience! It would be honest to say that the hotel is showing expected levels of "wear and tear" for its age but I don't consider this a negative at all.The foot spa was just what we needed after a long day walking! I also like that you could borrow beach towels which we did lots of times to go swimming. We would happily stay there again next time we are in Hawaii. Overall when I consider the cost, location and experience I consider this an excellent property.

Location is very good. However, the rooms do look quite dated and not really a luxury experience, but overall is quite clean. Price point is good but look elsewhere if you expect more luxury. I would say this hotel is more for travelers that don't care too much about the hotel experience and more about enjoying the beach and restaurants in Waikiki.

Spent 17 nights at the Sand villa (2 couples).Our rooms were small but cleaned daily and the bed was comfortable. We were on the 4th floor and the outside traffic noise was quite loud but was not to bothersome to me.The pool area is quite nice and peaceful with colourful foliage.The bar area mear the pool is quite and they never have music playing (during the day).The condos/apartments next door had garbage out half the time we were there and it did get pretty smelly before it was removed.The receptionists and other staff are very friendly and helpful with the exception of a gentleman named David who sells excursions from a desk in the corner (very irritable and gets frustrated with customers).I would stay here again if looking for a conveniently located low cost hotel with NO RESORT FEES

We recently took a family holiday to Hawaii and choice this hotel Although, when we arrived at 6am after a long haul flight and completely exhausted. We couldn't find the "chill out" room which is advertised on the website and weren't offered the facilities either.The hotel staff were helpful behind the reception and the door staff, but at times we felt like they didn't really want to deal with because we are Australian and it's very obvious that Hawaii now aims their business at the Asian market and pretty much that's it. When attempting to book day trips and activities, my mum and I went to the tour desk for some advice and help booking things. The man behind the desk wasn't helpful, considering when my dad arrived he would only talk to him and stated "did you serve in the army?" and completely changed the topic, we explained about the trips we wanted and to book them now and he also noticed a group of Asian people standing behind us waiting to be served. We had only booked one of our 3-4 trips and he dismissed us explaining these other people had booked into see him for 10. How rude considering they were 45mins and we were told to come back, by the time we tried to book things they were full or at inconvenient times for us. The location was very close to everything which was lovely and convenient, my room was comfortable, clean and the perfect size. The restaurants food was delicious and not too pricey, same with the drinks. Overall the hotel was clean, with comfortable beds, working facilities and friendly staff. it would be nice if we were included in the general environment and atmosphere, but unfortunately Australian isn't as wealthy as China and Japan.

Perfect location, very safe and easy to find our way around Waikiki. Markets close by, were there for the Pan Pacific Festival. Best to book directly on their website, we stayed 6 nights, had complimentary breakfast, which also included free transfers from the airport. Did not have resort fee's to pay on top, which most places on Oahu have. Friendly, helpful staff * booked a few excursions with the lovely David, he really knew his stuff...mahalo nui

If you want posh don't come here.If you want value for money then worth a visitIf you want a clean room than here is good. If you want somewhere close to everything then this is the placeStaff are friendly cannot complain and only say three of a 12 day stop.

Have stayed at this hotel several times and have always recommend it. It’s still a good place to stay but the rooms are looking tired. I booked the premium room which are on floors 10-12. But there are good rooms and not so good rooms. I first had a room on the west side facing a tall building and when I asked about the lack of view I was told I was on the 10th floor making it “premium “. A travel friend booked a deluxe room on the 9th floor facing Diamond Head. His room was soooo much better than mine even though I paid more. I was then on a second booking and after complaining had a 12th floor Diamond Head view room. Room 1203. Black out blinds that did not close fully letting in the morning sun. And a/c system that I had on 18degc and was still so hot I was star fished on the bed sweating. The beds sagged and the water pressure crap. The bar, pool and restaurant area are a highlight. Time for a freshen up of the actual accommodation which is what it’s main purpose is.

Highly recommend. Short walk to heart of Waikiki with view of golf course and water channel. Professional friendly staff, decent breakfast and bar food. Clean. Relaxing open air bar and restaurant with pool. Recommend.

The room is clean, mattress is comfortable, the location is about 12-min walk to the beach. Food Pantry is just across the street, bus stops at the end of the block.I booked through their own website, got breakfast and return airport shuttle included. They keep your baggage there free of charge if you have a late flight out.The staff are very accommodating and polite. Many thanks to Nancy and Kila!

This hotel is perfect if you want the best for the money you pay. It has great location close to waikiki beach, some great ABC stores and a great farmers market for food ( Kings village) on the way.
