Made a reservation with their website, They gave me a really great deal, better than any other booking sites. Price included an airport shuttle and breakfast which was very good. On check out date we used their hospitality room ( so great to have this option). The room was nice and clean. I would defenitely stay here again.

This property is located by the side of the canal, but within walking distance to Waikiki beach. We stayed for three days. The room we were given was a corner room on the seventh floor with a good panoramic view of the canal and the mountain across. Though the property has been redone, the decor has a dated look. Our room had all the expected facilities such as coffee maker, a mini fridge, a mini safe (key operated the key to be picked up from the front desk) iron and board wi-fi,ports for charging cell phones etc. The room had two comfortable double beds, a small desk and a chair. On the negative, the thermostat in the room was not a functioning one. With the A/C on, the room temperature went down to 65 deg. F, though set at 72 deg. F and it had to be shut down. Rooms are not sound proofed and noisy because of street traffic. There is a swimming pool at the back of the property. Only valet parking available at extra cost. No resort fee was charged. There is restaurant in the hotel with a la carte menu.

We would like to thank the staff at this establishment for the genuine service we received during our 6 day stay, Being first time visitors to Hawaii we were treated with kindness and respect, the room we stayed in was very clean we had breakfast daily which was included that was great, I especially enjoyed the foot spa that was soothing after a day of touring and shopping we had dinner and drinks one night at the hotel and that was superb our overall experience here exceeded our expectations thanks again Waikiki villa sands

Ok, whilst the hotel may seem a little dated to people, its clean and tidy. The staff are friendly and the pool is very large and is lovely. The bar and restaurant areas area also really nice. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are very clean. I have stayed here twice and never had an issue. We had some noisey neighbours on one night of our stay and security fixed the problem straight away. Great place to stay!

This is our fourth visit since 2009. It’s defintiley not high end but you get what you pay for. Beds comfortable. Rooms small but very clean. Housekeeping and service from employees excellent. Breakfast was included and has really improved since we first started coming. Used to be a bowl of cornflakes and tinned pineapple now it’s a buffet with fruit yogurt, toast, croissants, eggs, sausage etc. getting a little tatty - eg handrails and corridors could do with a paint, little 5ings like that. However 5 minute walk to central Waikiki and the low price with NO EXTRA RESORT FEE like the big hotels makes up for the tattiness. We will be returning for a fifth visit in the next couple of years

This hotel is a good value. That's the best that I can say about it. The welcoming check-in felt more like being booked into jail. The housekeeping was very friendly though. Valet parking is $25 plus tips. It may be better to park at a self-service garage nearby. A couple of the valets were rude and condescending. The room was clean, if a little small. Overall, I was slightly disappointed.

After weeks (maybe months) of 'umm-ing and ahh-ing', I decided on WSV as my choice of stay. Quite simply, v.good hotel, great location, clean, decent swimming pool and excellent hot tub. Breakfast buffet was great but is not included in the price. This doesn't matter as there are loads of places to dine but a walk away.Staff were both polite and friendly when I needed to interact with them and the price was extremely reasonable, given that I travelled over Easter.
user_name:
pjjj2017
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

review_body: Top location overlooking canal, golf course and mountains beyond, 5 minute walk to beach, 3 minute walk to ABC Store and Food Pantry. Close to bus stops, shops, restaurants and food trucks. Traffic noise can be a little disturbing sometimes but that's the same everywhere in Waikiki. Rooms are quite spacious with private balconies, very clean and comfortable with room safe, iron and ironing board. Swimming pool area is excellent. Hotel has a hospitality room with showers, computers, tv and lounge chairs for guests arriving early or leaving late, coin op laundry facilities and a bar and restaurant on site. Staff are always friendly and helpful, a tour desk also operates alongside reception. Check in and check out are quick and efficient. Stayed here for two weeks in March. This was my 7th stay at this hotel - just wouldn't stay anywhere else.

The service was great. The restaurant menu is average but the food was very good. The pool was clean but in need of new lounge chairs. The furniture in the room is old (1990) but clean and the bed comfy. Near shopping malls, restaurants and 10 minutes walk from the beach. We will go back!

Stayed here for 8 nights and absolutely loved it. Reception are very friendly and always there to help. After arriving from the airport we had a shower in the hospitality room which was nice after a long overnight flight.We went out and walked around until our room was ready. Upon checking in everything was quick and easy. We had a lovely room on the 10th floor overlooking the canal and golf course. The room was immaculately cleaned and a nice size. The bed was very comfortable and the whole 8 nights we loved coming back after a long day. It was truly a home away from home. We didn’t find the slight noise of traffic to be bothersome at all.The rooms were serviced nicely and all of the hospitality workers were always friendly.The restaurant within the hotel served really delicious food. Thanks so much to Raymond, Andy and Rod (hope the names are correct) They made our stay a memorable one as well with their fantastic service.The pool was really nice as was the foot spa. Laundry facilities were excellent and all other amenities.Check out was quick, easy and friendly. We were a bit sad about leaving such a great hotel that was “home” for 8 days.We will be definitely staying here again next time we are in Ohau. Thanks so much to all of he staff.Aloha and Mahalo

WAIKIKI SAND VILLA HOTEL - clean hotel,staff are friendly and helpful, close/ short 5 minute walk to WAIKIKI beach. Restaurant and bar nice. Safe location. If your flight leaves late- they will store your luggage and give you a key to a hospitality room where there are computers, TV, comfortable seating, two washrooms and massage chairs. Plus there is no resort fee!!

My wife and I spent four nights here. Our room was fine. Nothing luxurious but it had everything we needed. There was a balcony overlooking the canal. The hotel has a pool and hot tub. The location is on the eastern/canal side of Waikiki, just up the street from the King's Village Shopping Center. It should take you less than ten minutes to walk to the beach. I'm a fast walker, and it took me about five minutes.

Where to begin? It was a last minute booking for a night in Waikiki. I stumbled across the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel. I was a bit hesitant at first but soon after contemplating booked the reservation online.As I pulled up into the hotels entrance, there was no Valet to meet me (Valet parking only). I soon unloaded and made my way to the front desk where the agent was head deep into his work and after a few minutes of waiting he acknowledged me.After checking in I finally made my way to the room. To my surprise I was very thrilled with the many “environmentally responsible” enhancements made to the room. I did not have high expectations of the rooms decor or offerings which I was okay with. I loved the water cleaning toilet seat - it evens warms! The room had some issues with the AC as it had never gotten to my ideal temperature (maintenance also came to check it out).The package that I booked came with complimentary breakfast - it was nice little buffet which I really liked.I enjoyed the foot bath it was really relaxing. The restaurant staff was super friendly accommodating my every request.The highlight of my stay was finally finding out that they offer complimentary bottle of water and can of guava juice. This little touch in the room totally made me feel special, thank you!I will defiantly return - I really felt at home! I’m hoping my next visit I will have a better encounter with staff and the ac (lol - yes I like it cold).

This hotel was clean. Not very fancy but the staff was really, really nice and the rooms were good. It was a little noisy, but all the hotels in downtown are noisy. two blocks walk to Kuhio and 3 blocks walk to the main drag. Close enough to walk all over right in central Honolulu. The price was good for what you got. Fun bar and restaurant right in the building too. Didn't get to use the pool as it was pouring rain, but looked pretty nice.I would stay here again!

The hotel does not look nice from the outside and the lobby is very basic. However, our room is clean, has decent size and good view of the river. It is conveniently located as well. The only bad thing is checkin time being 3pm and not negotiable. We did not engage much with the staff and did not have breakfast included so cannot comment on them.

If you are looking for a resort, keep looking. At best the room was pretty clean, though out dated. The bed was very comfortable I must admit. Great nights sleep. We paid for a premium room, that gave us an upper floor view of nothing versus a lower floor view of nothing. No difference in the room vs a standard room. The pool is small with only about a dozen chairs around. We had a situation where guests threw towels on the chairs and then left for over 2 hours to save their chairs. Next to the pool was a wine bar and grill. This is not mentioned anywhere on the property. Found it by accident. Open 6pm till 11.Looked cute, never made it there. The hotel bar is open till 4am. The neighborhood around is pretty sketchy at best. Now for the positives. The staff were so nice and helpful. No complaints at all. . Waikiki is only a 3 minute walk, so the location was great for getting to restaurants and shops. Kings Village is another cute area to poke around in. The beach was not our main interest. We were here to visit family that lives north of Honolulu, so we were just looking for a clean room , and that is what we got.

Friendly staff walking distance to beach, shops, restaurants and bus stops. Nice pool area and wonderful hospitality suite rooms are on the smaller size. Shuttle service was included with our stay which saves $

I enjoyed my week long stay at this hotel. The room was clean. The staff members were welcoming and easy to talk to. There’s a foot spa, hot tub, pool, bar and restaurant even a guest laundry room on site. Reasonable prices for the location. Just a few blocks to the beach, shopping, and nightlife. I would stay here again.

I picked this hotel as I was staying in the peak season & all the other hotels I looked at were just so expensive. Also it had good reviews as well.Fair enough it isn't right on the beach & isn't 4 star but I was really happy with my choice.It is only a couple of blocks back from the beach which is less than a 5 minute walk away.The bus stop & an ABC Store are just around the corner which came in very handy.I had a room on an upper floor & facing the canal, as requested so it wasn't noisy as I am a light sleeper. The room was a good size, the bathroom had a shower/tub with a line to hang your clothes above it. The TV had a good variety of channels & was a decent size.I also had the buffet breakfast included in my stay to save on money. It was good but not a great variety & never changed during the week I was there but it served it's purpose.There is a hospitality room where you can shower, which I used as I arrived on a very early flight & my room was not ready, which I expected, so I just showered & went shopping. There are also a couple of computers that you can use which I took advantage of to print out my online check-in for my return flight home that I had to change because of a death in the family. The staff were very helpful & only charged me for the week I stayed there instead of the10 days I had originally booked. They also rang & booked shuttle buses for the Swap Meet & Factory Outlets for me as well.The pool area was nice with a decent size pool for Waikiki hotel standards. I never had a problem finding an empty sunbed & it was a good place to unwind after a busy day of shopping.I didn't eat at the restaurant at the hotel as there are so many other restaurants to choose from with better ambience but it looked ok if you didn't feel like going out.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for affordable accommodation & handy location in Waikiki.

If you are on a budget and looking for a hotel in Waikiki that's the place to stay at! It's very close to Waikiki beach (5min walk), the rooms are nice and clean and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. There is everything you need inside the hotel - pool, jacuzzi, bar&restaurant, wine bar, spa, computer room, free wifi in the entire hotel including rooms, laundromats, etc. Sign up for their newsletter and you might get free breakfast included with your stay. It's nothing fancy, but very good and varied - scrambled eggs, sausages, rice, vegetables, croissants, muffins, soup, yogurt, fruit (pineapples, melons, etc.), sometimes oatmeal, juice (4 flavors), water, coffee, tea. If you book for more than 4 nights on their website (which has better prices than most of booking websites) you get free airport shuttle, which will save you some money (usually the bus is around 15$ per person, one-way). There is no resort fee, which is also another good way to save few extra bucks (this fee is very common in Honolulu hotels and in my opinion makes no sense).Sometimes late check-out is possible (if there is nobody checking in to your room on the day you're leaving). If not they have two spare bathrooms for their guests, so you can take a shower before your flight (free of charge). They also have a storage room for your luggage if you want to go to the beach after checking out. It was my second time staying at Waikiki Sand Villa and I recommend it to everyone who is looking for a nice hotel and can't afford Hilton or Royal Hawaiian.

Older hotel showing its age but generally well maintained, neat and clean. A 10 min walk to Waikiki Beach, 5 min walk to convenience store and trolley stop (Local tourist bus) USB charging and bar fridge in room .Ice machine on every level. Small swimming pool with eccentric little wine bar. Great staff on front desk, although quite rigid on not checking in before 3:00PM. Sirens from the street were heard often, both day and night possibly due to the hospital nearby.

This hotel is wonderful! It's super close to Waikiki (less than 10 minutes walking) but far enough away that you don't have to deal with all the wild crowds and noise. The rooms are kept clean, the beds are comfortable and the staff are very friendly and willing to help you with anything that you need. If I had to find a negative it would be that the elevators are a slow, and the door at the bottom of the stairs is emergency exit only so if you are in a rush it could potentially be annoying, but in no way did this diminish​ my trip to Hawaii and when I come back I would absolutely stay here again!

We spent two nights in the Sand Villa hotel in Honolulu. Our room was clean and provided in room coffee maker, iron with ironing board, a safe, and the most interesting toilet seat. It plugged into the wall and sprayed your bottom with warm water on demand.Food was decent, breakfast included buns, yogurt, wet scrambled eggs, soup, rice, and fresh fruit. There was a very strong Asian influence throughout Hawaii and very pronounced at this hotel. All signs were in English and Japanese. The decor was dated and finishes were a bit worn. It was a case of you get what you pay for, but was okay for a couple of nights.

Room was cleaned daily and friendly staff. On arrival I needed to use the phone prior to check in and reception staff were accommodating - nice way to begin our stay. Short walk from the main strip and close to ABC and small market. Worth the $

After a horrible 2 night at Hawaiian Monarch hotel, we stayed here for 6 days. The front desk staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. We were 3 hours early of the 3 pm check-in and they held our luggage for us while we roam around Waikiki. They offered us a key to their hospitality room equipped with computers, WiFi hookups, tv, massage chairs (coin operated), sofas and bathrooms with tub/showers for men and one for women. When we finally checked in our room, the bed was soft and comfortable with fluffy pillows. Refrigirator, flat screen tv, safe, a balcony with a partial view of Diamond Head and across from Ala Wai Canal and golf course. The bonus is the badae in the bathroom! Plus they have a soap and shampoo dispenser. Theirs a restaurant by the lobby that serves breakfast/lunch/dinner and a bar. Valet parking for those that choose to have a rental car. We didn't have a rental car while in Oahu. We did a lot of walking and took the shuttle and road The Bus when we wanted to see more outside Waikiki. We did rent a motorcycle to go around the island! Great way to see Oahu and head to North Shore as well as taste Matsumoto shave ice in Waimea! Nothing like it! Have to stop there if you head to North Shore!

Very happy stay ! considering the star rating, very friendly staff very clean room and serviced every day, good facilities has everything you need, great bar area with two happy hours one in afternoon and also at night! Great bar staff and dinning staff. Nice pool area with pool towels available ,walking distance to everything, just a little dated but other than that would definitely recommend this hotel .

We stayed July 21-23, 2017. Upon arriving at the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel, we were not greeted or welcomed as guests. We had to pay $25/day for valet services (it was either that or try & find free parking on Waikiki) but no one helped us out of our car & into our rooms. There was only 1 working elevator, which made it extremely inconvenient to everyone, especially guests. No one showed us where the stairs were, which might've been a faster route for some and just in case of an emergency. The first night of our stay, the AC shut off and we were told the maintenance company was already working on it the next morning and should be up and running by that afternoon. After returning from some shopping later that day, the AC was still not working. What better feeling than to come back to your room with the AC on blast after a long day of shopping? Not for us. For the 2 nights we were there, our rooms were an uncomfortably 80 degrees (according to our AC system). And no accommodations were made by the staff. We have NEVER experienced such horrible service. Even when we checked out, I asked the front desk when the AC was gonna be back on. She just laughed and shrugged her shoulders as if it was a joke. We will NEVER consider returning to this location and we do NOT recommend this place at all.

We stayed here, we had 2 rooms, the hotel is clean & the staff are very obliging, the pool is good & has pool towels & the beds are comfy. The shower though was pathetic. The restaurant is quite expensive & limited menu. Great location, only 3 blocks to the beach & abc store at the corner.Thanks for having us

We used a last-minute booking site and fully expected ithe hotel to be satisfactory. It was no bargain! The only way I can describe the open-air lobby area is "grubby." Chipping paint. Areas that needed a good scrub. Rubber mats on the floor over some other outdoor carpet. A transient man -- obviously not a hotel guest -- was washing up in the men's room. We were not interested in seeing the room. Fortunately, the booking site and the very gracious woman at the front desk arranged for a cancellation. Too bad! It could be attractive with some updating and some elbow grease! Very conveniently located.

Our room was average size but very adequate. Rooms are well serviced and very clean. The breakfast is okay. This hotel is just a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach and has an ABC store just two minute walk away. Great views from the hotel overlooking golf course and river. Hotel has a lovely swimming pool and bar.

The hotel overlooks the river and golf course. The walk to the main strip eg- beach / dukes is a 10 max walk. Perfect hotel if you dont need a beach front property. Only complaint is there additional cots need to be updated as they were extremely uncomfortable the normal beds are good though. Breakfast could be improved with toast & cereal. They have a great hospitality room if u arrive before check in. The pool area was a big reason i picked waikiki sands.great size pool, lots of shade, hot spa and 2 bars. Staff were delightful, very friendly and fun. See you next time!

Not on the beach, but, nice. A little out of the way, 4 blocks from the beach, but the walk to and from is worth it. Nice shops along the way, small coffee shop with very good drinks. The in house restaurant was very good. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner... no complaints. If you ask you can get a 15% off meals coupon per day, so need to make a choice on which meal. My car valets were very kind and courteous, so tipping was no problem. Room was nice. Would have been better if our room had Queen sized beds. I agree that the stay is a 5 STAR at a budget price.

What a wonderful surprise this hotel was in this price range. Firstly, excellent location and really fabulous staff who would do anything for you.Expect to spend around AU$80 per night for room with two queen beds and kitchen and lounge area with plenty of room overlooking the pool. Bar fridge in kitchen. Oh, and that includes breakfast too! A basic breakfast but good for the price.Location is fantastic - almost on the beach front - two minute walk. ABC Store one minute walk. Staff are excellent. They really look after you and any enquiry you might have - I needed a doctor and they even gave me options and phone numbers etc. Keeping in mind that you're budget end of your options the bathroom did need a renovation but was clean and fully functioning. No lift to get suitcases up and down the stairs where we were.This was my fourth visit to Waikiki in the last few years and I have stayed everywhere from The Kahala to the Sheraton. I would say this is excellent value for money but you need to think 1950's Hawaii Five-O kind of hotel. I will be staying here again.This is a budget end stay with five star service.

Stayed April 12-16, lovely corner room over looking golf course, close to everything and clean, the hallway a little dark, will definitely stay again.Grand mother and 25 year old grand daughter had an awesome trip in Waikiki
user_name:
Lordes LakeHawk L
Las Vegas, Nevada

review_body: I so wanted to give this hotel a perfect score, but alas, the actions of one employee spoiled the reputation of a company that obviously goes to great lengths in hiring and training good people, both in front of the house and back. Waikiki is tourist expensive. We chose this hotel as we were on a business trip and the price per night was a 3rd the amount of the hotels right on the beach. At $175/N we were willing to walk the 3 blocks. Also, there is a $25/N parking fee with in/out tipping, which is pertinent to my one complaint. One morning we were delivered our car with my iPhone charging cable noticeably missing, as we always leave it plugged into the USB for navigating on the road. Just to make sure we were not mistaken in our suspicion, we checked under the seats and room, but we knew the obvious that it had been "borrowed". 24 hours after contacting management, I was informed by the general manager, Nancy, that they were still investigating (?). I'm not sure what they expected to uncover, but my investigation was complete and my conclusion correct. Now legally, they have no responsibility to compensate me. It was only a $3 cable, but now I have the irritation of hunting for a new one. At $25/N I don't care if it was a camera or stick of gum, I don't expect anything missing. Having been in the resort business myself for 10 years, I know that no matter how hard you try, you will always have a few rats on the payroll. To their credit, the next day they went out and got me a new iPhone charging cable (that I suggested would close the issue).Now for the good. Everyone we encountered at this property was outwardly professional, and surprisingly 5-star resort gracious and courteous. The verbiage was rehearsed-perfect. The service everywhere, from housekeeping, to bar, to restaurant, was flawless. Although the appointments of the property were not as posh and glitzy of those on the beach, the hotel was clean and manicured. One more thing: the wifi signal was free and strong throughout the entire property. If I would ever have the misfortune to do another photo shoot (I'm a photographer) on this tourist trap island, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

This hotel was not the fanciest hotel, but it certainly wasn't the worst. If you are the type of person that literally goes to the hotel to sleep and shower, this hotel is perfect. The rooms are pretty big and the a/c works well. You can tell the hotel is catered towards Japanese tourist as most of the writing in the hotel is in Japanese. They even have those high tech toilets you find in Japan with a bidet and a seat warmer. None the less, everyone still speaks English and everyone is so welcoming. I think if you rent a car, it's $25 per night to park, but if you park for a short period of time, it's $3/hour. The pool and hot tub were very nice and clean. The button to turn on the jacuzzi was a bit far from where the actual jacuzzi was (located near the bathroom), but it was warm and pleasant. Waikiki Beach is only about a 10 minute walk from this hotel.The only downside I have for this hotel is the WIFI sucked! My husband and I chose this hotel because of all the reviews about the WIFI since we both had to work remotely. I don't know what others considered good wifi or maybe it was our room, but the wifi was slower than dial-up.

For the price, this hotel is a fantastic place to stay in Waikiki. Only a few blocks back from the beach and easily walkable to the International Market Place and all of the shops and restaurants. The staff is over the top friendly and courteous. My room had a terrific view of the Ala Wai canal and the beautiful lights up the mountain at night. I rented a car in the lobby for a day, only $45, and even though the traffic caused me to return 10 minutes late, they graciously checked me back in with no charge and no hassle. I would stay again without hesitation.

I was there for a conference (this was not the conference hotel). Our hotel was clean however the breakfast was so funny and nonsence. They should change that.They shoudl definitely renovate this hotel. At least the view from my room was not bad :)

Our room is clean enough, amenities are there, like coffee and toiletries. Location is not bad, a walking distance to the beach. Quiet room, where we're at. Staff are okay. They have a computer room to print the boarding pass but 10 cents per page. I paid $160 to hotels.com and another extra charged of $35 per day for my sister as the third person, payable at the time of check in. It was valentines day week so I guess it is pricy.

Room was clean enough but cramped for two adults and two teenagers with outdated furnishings. Excellent position for walking around Waikiki. Staff were friendly, pool was refreshing, and the bar downstairs was an excellent way to spend a lazy afternoon with some locals.

Room is horrible, smelled like cigarettes! I booked this room on hawaiian airlines online, then they over charged us with 118dollars! I asked them what the hell that was for and the didn't even know! I booked this room with hawaiian airlines, and,never, ever, book with hawaiian airlines! They guage you for hundreds of dollars for no dawm reason at all! Not everyone likes to give away free money to people you don't even know! Then I file a dawm complaint over the phone and they don't do jack about anything!They just treat everyone like trash!

This hotel is very dated but clean. We had double bed which wasn't too comfortable.If you are simply looking for a bed it is great value. The pool is ok for dip, nothing special. Wine bar a bit over priced. The restaurant Wood and Bucket is attached but separate business. We tried to get a couple of spoons from room service and was told they don't have any. It is definitely a BYO.It can be a bit noisy with a hotel/ bar across the road. This depends on you room location. Front desk staff friendly.For me it's saving grace is cheap and clean.Short walk to everything. I love Kings Market Place and it is just up the road.I would stay again but ask for king bed.Basic coffee making no other cooking items in the standard room.

I stayed here for a few nights while in town on business. It is a great location if you need to get outside of Waikiki, but still want to be close enough to the beach. Onsite parking is $25 per day with as many in/out as needed.Pros: It is reasonably priced. No resort fees. Free WiFi is fast enough to FaceTime without interruptions. Staff was very friendly. It's clean.Cons: It was built in the 70s and you can tell- while it is still clean, the walls, ceiling, and doors are all very much from that era. Onsite parking is valet only, which adds tips to the parking cost. When all is said and done, this is a great hotel if you are looking for a place to stay instead of a resort. It's clean and has what you need, but is definitely not a high-end or luxury hotel.

this hotel is a bargain for the price you pay. so far no resort fee. the staff are what makes this hotel a delight to stay in. the renovated room was the cleanest we have ever seen for the duration of our 10 night stay the property is older but well maintained. there are issues with room noise from outside and neighbours in room next door but these are manageable the pool and foot bath are delightful after a long day of walking. staff are consistently helpful and friendly which makes a big difference. we will be back

This is the second time I've stayed here and again, I was impressed with this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable with a modest balcony facing west. A sliver of ocean view, but it's better to just walk the few blocks and be on the beach itself, quite frankly.It's undergoing a bit of a renovation currently, with balcony replacement going on when I was there. It's noisy during the day, but that's when you should be out sightseeing anyway. It's Hawaii - there's lots to do out there! Yes, the corridors are rather dark and somewhat dated, but do you live in your hallways at home?Again, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I wish I could have them staff every hotel I stay in!

Very consistent hotel. Stayed here many times and will stay again! 5 minute walk to the beach. Food pantry just a short walk as well. Great food at the restaurant.Nice clean pool. Thanks to all the friendly staff! See you soon.Thanks.

My stay at this hotel was actually pretty good. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean. I liked the option of a smoking room. There was a bidet...I don't see that everyday... View over looking through Ala Wai Canal was nice...Only one important suggestion...Have a better staffed valet dept...One guy in duty, so it takes forever to get your car. Poor guy was making it work but they need more help...at least during the peak hours. It just so happens there was a big marathon today so there was lots of people coming in and out at all hrs and there was only one valet attendant. Another detail is they only offer valet parking...no self serve, and street parking sucks in that area. But all in all, it was mostly a pleasant stay. I'd definitely stay stay here again
user_name:
Chasa P
Hilo, Hawaii, United States

review_body: The hotel is slightly dated but the facilities are clean and the staff friendly. About 5 minutes from Waikiki beach and the main shopping venues, the location is great. Overall a good experience, would recommend and will be back in the future.

We were very surprised when we checked into this hotel. The lobby was what I would expect of a hostel. The corridors were dark, tired and the carpeting looked dirty. The room was depressing. The room was small with scratched laminate floors, the lampshades looked dirty from many hands handling them. The furniture was early garage sale. The bedding was clean as was the bathroom. It was not a room or hotel up to our standard. We looked around and booked into another hotel that was much superior a couple of blocks away and was only $20 more. We voiced our compliant and they were very gracious. They also told us we could try and get a refund through our booking service. We were refunded with no problem. For that I am very grateful. I think the price of the hotel did not reflect it. It should have been under $100.

Stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa for the 2nd time in September for 5 nights before boarding a cruise home to Sydney.This Hotel, while not being "up market" is a lovely, very comfortable, hotel within easy walking distance of most things in Waikiki.This time we booked a Premium Room and were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of their Premium Corner Golf View Rooms with breakfast thrown in as well. While the breakfast is very simple it is enough to start the day.We had a hire car for 3 days and because we booked on their website and stayed more than 4 nights we also received 1/2 price Valet Parking as well as Airport pickup.This time we had the opportunity to use the pool and the laundry facilities were very welcome with an 18 day cruise coming up. Staff were very helpful as well, and when it came to checkout time we also received a discount on our account for being repeat guests, Very happy.

Location is always very important - and for the price of the rooms this place is good value for money. A short walk to everything and without the crowds and noise of other places we have stayed at.Wife and I stayed here for four days and as a good base to see the sights it worked out well. Room was old but well maintained. The wife and I ended up in a room with two slightly larger than single beds, which was unusual. The pool was relaxing and the staff were pleasant. The 3pm check in was a bit of a trial after a 6am flight arrival, but they had a courtesy room which was thoughtful. Would I stay here again - yes I would.

Hotel looks like it needs a facelift, compared to some of the others nearby but, it's clean, comfortable and affordable. Well positioned within easy reach of the major attractions, shopping centres and the most important thing, 'the beach'!

Great room with a good pool and even a Japanese relaxation pool for soaking your feet. Concierge was helpful with dinning options in the area. They have a bar which offers tapas and drink specials. Close to Waikiki night life, but not noisy.

Awesome hotel right in the heart of Waikiki. Within easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants, shops and bus routes. The foot spa, spa pool and main pool are the perfect remedy for a long day sightseeing or shopping and the bar and restaurant provide the perfect answer if you don't want to venture out to any of the other eateries close by. All of the staff are friendly and helpful and having Ones car rentals within the hotel is a wonder stroke. The only improvement I would recommend would be to upgrade the carpet in the hallways but overall, we loved our stay. We will be back next year with the kids in tow this time.
This hotel is just a beautiful little place in the heart of everything.... A few minutes walk and you are standing on the stunning Waikiki Beach .... what else is there to say   Breathtaking Views

Rooms are small but clean and lots of clothing storage. That's a great help since most visitors are for here for more than a day or two. The bathroom is really small with fixtures from long ago. There is a safe in the room for your valuables. Small balcony with chairs and a table. Refrigerator and coffee pot in the room. Parking costs $22/day and you have to use the valet. He was friendly and always quick to retrieve our car. Nice restaurant and bar on the first floor. Breakfast buffet available but no ala carte. Pool is adjacent to the bar. I would return.

Good sized room with 2 double beds, coffee maker, iron and board, safe. Good sized bathroom. Rooms cleaned beautifully every day. Close to the beach and shopping centre. Pool and surrounds very nice. ATM in the bar. I would stay there again.

We stayed at the waikiki Sand hotel in August 2016. The hotel is in a good position easy to get a bus to the main shopping mall Ala Moana. And also close to the beach and food. The pool at the hotel is big and a lovely area. The hotel itself is basic. The breakfast buffet is awful. Not worth having. The room we had was on the 9th floor but you could still hear the noise outside. It was like hearing through paper thin walls. And heaven forbid you have noisy people in the next room!Hotels are expensive in waikiki you get what you pay for so make sure you pick an expensive hotel!!!

We where there for a week in early September. Rooms have two beds in it - around 140 cm each. The staff clean very well each day. The hotel is a little dated but the staff is friendly and good. We had breakfast ones - did not do that again. Rented a car in the lobby - worked good - but cost 60 dollar for a small car.Talked to the travel advisor and she was great for advising and if you want she can sort out all your bookings.

A reasonably priced hotel with the amenities of a much more expensive property. Starting with the very friendly staff,I was impressed with their professionalism and attention that they gave me during my stay. The hotel has a very beautiful courtyard with lounge chairs and patio tables surrounding a nice size pool and a jacuzzi. There is also a wine bar open in the evening. I requested a room with a canal and golf course view as it is more quiet at night. My room had a Lanai with a view of Diamond Head which was stunning. There is a bar and very nice restaurant, fitness room,guest laundry also on the premises. In the lobby they have a car rental desk and a tour booking agent which you can get pamphlets and price quotes from. There is ample fast food,shopping and night life within easy walking distant,with the world famous Waikiki Beach about 3 blocks away. In closing I will definitely stay at the Waikiki Sand Villa again on my next trip!

I stayed here for six nights recently. The room was clean the bed comfortable the air conditioning was good and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The morning I had breakfast here it was good. Sure the decor is a bit old but it is good value

I travelled August 2016 with my partner as students, staying for five nights. The Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel never fell short of being clean, tidy and well-presented whether it was our room, or the pool, or other facilities. The staff were universally friendly and helpful, happy to have a chat about the weather or provide accurate advice about attractions, or how to make our way around Hawaii. It was on their advice we rented a moped and had a hell of a good time around the entirety of Oahu.Overall, I was incredibly impressed with the package given that the hotel is only a 3 minute walk to the beach. Thanks for a lovely stay. Without hesitation, I would recommend the hotel to my friends and family.
user_name:
Charlie L
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: Not the best place to stay for long time ...the breakfast was bad and pool was overcrowded .It is an old hotel maybe from 70's but the price was much lower than other hotels in Waiki beachfront...Don't expect a big luxury hotel.

When I booked a trip to Honolulu, I was quite excited until I started checking accommodation options and the expense of hotels, especially in and around Waikiki. However eventually after much searching, I found a pretty good deal at Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel.My flight arrived very early in the morning so by the time I arrived at the hotel (around 9.00am), I knew there was little to no chance of my room being available. That was the case but the hotel offers complimentary to guests a room where they can freshen up (including shower, bathroom, internet access) and then leave bags. This meant that I could get changed out of my warm clothes into clothes more comfortable for the warm temperature outside and go exploring before coming back later in the day to check into my room.The hotel is nothing special to look at from the outside (think Soviet-era concrete high-rise) and the hotel is old but once in the room, it is very well appointed, the beds are comfortable and the bathroom was clean. I had a room with a balcony and view of the nearby canal and the air con was easy to control inside the room. The hotel is located close to plenty of very good dining options and is about a 10 minute walk to the beach. It's also close to the bus stop for The Bus which is cheap and easy to use and a great way to get around Waikiki in hot weather.The staff are friendly and helpful and my only complaint during my stay was a result of renovations being done to a room next door to where I was staying. I'm a night owl which means I like to sleep in but hammering outside my room started at about 9.00am which didn't make for a particularly full sleep.I had breakfast once in the restaurant - it is buffet style with a mix of hot and cold dishes, it's good value, filling and plentiful. I didn't use the bar or the swimming pool so can't comment on these amenities.Overall, a very comfortable stay and I would certainly consider returning here when I come back for another holiday.

We stayed here for 3 nights after our cruise.Great location, 5 minute walk to the beach and surrounded by shops and restaurants. All bus stops close tooRooms are dated but comfortable.Sometimes they were a little noisy early hours due to sirens and rubbish trucks etc.We had to wait a bit late in the day for our rooms to be ready(3.30pm)The young man who greeted us when we arrived and helped with our luggage, was very friendly and helpful on several occasions

Spent four nights here on a recent trip to Hawaii. Booked direct through the hotel website, which entitled us to a free pick up and drop off airport shuttle which was on time and great, and also free breakfast for the two of us for the entire stay. The hotel was already great value for money and those added extras just made it even more perfect! Pool area is amazing and they do sometimes run out of towels but simply ringing reception will get some new ones delivered promptly. Food was great from the restaurant and was nice to be able to have drinks there throughout the day and into the late hours of the night. Staff helpful, yet didn't really need to bother them as most things were there and ready to use. Will stay there anytime I am visiting Waikiki!

Surprisingly the restaurant in the hotel has really good meals with decent pricing. The location is very close to the beach, walkable distance. The rooms has balconies with OK river view.There is a small booth where you can book tours, very convenient.The hotel has a lot of tour bus tourists staying, which makes it a very busy hotel.The only drawback I could think of is that the restaurant has opened Windows so you are dinning with birds next to you, which is not my preference. Overall a great hotel with polite staff!

This hotel suited our needs perfectly as we only stayed two nights and left early both mornings and arrived back later in the evenings. The staff were very helpful and we could leave our bags there on the day we left while we went to Pearl Harbor. The hotel could use an upgrade but it was very clean. If you are looking for basic accommodations at a reasonable price in Wakiki, this is it.

Service was awesome as we needed a place to sleep for the night after getting locked out of our air bnb rental (i dont recommend keiko's place on that site) got offered a room around 1.30am. Got offered a good deal on the room. I would go back

The hotel is just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach. The bus stop is just one block away. The foot spa is comforting and free of charge. The small bathroom has a bidet! Free daily newspapers are available near the elevators. With a four day or more stay a free shuttle ride to/from the airport is offered, but it takes the "scenic route", and it makes this hotel the last stop. There is also a free breakfast with a deluxe room that is very basic for a buffet, and caters to the Asian fare. As long as you're just showering and sleeping there, it will suffice.

great budget hotel stayed here 3 times now for 12 nights always friendly helpful staff has everything you need great pool and restaurant /Bar, very clean, close walk to the beach and shops. yes there is fancier hotels around but you also pay for it. will be staying there again in the near future, airport pickups help and its free if you stay longer than 4 nights would recommend if you are on a budget or dont want to spent all your money on accommodation

We were well pleased with this hotel. Not a lot of bells and whistles. But, we were just looking for a clean, comfortable place to rest our heads at night after exploring the island during the day! We don't spend much time in the room at all. Upon arrival, the room was ready. It wasn't the cleanest, but I think it was just unnoticed. By the second day, the wall was wiped down where it looked like someone had spilled something (previous to us). Bathroom and linens were clean. Pool area was clean, and nice. Front desk, and all staff including valet was friendly. The lady at the excursion desk seemed less knowledgeable than we were, and this was our first trip to the island. We were not impressed with the restaurant, or the key card to turn on lights/AC. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised!

My husband and I booked a stay here 6 months in advance. The hotel manager worked with me and got us a great rate and even upgraded us to a king bed for our stay. This was like our honeymoon.. But 20 years later. We came here to celebrate our 20 year wedding anniversary! She had said she marked it that this was a special occasion and would do something special for us for our first visit to the island and the fact it was our anniversary. She didn't. But with that aside. Our room was up high with a great view from the balcony. Pretty standard room. Kind of small, but we weren't in it too much so that was ok. I don't like how the bathrooms are set up. There is NO counter space for anything like make up , hair stuff, toothbrushes etc. I did however enjoy that The rooms had fancy bidet toilets. Lol. The heat in Hawaii is HOT AND Humid! So we were bothered the rooms never got below 78-79 in the days but at night it was fine. They need signage at this hotel BAD! We had to call down to find out where ice machines were or vending machines (which they didn't have?!?) they had one soda machine with warm bottles of soda for $2. The restaurant in here called Wood and Bucket has a small menu but good food. You CANNOT order it from your room and go pick it up which was a big disappointment!! Or no room service:( The pool was great! Beautiful. Quiet. Biggest one in Honolulu!... But to get to it you have to walk through that fancy restaurant that is in the hotel! That is awkward and I didn't like that at all. Plus is closes at 9pm , which is when people would like to swim and unwind after a long day of heat while touring the island. Most others (we looked) closed between 10pm-midnight! They do have valet parking which was great and our valet Joel was wonderful and we left him a tip at the end of the week! There is said to be a "continental breakfast " in their website video, but we found this isn't true unless you are in an upgraded room. So it the will cost $14 a person. I did complain about this as we were in an upgraded room so they did go ahead and give us vouchers for breakfast the rest of our stay. This needs to be more clear on their videos. People watch these when making decisions and then they aren't true. Not cool. Also, we had requested a smoking room (bad habit I know!) and didn't get one. Which we wouldn't of smoked IN the room, but on the balcony. But doing this (on balcony) got us a "warning" for smoking in room!! We never smoke in any rooms , our house, car, etc. we took this "warning" and talked to the front desk and I guess no matter what you can't smoke outside?! Well It didn't state that ANYWHERE! Then like 3 days in to our stay (after complaining) we found a nice smoking area?! Why wouldn't they of told us about this? But.. All in all for the price and location it was a nice place to stay. Not sure I would stay again if we ever visit the island in the future. Too much confusion and miscommunications in my opinion. We ended up checking out early and stayed with our friends who are locals the last 3 days we were there.

Lovely spot to stay at an affordable price for those on a tight budget. Decor is a bit dated but had all the amenities we needed (apart from a proper kettle and decent coffee!!). The pool was perfect and open till 9pm. Only downside was that you have to walk through the restaurant to get to it. Hotel is only 2 blocks/10 minute walk from the beach. Great stay.

Stayed here for 6 nights as one of the cheaper options in the area, but pleasantlysurprised. Location is good, only a short walk from Waikiki beach. Can be a little noisy due to cornering a busy road, but not awful. Room was simple, but clean and comfy. Pool was great and free wifi through out hotel. All staff were very nice as well.

One year later…….One year later and I find myself back at the Waikiki Sand Villa for 11 days of sun and shopping.I am happy to report things are on the up and up.The staff, the rooms, carpet, bedding, pool area are all better than my last visit, unfortunately the prices has risen too!I arrived early to a friendly welcome and was told my room would be ready at 3pm. I was advised I could use the Hospitality room to get sorted and I could make use of the pool and towels etc. My suitcase would be stored securely until I needed it. I recovered my pool gear from by suitcase, picked up a free newspaper and got some towels from the ample supply by the pool and made myself comfortable till my room was available at 3 pm. The pool area is extremely nice and shade and deck chairs are available. Bathrooms and showers are adjacent to the pool and the Wood and Bucket bar will deliver drinks poolside once you order at the bar.As promised my room was ready at 3pm. If you book through the hotels website you will obtain several advantages. On standard rooms you will get a free airport shuttle (To and from the airport), free hotel safe in your room and free local calls. On deluxe and above rooms a free breakfast is included for every day of your stay for up to two persons. free Wi Fi is also available throughout the hotel, rooms and pool areaMy room was a standard rate one but on the 11th floor. It was very tidy and had a nice balcony with table and two seats. There was room to dry small items of clothing (bring a stretchy line)A reasonably large fridge –freezer was supplied which accommodated large bottles and cans of drink. Bottled water (the tap water is chlorinated) was available nearby for 99c per 1.5 liter.The linen on the beds was of good quality and pillows and bed comfortable. A hairdryer was also provided along with a bidet on the toilet. Shampoo in dispensers was provided in the combined full size bath/shower unit. Hot water at very good pressure was always available. The central air conditioner worked well, had an individual thermostat in the room and did a good job of keeping the room comfortable. Ample clothes storage and drawers were also available. The door was strong and the locks secure. Access was by way of magnetic swipe card key and the safe had a conventional key.A coffee maker and coffee bags were provided daily and on request a Hotpot (kettle or jug) was also provided as I prefer tea. 2 x ceramic cups were also provided.The daily maid service was friendly and did a very good job of maintaining the room and changing towels etc. The staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly at this hotel. I was never pushed to leave the room for the maids as I have experienced at other hotels. The maids here work around your schedule, not theirs. Excellent! There is an excellent Supermarket called the Food Pantry within 2 minutes of the hotel (walk across the road and diagonally through the car park on leaving the hotel and you will be there! Take a reusable cloth bag with you as the bags in Hawaii are paper only. You will find all you need there including ready to eat meals. There is also an ABC convenience store 2 minutes’ walk from the hotel if you turn hard left on leaving the hotel. I use both to purchase water, food, beer, soft drink, bread fruit etc, very convenient.The beach is about 8 minutes relaxed walking from the hotel with plenty to see on the way. If you are fit you can walk to Ala Moana along the canal which is the coolest way to walk. Turn hard right on leaving the hotel, cross the road to the canal and turn left away from Diamond Head to walk to Ala Moana. Plenty of free maps available on the sidewalk. Some of the walk is in the sun so wear a hat and sun is under shade trees along the canal (allow 40 minutes).There are plenty of places to eat and they are not all that expensive. Use Trip Advisor for recommendations. Check my reviews to assist here. Some are very close to the hotel and some 15 minutes’ walk away like the Shorebird Beach Broiler, my personal favorite!This hotel just keeps getting better, it’s not the Hilton but it punches way above its weight! Enjoy!!

Pros:- Price!!! So important on our budget!- Within walking distance of the beach.- We had a gorgeous view from our 8th floor balcony facing Diamond Head!- Very friendly and seemingly responsible valet! They made a huge difference! - Foot spa! Why aren't other hotels investing in this?- Gorgeous pool! Too die for beauty out there with the flora and lighted pool. - Visited the glorious hot tub every day and almost every night!- Housekeeping staff is on it! Always a clean room and they changed the sheets everyday! Never had a hotel do that before! - Daytime bartender was so helpful. We ordered food but the hubby was still a little seasick so she was happy to box it up for us and even gave him a free ginger ale. Talk about feeling cared for! - Room was cozy with a great balcony.- On site laundry facilities but I think it should be made free to guests.- They have a designated smoking area that faces those luscious green mountains!- The bidet was very neat!Fails:- Hot tub & pool close at 9pm. Absolutely devastating after all the sightseeing and you just want to relax.- Pool towels didn't seem to be stocked throughout the day, especially in the evening.- The big guy at the front desk...bad attitude all the way around. He was not friendly at all and seemed annoyed every time we had a question or concern. I don't remember him smiling once. - No one bothered to explain to us about where the smoking area was, where the pool was, the pool/hot tub hours, parking policies/charges, special perks like the coupons for the restaurant, no mention at all of the Hospitality Floor, how to turn on the power in our room, we were never told about the spa in the hotel and I would've gone if I knew (I just found out tonight after reading another review). We had to find out everything on our own. That wouldn't bother me but it kinda made us feel like "stupid tourists".- Night time bartender could be a little more friendlier and a little less annoyed. She was smiling at all the single young men but seemed irritated at everyone else. She also can't make a martini...word of advice: the vermouth isn't poured into the martini, it's just used to swish in the glass before the martini is poured in. - Hotel is a bit dated. - It was very awkward to have to walk through the restaurant and bar to get to and from the pool. I'm sure people didn't want to see us parading through there in our wet bathing suits. Especially when there were no pool towels available.- The full size beds were a tight fit for our honeymoon.- Water pressure in the shower was lacking.- I had to beat the tar out of the light switches to get them to switch on and off.I did put more cons than pros but my overall opinion is that it was a very decent stay for the money. Will we stay here again? It's a definite possibility purely based on how much my pro list meant to me.

I did a lot of homework before choosing Sand Villa. In the end I chose it because NZ friends stay there every year and recommended it. It is Japanese owned and therefore some things were not familiar, e.g. the "bidet" style toilet!! and the buffet breakfast definitely favours Asian breakfast tastes. But try the bar in the evenings - it is frequented by hard case locals! everything is immaculate and spotlessly clean, the reception staff friendly and helpful. as a female travelling alone I felt secure and comfortable here. and you can ask for an electric jug to make a cuppa if you don't like coffee....

This property charged our card when we booked in February for June visit - we could only have twin beds despite booking well in advance. Its a good location but there are a lot of options in Waikiki so not sure we will return to this property.

Stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights. We had a room with 2 beds and a great view of the river off ala wai. We liked the check in process and the valet was great. We did have to pay to valet the car each night but it was affordable in comparison to other hotels. Also, the location was great, and we could walk to most places. The staff was really friendly as well. The food downstairs was not bad either. We tried the breakfast buffet and had dinner at wood and bucket and both were good. Remember to bring your coupons, and you can get 15% off each time. Also, the pool and jacuzzi were awesome! The downsides of this hotel are that it's a little bit older and is showing its age a little. The bathroom was decent but could've been bigger and the shower didn't have the best water pressure. Also, the beds were a little stiff and hard to sleep in. But the part that was the most frustrating was how the power worked in the room. You have to use the room key and sometimes this caused a lot of issues. Also, the AC didn't really cool down the room and each time we wanted to turn the bathroom light on and off we had to pound it really hard or else it wouldn't work. I would recommend this hotel if you're on a budget and if you're not going to be in the room a lot.

We enjoyed our 11 days at Waikiki sand villa. From the moment we booked, friendly transfer pick up & drop off, nothing was too much to ask. We booked excursions with the tour desk who was a friendly & knowledgable lady. The pool is fantastic, it's large, clean & peaceful to relax by & sip on a cocktail. The cleaning service was brilliant, our room was tidied up each day, all the staff are accommodating & friendly. We definitely would be back its the best value for money in Waikiki and close enough to everything but away from that main strip noise. The restaurant served tasty food as well. Thanks for a lovely stay Sand Villa your staff are excellent & this is certainly value for money.

We stayed for 2 weeks, and loved the hotel.We booked a base to explore from rather than a resort hotel.Great location near all the action,but in a quieter area.Checking in and out was quick and easy.All the staff are brilliant and really friendly,i know they were doing their job,but it felt genuine.We had a premium corner room with fantastic views both day and night.It was clean and the beds were very comfortable.Loved the electric toilet.2 things i've not seen mentioned in other reports are the USB charging hub in the room and the ice machine in the corridor,which were a nice touch.Free Wifi was good.Although there was 4 of us in a room it did'nt feel too crampedFree breakfast was a bonus,but after a couple of days got a bit boring.The pool area was nice and generally relaxing.Fresh towels are provided,which was helpful as no drying worries.The foot spa was most welcome after a hard days sightseeing as was the jacuzzi.The second floor hospitality room was useful after checking out and the hotel provide secured storage of luggage.The bar had a great atmosphere due to the locals.Mahalo to all the staff,we hope to be back in 2018

Why did it take me 23 visits to hawaii to find this place ! What a great place its not the Ritz but if you are looking for a basic reasonably priced hotel with the most amazing friendly staff a true home away from home then this is it. It has a nice pool area a good wifi service all over the hotel a hospitality room & you couldnt find more helpful staff anywhere its like the true hawaiian spirit that seems to have died in all of the big corporate hotel chains. Mahalo to everyone at the hotel the owner should be proud of you ! & if we can afford to come back next year we will be seeing you soon.Mahalo again & well done.

After 2 amazing vacations at the Hilton Hawaiian Village I switched to the Waikiki Sand Villa a few days before this year's vacation started because I had a I-want-to-buy-a-boat-this-summer-should-I-really-spend-that-much-on-a-hotel panic attack. And boy did I feel bad as I always knew what to expect with the Hilton and this one here was a big unknown.Reasons that justified the switch instantly: - Saving over 50% in room rates compared to the HHV- Complimentary airport pick-up and drop-off (another $50 saving)When I arrived, check-in was easy and to my surprise I even got free vouchers for the hot breakfast buffet because I had booked a whole week in a certain room category. Awesome!But... I needed to adjust my attitude as the WSV is not the HHV and things are a little simpler. So here my list of pro's and con's:Pro:- The price- No resort fee - Rooms have hardwood floors, so much cleaner than yucky hotel carpets- The pool (size and hardly ever anyone there)- Heated toilet seats :)- Convenient location- Free hot breakfast buffet if you book a certain category/length of stay- Friendly staff- Free WiFi and actually great reception all over the place- Free airport shuttle if you book a certain length of stay- Great securityRoom for improvement:- No cleaning wipes at the gym for guests to clean up after themselves- Corner rooms' balcony doors are not fit to handle the wind, they keep banging against the frame (I had to switch rooms because of that)- Hallways would look so much better with just a fresh coat of paint- Drapes could use some love = a round in the washer- No real milk/cream for coffee/tea at the breakfast buffetOverall the WSV is a very solid option if you don't want to spend your vacation budget on a hotel room.

We had booked a double room on the 9th floor for 3 nights and were impressed by it and puzzled by the heated toilet its 3 temperatures, bidet facility and hair dryer (only joking). We disconnected the electric plug (yes electric in a bathroom) and felt safer having done so. There were coupons in the room for discounts for breakfast 15% off and also for luncheon and dinner in the Wood and Bucket Tapas bar and grill. Having to leave very early on tours of the island breakfast was not an option for us. Later on our return we changed and went down to the pool for a swim. I went to order a drink and discovered I could not charge it to my room bill, for which $75 had been temporarily charged to my credit card when we checked in and could only pay for it when ordering. Then the penny dropped the bar and grill was not part of the hotel. I went thirsty. The charge for our rooms for three nights were different each night averaging £82.65 with the highest £92.18 and the cheapest £76.29 plus a total of £34.61 for 'taxes and fees'.The best things about this hotel were its location and comfortable beds.Would we stay again? With so many to choose from we think missing this one would not upset us!

We stayed here over New Years Eve and had an amazing time!We were expecting to get what you pay for, as this was one of the cheaper hotels in Waikiki but we found this hotel excellent value for money! The rooms were nice, clean and spacious and we even had the extended balcony as we were on the corner, it was excellent. We used the pool and hot tub once and it was really nice as there was nobody there! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful! 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach tops!! We would definitely stay here again!Don't use the restaurant downstairs however as we had a bad experience, extremely slow service and terrible food!

The Hotel is perfectly located in the middle of honolulu walkable distance to everything to block away from the beach and close to the canal with beautifull views the room are nice and clean nothing fancy but you dont spend your time in your room anyway the pool area is really cute

The Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel is one of the rare offerings in Waikiki where there is no added resort fee through your stay. As this price can differ substantially from hotel to hotel, it's certainly a bonus that you aren't paying additional money to stay here. On Ala Wai Boulevard, the Hotel is a 5-10 minute walk to the beach, and to all the sights on the Waikiki strip. If you're situated at the back of the hotel, it's certainly a lot quieter than it is at the front, so make sure you're asking to be put at the back for some peace and quiet. The rooms are very small - there's no space for chairs and lounges in the double bed rooms, so it's not particularly well set out for families. I wouldn't see any more than 2 adults fitting into these rooms and even then it's not exactly comfortable. The Hotel is in the process of updating the rooms - so if you get a refurbished one I'm sure your experience will be a lot better - I was in one that has yet to be refurbished and it was looking it's age. There were cosmetic issues in the room (peeling paint etc) but it was clean and neat. The mattresses were a bit of an issue, as they were so old and worn out that they sagged dramatically in the middle - but a quick chat to reception got this fixed up straight away for us. The Valet service for car parking is great - no need to worry about where to park when you go out (and parking at most hotels in the area usually requires you to get back before 5-6 to guarantee a parking position) and so it's so much easier to let the valet look after that for you. There's a tv, a refrigerator and wifi that will hopefully work for you. We had mixed reliability with the wifi - sometimes it worked, sometimes it didn't. If you're out and about for the whole day and you're coming back to sleep, the Waikiki Sand Villa is a great option. It's neat and tidy, and whilst a little basic on the amenities and physical appearance, it has what you need to make your stay an enjoyable one.

Did a walk-in/check-in on May 20th, 2016 @ around 10pm and the front desk service was so terrible. Yes, he greeted us; however, he did not smile at all. And he, kind of, lack in explanation and everything. He did not give the right direction where my other group of friends were going to sleep in. Also, the door of the room we stayed in was difficult to close and open. It was heavy, i should say.

It is about 3 blocks from Waikiki but a nice view of the canal. The rooms are not fancy but comfortable and have a small refrigerator and freezer. The pools is great and it has a Jacuzzi. You can even bring in your own food and drink but no glass.The bar is more like a local bar and has a daily happy hour. All the staff are friendly and make a good drink.Two restaurants on property, ate at both and both were good. The lobster mac and cheese is yummy. The other restaurant is a wine bar and has a limited menu but was equally yummy. I had the fish and it was prepared nicely.The also have a foot spa to soak your feet when you come home at night or anytime.

I was impressed with the hotel for the price and the staff was also very helpful. We only needed one night since we were a cruise the following day. Sorry we did not stay two nights. The location was a little more than 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. The painting on the outside of the elevator doors made you feel as if you were outside. Our room had the river and a golf course on one side, yes traffic but we did not find that the noise bothered us at all. We arrive around 1 PM and had a 2:30 tour of Pearl Harbor, they checked us in quickly while our cab waited. Thought the room was lovely, it was on a corner and we had a terrace that went around two sides. Two windy to keep the doors open to the patio but we did enjoy sitting out there. We booked very early and the room was under 130.00 a night. Well worth it...Breakfast was also decent. Although we did not get to use the pool it was much larger than I anticipated and the foot spa was a nice addition that we did get to use. A restaurant and bar is also in the hotel. ABC store on the corner with another one on the 2nd block. I would stay here again...after all in Hawaii it isn't about the room, clean free WiFi,Coffee machine, safe, and frig...all that we needed. Found this hotel by reading what others said on this site...Thank you

I travel often to Honolulu for work and when the day is done all you want to do is relax. This is a very quiet but busy hotel. They provide Hotel service that has to be rated as EXCELLENT! I don't like to spend a lot of money while on business and these guys are priced just right! I am so please to deal with smaller hotels that provide BIG HOTEL SERVICE!

Dont expect too much - you get a good location and basic standard but defenatly not wort its price. front rooms are noisy - so the best option are those at the pool area. Breakfast is not included but it was the best part - tasty and diverse.

I know hotels in Waikiki are pricey, but I didn't know it was that bad. First, the room/hotel was dated; felt like walking back into the 80s. Staff are just ok (they didn't even help me to make a free call to confirm a shuttle booking!) But the worst of the worse, I have a cockroach crawling on my jacket (hung in the open wardrobe) on the last night of my stay. It's not a small one, a standard tropical one. I managed to take a picture of it (see photo attached). I thought about to report it to the reception. But considering they weren't really that helpful, what would they do about it? Positives? Location is good, I give them that. View from my room is good. They did give me a 10% discount voucher for my next stay... maybe not!

Stayed here for 6 nights and had no troubles whatsoever. Great views form the top floors and a short walk to the beach about 10 minutes. So much to do within walking distance. We did not see any roaches and the staff was friendly!

A 10 min. walk can take you any where---Let's talk hospitality ---You are made welcome as you step into the lobby--ALOHA as Ariel gets your bag .Your room awaits---free wifi in your room --the house keeping staff are well trained-- they will not disappoint --ASK-you forgot something--ASK. During the day--Romana will take care of your food & drink even if you are at the pool.In the evening--Adora ,Mimi,& Jake will help you with the menu. Relax-Relax your in HAWAII.

I stayed here for 12 days with my two friends from Australia. I was very hesitant at first because it was cheap but I was beyond amazed at how beautiful the hotel is and how amazing the facilities are. The staff are so friendly, helpful and fun which made us feel right at home. The pool and spa are incredible and it is never over crowded. The location is perfect and a 5 minute walk to the beach and main strip. The rooms are amazing and are much bigger than I expected. It is very clean and the cleaners are lovely. The hotel got us three single beds which was greatly appreciated as it wasn't guaranteed. When our flight was cancelled the hotel was booked out however Ray was very helpful and arranged another hotel for us that was cheap. The wifi is free and has amazing connection. I am just so happy with this hotel I can't put it into words! It really made our trip amazing and we will definitely stay again in the future!

Great hotel with in room wifi free of charge !!!! Location right in the middle of Waikiki with mountain views . Clean rooms , close to a good grocery store and bus stops . Great value for your money !

Third time staying in waikiki and this was the best stay so far. Inexpensive and only a 10 minute walk from kuhio beach (my favorite part of waikiki beach). Rooms were old but well kept and comfortable. Water pressure was good and hot. Restaurant in the lobby was delicious and valet and hotel staff were always more than happy to help and fast.The most important thing about this place is that it has at least 6 hours of quiet a night since it is close to the canal (still get a white noise app for the trip). This is very important because waikiki is a very noisy at all hours of the night!

From beginning to end, our stay at this hotel was nothing short of fantastic. Although the carpeting needs replaced in the hallways, and the halls need a new coat of paint (of another color) it was really great. Even though this is an older property- it was clean and the beds were comfy and fresh. The grounds outside did not match the halls upstairs- in a good way. The patio off of the bar area was a literal scenic haven. So comfortable and upscale looking. Who knew there would be a FREE foot spa heated by solar power right off of the patio- AWESOME!! The pool area was beautiful and the foot was very good. Highly recommend the Ahi Poke and the sizzling chicken plate and the sizzling steak plate- as well as the cheeseburgers!As for the personnel, I challenge anyone to find another place that the people were any nicer. They just could not do enough for you and were happy to do so. The location of the Waikiki Sand Villa was perfect. We'd definitely stay there again.

I was so excited to be in hawaii for our last trip before out baby comes. WORST hotel 1st impression of my life. First off we booked a queen room and ended up in a room with 2 double beds. Mind you i am very pregnant it was a very tight fit. Next the washroom was Filthy HAIRS and left over SOAP all over like it wasn't even cleaned after the last guest. So dirty I felt like showering in my shoes. Next one of the beds were covered in stains not sure if the sheets were changed. It was very disappointing walking into this hotel after seeing such nice photos and pretty good reviews. The photos are OLD this hotel seems run down really needs a reno. My husbands biggest complaint is there is ZERO control over the thermostat main reason is it will only run while the key card is placed in the room wall unit that supplies power to the room, also all lights are turned on when power in being fed to the room with no light switches to turn them off. When you sleep the key comes out to turn lights off. This was leaving our room either too hot or too cold because as soon as we leave the thermostat turns off. Dont know about you but I am not about to leave my room key in the suite. Do your self a favor and book something else.

We stayed here for 11 nights & it fitted our holiday very well. It is very close to everything, the beach, shopping & restaurants & being those few blocks back (5 min walk) we liked being off the main track. The hotel backed on to the canal & the golf course so the views were pleasant from the balcony. We had several meals in the hotel & as well as being reasonably priced everything was so delicious. Happy hour was great too along with a decent sized swimming pool & a foot spa which we used a lot. The staff could not be more helpful especially Pili who we got to know very well. Misako booked us several tours & was a wealth of information & such an awesome lady. If you are looking for a friendly great value place then this is the one to come to & we would definitely stay here again.

Do not expect too much. That`s a budget hotel, but clean and with friendly staff. The location is quite noisy, but rather close to the beach and the main attractions of Waikiki. For the breakfast you have to pay additionally, but it`s reasonable option. The food is tasty and in a pretty good choice. The price for a triple room in January, around 150 $ plus taxes, seems paradoxical, comparing other hotels, to be quite attractive, like for such a tourist place.

Set a few minutes walk from Waikiki beach, it has a very hot jacuzzi and foot spa and lovely big swimming pool. Pool towels are provided. There is a bar near the pool area. You have to walk through the restaurant to get to the foot spa or the pool area though. The rooms are basic but we stayed in a room with two double beds with three of us and it was quite comfortable. With four people its a bit of juggling with suitcases. Small area to hang clothes but chest of 6 big drawers. TV. Coffee maker, ironing board and iron. No kettle. Would have preferred a kettle to a coffee maker. There is a hospitality room on one of the floor where you can use the microwave if you need to heat something or need to wait till your room is ready or even freshen up after you check out if you still have to stay for the day. It has a bathroom, loungers, computers. The rooms have free wifi and worked quite well. Shower gel and shampoo, hand wash. No shower caps and toiletries so you need to bring your own. Has a bar fridge. Bus stop is close to the hotel to catch buses to just about everywhere. Fares were $2.50 a ride (1.25 for under 18's)and if you need to transfer buses, you can do so on the same ticket, so long as you use it within two hours. There is a supermarket across the road open till 1am and lots of restaurants, nightclubs and shops nearby as well as McDonalds if you pine for fast food. We went January and had temperature around 27 degrees celsius. Water was cool to get in but warm once you were in and there was no lack of people swimming. Warm enough to walk around in summer clothes, swimmers etc. Doesn't cool off till late night and still only need something light. Showers are very good. Great water pressure. Very nice and helpful staff. We stayed on the 12th floor and overlooked the canal. There is a golf course on the opposite side of the canal. If you follow the canal you actually walk to Ala Moana shopping centre but it can take up to an hour, depending how fast or slow you walk. We did get noise from constant sirens going down the road and if you leave the balcony door open it gets a bit noisy but it didn't bother us at all. Great place for anyone to stay.

I stayed here for two nights, it's a very basic room but does have a mini fridge which was good and the WiFi was decent.My biggest complaint would be that it's not sound proof at all. I could hear the neighbouring families but mostly it was the cars screeching up and down the road. I was on the 7th floor and it woke me upa few times both nights.
