I know it's not the hotel's fault there's idiot drivers, however their soundproofing could be improved.

Waikiki sand villa hotel isn't the most modern or luxurious hotel in Waikiki but the rooms are clean and has everything that pretty much every other hotel in Waikiki has. The hotel has a sort of transit room where if you arrive early you can have a shower, freshen up and use the Internet. With the hotel having free wifi, that certainly was a big plus as a traveller to not have to mess around getting that sorted. The only drawback is the 2 lifts they have are incredibly slow and we were worried that using the fire stairs would set off the alarm so made for a bit of a wait at times. The staff were friendly and helpful and I'd definitely recommend for someone who just needs a nice room to base themselves out of for their holiday instead of lapping up the luxury of the hotel itself

Rating is probably more of a 3.5. Definitely more of a "budget" hotel, but if you're planning on spending most of your time out of the hotel on the beach or sightseeing, it has everything you need.Pros:- Location is only 2 1/2 blocks away from the wide stretch of public beach at Waikiki. Really can't beat that, unless you're in one of the really expensive hotels ON the beach. Also, there's even an ABC store half-way to the beach to stop an pick up snacks, sunscreen, etc. - Beds were surprisingly comfortable! I struggle with insomnia and once I got used to the noise (see cons), the last three nights I was there were some of the best nights of sleep I've had in years!- Helpful and friendly staff.- This one is random, but on top of a pool and a hot tub (neither of which I used so I can't speak to them), there is also a foot spa, which is basically a hot tub but just for your feet. It is located on the outdoor patio of the restaurant. My boyfriend and I had gone on a long hike one day and checked out the foot spa to help our aching feet and it was so nice that we went down to use the foot spa on all subsequent nights.Cons:- Other than just generally not being as elegant as some hotels, with older fixtures, carpet etc., the worst part was the noise, particularly in the early mornings (starting around 6 am) when it seemed like there were always garbage trucks or construction of some kind going on. I was on the Kanekapolei Street side on the 9th floor but it really sounded like the trucks were right outside my window. Now, as I mentioned before, I suffer regularly from insomnia, so I am a lighter sleeper than some; however, that also means I already wear ear plugs to sleep every night and the sounds of the trucks still woke me up the first few mornings. However, the second half of my trip, I switched to the bed further from the window, went to bed earlier (and was pretty tired from hiking, surfing, etc), and I slept great the last few nights, so who knows!

We stayed in Waikiki Sand Villa from December 2015 to January 6th 2016. We had a fantastic stay! The Customer service was excellent and the hotel is literally a straight 5 minute walk to the beach. However, the hotel does need some TLC, the hallways to the rooms aren't great and doesn't give a good first impression in complete honesty. The rooms are big and we had a corner balcony on the 5th floor which was excellent. The a/c worked fine too. All in all a fantastic stay here, no complaints! Just don't expect it to be a new, modern looking hotel, the hotel shows it won't be within its price! Excellent value for money though. Don't bother with the restaurant downstairs, it's one of the worst we have been too! There were three tables seated out of about 20 and we got told we had to wait 10 minutes. Baffled, we waited outside for 15/20 minutes, only to be seated to receive poor dishes. Did not receive great service either, quite rude and abrupt and Was told at the end 'tips aren't included but definitely appreciated' when given our bill as if we didn't know that already. Very rude considering this was the worst food and service we had our entire trip! Completely begrudged paying any tip at all but we did! Complete no for me! Another party in there left before even ordering it was that bad!

We stayed here with 4 of us: me, husband, 20yo and 14yo. The room was about what I expected, plain but very clean. There were 2 double beds and a couch bed. However, you couldn't fold out the couch bed. It had a small kitchen with everything except an oven. The location was perfect as it was very easy walking distance to the beach and to my mom's hotel. I would probably have given this a 4 star rating except for the noise.Our room was right above the bar.. We checked in New Year's Eve and things were going strong and loudly until nearly 4am. Ear plugs helped some. The noise was definitely better the next two nights, but still loud enough that it made it really hard to sleep unless you had ear plugs. The front desk was quite helpful with several of our questions. They were friendly. The breakfast was quite good. I know the hotel was full on New Year's Eve or I would have asked for a different room. Perhaps it would have been quieter at night. By the end of three nights there I was so excited to go somewhere where I could get a good night's sleep. Other than that one factor, I would gladly recommend this hotel. It was an excellent value. If you like to party into the night and sleep in, then this would be perfect for you.

we reached Honolulu after a grueling 25 hours of travel as we had a layover at Narita of 8 hours! we reached the hotel at 11, but were informed that the check in as at 3 only so we could wait in the hospitality room. That room was over crowded, not very clean and with no place to sit also! I again appealed for an early check in- which I had also specified while booking the room. The attendant was a little cold and told me that it was the rule. we waited another 2 hours in the restaurant ( which by the way was quite shabby and had a dirty floor) and finally got our room around 2. However, the room was quite good and the view was fantastic- overlooking the stream nearby..We discovered happily that we could walk down to the market and most restaurants nearby. The beach was also right there. On the whole the stay was comfortable but mostly due to the location. we hardly spent any time in the room itself. It was a little cramped as there were 3 of us, quite clean ( the bathroom had a very modern seat!).

We stayed at the Sand Villa the week of Thanksgiving for 4 nights M-F with 2 rooms one for myself and other half and one for my parents. This is a great budget minded hotel just a few blocks North from Waikiki beach. If you're looking for a simple cost effective hotel that you know you're not going to spend much time at because you're in Hawaii, this is a great place. Tiana at the front desk is wonderful and Teddy the bellman/concierge will both assist with anything you need to get around town. The hotel does have a bar/restaurant down stairs and a small pool area set outback. We didn't spent too much time there because, again, you're in Hawaii so we basically were there to sleep and shower. The rooms were simple, clean and welcoming and some had views, but in the end this certainly met our objective. If you want to be just down the street from Waikiki beach and all the shopping without paying high price hotel for which you are not there but only a minimal amount of time, consider Sand Villa.

It was my first time in Hawaii and my husband had found a deal last minute. Little did we know that it was the same weekend as the Honolulu marathon. We checked late, tired from our flight and starving we walked walked and the room was clean and tidy. We were starving, the bar was still open (4am, one of the few) and the kitchen was still open so we nearly inhaled everything on the menu. The beds were comfy, the only that was confusing was how to turn on the AC. We were trying to figure out how to turn on the AC and it took us an hour to realize that it was our room key to control the fan/AC in the room. So my advice, always ask for two rooms keys...one to place in the room for the fan to run and the other to keep on you. The location itself, is a quick walk to Waikiki boardwalk, conveniently located to most major bus lines (recommended) to get anywhere in the city.

Stayed here for about 1 week. Room was nice and comfortable however the hotel halls were a bit shabby and perhaps in need of a face lift. A short walk to an ABC store which is convenient. There's also bus stops near the ABC store in close proximity which made it easy to get around. Whilst the hotel is not located on the beach it was in a decent area where just local traffic passes through. It wasn't overly busy with high traffic or tourists in large numbers so it was relatively peaceful. Room had a small fridge which was convenient to store water bottles and some food.

My husband and I eloped to Hawaii and we didn't want to spend a fortune on an expensive ocean front hotel. We were not disappointed with this hotel. Yes, it is a basic hotel room but it included a bath and shower with a king size bed (which a lot of Waikiki hotels ou have a shower and full size bed). Our room was on the 12th floor and our lanai was a large "L" shaped lanai with views of the canal, mountains, city and ocean. The pool is outstanding and quite possibly the largest pool by Waikiki standards. The staff allows you to bring your own cocktails and snacks poolside, which can save you some money. We stayed for 11days and enjoyed getting to know the staff. The bar is filled with locals who are a lot of fun. The hotel is well located and close to everything!

a budget hotel with lots of amenities. great pool that you can do laps in and a cool hot tub but water temps can be inconsistent and sometimes a little cold. wifi works great.nice restaurant with some tasty stuff. liked the free breakfast in the morn and the free newspaper. reat staff work here. the security guy -- shawn -- is a great customer service representative for the place. he seems to wear multiple hats and almost seems to live there. but kequila of the front desk staff is great as well. always is helpful and has a smile on here face. debbie and ramona in the bar are great and make you want to come back. i know im missing some folks will definitely come back.note if you are a smoker -- rooms on floors 2 and 3 are smoking rooms

So, I'm going to ignore everything else about the Sand Villa and focus on this.. The Waikiki Sand Villa is what I would describe as a budget hotel. And very dated. So, one would think that the staff and management would bend over backwards to keep their guests happy, right? Wrong!We purchased a bottle of wine from a nearby ABC store to enjoy in our room (because we don't always like the company of strangers at a bar) No glasses are provided in the room apart from those in the bathroom. So, we asked at the bar if we could please borrow two wine glasses. The bar attendant said no, because we might not return them, however, we could have two plastic cups. We offered to leave a deposit. The answer was still no. So we asked the Cocierge. Still no.We have travelled extensively through our home country of Australia, and also Italy, Germany, Austria, France, and the U.K. Never ever have we been declined such a simple request. Honestly WSV, if you're so worried about your guests stealing things from your rooms, chain everything down!What a joke.

4 nights in mid-September, $140AUS per night. Friendly, helpful front desk staff, friendly housekeeping and maintenance staff. Had a double balcony as room was directly behind the elevator shaft, no noise from the elevator at all/ Fantastic view of the canal, also had views of the ocean. Fast internet, comfortable bed, clean room,heated toilet seat and bidet, catering for the Japanese cliental, of which there were many at this hotel. 5 minute walk to the beach, 1 minute to the main drag for buses, also farmers market set up every afternoon to pick up a cheap meal.Would recommend this hotel to fellow travellers.

Best bits: This hotel is reasonably priced which is rare for Waikiki. You are 3 (small) blocks from the beach, less than a 10 min stroll. There is an ABC store on the corner and lots of supermarkets nearby. The hotel is right by the canal which I could see from my room with a great view over downtown Honolulu. I arrived early in the morning and couldn't get into my room unfortunately but there is a hospitality room with full bathrooms so I could shower after a long flight. All rooms have balconies. The pool is really nice - large and not on a roof so sheltered from the wind! The foot spa is also really nice and relaxing. Staff were pleasant.Bad bits: The bathrooms are dated and mine had terrible water pressure on the 8th floor. The breakfast is disgusting. Do not pay for it!!!!!!!!! It caters for the many Japanese tourists with a selection of noodles and veges (not my thing) but the rest is dismal. A few fruits, some french toast with unidentified sauce, dry scrambled eggs, tea only available on request and no fresh milk. Only that dreadful American flavoured creamer. Also, one lift kept breaking down when I was there...

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights costing about $150 Canadian a night tax included, which was cheaper than a lot of the other hotels (no resort fee). We rented scooters for 4 days, and they let us park it at the hotel for free (regular parking costs about $20/night). The location was great in Waikiki and was very close to beaches and shops. They also gave us a corner room looking out to the golf course and lake, which was beautiful with lots of sunlight (if the sun was out). Overall, we would stay here again.

Check-in went well as our room was ready a couple of hours early. The room was great. We had two balconies to enjoy as our room (411) wrapped around the elevator shaft (no sound heard), and was comfortable, clean, well designed. I am glad to see they have a number of environmentally-friendly programs in place. It's 2015 - all hotels and properties should have room-card power "on" at the door; this also allows power for the fridge, lights, tv, etc. When you leave all the power shuts off except for over the desk, so you can keep your computer/phones charged etc. Staff was great. Friendly, helpful, and sure, although you would expect that in Hawaii, no matter where you are staying, the staff here was also patient with children and elderly patrons. Nice to see and experience.The pool was the best we've had the pleasure to use. A Hottub, solar-powered Japanese foot pool, the whole lanai and pool area is clean, nicely designed and... I really enjoyed discovering the gecko family making their lives on the pool island. Sweet!Some of you would have experienced the "usual" when trying out a hotel-based restaurant. However, the tapas-style food, presentation and quality of the Wood and Bucket was a *huge* surprise. Complete with a couple of complimentary discount coupons as hotel guests, it was worth trying out. We liked the food so much we ate there for dinner four nights in a row. Highly recommended.Giving the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel five stars. Talking with other guests/patrons from around the world, our experience wasn't a fluke. This hotel simply works a bit harder.

The hotel was reasonably cheap for a Waikiki property, so I wasn't expecting too much. However, the property was great.It's about 2 short blocks from the main drag in Waikiki, so good location. We had a lovely view of the golf course and lush green mountains. The hotel pool and spa were good, and theres a cute solar heated foot spa which is nice after a big day at Ala Moana!  The rooms were basic, but nice enough, and clean. We had a small balcony which was nice.We didn't eat at the restaurant but heard from the locals that the food there was fantastic. We had cocktails though- I can vouch for those!There was a Chinese acupuncture/massage service at the hotel, which was reasonably priced, but we didn't have time to try.Overall, the staff were friendly, great location, and an absolute bargain- I would definitely stay here again.

I've stayed at many properties throughout Waikiki, but this has ended up being my absolute favourite. Besides the absolutely convenient mid-Waikiki location, here's the highlights I loved:1. The pool is large and attractive. You can choose to be in the shade or not at practically any time of the day. Perfect place to rewind when not at the beach or off exploring Oahu.2. The restaurant is really quite good. Too often, hotel restaurants aren't that special, but there's something going on in the kitchen here and each meal I ate was superb.3. The rooms have been recently refreshed and mine was airy, clean and had two small balconies. Loved the beds - very fresh and comfortable. The central air conditioning means no rattly, moldy machine ruining your sleep. It's just... perfect, really.4. The staff is absolutely, genuinely friendly. Everyone here I encountered was approachable with a fantastic sense of humour and grace.5. I mentioned the location already, but really... it's VERY convenient for exploring Waikiki on foot. Just ten minutes walk from the main beach and a block from the grocery store.The only real hiccup is that my new iPhone wouldn't connect to the free WiFi and the wired ethernet connection went down a couple of times. Small things, really.I would DEFINITELY stay here again and I think I've used up my all-caps quota for the year, but I can't say enough how much I loved this hotel. Can't wait to return!

It's a pretty old hotel but the location is great (walking distance to Waikiki beach and restaurants etc). There's a hospitality room there for guests to use if they arrived too early before check in time. There's a travel desk there and the nice lady there could arrange for tours throughout the island and you can also booked the shuttle van to the Waikele Premium Outlets.The hotel room is big and clean and the wifi is very fast.

This is a great hotel for a great price. We booked almost 10 months early and received a discount for booking that far ahead. When we arrived, our room was not ready but we were able to use the hospitality room. Upon check in, we were told we had been upgraded to a better room on a higher floor. Our room was on the seventh floor with great views of the canal and the golf course with the mountains in the distance. All front desk staff was friendly and kindly answered our many questions regarding buses, restaurants, and directions. It is a short walk to the beach and bus stops are 1-2 blocks walk. Our room was clean. We were pleasantly surprised to find the floors were not carpeted but had some kind of wood laminate. There is a restaurant in the hotel and many more within walking distance (a block or two). An ABC Store is maybe 2 blocks away in case you need gifts or snacks. Wifi is free.

Our family enjoyed one night in this Friendly hotel. They had a great pool, the place was relaxing and clean too. What I really like was how friendly the young lady who checked us in was. Its always nice when staff makes you feel like family coming home :)

My wife and I had a 2 day stop over at this hotel and I am honored to report on people with outstanding service. Jennifer in the bar, Pili and Tiana counter staff were probably the most delightful people I have ever encountered in our many years of hotel accommodation. Assist with taking bags to rooms was not trouble at all; any question at reception was assisted with prompt service and a very pleasant response. The bar at this location is very open to the street and at this location Jennifer remembered what we had eaten the day prior and recalled out drinks. Her pleasant professional manner really made us relax in this very traditional environment hotel. There was a very nice pool at the rear with a Italian restaurant with well priced and quality food. The bar meals were well priced and many local drunk at the bar. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the beach and well situated close to ABC shops for any kind of supplies. The hotel is showing wear but it is clean and the fantastic service makes up for any minor scaring. Overall my wife and I would easily stay there again. The hotel is opposite to a golf course which adds a beautiful inclusion to the mountains.

I stayed here for a weeks vacation with 2 friends. We chose this hotel because they offered 3 twin beds at a very reasonable rate. We got what we paid for. The staff was excellent and very accommodating. I was expecting better accommodations based on the pictures. The rooms are old and worn. The room was cleaned everyday, but each night all of us had BLACK feet from the floor. More than once we retuned to find bugs scurrying when the light was turned on. The air conditioning sucked to put it bluntly! The electric and air only run and operated with a key card inserted into a power box! You leave with your key the power goes off! You got it , you return to a hot room with the clock flashing....going for ice- reset the clock! I read the reviews and not once was this mentioned. The restaurant was very good, we never had a bad meal and LOVED the Loco Moco. The tour person did get us messed us a couple times with wrong times, but it worked out. Just double check....

I stayed here in September for 5 days with my 2 children along with a large group of friends that I was traveling with. Check in was easy, my room was available when we arrived at 1pm. Room quality was good, beds were comfortable however the only 2 complaints I would have regarding the room is that the bathroom is very small and the air conditioner is very loud. Breakfast wasn't very good as they cater more for the Asian population (really rice for breakfast?) The tour desk was disappointing, the lady at the desk was very unreliable one day not arriving until after 9 and we missed out booking a particular tour that we wanted and was forced to go another day ... I only booked this hotel due to our budget but I don't think we would stay again.

Good location, easy to find. Rooms are rather old but basically all right. Breakfast must be paid extra - not cheap, but good. Breakfast in a hotel over the street is cheaper, but not so good. Waikiki was a bit disappointing for us. The rumours are better than facts. There are much nicer beaches in Oahu.

Very decent rooms, little dated but no big deal. Extra clean rooms. Our room featurued a toilet with bidee, ery nice. Hotel has 2 elevators in alobby. ! elevator didin't work the first day of our stay, 2nd day both of the elevators were down, we had to use stairs (6th floor). By the day 3 they fixed both elevators. Elevators were very slow, but managable. Total of 11th floor. Pool wasn't much, nice hot tub, not very hot though. Valley parking for a $10 a day, nice restaurant in a lobby please check it out. Check in and check out was a brezee. Hotel was 2 blocks away from Waikiki beach. Plenty restaurants close by, so dont worry about that. We also utilized massage parlor in the hotels lobby, very decent price for a massage. Very good hotel if you are on the budget. We paid $480 for a 4 day stay, that is including vallet parking. They do offer free shuttle to airport if you stay 4 nights. We rented a car so didn't utilize that. Free wifi.

We were coming into Waikiki late, and we're moving on the next day to a different part of the island, so we didn't want to spend a lot. The location was very close to the main drag for shopping and restaurants. They gave us a corner room that over looked the channel of water on the side of the hotel. The breakfast is not included but they gave us a coupon.

convenient location 5-10 minutes walk to the beach. comfortable beds and great staff, very friendly and helpful. The Hospitality room meant I could take advantage of the time before and after my check in and out, and still shower and change before my late flight.

Stayed there for first time trip to Hawaii. Great location close to beach. Very clean rooms and friendly staff. Nice grill and bar on first floor when felt like relaxing after day out. Price was right and AC was appreciated during heat wave proclaimed by newspaper, a free copy of which was provided every morning in the lobby. Would definitely stay there again.

The hotel has a perfect great value! The room is very confortable and clean! Wifi reachs 9th floor. Perfect hospitality room for use after check out. Near from waikiki beach and grocery stores. Foot Spa for free. Crew is very kind. The bad thing is parking. 20 bucks per day. Look foward to park in the streets.

We did not try the breakfast (didn't look good and not included) but the room was good and so was the location, and the price too, being in central waikiki and close to a bus stop. Service at reception good.

Booked 5 nights. Upon arrival, I was given a key to their "Hospitality Room" since my room wasn't ready. The Hospitality Room was a recreational room with computers, TV, 2 couches, 2 massaging chairs and 2 bathrooms where one can freshen up while waiting for your room.Overall, I had a decent stay. Like many of the reviews described, the hotel is definitely a little dated. The room was a little cramped. Kind of narrow with 2 full size beds. Beds were comfortable. AC was a little difficult to control so it wasn't as cool as I would have liked. Internet was a little slow so you couldn't even stream short videos. The pool and jacuzzi were decent as well. It mainly caters to Japanese tourists so you don't have to deal with obnoxious mainland tourists who think they own the place. The hotel itself was 2 blocks away from the beac and a block away from the bus stop(s) so it's very conveniently located. It's also a block away from Food Pantry. I wish there had been a microwave in the room. Would have been nice to have leftovers from meals the day before. I don't know that I would necessarily return on my next stay but it's definitely a decently priced place if you're on a budget.
user_name:
Ben P
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Stayed in studio room for 6 nights which overlooked the pool. There was a lounge, kitchenette and dining table which came in handy when having breakfast in the room. Free wifi available. Location is good only a short walk to the beach, across the road from the canal and not for from a supermarket. Even though the room was a bit old it was still a good room especially for the price. The only issue I had was the screen door hinges for all the studio rooms did not work. This meant that the door banged loudly when ever anyone was entering or leaving their room. This was very annoying at 6.00 in the morning!

We just returned from our 2nd stay at Sand Villa Waikiki Aug. 2015. Still a great place and good price, but I must say we don't like the changes made since we were there 4 yrs ago. Why ruin a good thing that WAS the Sand Bar Restaurant and Bar??!! We used to enjoy a wonderful fresh made omelet in the morning with a bloody mary...or coffee. Now it's buffet only. PASS. $14 ea is not how I want to start my day. Can't say I like the Wood & Bucket theme instead of Surf Boards!!!! Fire that decorator! ha.Before I go on I must say the overall service is great and they are accommodating, with great attention to your room and clean sheets daily!!! :)Now the room...........after we complained they adjusted our thermostat. I'm sorry....any room should include cold a/c all the time!!!! You have to keep your key card inserted at all times for the A/C to work. I would much rather just be able to adjust my thermostat..I WOULD gladly raise it when I leave. AND have cold air at night. I don't think our room ever got below 75. It was HOT in Hawaii the entire time we were there! :| Come on tradewinds!!! Also, watch the double beds thing....double double means Two DOUBLE or Full size beds! Not the most comfortable either. Yes we could have changed rooms...but had a nice location and had unpacked before we realized everything. Yes...for 12 nights.They have a nice pool with great access to free towels, however when we finally had the time to actually get in the pool after seeing a beautiful sunset on the beach and a quick bite only to be told the pool is now closed!!!!!!!!!! What??!!! Yep...Sat. nite at 9 pm!!!!! I was most unhappy. It was only the two of us and and two other people, being very quiet. Perhaps they could change it to no loud kids after 9??!! lol? Or later period. Especially weekends! :)I must say many kudos to the QUICK response and action to replace the mini refrigerator in our room when it went out!!! Day or night they send their technicians!!I do wish I had known about the foot spa... lol. I know now...and will check it out along with our next room before we get all settled! Hubby says we are going back to Waikiki annually....yaay!!! I know 3rd time at Sand Villa WILL be a charm!!!! Mahalo!!

This is the 3rd time we have stayed here at this hotel Rooms are great /. The pool is huge The location is just 10 minutes walking to Waikiki beach, Ashley at the front desk is very helpful. Also very close to restaurants and stores

Firstly, comes with a free foot spa opened from 8 to midnight everyday!Secondly, the hospitality room is FANTASTIC! There are three computers with internet, two bathrooms, a couch, TV and a microwave! All for while you're waiting for your flight. As long as you were a paying guest of Waikiki sand villa, you are able to use it even after you have checked out!They are also happy to lend you beach towels even if you have checked out.Our room itself wasn't the greatest. The water in the shower came out a bit stronger than weak pee. The bathroom lighting was dark and took 10 minutes before you felt like you were no longer feeling your way around. The ventilation also did nothing for the bathroom.The room itself was a little small for four people, but reasonable. The only main concern I had was the air conditioning system. It was very old and literally took a day or two before it finally cooled down. As a result, we kept one room key always plugged into the power and only used one room key to get in and out of the hotel.Location wise was perfect! Close to the main strips and close to the beach! It was also close enough to multiple eateries and other large hotels in the area so pick up for tours were easy if they didn't pick up at the front door.Despite the construction happening on our floor and the not so good bathroom, I still enjoyed my trip lots!

We stayed here for 9 nights and loved it. Very close to everything and everyone very friendly. The room isn't huge but it was enough for us and the beds were really comfortable which was great. The pool was a good size too and we had a nice view of the canal and golf course. We would definitely recommend staying here and we'll be back. The price was reasonable too for Waikiki.

I did alot of research re hotels for my 8 day break in Waikiki and decided on Sand Villa and I am glad I did. I recently checked out after an 8 day 7 night stay in late July 2015. This hotel presented the best value for money and was very well located. I stayed in a premium corner room and it was great however the wind is strong and rattled the windows intermittently during the night, which may disturb some, however didn't bother me. Overall the hotel is a little dated with older facilities however nothing that would negatively impact a stay. Very clean room on level 12 with a view of the water and mountains, which was serviced daily. The hotel staff were great and I didn't use pool etc so cant comment on those facilities. I wasn't particularly pleased with the restaurant breakfast offering, it was small and bland BUT again, for what it was, it was good value for money. Also good if you were in a hurry. Id suggest skipping this and getting some fruit/yoghurt etc from the ABC store down the road and putting it in your room fridge for early mornings. The tappas dinner in the restaurant was lovely and I recommend it. The hotel is a nice stroll to Honolulu zoo if you feel up for a walk. The free return transfer to the airport was fantastic! Thank you to the staff!

it was a nice stay. the price was fair, it was within walking distance to the beach and all the shops and restaurants. Parking in the area is very difficult so we opted for the valet parking option. The bar downstairs is awesome, great food, and great prices. the pool is very nice and surrounded by nice plants. would visit again!

I researched a lot for my 10 days stay in Oahu . Got a great deal at this hotel .Great swimming areaGood breakfast menu Nice and spacious roomsDecent view Nice bar and beer Walking distance from Waikiki beachEnjoyed all 9 nights with my day with my dad !

We arrived early from catching an overnight flight. We knew check in was at 3pm so we were just hoping to drop off our bags and come back later. To our surprise, the hotel has a hospitality room. This hospitality room is equipped with showers so we could freshen up. It is a great feature that I have not come across in hotels. The staff were friendly and the facilities were great. The location is also fantastic! Only a block back from Waikiki beach! The only negative, and it's a small problem, was that towels were not restocked by the pool which meant we had to sign out towels from housekeeping which was a little annoying.

I stayed here in July for a wedding. Most of the others were staying on Waikiki Beach, but I chose this location because of price and its location to running trails ... and was not disappointed.The property is not luxurious and could use updates here and there ... but the rooms and other areas are more than adequate and are clean, which is the main thing. It's a short walk to the beach, and a half-block from a supermarket with sushi and decent deli-type options -- particularly since the room had a fridge.I'd stay again without a doubt.

Loved it it was very cheap and beautiful view I think people should go there any time in the summer and be sure to wake up about 5:00 AM so you can get dressed and eat breakfast and about 5:45 the sun rises and it is probably the most beautiful thing my friends and I have ever seen

we liked staying here we were lucky to be on the top floor so it was very quiet and the beds were comfortable.Still close to the shops but was nice to get away from all the crowds back to the hotel.We spent a lot of time near the pool which is a god size and not as busy as the Hilton waikiki village which you had to fight for space, this was nice and quiet and very relaxing.Thanks for a pleasant stay we were very happy with the hotel and the price.

This was our first stay here and I'm glad we gave it a chance. It's less busy than other hotels in Waikiki, but is still close to everything. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and check in was easy. Everything went smoothly during our stay. The room was small and simple, but clean and comfortable. It was perfect to lounge in when we weren't out and about. I do wish they had more available reading materials here so I could have read a bit while relaxing. Maybe some books or magazines? All in all a good stay, and we'd consider coming back the next time we're on the island!

After a lot of TA research - we booked the Waikiki Sand Villa as we were looking for a larger room with a kitchenette - and not too expensive! (Family of 2 adults 3 children). Our room was located next to the pool and had 2 double beds and a foldout sofa bed. The room also had a small kitchen table and kitchen area with microwave - which allowed us to have breakfast in our room each morning before heading out. The beds were comfortable and the room clean (serviced daily). The only complaint we had was the slow draining shower. We ate at the restaurant twice for dinner during our stay and the food was great. The hotel is located close to ABC stores, Food Pantry and bus stop to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It's about a 8 minute walk to the beach. The pool is fantastic - water was warm and it was never too busy. We would definitely stay here again.

Hotel Waikiki Sand Villas we choose based on TA reviews, low cost including free shuttle and presence of a pool. Pool was a must for my daughter. Short walking distance from a grocery store Food Pantry was also a plus. There were no long waiting to register. We arrived early morning, so our room was not ready yet and they let us use a hospitality room which was very nice. Hospitality room has 2 bathrooms with showers, couch, massaging chairs (for $1), microwave, copy machine (for some money; didn't see the amount) and 3 computers. Hotel also has a laundry room on the same floor as a hospitality room. Our hotel room had a mini fridge but no microwave. Pool was good, with several other guests there. Water was clean, a little colder that we would like, but enjoyable. Free shuttle is provided only if you book your reservation directly on the hotel's website. Hotel is located 10 minutes easy walking distance from the ocean. The beach there has many rocks but if you walk along the beach to the left in just a few minutes you will see a sandier beach. We wore watersocks. There are 3 ABC stores and many other little stores and places to eat nearby. The only downside was that the room was not very quiet and it was difficult sometimes to sleep at nights. Beds are firm and comfortable. Good for people with back problems. We were able to see water in the canal from lanai. Staff at the hotel was very nice. I liked the hotel overall and would stay there again.

Stayed here on a business trip,ideally this is not a hotel for the business traveller as I felt outta place amongst all the holidaymakers. Never the less I really enjoyed the room. Clean and serviced daily with decent linen and fresh towels. Room was spacious with a great view and so local I felt local!The breakfast offering in the restaurant downstairs offers 15% off food which is a bargain and was really tasty.Would recommend

Hotel is amazing. Rooms were nice, staff was very friendly. Very close to an ABC Store which tourist love. I have no complaints about this hotel. One thing i thought was interesting was how the hotel saved energy. You needed to have your room key and stick it in the key slot in order for the ac, lights to go on, otherwise it would not go on.
user_name:
Bob W
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: I stayed here with my partner for 4 nights. We were trying to stay somewhere a bit cheaper as a lot of the Resorts/Hotels right on the beach were so expensive for the time of year we went. Even though its not right on the beach it's only about a 5 minute walk to it and all the restaurants and shops are all so close as well. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and our room was very clean. I would stay here again.

Enjoyed a two night stay at the Waikiki Sand Villa. The room (1201) located on the top floor had spectacular views of the mountains, Ala Wai and a section of Diamond Head.A king sized bed with firm mattress, clean, sufficiently sized bathroom and a very spacious Lanai, made this the perfect starting point to venture into Waikiki and to explore Honolulu.The hotel staff was very friendly and efficient.A restaurant and seating areas are located in the Lobby.Enjoy a drink at the bar during Happy Hour and rejuvenate your feet after a long day in the solar powered foot spa.The tapas style food at Wood & Bucket Restaurant is well prepared and tasty.Discount vouchers for breakfast are part of your welcome package.The staff at the breakfast buffet was very friendly and entertaining, but I was not interested in the food choices.I did get coffee to take to my room, to enjoy the spectacular vistas from the Lanai.This would also be the perfect spot to have breakfastI would certainly stay at the Villa again and do just that.

This was our first time, staying at this hotel and our decision to try it was the price (Expedia Sale), location, free internet, no extra resort fees, and the provided photos (which you can not always trust). Upon our arrival we were greeted by the valet and check-in was a breeze. Our room was simple and functional, but it was clean and comfortable. The free internet and the Toto Washlet, was definitely a nice feature ... instantly connected and a clean bum! (LOL). The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and it added to our vacation. We were pleasantly surprised by the pool facilities, a tropical garden oasis, next to the bar and restaurant. Waikiki beach was just a few blocks away. It was definitely nice to step out of our hotel and to be able to run along the Ala Wai Canal towards Queen Kapiolani Park and circle back along Waikiki Beach ... paradise! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a clean room and good location ... good value for the money.

Fair priced and close to everything - beach, convenience stores (ABC) coffee shops and restaurants all within walking distance and not to mention a great foot spa, a restaurant/bar open until 4am, an on-site travel agent (booked me on a helicopter within 1 hour of me asking!) and no one can get into the elevator without showing a room key. Love this place - I stay there every time I am in Waikiki!
user_name:
April D
Green Bay, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: This is the third time I have stopped over and stayed at this hotel and it is still as good as before. It is conveniently located and within easy walking distance of the beach and shops, the rooms are well appointed, clean, free wifi, and the corner units have a great view, its not as noisy as other hotels and the staff are friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast is discounted for guests and was a good start to the day with the restaurant and bar in the ground floor easy to get to and a friendly atmosphere. I used my return discount voucher for my accommodation - there was no hassles in getting this off my bill. I will stay here again.

We spent 3 days here early May and were very happy with our accommodation, room was spacious with a balcony and it was lovely to sit out there having a coffee early morning taking in the views over the mountains and the canal. Great location, within walking distance of shops etc. Bar and restaurant downstairs, friendly staff. We would definitely recommend this place.

I was looking for a safe budget hotel with a nice pool and local pub in Waikiki. The sand villa provided both. My daughter and I stayed for 5 days in May. The rooms are just ok-basic but clean, had a small fridge, coffee maker and tv (which we didn't use). Would have really like a microwave but the room did not have one. We enjoyed the pool- hotel was clean. The pub was a nice break after a long day and not wanting to go far, drinks were reasonable. There is an wine bar on the hotel site with a few tables-good wine but pricey.The hotel over looks the canal and only a 5 minute walk to the beach-we rented a car and mainly traveled north to snorkel at shark's cove. The staff are super friendly. The best was being able to use the guest room for late night flights- we checked out at 11am, stored our luggage at the hotel, went back to the hotel 6pm to lay by the pool and used the guest room to shower and relax before heading to the airport. The lanai was pretty small but we were only in our room to sleep and change so it really didn't matter. Would definitely return if wanting a budget room with great service.

This review is very late in coming. We stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa for 5 nights in September 2014 before we embarked on a cruise around the Islands on Pride of America and then home to Australia on Radiance of the Seas.This was our first (but def not our last) time to Hawaii, we are planning to return in Sept 2016.Sand Villa was a great hotel and because we were staying 5 nights we were upgraded from our Deluxe Room to a Corner Premium Deluxe with a Lanai that wrapped around the front and side, had airport pickup included, free wifi and half price valet parking among other things.We rented cars for 3 of the days we were there and the service was just wonderful.Room was great, staff very helpful and position a couple of blocks back from the beach but still only 10 minutes walk was perfect, very peaceful near the canal with lovely views.We will be back to Sand Villa on our next visit to Waikiki next year.

We selected this hotel by location and price. We looked for a quiet location away from the main streets. This hotel is on the canal side of Waikiki, and although away from the crowd, is only a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach. We arrived about 8.00 am, after one of us being ill on the flight, didn't expect our room to be ready buy the friendly staff stored our bags while we found the nearest local Doctor. Check-in time was early afternoon, but the staff allocated us our room at 11 o'clock. we were up-graded to a lovely room, 920.From this corner room we could see the beach one way and the golf course and the mountains the other way. There is an ABC (7 eleven type) store 200 meters away.Bus stop on the same corner. We paid $115 per night plus 14 % tax. We booked in on the 3rd March 2015 and out on the 10th March.The hotel also runs a free airport pick-up and drop off service.Thankyou to all the staff.

We have stayed here 4 times now and will continue to stay here.From the complimentary airport shuttle if you stay 4 or more days to the excellent service.We always arrive early morning so we cant check in straight away, they have no problem storing our luggage in a secure back room so we can go out and start our holiday. They also have a day room if needed for early checkout which has a couple of computers and a printer and a laundry room with a couple of washing machines and dryers.When we checked into our room the toilet was broken and they didnt hesitate in upgrading us from the 7th to the 12th floor. My sister and her daughter arrived the next day and they were upgraded too to be on the same floor as us. Anytime I have rung reception I have been greeted with a friendly response. The canal, mountain and diamond views are exceptional, you do hear the odd firetruck go by, but it is on the main road and noise is not a big problem, though I would probably always try for the highest floor you can afford.The wifi was good. There is a coffee maker with coffee and tea bags in the room, plus a small fridge. There is plenty of storage and a safe. Breakfast is basic but plentiful and nice and I don't eat a big breakfast anyway. I think they have the best pool in Waikiki, We had several lunches and many happy hour cocktails around the pool. It is a short 10 minute shopping walk to the beach. The trolley bus and public buses are only on the next street up and there is also a ABC store on the corner for all your needs and a food pantry a short walk down from that. There are quiet a few decent restaurants close by too. You also get a 10% discount voucher for your return visit. I absolutely adore Waikiki Sand Villa and shouldn't recommend it so highly as It may make it hard to book in in the future, so to the management please remember me if i have a hard time booking in in the future.

I stayed for two nights. It was very comfortable for me. Facilities in the room were not so much. Free Tea bags were indispensable. Sound of fan in the bus room was too noisy. But wash let was available. Finally it's okay for short stay.

I have stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa many times over the past 10 years, and I am writing at the end of another wonderful 12-day stay. The hotel is located right in the heart of Waikiki, convenient to all of the shops and restaurants, as well as a full-service grocery store right across the street. The location is a brief walk to the beach, and is adjacent to the canal and golf course, with the mountains in the background. Beautiful views all around! The staff could not be friendlier or more accomodating. They offer valet parking on site with in/out privileges, and 50% off the parking rate if you book directly on the hotel's own website. If you stay more than 3 days, you also receive a complimentary airport shuttle. The WiFi is excellent. The restaurant and bar at the hotel are reasonably priced and have good options. You will note that there are many "regulars" at the bar who are locals, not tourists! There is also a new wine bar that seems to be quite busy most nights. The pool and hot tub are great--the pool is quite large by Waikiki hotel standards. The hotel caters to many Japanese tourists, hence why all of the signs, menus, etc., are in Japanese as well as English. There is also a spa on site but I've never used it. Honestly, I love this place! I look forward to my next visit.
user_name:
eps2015
New York City, New York

review_body: We were randomly "assigned" by our travel agent in a combination of hotel+air ticket to this hotel and found it very convenient indeed. The hotel is perfectly located: Very quiet and peaceful neighborhood, only 2 blocks, 5 minutes walk, from the main street along the beach of Waikiki, and from the center of everything (and only one bloc away from the bus stop of No. 19 or 20 to the airport, about 50 minutes ride, $2.50). The room was simple yet very clean and comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, and the beds were large and comfortable as well. The staff was welcoming and responsive, very helpful, always friendly and efficient. We asked for additional towels and received them on a daily basis. WiFi was excellent, and we also had no trouble at all with the air conditioner. There is also a nice and intimate, so to speak, pool & jacuzzi at the back side of the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel is costly (more than $12), while the hotel just across the street provides the same for half price ($6). Another Tip: Choose any room on the West side! Avoid the rooms on the East side as the view might be gorgeous but the blow of the winds on the window wouldn't let you sleep at night and relax during the day! Otherwise, the experience in this hotel was wonderful. Highly recommended!

Nice friendly staff, average rooms, fairly clean. Good price for Waikiki but basic hotel. Hotel is on the Ala Wai which is a busy street. You can park on the Ala Wai for free, but you must move your car on Mondays and Fridays between 8:30 am and 11:30 am. The city is very aggressive about towing.

If you do not want to spent a lot of money and want to find a place to stay in waikiki , close to verything , sand villa is the place to be.staff very friendly , breakfast at dollar 12,95 is overpriced and the food they serve more forAsian customers.

Nice hotel with good location on Ala Wai Blvd. The hotel caters to the Japanese, and that is a good thing because it is fairly quiet. The free WiFi is nice and it has a internet cafe on the second floor as well. The best aspect of this hotel is the friendly sports bar in the lobby. Good place to have a nice meal and watch sports along with a good draft beer. Not a loud bar and it has many regulars. I have stayed here 5-6 times and will be back next month for six days before flying out to Hilo.

Found the hotel to be clean. No issues at all. Quite close to the beach. Hotel staff were helpful n polite. Check in occurred without any issues. Hotel aircon working fine. We were given room on level 10 so view was great too.

I booked the Sand Villa mainly because it offered smoking rooms (for my travel companion) as well as the cost. Having been to Hawaii previously (first time stayed at Outrigger Reef, second time Mirimar) I was a little skeptic with the location and had some concerns about why the Sand Villa was so much cheaper than other hotels. The Sand Villa was very clean, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and the pool area was beautiful!! The pool was a little on the cool side...but once in, it was HEAVENLY! The hot tub and the foot bath were very nice too! The bartenders were nice enough to always fill up our water bottles. The noise level can be a little high at times, especially late in the evening. Lots of high school aged students throughout our visit. We did complain twice. The first time was because someone kept trying to use their key to get in our room and must have given out their friends the wrong room number as we had phone calls and knocks on the door a few times. We were moved to another room which had a better view and was much quieter. There as another night were there was a party next door. By 2:00 a.m. we called security who immediately came up and the rest of the night was very quiet. Location wise....it is a bit of a walk to most restaurants and to the beach. I'm out of shape and walk slow; however did not find this to be an issue which was a small concern. I would totally recommend this hotel and in fact, am already planning a return trip to Waikiki !

This was the third and fourth visit to Sand Villa and it was just as good as it was before. Had no problem leaving our bags as we were to early to check in, we then checked in to our 7th floor room and our toilet handle snapped straight off we rang up and were quickly moved to a new room on the 12th floor (an upgrade at no extra cost). My aunt and cousin were joining us the next day and got upgrade to the same floor as us so they would be close. Best service in the restaurant, taste food. Bar service just as good , enjoyed the cocktails by the pool at happy hour. Overall i miss it and would recommend to any one that doesn't mind the short ten minute walk to the beach.

- Our family of four including 2 teenagers aged 17 & 19 travelled with Hawaiian Airlines from Sydney for a short break. - Chose Hawaiian Airlines for their generous baggage allowance .and good rates. Service was great, seats a bit hard but tolerable. - Chose this hotel for it's value and proximity to transport, Waikiki beach and shops.All buses to Ala Moana, Pearl Harbour, Waikele Premium Outlets, Kahala shopping Mall, Diamod Head etc left from Kuhio Ave down the street from this hotel.- Had 2 connecting rooms 901 & 911 on the second floor (smoking floor).but there was no smell of smoke in the hallways. Both rooms were very clean each with 2 very comfortable double beds. had A/C's TV's, fridges, excellent WI FI reception (free), balconies and the rooms were attended to daily. The staff were very attentive, kind, well mannered and we can't thank them enough.The hospitality room with computers, TV and microwave and the laundry room next door were a blessing.The hotel arranged for our free transport from / to Airport.Did not get a chance to use the pool or visit the bar/grill restaurant. but had a walk through and all looked good. - We quite liked the Hawaiian themed décor of the rooms and our only suggestion would be to have smaller chest of drawers in the rooms so as to allow more room for suitcases, save the money spent on fancy Bidet / Toilet seats and spend it on re-carpeting the hallways and install better lighting in the bathrooms. - The International Market Place due to open in 2016 is on Kushio St, but for the meantime there is a narrow alley way next door with plenty of stands selling Hawaiian T-shirts, dresses etc. - ABC stores ( bread, milk, drinks, snacks, toiletries), and the Food Pantry were only a 2 minute walk away. - Ross For Less on Seaside Ave a 5 minute walk (open till 1.00 A.M !) a great place to shop for clothes, shoes some household goods etc. We found more here than all of Ala Moana and the Outlet ( daughter found a magnificent evening gown, several day dresses, tops, Guess shoes very very cheap. Son found a Nike Sports jacket , some fancy shirts, and several items for 'mates'- Going to Waikele , catch the new "E" bus (instead of No 42,) change to No 433 at the Waipahu transit centre ( this will save you more than an hour of travel). Make sure you tell the "E" bus driver you are going to Waikele to get the one ticket for both buses .Found quite a few 'brand ' name items at reasonable prices here. Son and husband found football and basketball shoes at Sports Authority and a designer watch all at good prices..McDonalds is across the road as is a great Party Shop.- Going to Pearl Harbour (plenty of reviews on this site) we joined a tour group which finished the tour early in the afternoon and instead of returning to Waikiki with the tour bus we caught the bus from the highway across the road from Pearl Harbour to Pearl Ridge Shopping Mall .This place is in two sections (Uptown and Downtown) There is a monorail $1.00 each way from inside the shopping centre that travels between the two sections. We found quite a few things here at very good prices.- Visited the Flee Market on Sunday held at Aloha Stadium. Total waste of time. Hundreds of identical stands selling exactly the same Hawaiian T-shirts and very little else. Had a massive headache from seeing the same things for over 2 hours of walking (only did half the stadium and gave up !) AND had to endure the family's ire for having dragged them out there !- Went to Paradise Cove (pre-arranged from Sydney) on New Year's Eve, had a great time, well worth seeing, were seated on the side tables, great view of the stage, good company and the activities before the show were great too. We got back in plenty of time to rest a bit at the Hotel and head to Waikiki Beach for fireworks display.- Went to Ala Moana a few times (plenty of other reviews on this site) . Walk straight through the food court, out on Keeamoku St, where you'll find Nordstrom, Wal-Mart and another Ross across the road.- Husband and son caught the No 19 bus to Toy Lynx on Iwileii Road to purchase some "rare" Yu-Gi-Oh cards ! while daughter and I caught the No 22 bus, drove past Diamond Head and went to Kahala Shopping Mall. which had quite a few nice dress shops and eateries.- As for Waikiki beach, it is a 'paradise' for swimming, sunbaking or simply walking around at any time of day or night, plenty of eateries and expensive boutiques open till late. Denny's nearby has the most scrumptious milk shakes. The Cheese Cake Factory has great food ( Don't spend hours in the queue, ask to be seated at the bar area (even with Children) and you will be served straight away. We also ate at the Atlantis Restaurant which had great service and wonderful food.- Hawaiian hospitality was evident everywhere we visited, such kind and happy people.

We were staying in Waikiki for several days and needed a good value hotel. We found Waikiki Sand Villa through reviews. The hotel is very basic, but a good overall value. The rooms were clean and adaquate in size. They did mix up reservations and I had to deal with management to show I did have reservations when their computer system showed I didn't. It wasn't a big deal, but I would have rather have slept than deal with it. I would stay there again when in Waikiki.Pros: Great neighborhood. Everything (resturants, bars and beach) is within walking distance to the hotel.It has its own bar with food options. Many people staying at area hotels walk over because their hotel didn't have one.The hotel was clean overall.Cons: No street parking. Valet was available, though, for a daily rate of $20 with in and outs welcome.You had to have your hotel key inserted into the wall for electricty. That meant no air conditioning to keep the room cool while we were out. We just left the door open to get air flow.

Stayed here over Xmas as a last minute booking and one of the only places available. As a result the price was high and therefore the value average. It's dated and the walls are thin but the location is great being a couple of blocks from beach and the free foot spa behind the bar was great after spending some time in the ocean every day. Room size ok, ours had not much view.

Stayed here once in the '90s - much improvement since then. Standard room on 5th floor was nicely decorated and had a great view of the Ala Wai Canal. Ceiling air conditioner was quiet. Bidet in the bathroom - with a heated toilet seat! (Maybe not needed in the tropics, but at night it was a plus.) Front desk people were professional, housekeeping pleasant. Good location away from the beach traffic, close to shopping, restaurants and bus. Only drawbacks were lack of microwave oven and occasional cigarette smoke coming through air conditioning vent in ceiling.

This is the 2nd time we have stayed here and again it meet all our expectations. We booked 6 rooms all around the pool in the units and they are perfect for families as the rooms a large, have cooking facilities and being around the pool it is extremely well positioned.The hotel is no 5star, but for value for money it out points all of the large beachfront hotels.The bar staff and food is excellent and the short 2 minute walk to the beach again makes this the best value for money hotel in Waikiki.

(1) We picked the Hotel as it is close to Waikiki without having to pay a lot of money. It is a less than 10Min walk to the beach.(2) Hotel is not fancy, but in good condition. It is a little bit outdated. Room was clean as were the beds. Wifi is free of charge. (3) Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper (window was open). The higher, the better.(4) If coming from the airport, bus 19 connects Airport and Hotel (short walk to/ from Bus Station). Per Person: 2.50 USD. Duration: approx 1,3h.(5) A Supermarket (Food Pantry) is close by.Summary: Hotel is for guest that look for a reasonable priced accomondation and spend most of their time at the beach/shops anyway.

Had a great stay at this Resort.It is in a great location.Only 2 blocks from beautiful Waikiki Beach and close to Restaurants and Shops.It is an older style Resort, but has a great Pool which is a good size and plenty of deckchairs and a hot tub.The Restaurant is okay priced, we ate there a few times but there are plenty of Restaurants close by.The Rooms are clean and have comfortable Beds.I emailed before I arrived and was given a room high up with awesome views over the Canal and Golf Course.The Staff are all friendly and are happy to help.I would definitely stay here again next visit to Waikiki.

I loved that there was an on-site bar with a grill that was open nearly all night! I loved the hotel's atmosphere and the foot spa, not to mention the five minute walk to the beach! There is even a post office a block away if you buy too much and have to ship something home!
user_name:
April D
Green Bay, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: Was a lovely stay. We could walk to the beach. The restaurant is nice in the hotel. The only disappointment was they didn't accept a prepaid travel card for payment so we had to use a credit card from Scotland so got charged for that. The pool was nice but you had to get towels from housekeeping which was annoying. The room was nice and had a balcony which had a great view. The toilet was interesting. The hotel was in the middle so it was accessible to most places. It was also close to bus routes.

Very good hotel for a reasonable price. Great location, you can walk to everywhere you need and it's far enough from noise. Staff was very kind and always smiling. We had free wifi in the room, but it was working a little bit slow. Room was clean, bathroom had a special electrical toilet with heated toilet seat and washing mechanisem ;) Basic breakfast was included in the price.

I have stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa twice, first in February 2010 and most recently in December 2013. My booking to return to the hotel in two weeks reminded me that I never finished the review I started! The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. The bar/restaurant is pleasant, open late and the food is surprisingly delicious (each time I've been to Waikiki (3 times) I've been back to have the fish tacos :D). Beds are comfortable. I've stayed in the tower once and in the rooms overlooking the pool the other time with a kitchenette. Both were fine. The best thing about this hotel is the pool! The pool is that of a 4 star hotel, huge and always the perfect temperature. This is the main reason I choose to come back to this hotel rather than go back to the other hotels I've stayed at / other hotels in my price range because I want to swim in this pool every day!!! I can't wait to come back in 2 weeks!! Enjoy guys!

This property was suggested by a friend and I admit I was skeptical. However, I would stay there again. It is a typical tourist hotel with many tourist from Japan. However, my room was clean and the staff was extremely friendly. The bar is fun and the food at the restaurant was reasonably priced and tasty....especially the burgers and the ribs. Debbie, at the bar, was a great hostess. It is close to the beach but far enough away to avoid some of the crowd. Reserve a room on a higher floor....you won't be sorry for the higher charge.

The hotel is very decent, clean, you get what you pay for, and considering how expensive hotels can be in Waikiki, this one is a great price and amazing location, walking distance from Waikiki beach, bus stops and lots of shops around. Recommended!

This hotel was amazing value, considering it's location. Right on the canal, just a short walk down to Waikiki beach. On checking in, we were upgraded not one room type, but two! The front desk staff and valets were lovely, always happy to help and provide advice. The room was clean, had a nice view and looked to have had some work done recently (definitely not as outdated as some other hotels in the same price range). Free wifi and breakfast. The breakfast was basic, but since it's free who's going to complain. While the rooms were good, sadly the restaurant was not. I tried a cocktail which I ended up not being able to drink. Great happy hour though, so if you're looking to drink a lot for cheap, you probably won't mind. I would stay here again.Stayed June 2013 for 5 nights with a friend.

It was good for a cheap waikiki option. The location is great. The rooms were ok. We had a plumbing issue, but that was fixed (the second time we asked). The pool was nice. I might stay there again if I was on a budget, but would prob just fork out the cash for something a bit nicer..

We stayed here for 8 nights in Oct 2014. Rates were cheap and cheap is what we got! Location is fine for access to beach, shopping, restaurants etc. Overlooking the canal and the mountains was quite pleasant, we were a short easy walk (5-10mins), on flat ground, from the beach. We were only a short stroll to catch a trolley to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, you can pay on board ($2) the (Pink Line) trolley. Just don't ask the lady at the hotel (on the tour desk), for a trolley map, she refused to give us one unless we purchased our tickets from her. The maps are available free on board the trolleys and from most hotels and various locations in Waikiki. The hotel advertises free breakfast, however, it wasn't free (it was approx. $12 p/p and not worth it), we found a great little breakfast at 'Cheeseburger', hash brown, two eggs, toast and coffee for $6.The room was EXTREMELY compact, two double beds (2 adults, 1 child) and no room to swing a cat. The pool was quite a nice area and pleasant enough to relax with a cool drink, as was the bar. Laundry facilities are available to do your own washing/drying on level 2 ($2 washer, $1.50 dryer). There are two lifts available, both of which broke while we were there (thankfully, not at the same time), however it did take a while, with only one lift operating, we were on level 12. The hotel is very dated and in need of an overhaul. If you are on a budget, (ours was approx $129 per/night), then this hotel is adequate, if you can afford to spend a bit more to go elsewhere, do it!

Sand villa ended up being the best choice for our comfort and price point. I was a bit apprehensive about location being further than beach facing resorts, but the walk was brief and quite enjoyable lined with small shops and tropical plants, whereas a big resort would probably make us walk the same distance through it anyway. Also the food store and bus stops are only block away, so very convenient location for a budget (for Waikiki) price. I booked the reservation on hotel personal website, so that way I got the early-bird discount and also got the shuttle to and from airport for free. The size and the room décor were very comfortable with very functional lighting options. The mini refrigerator was quite big with a freezer and a vegetable tray – very useful for longer stays. The table is a good size for two people to have a meal inside, but we did wish for a second chair (seating on the bed is not very comfortable). The hotel’s restaurant offers buffet breakfast, but we did not try it (the $12 is quite pricey for my budget), but I used the coupons (given at check-in) for a couple of dinners (the food was ok). The staff was always friendly and willing to be helpful. The room was cleaned daily. The beach towels “rental” was very convenient, as well as hospitality room with computers, MW and the showers (for late check-out option). I had to leave AC on during the night since it was too hot to open the balcony doors (also I could smell tobacco from the lower levels). The shower head and the mattress were good (for me), but I brought my own soap bar, since they only offer liquids (dispensers attached to the wall). Overall I consider this hotel to be the best in comfort level that I’ve been to for the last few years, so MAHALO!

Very good place with the fair price and location! We stayed for 6 days with average price about 80$ per night with BB. Nice room. Actually who need the room at Hawaii??? Just a place for sleep in 10 min walking distance from Waikiki beach! Excellent! Definitely recommended for tourists!

I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is a good hotel for the money. I could have had a room for $99 a night but decided to splurge for a larger corner room with wrap-around deck and view of the canal and golf course for $129 a night. The room was clean and had air conditioning. The location was about 2 blocks from the beach. We could walk one block and catch the bus. We arrived around 1pm and our room was ready which was nice. We had one dinner in the restaurant. It was OK. We also had the buffet breakfast. It was pretty basic....fruit, eggs, French toast, sausage, toast, sweet rolls, etc. I thought it was a little expensive $12 for what you got. This is a good basic hotel. If you want a clean place at a reasonable price I would recommend this hotel.

The rooms of the hotel are a bit outdated but they where very clean. Staff of the hotel was very professional and helpfull. The location of the hotel was excelent. Takes about 10 minute walk to reach the beach. All and all an excelent hotel to stay on Waikiki.

Great affordable hotel!I got the corner room direct from the hotel website with advance discount.Location is a walk from waikiki but away from the noise!Walking distance to grocery store ( food pantry) and plenty of abc stores. The beds are awesome! Slept like a baby . The service is great. Everyone was eager and happy to help.The restaurant /bar serves until 4am!!! Get the sizzling steak! Overall. Since your reading this your probably visiting waikiki soon . This hotel would fit you if your budget is around 120-140 a night and want the aloha experience .

The hotel is very good! The room has adequate space, comfortable beds, TV with many channels available and the bathroom features intelligent toilet seat. The hotel has a swimming pool and parking. Is located close to many shops, pharmacies, markets, and trade in general. The service is very good, with attentive and helpful professionals. At the reception there is a travel agency for tours on the island. This is very good!

Reasonably priced budget hotel, it has everything that average traveller needs. Clean, quite big rooms, a short walk to main Honolulu attractions and professional friendly personell. Had some misunderstandings with hotel staff, but everything was solved quickly and with sheer professionalism.

google "streetnaked"A very good budget hotel. Customer service is excellent and very accommodating, always willing to fulfil your every needs. Rooms are clean and well maintained, the cleaners are extremely friendly and are happy to assist when necessary. Extremely comfortable beds and pillows. Breakfast was ok, however there could have been a larger selection of hot food for the price.

Room size and description was perfect. Close to the beach, beautiful view from my room. Helpful with tourist attractions and directions. The buffet at the hotel was horrible. Did breakfast and went out to eat afterwards. That was the only downside to the hotel.

BEWARE: this website shows a free continental breakfast, but was informed when waiter gave use our breakfast bill that they stopped free breakfast at beginning of year. Rooms are ok, small, nothing fancy. Good location to beaches and attractions.

A very good budget hotel. Customer service is excellent and very accommodating, always willing to fulfil your every needs.Rooms are clean and well maintained, the cleaners are extremely friendly and are happy to assist when necessary. Extremely comfortable beds and pillows. Breakfast was ok, however there could have been a larger selection of hot food for the price, for example, beans, bacon.  Short walk to the beach and to the centre.

This hotel is great. The customer service here is amazing, and the employees working at the front desk speak perfect English. They were very thorough in explaining everything and did everything they can to help accommodate us. Will definitely come back to this hotel! The location is great because it's about 5-10 minutes walking distance to the beautiful Waikiki beach. The rooms are very clean and spacious, which is very important to me. The staff are all very friendly, and it's just a lovely place to stay at. Not to mention they offer valet parking for a very affordable and reasonable price. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Pros: Budget friendlyMini-fridge in roomShort walk to Waikiki BeachLaminate floorsDecent room size Quick valetAir conditioned roomsConsWe were on 4th floor - lots of street noise.OldLack of quality bath amenities (budget)Extremely firm and uncomfortable bedsHorrible service in bar (I had to go find a menu - and then we waited without anyone even acknowledging us for over 15 minutes - they were not busy - so we left).

If your visiting Honolulu, this is the best hotel to stay. I was there in 2008 and 2013. The rooms were clean, the bar and restaurant in the evening very good. You can meet a lot of locals there.If you have a car, you have only valet parking so plan in the extra costs. Waikiki Beach isn't far away (5 - 10 min. on foot). You have an ABC-Store on the next corner and a Denny's isn't far away.I'm planning on returning again in November.

First trip to Hawaii, and accommodation selected by a member of our group, based on a previous stay. Was a great choice. Rooms were generous in size, clean and tidy. I had two queen size beds in my room so lots of space for me and to spread out my shopping purchases. Staff very friendly. Great restaurant with standard menu and drinks. Not 5 star, but not needed. A reasonable meal and good selection of drinks is all we were after, after a day out on the beach or at the shops. Centrally located so within walking distance to both. Made good use of the free wi-fi. Big plus! They also have a laundromat available which was very helpful.Best of all, it is very reasonably priced, and you get a discount for returning, which we did before and after our cruise. Would stay again.

We stayed here for five nights from June 30 - July 5th this year. We wanted somewhere that wasn't going to cost an arm and a leg but be close enough for us to walk around Waikiki. We didn't know what to expect on arrival but were pleasantly surprised. We had opted to stay in one of their villas at the back of the hotel beside the pool. Dbl/dbl with a kitchenette, spacious with a couch too. We were on the second level and had a nice view of the pool. However underneath our room - which we would have appreciated someone telling us, was a bar open from 6 til 2 am. This can get LOUD! I made a complaint the first night. The room was clean and everyday after house keeping were great. The pool was a great draw for us since we are traveling with our three year old, however in saying that the pool isn't very deep - if my memory serves me well it was only 5ft at its deepest, so not so great for us. Since we had a kitchenette we only had breakfast in the hotel once, and we didn't rate it highly, but there are plenty of other options close by. There is only valet parking, no other options, most of the time they are quick and friendly but there was times when they were very slow, you feel like you need to rush in and out of your car too as it is only a single lane driveway. Within walking distance there was a little market with heaps of local fresh fruit and home baked food, very delicious! There was also a restaurant down one block that did an all you can eat buffet dinner with a show for a very reasonable price! Reception were very friendly and helpful but the lady at the tour desk when i called and asked about 4th of July fireworks could tell me nothing.The hotel is undergoing renovations in the lobby which was a bit messy but it has already enhanced the entry of the hotel greatly. We would most likely stay here again because of the location, size of the room and price.

This is the second time I visited and stayed at this hotel.The staff are friendly and helpful. They helped me with getting back to the airport and organized a shuttle and were happy to organize a taxi when the shuttle was running late and then cancel that for me when the shuttle arrived.I used my discount voucher for return stay.I had a corner room with a good view and all that I needed - it wasn't poky but gave me a good amount of room and free wifi.It was in walking distance from everything I wanted to see and to the trolley stop.I would definitely return here on my next visit.

Usually stay at one of the hotels on or across the road from the beach but decided to try this one. Very good. Clean, quiet, friendly staff and only about a 5 min walk to the beach. Has a great big pool and spa in a very quiet leafy surround. There were works being done to the restaurant down on the ground floor but it did not impact us in any way with noise or dust etc. Will look great when finished. So a good stay in a good location that is worth the savings.

I found the sand villa a great place to stay they have and awesome computer room where you can stay after your trip is over to wait until your flight home it is also equipped with showers and washrooms and tv with cable for you wait dining area and bar is excellent the staff are all very helpful we have been there the last 3 years in a row rooms are very clean and there are many people that are regulars there every year met a lot of great friends the pool area is excellent and they also have a foot spa all kept very clean also a hot tub all near the pool great place looking forward to going back in febuary for another15 days

We have stayed at the Sand Villa twice over the last 2 years April 13 & March 14. It may not have beach views but it has fabulous views of the river & mountains. The rooms are always clean & the property is very well looked after. They have a bar which has Happy Hour everyday. You will meet some interesting locals who will give you some local knowledge. We will always stay here when in Honolulu!
