Stayed at the hotel for for 46 days. The rooms and the hotel was very clean. Great location, close to everything. Staff members, specially the security guard were friendly. Will definitely stay again.

Enjoyed our stay here and will go back again, room lovely with a nice view from our balcony, staff friendly, hotel clean, close to the main shopping areas and the beach, will stay here again when we go back to hawaii.

As a working 19 year old with a limited budged, this hotel was a great choice! We spent 9 days in this hotel and we loved it. I think the most important thing to say is that - it's very close to the beach. Beach is just few minutes away, the neighborhood is nice and safe. People are friendly and nice, food is amazing, overall this was a great choice. One thing you have to keep in mind is that breakfast is not "too generous" . A juice, little fruit, toast and butter. You'll probably be hungry very soon. There's a really good free wi-fi, rooms are nice and clean, pool is a decent size. When I come back to Hawaii, I will most likely stay in this hotel again.

We stayed at the Waikiki Sand Vila for two nights in March, thanks to a tip from a friend. Our room was great - we got a free upgrade to an eighth-floor corner room with a nice little balcony. The view of the mountains was lovely, and we were far enough above Ala Wai Blvd. that traffic noise wasn't an issue.We were within easy walking distance of the beach, restaurants, and anything else we wanted to do. I would happily stay here again.

With a student at University of Hawaii, we are always looking for affordable hotels in Honolulu. I think we've finally found it. Wood floors, a Japanese-style Toto toilet, refrigerator and comfortable beds. The hotel is in the process of updating the lobby and rooms. Our room was modern and clean. With a beautiful view of the Ala Wai and a partial view of the ocean, you can't beat the location. The pool and hot tub is nicely landscaped and very charming. It's a 2 block walk to the beach which passes right by the ABC store to get your morning coffee or your evening bottle of wine and snack. It's not fancy but it has all the elements for a comfortable and pleasing stay in Paradise.

Waikiki Sand Villa is really the perfect place to stay. Walking distance to the beach, great shops, great food. The valet parking is very convenient. It's very affordable compared to so many of the other choices there and it's not like we're there for the rooms anyway, right?? Very nice staff, helpful and friendly. We will be back!

I stayed there for two nights in January on my way to another island and it was my fourth stay in this hotel. Location of Sand Villa is simply perfect; walking distance everywhere (the beach, trolleys/bus stops,. Front desk and maid service was very helpful. Rooms on higher floors are quieter. My room was facing (partially) canal (great for sunrise) and the ocean. In my opinion, for those who are on a budget it is a great hotel.Book a room directly from their website for better price and free shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel and back on the day of your departure. While booking be detailed with what kind of room do you want (some rooms were recently renovated). I will stay there again and highly recommend Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel to anyone.

We stayed at the Sand Villa in 2012 and enjoyed our stay, and received a 10% off coupon for our return visit. This time, instead of staying in the tower we chose to stay in the villa (with a kitchen). We were there for 9 nights - and for 10 days we felt like this really was our home. We have a 3 and 5 year old, and I'm 6 months pregnant, so we needed the space and the villa studio suites provided us with that along with the great poolside location (which we didn't seem to use at all when we stayed in the towers strangely enough!). I'll try to keep things simple and tell you the good.Pros: - spacious room- great friendly staff, especially front desk for being so accommodating with our stroller storage (no elevators in the villa with their 2/3 floor studios).- relaxing pool and hot tub environment, with tables so you can dine outside with take out or your own cooked meal if you feel like having a night in- very affordable compared to other hotels with the same features (kitchen)- central location to all the shops and bus routes (Kuhio Ave), and only 3 blocks up from the beach. - just a comfortable stay after long days out and in the sun (the couch was always nice to just sit on - speaking as a very pregnant lady)The Cons (not that these are a huge deal, and certainly we would not make a huge stink over):- being on the 2nd floor, the 3rd floor above us would wake up at 6am to what would seem like rearranging their furniture. We told the front desk that they could probably solve all the noise by putting padding on the table and chair legs so that could reduce any of the noise- all the cutlery and kitchen basics were not consistent between rooms (i had a cutting board, 2 forks, 3 bowls... etc, while our friends had a spatula, no cutting board.) I'm sure if I told front desk about this they would resolve it, but because we had friends in another studio we would just borrow from each other for the meals we needed those items for. All in all we really enjoyed our stay here, it's not a Hilton or Embassy Suite, but if you're a family on a budget and want something comfortable, I would highly recommend checking out a studio suite at the Waikiki Sand Villa. We do a lot of traveling as a family, and this was one of the few times that we were really sad to have to leave - and a lot of it had to do with the fact that the Villa felt like a home for us.

You can walk from here to Waikiki Beach and the International Market Place, very convenient, drive up to the hotel, hop out of the car, reception is right there, elevators just to the right up to the room! To the right of that (the lifts that is) is the Sand Villa bar and grill, great value food! Don't have to walk miles to reception or the room. Rooms are not flash, but clean. If you're on the upper levels, great views over the Ala Wai Canal. If you arrive early, they have a room you can freshen up in with showers. Or if you're leaving late, you can check out, leave your bags at reception, head out for that last minute walk along Waikiki, and when you get back you can use the same room to freshen up before heading to the airport. Can't go wrong! Loved it!

the staff was quite helpful in answering all my questions. Away from the main drag and 3 blocks from the beach. The Food Pantry is close by if you should need groceries. The rooms are clean and the maid service great. The hotel is eco-friendly with recycling bins and hand dispensers in the shower and over the wash basin . The pool is quite nice and relaxing with palm trees and a jacuzzi to rest your body from all the shopping . Nice view of the canal and the mountains . Would stay if I were to go back Next Year

A lovely place to stay, Great walking distance to everything in waikikiLovely room, sure it might need a little love to walls but its clean and king size bed was brilliant. A wonderful view on the 12th floor, room cleaned Daily, free towel hire. Lovely people at reception and great value for money. Because I booked on their website we got a free shuttle from airport to hotel and then back again, will be back for sure

Spent 4 nights at this hotel and enjoyed everything. Great location and couldn't beat the price. It's not the Hilton but it is a great value. It is only 5 minutes from the beach, restaurants and shops. They were very accommodating. The 3rd floor is a smoking floor which was great for us. The only drawback is it is on the same street as the fire station so we did hear sirens at different times of the day and night but not very often. I believe if you were on a higher floor that would not be an issue.We spent 3 night at a different hotel on the beach and paid twice as much and the room was half the size.

Hotel is located near to waikiki beach.. nice view of lake and golf courts from room.. clean room and big.. good staff.. big pool.. jacuzzi was great.. Rules and procedures of this hotel is bad.. u cant smoke in balcony.. but u can smoke in 2 nd floor rooms.. but nancy the manger was explained the situation and I finally gave up smoking :(.. but she was helpful on changing the room to 2nd floor if required. .I don wanna give up view..so I stayed back in 8 floor..The other procedure I didn like was filling a form for using the fitness center. . I nvr seen this process before in any hotel..Good things abt hotel was staff.. they r really friendly.. house keeping is really good.. hotel is really located in 0.3 miles to beach.. sand bar is a happening place..I would go to this hotel again if at all I am gonna give up on smoking :) caz I don wanna stay on 2nd floor..Non smokers this is a best a place u can go for.. Rates are considerably cheap if u book in well advance. .

I love this place! Its reasonable, the rooms are nice and up to date, the staff is super friendly, the restaurant / bar is yummy and most importantly...........its 2 blocks from the beach!. Love it! Love It! Love It!

I have been to Hawaii many times and the last two times I have spent 1 week each time at the Waikiki Sand Villa. The first time I stayed here I stayed one night in every class of room to get a feel for what I wanted. To me the best value is the corner room with a view of the Golf Course and Diamond Head. For the price you will not find anything better in Waikiki. Everywhere in Waikiki has crazy parking fees as of late and everyone has also jumped on the band wagon with huge amenity fees, which really don't add anything to your trip but an additional expense. WSV doesn't have amenity fees, which is great and a little trick about the parking....book your room directly with their website and parking is 1/2 off making it just10 bucks a night. Seriously it will be money well saved that you can spend at the bar! Location is very good for walking to the beach or to all of the shopping areas. Great noodle shop near by is Mira Ka Me Udon...Cheap and delicious and a must. Staff was always very friendly and valet is prompt. Rooms are not luxurious, but very clean and perfect since you will be at the beach most the time anyway. This hotel offers value to someone who wants to get out and do things but isn't so much interested in 500 Thread Count Egyptian Cotton pillow cases and sheets. If you want that type of service you will need the Hilton. I will always come back here ....they give you a bonus 10%off coupon for your next stay when you check in. Hang onto it and that is just one more reason to come back! Highly Recommended.

Great location, walking distance to the beach, hotel is clean and the staff is very nice. The price is very good for the location and accomodation is quite perfect. Laundry room available for guest and other facilities which make this hotel a great bargain during the high season.

The room had a good size, was clean and the staff was very (!) friendly and helpful. The bathroom is not fancy (exception: very high-tech toilets) but functional. The balcony gives enough space to sit a party of 2 and the fridge, A/C, WIFI etc. worked all the time. I booked a smoking room but due to a mix up got a smoke-free room the first night. The misunderstanding was handled very professionally.The pool area is kept clean and offers a few spots to relax or sit but I would not spend the day there (and why should you with the beach so close).The breakfast includes a few slices of toast and a Mini-Croissant with butter and jam, canned fruits and coffee/tea. Also, the breakfast area is quite crowded (and loud) but you are free to take your food up to the room. All in all not worth getting up. I also used the laundry and the computer room. Both are ok if you need a quick solution.Be aware, that you cannot use the stairs to reach or go from the lobby and the 2 elevators are sometimes quite busy (especially around breakfast time) so you'll have to wait a while.The hotel is not directly at the beach, but you reach all important spots in a few minutes’ walk.All in all: the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel is not fancy / special but you get a good value for the price, very helpful staff members and you stay in a good location.

Good location, nice view, nice staff and decent facilities. Free airport transfers is a definite plus. Don't expect too much from the complimentary breakfast, just fill up on toast and pineapple. Excellent value for money.

Our experience started with the free pick-up at the airport; it was right on time although our flight had been delayed 6 hours. The check-in staff were friendly. The hotel has a certain "60s" feel to it which is kind of charming. The property is tidy throughout. Our room was clean with a nice view. The pool was adequate (enjoyed the jacuzzi). The restaurant, bar, and concierge staff were consistently friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned everyday to a high standard, and we enjoyed the novelty of the Japanese style toilet. There was a storm one night and the sliding glass doors onto the balcony rattled a lot. The location was superb; it was just a short walk to the centre of Waikiki Beach and bus stops. The hotel seemed to attract laid-back, loyal return customers which we enjoyed. The free wireless internet worked perfectly. Finally the free shuttle back to the airport was again spot on time. It is far from the fanciest property in Waikiki but if you are looking for a comfortable stay that offers great value for money I highly recommend this hotel.

you want convenience good price and friendly staff this is it, minutes from beach a decent walk to ala Moana, quiet and we have stayed here before will stay again, no frills the beds are clean maids are good ok one complaint lol,,,the weather was kinda blah,,first time in january 75 degrees just crazy windy and some rain oh and free wi fi is a bonus too

They no longer have a free buffet breakfast of foot spa but it is nice. Good Bar and great food at a good price. I will be back. It is a few blocks from the beach but it is not a bad drive. Enjoyed the stay

The Waikiki Sand Villa offers good rates particularly if you book at their internet site. Based on the rate you can expect okay but not great and this is what you get. The hotel is a few blocks back from the beach but not so far that it is a chore to walk there and the main shopping area is equally close. I had anticipated that for the price the place would be a lot less accessible so the location was a pleasant surprise. There is a spacious open lobby and the reception staff were pleasant and helpful. My room was on the 6th floor and had 2 double beds which was overkill for 1 person. Fewer beds and more open space would have been welcome. With a very large unit that held the TV, fridge and storage space and a desk and chair, there was very little free floor space. The room had a fairly large balcony which helped a bit. There was a coffee maker but only the first filter pack is free. Any additional packs cost $1 each at the front desk which seemed reasonable. The bathroom was small but clean and the towels were replaced each day. The toilet had one of those weird multi-function Japanese seats with a control panel and far too many options. A heated toilet seat seemed a little too much in tropical Hawaii and I opted to turn it off. There was free in-room wifi that worked well until a power cut one night which did enough damage to the system to have it down overnight and part of the next morning. These things happen and it was clearly not the hotel's fault. They had a service person there most of the night and again the next morning trying to sort it out - and eventually he did.The lobby restaurant has a buffet breakfast which costs about $12. It is similar to the free breakfasts that you get in many US 2nd tier chain hotels and you are better off eating elsewhere. A couple of times I walked to Cheeseburger Waikiki which is a fair hike away (maybe 30 minutes) but worth it for the good breakfast food and the lovely, motherly waitresses. I had dinner at the bar in the lobby restaurant one night and it was significantly better than the breakfast.Overall, the Waikiki Sand Villa provides a level of service and facilities that is probably a bit above what you should expect for the very reasonable tariff. If you go there with suitable expectations you won't be disappointed.
user_name:
Jane E
New York City, New York

review_body: Not a bad place still having a number of apparent drawbacks:1. Our room was very basic and pretty tired. In particular, one of the balcony doors didn't operate properly sticking all the time.2. Due to the location, it's permanently windy on the balcony, and you feel very uncomfortable there. 3. Worst included breakfast I've ever seen. Bread, butter, jam - nothing more.Long story short: it's OK for one-two-three night stay, but, should you decide to spend in Honolulu a significant period of time, I would definitely recommend to opt for something different.

What a sad, soulless establishment this is. We stayed here in early August 2013, after staying at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki and then going on a cruise around the islands, and we were very happy that we only booked it for one night before we flew back home. It was about $120 for the night; the White Sands was about $150 and I thought from the reviews that this would be a good option to save us a bit of money, but in the end I wish we would have just stuck with the White Sands.I think we got the "Premium" room. Our view was a bit of the Ala Wai canal and mostly the run-down street that the hotel is on and the wall on each side of our balcony. I suppose if you get the rooms that face the canal it would be nicer. I did ask for a room with a view of the canal, but again, it was mostly a view of a wall. Bathroom was filthy. Slept on top of the sheets for fear of finding something worse in the bed.The location is alright, close to Waikiki Beach. I suppose the pool area looks nice, and there is a jacuzzi as well, but we saw dead roaches on the ground when we were leaving the pool. Staff was neither friendly nor helpful. I noticed they were more friendly and helpful to the Japanese tourists staying there. Sorry that we weren't Japanese, and for having standards.Much better for anyone who does have standards to stay at a place like the White Sands Hotel, very warm friendly atmosphere there, unlike the cold businesslike feel here. A disgrace to all of Hawaii.

We checked into this hotel and hadn't been in our room for five minutes when we saw our first roach. We were fortunate enough that there was another room available that we were transferred to.There was one pouch of coffee in our room the first night and the following day the housekeeper didn't leave any coffee. So I went down to to the front desk to ask for coffee and was told that they only supply one pack of coffee on your first night of stay. other than that we were supposed to buy packages of coffee from them for the rest of our stay if we wanted coffee.We were given breakfast vouchers for a light breakfast that consisted of toast, coffee or tea, canned pineapple, and a glass of juice. anything more than this was expected to be paid for. Since then, they have stopped serving their "light breakfast" completely.

We stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa for 10 nights, and thought it was excellent value for money!, the service was also brilliant from all the staff there; including the cleaning staff, who would come and service our room each and every day without fail, and I must add, they did a brilliant job too!We will definitely be staying here again on our next trip to Honolulu, as we could not fault the service here - absolutely loved our stay, and have also recommended Waikiki Sand Villa to our friends and family!
user_name:
Allison R
Waitakere City, New Zealand

review_body: Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel is a perfect place for a traveler who is on a budget and do not mind being couple blocks off the main promenade. Hotel and the room were very clean and decent with basic amenities. Continental breakfast was included in my packet but I would not pay extra for it. The room had an amazing view of Diamond Head and Ala Wai Golf Course which made my stay even more enjoyable. The Waikiki Beach is 5 minutes walk from the hotel, bunch of food places and markets with local stuff around. I strongly recommend staying at Sand Villa Hotel. Very good service for even better price!

The sandvilla hotel is a beautiful, clean establishment, and the staff were nice and helpful. I stayed in one of the suits upstairs, and was informed by the hotel staff it was used to film a scene for hawaii five-0.

We had no hot water around 10 pm, so we couldn't take a shower at all. The front desk or web site didn't notify about limitation of hot water, which I think it is ridiculous! When my husband complained to the front desk, they just said "go to pool area to take a shower with hot water" and "ran out of hot water." We are tourists, and came back from tours often late. BUT we couldn't take a shower!

Stayed 10 days in November 2013. Staff friendly, rooms and amenities acceptable but real advantage here is price. Walk to beach and popular restaurants everyday a bit of a pain but I have been spoilt staying in beach front hotels last 4 visits, but this strip was on a budget.

We've stayed three times at this hotel. The location is perfect, just 5 min walk to the beach. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel needs some renovations to be done but is very clean. They offer a very simple complimentary breakfast but is very very convenient to take a bite before heading outside. Beach towels are provided daily. If you book your stay through a hotel website they can arrange a free round shuttle ride from the airport (contact them via e-mail).

We spent 4 nights here at the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel, in a 'premium corner city view' room no. 1111. At US$110 per night, it was good value for somewhere within a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach and booking through the hotel website gave half price valet car parking (US$10.50 per day instead of US$21). The hotel only provides valet parking, but you could try for on-street parking nearby.The room was showing signs of wear and tear, but otherwise clean. The door to the small balcony was difficult to open and required quite a bit of force. A good size fridge in the room, meant we could buy supplies from the nearby ABC Store and keep in the refrigerator. The musical toilet seat is really unnecessary, but can be unplugged from the wall. My only real complaint with the room, was the lack of air conditioning, which always seemed to struggle and couldn't cool the room to a comfortable temperature. We found the hotel staff were always friendly and helpful when needed.The free breakfast offered by the hotel, is just toast with butter. The $5 breakfast offers a little more with rice or potato, bacon or sausages and scrambled egg on a plastic plate.

As we were by car, parking availability was important. The location is very good, with a short walk you have access to Waikiki Beach. Room clean and with views of the canal. Air conditioning working well and silently. Considered a good option for the money. Surely we would be in this hotel again on another occasion.

Booked in this hotel to stay for a week. Totally would not stay here again. There is an apartment block next door, where people climb out windows and sleep in the drive way, but there is a security gard outside at night fall... not safe. The rooms are budget. If you have a noisy neighbour, they dont listen to the 10pm quiet time, which is annoying. DO NOT used the lady at the desk to book outings.... Our last full day activity was cancelled, and we had NO notification at all.

My grandson & I stayed here for 9 nights. We were really happy with everything!  We were pleased with our entire stay.The staff is really nice & helpful.  We had a great view of the canal & we could walk almost anywhere in Waikiki. Breakfast isn't much but holds you over & it's free . I walked to Starbucks for my coffee daily and enjoyed my morning stroll.The pool area is gorgeous and very private. My grandson had wifi So he was happy. I will definitely stay here & highly recommend Waikiki Sand Villa to others

I booked this hotel for 9 nights with my best friend ,on arrival we had a problem but ended up with a wonderful room and view of the Canal and partially of Diamond Head .The staff were just wonderful, thanks to Kila one of the staff.The pool and location were awesome .This hotel is very busy with alot of guest from China and Japan so the lobby is always crowded .Love the bathroom with the warm seat ,housekeeping could do a little better on cleaning but the room was decent ,the beds were a bit soft ,i like a firm bed .Breakfast was a joke toast sliced bread butter ,jams watered down juice and tea ,coffee every morning i had to eat out each morning after that.This hotel is in walking distance to the beach ,stores , shopping in the Waikiki area plus the Canal is great for walking .Despite the things i didn't like i would stay there again .We enjoyed our time at the Waikiki Sand Villa .

We were looking for a hotel with a pool (I know, the beach is close but you can't always be at the beach!), balcony, wifi, and fridge. This hotel kept coming out on top of the list. The best prices were on their own website. They furnish towels for the pool and beach, so we didn't have to pack beach towels (I emailed to ask ahead of time). They have a 'hospitality' floor which, for us, meant a place to hang out when we had to check out hours before our flight (late evening flight). This room had sofas, massage chairs, books, computers, full bathrooms with shower (you could actually spend the day at the beach or pool, then shower before your flight.)  Sure, the breakfast was skimpy, but it was FREE - if you want more, just go to an ABC store and buy a few extras and bring them back to have with your toast and coffee. Very helpful front desk staff. All in all, we were happy with the hotel.

I've reviewed this hotel before, & although its a lot older than when we first stayed - so are we!Its still the local waterhole to meet the natives & ex pats, but there are now a lot more Australian & Chinese guests. Rooms on the top 6 floors have great views, & the hotel has a fantastic pool.Only 3 short blocks to Waikiki beach & 1 block to Kings Square, the position is hard to beat.The bar has Happy Hour from 4-8pm & great bar snacks.Breakfast is minimalist but hey! at these prices who'd complain.

I stayed at this hotel with my husband during 6 nights from Sep 29th through Oct 5th 2013. Although the bed was good , the hotel is very dirty. The breakfast is horrible! They control the number of toasts you eat ( maximum of 4 per person). There were birds and we found one cockroach at the breakfast area one day. The name of the juice at the machine was hand-written in a small piece of paper and there were towels behind the coffe machine to hold the spilled coffee! Disgusting! We asked for a car to place our lugagge and there was not available. There was only one for the entire hotel! The carpet on the corridors were ugly and dirty! They only treat well the japanese, chinese and koreans! We, as brazilians, felt that they did not really care about us. We will never stay there again. We do not recommend the hotel, specially if you are american!

This hotel is great for the price - staff friendly, rooms clean and good situation. We have stayed several times and always come away happy with our experience. The pool area is superb for relaxing, the rooms are of reasonable size (we don't spend much time in there). Restaurant and bar - great staff and food. Overall we enjoy our time here and feel that it suits our needs

we had a clean room, staff was warm and friendly. Parking-service was excellent. Breakfast was limited to 2,3or 4 toast with one (1) small plastic cup of butter and one cup of marmelade.Swimming pool was ok but very small and no privacy.

For the money, this was one of the better deals we could find to get us out of the hostel. I feel like we lucked out with a room on the top floor, but the beds are comfy, the service was great, and the room is in good condition. (the bathroom had a little bubbly paint but nothing nasty)It's a perfect location. The down sides, parking. It's expensive. We ended up getting a spot on Ala Wai next to the canal (which is free) and just hoofed it. I feel like the hotel could up its price and offer free parking rather than making it a separate charge, then people feel like they're getting a deal. Also the "breakfast" is something we took advantage of only one day. You get a cup of pineapple and your choice of 1, 2, 3, or 4 slices of toast..I do wish the ac would have worked better, they did maintainence during our stay and turned it off, so our room got HOT, interrupting our sleep. The elevator also seemed to break a lot for a 4 night stay.

Considering it's in Waikiki, this hotel is a good value for the price. Spacious rooms with a small balcony. Appreciated that there was a mini fridge in the room as well. Breakfast consisted of toast and canned pineapple so we ended up just skipping it most days. If you need a break from the beach crowds, the pool at the hotel is very nice and wasn't crowded any of the time we were there. Excellent location, easy walk to all the action. We had a rental car and were able to find free street parking within a couple blocks every night. Would (and probably will) stay again.

For travellers not wanting to spend a whole lot on hotel prices, this is a good choice for the Waikiki area. We stayed here for over a week. While the room is not spectacular, it’s pretty amazing that the following was included in the price:-Round-trip shuttle transportation to and from the airport.-Light breakfast every morning, with coffee.-Room with a balcony, and with a good view. -Beach towel service. -Location: while not on the beach, you only a couple of blocks away from one of the most famous beaches in the world. Also, it is right next to the canal, which is a nice view from the balcony. I believe there are early-bird specials for booking early on-line.  For those looking to save on activities/sights, do check out Groupon Honolulu in the weeks leading to your vacation. I’ve never seen so many great Groupon options before on a vacation destination!

Great location only a block or two away from all the stores and restaurants and a few minutes walk to Waikiki beach. The rooms and bathrooms are a little older but clean and functional. The views from the balconies are great. The hotel, valet and bar service was excellent. The only complaint is that it gets very crowded during free breakfast time, and I personally wouldn't recommend to eat breakfast there.

This hotel is a great deal. It's clean and affordable, and in a great location. The rooms are a good size and have balconies with views. The bathrooms are tired but are being remodeled (up to floor six when we visited). The housekeeping was good and timely, and there are fine laundry facilities available. It's in a good location on the canal and only one block from the bus and trolley line, four blocks to the beach, and within walking distance to a myriad of restaurants. But the best thing about this hotel is definitely the pool.

This hotel was excellent value for money. Good size room with two double beds, a bath and shower and a balcony overlooking the Ala Wai canal and golf course, with views of Diamond Head.Hotel had its own pool and restaurant. Short walk to shops and Waikiki beach. Staff were cheery and helpful at all times. Room servicing was carried out daily. Continental breakfast included in tariff. Close to public transport. Able to get good tariff rate and book on-line. Free return bus to airport if staying more than four days.

Our stay here was a pleasure and so relaxing. The staff was amazing and were always ready willing and able to help with any concern or question. We also enjoyed the pool and the restaurant. The valet service was convenient and our entire group of 40 people were all very satisfied and we cant wait to go back again next summer. We were pleasantly surprised with the entire hotel and area the price was very reasonable and within walking distance to shopping,restaurants and the beach. Thank you Waikiki Sand Villa for making our vacation so lovely!!

I stayed in this hotel for 16 days and it was great for a basic hotel. Room is very clean with a sparking clean shower curtain and bath tub. Don't expect a fancy hotel but this hotel is perfect for a basic stay. Breakfast is just bread and pineapples and some juice. Staff are extremely helpful and they have valet parking. 5 minutes walk to nearest ABC Store.

A good 'value for money paid' hotel. Loved the canal and mountain views from my room. Pool area is very pleasant. Loved the location; being on the edge of the 'tourist concrete jungle' rather than in the thick of it! Easy walking to anywhere in Waikiki.Was thrilled to be given a room on arrival before 10am after an all night flight, as advertised check in is at 3pm! Would stay here again. Didn't try the free breakfast although by all reviews I didn't miss much!

polite staff, clean rooms, good pool, good location, bar and bar food good. breakfast (complimentary) toast and jam, croissant, juice, pineapple chunks, tea & coffee. what do you want from a reasonly priced hotel. great 5 day stay. road noise seems to echo off of tall buildings but another beer put pay to that :)

In general, it is a good hotel. A budget option for Waikiki, but the service is not so good. Expect a lot of oriental tourists that are frequently not polite. I`ll leave some specific comments in this review, but I would stay there again despite the not so good facts of the place.Location: the best of the hotel, in 3 blocks you`ll be in Waikiki Beach. ABC store at the same block and fast food options are near. It is in front of Ala Wai Canal, a great place for walking or running. Room: spacious, with 2 twin beds (comfortable!). we had a room at the 6th floor and had great views to the Ala Wai Canal from our balcony (and we got the cheapest room!). About the service room, sometimes it was done just in the afternoon… But the room was clean and the towels were changed every day. Wi-fi is average, you have to digit the password every time you want to use on iPhone. Bathroom is big, shower is nice. Sleep quality was ok, we could hear the traffic from the avenue, but it was not something that disturbed us. There is a coffee maker at the room, but coffee it is not replaced (you have to ask the reception for more coffee and they charge you for it).Parking: there's no parking lot, but there's a valet. Forget about trying to park on the street: the spaces are always full, it's almost impossible to park in this area. We just rented a car because we prefer to make our own tours. Remember to book the valet at the check-in, they give you 50% discount. The problem is that the valet people are rude sometimes, and just give the keys to you get the car by yourself. The good part is that you save the tip when it happens. One time we had to get the car by ourselves and our car was blocked by an employee SUV. I just didn't complained with the staff about that because we didn't have any bookings for that day, but it was too bad. Breakfast: definitely, not ok, I recommend you to buy your on things and avoid the mess. You`ll have 2, 3 or 4 slices of toast with butter and strawberry jam, coffee and canned pineapple, just that. Long lines of people that don't speak english form before the beginning of the distribution (it starts at 6:30am) and there's just a few tables. I thought it could start at least 30 min earlier, since some pick up tours are early in the morning (for Pearl Harbor, for example).

My family stayed at the Sand Villa Hotel and found that value for money it was the best hotel in Waikiki. It is no 5 star property but is a good 3 to 4 and with prices a third of some of the other hotels, is worth every cent.It is an easy walk to everything Waikiki is famous for, with a bar and resturant that has meals and beers at great prices.If you are looking for a place to rest your weary legs after a long day in Hawaii, without breaking the budget, with everything you need from a hotel, than the Sand Villa is the place for you.

The room was OK and the hotel was rather full with no particular service. We had booked a trip from the airport with the hotel but we were only picked up after a good deal of conversation with the hotel. The breakfast was a joke, everything was handed out from behind a desk. The hotel had a good many japanese guests who never smiled and bumbed into us several times without excusing themselves, rather rude I must say. Waikki beach was on the other side of the island so we did not see much sand or beach, we had to walk 10 minutes to experience this. By walking there was much to see in the surroundings, it felt like we were on Manhattan or central Tokyo, with all the exclusive affairs and high prices. I cannot recommend this hotel, better to look elsewhere.

I just finished a Family Vacation There were a total of 5 people in our party. I chose this hotel because I was planning on spending more time outside of my room than in but still wanted everyone to have an actually bed to sleep in. I had looked at a few other options (condos, etc..) but for the cost per day to be a bit higher when compared to renting 2 adjoining rooms from this location. With some of the other reviews of this place I was a bit unsure when I travel with my family the key issue is how clean the room is. With that being said, the rooms we stayed in were on the 8th floor and, were clean and, in decent repair. There were a lot of signs that this place is older your typical mildew in the shower area, and a bit of mold on the celling. The same type of items you would expect to find in a low budget clean hotel. This to me was not a deal breaker, and could easily be over looked due to the age of the Hotel. One of the things I liked was the fact that our room had hardwood / Pergo type floors and they looked great. The beds were comfortable, 2 twin beds per room. The linins were clean and appeared to be well laundered. The cooling system for the room worked as long as the room key was in the switch. We only stayed on the 8th floor (took their buy early special) but the view was still nice. Of course that is assuming you’re not looking down. The apartments nearby are a real dump. The staffs at the hotel were good but a bit on the serious side. They do have a type of breakfast every morning, but you should not expect anything more than some toast and coffee/pineapple juice. I’m very serious do not book this place thinking they will feed you breakfast, they won’t. What they offer is more of a snack to get you going till you can have a real meal. This place really caters to the Asia tourist. Almost everything is multi language, when it comes to signs. They had a towel loner program so you could check a towel out and take it to the beach with you. The beach was well within walking distance. I walked there with my 2 children (ages 7 and 12) in about 5 min. If any couples have younger children rest assured knowing that the walk is short enough that there should not be a problem. So my overall take. If your comfortable staying in a budget hotel (think 15 year old days inn) Then you will have no problems what so ever in this place. If you are bothered by little things then you may want to look elsewhere. Now for some of the things I did not like about the hotel. The only parking is Valet and there were times I was stuck waiting for them to get my car. There is so much within walking distance to the hotel that I only had to pull it out when we were traveling around the island. If you book directly with the hotel they will give you a discount on parking, otherwise it is expensive. You can google their website for more info. If I were to go back to Oahu I would stay here again without hesitation.

but the place was surprising better than average but not quite good. rooms are a little tired, but who spends a lot of time in the room. wifi worked flawlessly and the room was clean. a little small but the lanai made up for it. the pool is big enuff to do laps in and voila they have a great hot tub. as a bonus there is a bar and restaurant in the place. hotel is in a great location close to everything, inexpensive, with a frig and a coffee maker.

Though overall I would not fully condemn the hotel, I will say this: I don't care where you are in the world, the price has to match the services. Our room smelled so bad - the bathroom smelled like missy pildew and we had to air it out for it to be tolerable. The fixtures had rust on them and the tile grouting was stained - not attractive. The free breakfast they offer is insulting- a few pieces of toast and a half cup of orange juice. The beds were decent. I'd shop around a bit more before thinking about staying here again.I wouldn't call the hotel a value for its price, but if you are just using the place as somewhere to stay overnight, you can probably overlook the hotel's lack of quality.

You pretty much can tell this hotel is old just from the elevator. The room is nothing to write home about. But since we needed just an overnight stay it was all right. The staff were very nice and accommodating. The owner really need to do some renovating. But we know that's not going to happen. The area is not great. Hookers do come out at night. Lots of traffic passing by. I enjoyed the late night bar. Bartender was very friendly. And for the time of night we arrived, the food was still great!

This hotel is fantastic for the price compared to many we looked at in Waikiki. The hotel itself is a bit dated but has everything you need if your not planning to spend all day sitting in your room! Nice pool area & heated spa were a bonus. The location is good. Very close to the main drag & beach. There is a tour desk in the reception with the most lovely & helpful lady who helped us book shows & tours. Breakfast is included & very basic. The only negative to comment on would be, because of the older style of the hotel, our balcony door didn't lock very well.. could be a security issue but these things are bound to pop up with an ageing building. We found there were a lot of middle age- older people staying here.. the general vibe was really casual & cruisey. Lots of people down at the bar at all times. Every one was friendly. Good holiday feel without the big price tag!

I was looking for an inexpensive hotel to store my luggage for a day so I didn't expect much. However, I thought the hotel was very good for the price. I have no idea what the other reviewer means by "paperless toilet". It had a normal bathroom. However, you did need to use your key to turn on the lights. The people who worked here were all very nice. The view out my window was poor since I looked over a neighboring apartment building. However, past that was a nice view of a lake. If I needed to save money, I'd stay at this hotel again. It was a short walk to the beach and right in the heart of all the other activities. My room had a twin bed and a full size bed. The room seemed dated, but clean. The room next to ours had two twin beds and a full size. This would be nice for a couple with two children. (They also have kitchenette rooms.) They also had a decent hospitality room that we were able to use before check-in. It had couches, computers, a woman's bathroom with shower, and men's bathroom with shower. This was handy for us since we just walked off a cruise ship. If you're looking for something fancy, this is not the place. However, if you're looking for a good value and a place to sleep, store your stuff, and shower while you explore Hawaii, then this might be an excellent place.
user_name:
Diane G
Toms River, New Jersey

review_body: just got back from Honolulu, stayed here suppose to be 5 night but ended up changing hotel due to harrasment from the Manager of the security.. I have a a visitor from my hotel.. dont know the policy of the hotel that u cant have visitor in your room..... He totally told me in that he can evict me and not to question him cause he was manager, to find out only manager of security and a valet who expect to have tips.. Im sorry but you are out of control.. he make me feel so uncomfortable during my stay everytime im in the lobby using the internet.. the internet inb the room is so slow , you have to go to the lobby to get a faster connection. This guyis the rudest person i met.. You work for customer service you should know better. I didnt get the name of the guy, Manager of the security. word of advice to you....we are the one thats why you have a job so be thankful.. respect the guest.. The management is aware who is this guy...Very Bad Experience....

This property needed to be updated badly Yet it still proved to be a nice and relaxing place! If you are a "Green" type of person this is a very energy saving hotel from the Key card being required to turn power on to the "paperless" toilet! The pool area was very relaxing and we ate our free toast and pineapple breakfast there in the mornings. As far as location it was a short walk to the beach or International market place. If you like early morning walks as we do you are right next to the Ali Wai canal and can walk its walk free of street crossing. Customer service was great as was the little Bar/ cafe onsite. We would return there again!

We were a little concerned about staying at this hotel at first because of only 2.5 "official" stars so were really impressed with their good service, clean and well-equipped rooms and amazing location (in the heart of Waikiki). I would easily give this hotel 3.5 stars and considering the price, it's a great deal for those who only sleep in the hotel and explore the rest of the time. We didnt really use the breakfast coupons but I think it's a great add-on - even if you just get the coffee to start your day off.

We stayed for a week in 2010 - forgot to give a review. Price was good for this average looking hotel. Room is average but carpet not so clean. Location is great! Walking distance to the restaurants, mall and Waikiki Beach.
user_name:
underwaterangel
New York City, New York

review_body: Since this was my first time in Honolulu and Hawaii, I relied heavily on past reviews of this hotel when making my decision to book. I gotta say that previous reviews were pretty much bang on. The hotel itself is definitely quite average compared to the mainland - nothing fancy and (relatively) decently priced.My room had some damage to the chest of drawers which definitely did not make a great first impression as to the upkeep of the hotel; but after the first day, I didn't even notice it. The room was pretty clean and housekeeping did a good job of keeping it that way my whole week there. The room did have a balcony which had a nice view of the canal. Also, I thought the air conditioner was a bit weak when I first got there but it was OK and did a good job of keeping the room cool.The location of the hotel more than made up for the average room. It was close to Waikiki beach and the main strip. I didn't rent a car and walked or took public transportation to go where I wanted. I will mention that I just stayed in Honolulu this entire trip but if you wanted to travel outside the main city, I saw many tour buses doing pickups in Waikiki to places outside the city, like the Polynesian Cultural Center for example.All in all, it was a great place to stay. I would stay here again if I was on a budget and/or traveling alone like I was for this particular trip.

Rooms are clean and relatively average - not so spacy if you are a family. The pool is nice but the breakfast is really cheap - pineapples from a can and toast with botter and jam. Drinks were: cooled pineapple juice from the can and black tea/coffee. They do inform you the breakfast is light, but not that it is lowes quality! Cheap yes - but really not very amusing for a person with gluten allergy (wheat allergy) not drinking either black tea or coffee. For breakfast they were unable to get me a banana or an apple, so all I had was pineapple from the can, which can be a little boring after three days.

There isn't much special about this hotel, but there isn't much to complain about either. The price to stay here is lower than most hotels that are located much further from the beach and other action. The hotel common areas and rooms are reasonably clean. The furnishings are older and modest.The staff were mainly friendly and helpful. The hotel has a good location. You can walk pretty much everywhere from there. If you like running, you can start along Ala Wai Blvd, which is great. Only two complaints:- get a room further from Ala Wai Blvd. if you want to avoid noise from that street on the weekday mornings. Otherwise the hotel area is quiet at night. - The breakfast is free, but not really worth getting if you enjoy a substantial breakfast. It is just toast, coffee and jam. If you don't like big breakfasts, then this won't be a problem for you. Overall, not bad, but nothing special.

Our view was looking towards the golf course from the 11th floor. Room was clean and nice, but the outside noise from the cars etc were not good for a quiet nights sleep. I feel the price was right for this hotel... Nice pool..breakfast consists of toast, croissant,juice and pineapple cubes along with coffee/tea. Rental cars are one block away

My husband and I grew to appreciate this budget hotel very much on our brief stay, one night prior to Kauai and two nights on the return before flying back to the main land. We will definitely consider staying here on our next Honolulu visit. It is a good value for the money and the location worked great for us. We could easily walk to the beach, restaurants and bus stops.We especially liked the vibes of the open air lobby, the fun and friendly bar serving good Micro brews and the Toto toilet with heated seat and more. Skip the Wiki Wiki breakfast and head to the corner coffee shop for excellent Hawaiian coffee and steel cut oatmeal. Ask for a room on a higher level floor that is not street side since those can be noisy. A nice discount is available for early reservations and return visits. The staff were friendly and helpful.

The location of this hotel is great, and I'd say that if you can get a room there for about $100 or less per night and cannot find anything else in this price range, it is probably a decent choice. The two main drawbacks I experienced are: 1- the poor sound insulation- inside your room, you can hear pretty much everything that is going on outside; and 2- a bathroom that had not been properly cleaned, which to me is one of the cardinal sins that reputable hotels must avoid at all costs. I must admit, however, that based on my experience, noise complaints are dealt with swiftly by hotel staff. Kudos for that! That being said, I would likely not stay here again, unless the price for the night was well under $100.
Front desk people keep their distance. The late night guy didn't know about the 11th floor soda machine....Room 1208 was ok. Great view to the mountains.Breakfast is a joke..........................

The staff was very helpful. Any questions we had were answered & they were polite! The wiki-wiki (light) breakfast was great. You got diced pineapple, juice, coffee, toast & jelly (a couple mornings we got a croissant too). Parking is valet only. The valets were all helpful & courteous. The rooms have no carpeting which at first is a little strange but not altogether bad. The rooms were spacious & the wifi was great. The shower has a very touchy knob. We had a hard time getting the temperature to stay in one spot. It is in a very nice spot for shopping & the beach. There are plenty of places to eat within a few blocks. There are also a lot of ABC Stores right around the hotel.They are stores that have any of the basics that you would need. Hot tub was at a nice hot temperature which was nice. It was clean & clear & so was the pool! The laundry area was nice also. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel twice & it was a good meal both times. They do need more help in the restaurant because the waitress was also the help at the bar so refills on pop & coffee were neglected.

The hotel is situated 5mins walk to convenience stores, restaurants and bus stops that takes you to the airport and KCC Farmers Market. A 10mins walk will take you to Waikiki Beach.The front desk personnel was less than friendly. Wasn't able to check in before 3pm. However, they are able to store your luggage at a secure room behind the front desk. Great hospitality room with computers and free internet access. Breakfast the same everyday, toast with butter and jam, a croissant, canned pineapple, diluted tea/coffee. Nice swimming pool.Room pro's:Adequate in sizeBalconyLarge fridgeStrong A/CRoom Con's:not 100% clean (corners and under the bed)no carpet in room. wooden flooring. bed are squeakyFree in-room Wifi!Overall, a great basic hotel to sleep and shower and to sleep off jet-lag. Great for budget traveler.Will recommend this hotel.

I visit Honolulu every six weeks for work. I stay here every time. I found this hotel as it fits my budget...I mean really for $99 a day, 4 blocks away from Waikiki...cant' beat it right? BUT, I am thinking I may look for another place to stay...why? Coffee. I'm not a big coffee drinker but I do like to drink it on occasion and think that it's pretty much a staple in hotels. Apparently not in this one. You get 1, yes ONE, coffee packet thingy for YOUR ENTIRE STAY!!!! You may buy more for $1 per 4 serving packet. It's the principle of the thing...Motel 6 will replenish your coffee, and this hotel is on par with Motel 6...it gives you a clean bed and bathroom.....but little else, including coffee. On my other couple of stays I figured it was just a housekeeper who forgot, but I went down to the front desk and found out that was not the case. The management should be ashamed. Bad hospitality is worth a TERRIBLE rating. Really Management, pay the $0.25 and give us some coffee.

This was out first trip to Hawaii and just needed a place to sleep off the jet lag for one night before our stay in North Shore. This was the cheapest place we could find in Waikiki that seemed reasonably nice. We were extremely disappointed with this hotel. Firstly, we thought we booked a room in the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel, but our room was in a completely different hotel altogether across the road and it didn't seem very nice.. Talk about shady. The guy at check-in was rude and arrogant as well. The room wasn't very nice and we felt dirty being in it. But we were tired and had no other choice. The only positive thing about this hotel is the location and the girl behind the bar was nice. I'd never stay at this place again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

I stayed there for a few nights on my current Hawaii-Trip.Let me say: There's not much bad I can say about this hotel!I stayed in room 1104 on the 11th floor in the main tower, view towards the canal. Room was very clean and nice. Bathroom was ok too, even had one of those geeky japanese toilets with buttons and all.Free WiFi was available!Location was PERFECT, you are in 5min walking distance to Waikiki-Beach and 3 minutes walking distance to Kalakau, the main street in Waikiki! Hotel is directly at the Canal, so NOT in frontline beachside ... but I thinks that's one more advantage, not that much noise and tourists. But as I said: 5min by foot and your right at the Duke statue at the Beach.ABC-Store (where you can get ANYTHING) is 1 minute away!The even had a pool, which I didn't use ... because I'm on Hawaii, I use the ocean.The staff was VERY friendly and helpful.The breakfast was a little "basic" (you had to choose between 2, 3 or 4 slices of toastbread, a croissant and that was it), additionally you could get yourself free coffee and OJ.If you're planning to do a budget-trip to Waikiki and wanna be near the center and in walking distance: Choose Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel!I give it 5 stars because: if I ever will be back in Honolulu, I will choose this hotel again, without ever thinking about it! That, and the perfect location, the free WiFi and the friendly staff makes the perfect rating!

I was travelling on a budget and needed to find a reasonably priced hotel in Waikiki.I booked the sand villa direct with the hotel and received "an advanced special rate" which consisted of a upper floor corner room with balcony and shuttle both from and to the airportThe external construction of the building is not great but we received a 12th floor re-furbished corner room overlooking the golf course on one side and the high rise hotels on the other.In terms of value for money the property was very good and in particular the "sand bar".OK the tropical breakfast was an couple of slices of toast some fruit and a coffee but that is what I usually eat at home so was adequate.The beds were comfortabloe and the the pool area very good.If you want a budget priced hotel close to the centre of Waikiki this shold meet your needs.

We found 'early bird' special rate on their website (90$per night) and for that price I think it's a great deal! This is already a decent hotel with a swimming pool and a hot tub, 3 minutes from the ocean, with polite staff, luggage storage, a few free PCs with online access, hospitality room - great if your flight is in the evening, car park (although Ala Wai Blvd is free to park - watch out for street claeang - you need to move your car then!). I really doubt you'd need more amenities when you have one of the most beautiful beaches in the world 3 minutes away. There's even a supermarket on Walina St one minute away. The only minus is a poor breakfast (menu: 2, 3 or 4 slices of bread with butter and jam LOL).

Centrally located. Very good restaurant onsite. Breakfast left alot to be desired, canned pineapple not what I expected in Hawaii. Excellent maid service.... Front desk very helpful and friendly. Color of the hallways was not very welcoming and actually quite drab. Nice location on the canal. Easy walking distance to many sites and bus service close by. Been coming here for the last 5 years, would be nice to have pay per view movies and microwave. Plenty restaurants and night life close to hot. Very reasonable stay, they even hold your luggage and can hang out by the pool before your filght. The only hassle we had was with someone on the staff(security??) that challenged our staying there while waiting to leave, not very professional. Ohterwise the whole experience was great!

We stayed here from Feb. 7 through Feb. 15, 2013. We were in a premium corner room on the 11th floor, with the lanai overlooking the canal to the left and even got an ocean view (small, but viewable!) to the right. We enjoyed every morning going down, grabbing some coffee and sitting on the lanai and taking in the sunrise and activity early in the morning. We did not eat the breakfast, which the hotel could do without, but plenty of people did take advantage of the free toast, croissant and pineapple. We did the $3 breakfast deal at the Subway just down the street. In past trips to Oahu, we walked to this hotel because we love their restaurant! Their teriyaki chicken, sizzling steak platter, island catch and nachos with kalua pork are heavenly!! We sat in the hot tub several evenings due to the cool tradewind breezes we had. It felt great! The pool area is nice, the walk is close to everything and not too far from the beach. We booked through the hotel and would stay here again if the price was right. The only problem we encountered was that we requested a king bed. The hotel responded to us before we arrived stating that they would try to accommodate us but that did not happen. My husband and I shared a full sized bed! We had two full sized beds but it ended up working out. We used the other bed to put our stuff (: Besides, we were never in our room for more than an hour after we woke up or an hour before we went to sleep! So, it worked. Decent place at a decent price. One thing I will say though, is that it is too bad there is a really sketchy apartment building right next door with a woman who tries to guilt you into not being "green" if you don't rent an electric scooter from her! She was kinda scary. It's too bad that place can't be demolished! I bet the hotel doesn't like it there, either! I would recommend this place for the people that are budget conscious like us and don't need a luxurious place to hang your hat at the end of the day! I say it is "good enough"!

Spend a week at the Sand Villa, it was a reasonable hotel with a great staff. The rooms were a little tight but clean,The restaurant bar is always busy. The location is great for walking Waikiki Beach. Plenty of restaurants and night life close to the hotel. I would consider staying here if you want a reasonable room in Waikiki Beach.

We stayed at the Sand Villa for 7 nights in February 2013 -- booked a junior kitchenette studio directly online, so got parking for $10.50/night, which is a bargain compared to other hotels in Honolulu. Valet parking, so you don't have to worry about the sometimes non-existent parking elsewhere -- never had to wait more than 2 minutes for our rental car. We paid an average of $175/night including ALL taxes & fees -- excellent value. The hotel itself is just what we look for -- helpful staff, clean, good location, good water pressure, free wifi, free breakfast. And about the breakfast -- other reviewers complain about it, but we found it more than adequate to start off the day. Unlimited coffee 6:30-9:00am, 4 pieces toast, a croissant, a cup of pineapple chunks -- pretty much all we needed. Our kitchenette studio had a fridge & microwave, which we always appreciate -- we like to stock up on our own sodas & snacks. Beds were just fine, pillows were a bit flat but not unworkable, bathroom served its purpose & was clean, good water pressure (very important to us!), tv had the usual assortment of basic channels (but c'mon, you're in Hawaii, who watches much tv?). We overlooked the pool area, so didn't have any noise issues. Location can't be beat for the price -- an easy 3-block walk to Kalakaua Blvd, the main drag that parallels Waikiki Beach. AND there was direct access to the beach right at the end of the street, which is a huge plus -- you can sometimes walk for blocks before finding a way to actually get TO the beach! Numerous touristy stores, ABC stores, mini-marts all within a few blocks for you shoppers. Also a McDonald's and a Burger King along the strip. The tour desk is right in the hotel lobby -- we booked a whale-watching excursion and were pleased with the operator's knowledge and recommendations. Another big plus -- a separate business center with 7 free computers and a pay printer (10 cents/copy). Very handy to check email and print off boarding passes. We never swam in the pool, but it looked nice & the pool area was clean. All in all, we'd definitely stay here again -- great value and great location for Honolulu!

The Hotel is pretty clean. The staff was friendly. The free breakfast was toast and pineapple but enough to fill up. There are other choices you can pay for. The lounge is very nice and the food was delicious when we went for lunch! The pool area was very nice and relaxing. The beds are very hard and the view wasn't a nice one but the location was good. Its further from the busy beach strip so it quieter, its still only a couple blocks from the beach though. I would stay here again, I'll buy an eggshell pad though for a softer bed. For the price of this hotel, its a good one.

I came to Hawaii for the first time in January 2013 and made a terrible mistake by booking 3 nights at the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel.From the moment we arrived, I noticed the unprofessional and unkind attitude of some of the front desk clerks. I should had followed the advice given by a gentleman waiting to be served who told me that his experience in the hotel was terrible.In fairness to the Hotel itself, it is clean, the rooms are good enough and the location is perfect.But I am telling you, if you are someone who likes to be treated well, this is not for you.I suffered and incident with one of the Valet Parking clerks named ROBERTO DEL RIO. I lost my valet parking ticket the first night and all I got from him was a bunch of insults and patronising behaviour because of that when I wanted to retrieve my car.The 2nd night I was coming back walking from dinner with a friend and when requested my car to get some luggage out of it, I was insulted again by MR. DEL RIO who even ask us to check out of the Hotel, insulted us in the middle of the lobby and even call us drunk! (Last time I checked it was not illegal to have a glass of wine while dining).His behaviour and customer service can only be described as primitive and arrogant. He even said he was the Hotel Manager. Clearly that's why he works in the Valet Parking.By the way, you have to pay $20 daily extra from your room rate, to have your car mandatory in the Valet Parking as the hotel does not have private parking. On top of that, you get treated like this!To make things worst, the actual Hotel Manager never responded personally to my complaint.I requested to speak to him (his name is Sheldon Yoshida) and all he did was leaving messages with the front desk for me to write a letter. Last day he was even at the hotel and said he was going to a meeting.Once I came back to London, I wrote to the board of Directors and Yoshida replied saying he analysed the situation and he couldn’t find any wrongdoings.I am not going to bother you with more details. But take it from someone who never writes reviews online! I had to do it this time!AVOID THIS HOTEL IF YOU APPRECIATE GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE.THERE ARE TONS OF BETTER HOTELS AROUND FOR THE SAME VALUE.

Let me start by saying that the staff was very friendly and the rooms were in reasonable conditioon. That said, the first night, our room never went below 77 degrees. That was fixed, but the second night, the fire alarms went off at 3 a.m. and 5:30 a.m. We were told they would be fixed. The third night the alarms started at about 10:30 p.m. and went off a total of six times. We spent over an hour in the lobby trying to get info when it would be fixed and finally went back to the room at 1:30 a.m. For all this inconvenience, we were given a grand total of 10% off our bill and were told that the manager would contact us. It's been more that a week and we have yet to hear from them. We were so sleep deprived by the time we left, we never wanted to see this motel again!

Recently spent two weeks at this hotel in the suites above the pool area. The suites have two double beds, a small kitchen area and a pull out couch. The room was not very clean. I spent some time wiping down spills on the wall around the kitchen area and scrubbing the grout around the kitchen counter and bathroom counter. Very dirty. The beds are very hard and uncomfortable and the sheets don't fit so you wake up each morning with the sheets off the bed. The couch was very dirty with stains all over it so I requested a blanket to cover it before I would sit on it. The shower head was terrible and it was difficult to get a good shower. They have a bar that is open until 4am in the morning and several nights there were loud groups yelling and partying right till 4am. Did not have a good night sleep the entire vacation even with earplugs. There is a complimentary breakfast which was a joke. Cold dry toast, coissant, watered down pineapple juice and coffee. Tried once and that was it. Terrible! Hotel has a restaurant that actually served great food but the waitresses at times were very rude and service was not great but for the price would eat there again. Pool area is very nice, lots of tables, chairs and lounges. Also very nice hot tub. Overall service was good. Staff are helpful and very nice. Hotel is just old and tired and management needs to improve the breakfast, close the bar earlier, replace the old beds and linens, and improve quality control on cleaning service. Still would prefer to spend a bit more and get a nicer room.

I traded this hotel for Hyatt Regency to save some bucks, but it turned out to be a not so good decision. The hotel is located almost centrally to anything in Waikiki. It is a few blocks away from the beach, restaurants, Waikiki Tram stop and shopping malls. The location is great but the hotel itself needs some upgrading. The hallway carpet looks dirty, the bathroom has that ammoniacal/urine smell even though it was just cleaned. The toilet seat has bidet which is very popular in Japan. The room is clean but needs new painting. The bed is comfy and the linens are clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. The business center (Hospitality suite) has 7 computers ( I've never seen these much in a business center!) and a pay-per-print printer. Should you need a microwave oven, you need to go down to the housekeeping lounge and use the microwave oven there. I was hoping they would have one at least in the lobby. There is free continental breakfast consisting of toasts, butter and jam and canned! pineapple tidbits. They have a swimming pool and a mini spa/whirlpool at the back. If you're looking for a place just to sleep, this is a good enough place to stay.

We paid about 350 dollars for a two night stay on the 1st January on a standard room with breakfast. For this money we checked in to a tiny worn out room , thanking god we only booked two nights there from a total of 14... Breakfast is served until maximum 09.00, well here is the good part! They offer a tray with a couple of toasted pieces of bread, jam and a small glass of pineapple juice! There was supposed to be a small croissant also , but do not ask after 08.00... Yes, this is the breakfast served... A " light " breakfast as the receptionist described it ! Prison breakfast i would call it ! Then if you ask tp pay for an omellette or something decent to eat, they make you wait until after 9.30 when the snack bar opens to give your order... There also seems a lack of tables and chairs , as there are only a couple of tables available so. you will probably end up holding your precious tray with " delicacies" waiting for somebody to get up and be seated. By then of course the bread is cold and not eatable, so frustrated you go out in search of a decent place serving breakfast... My God what a waste of money that choice of a hotel was.....

The hotel is well located near to Waikiki downtown. The hotel is nice and comfortable. I send there 6 night with my wife for our honeymoon and we spend some great time. The attention by the hotel staff is very kind. The breakfast is very good. The hotel have pool but we didn't used it because we prefer the beach. The bar is nice and have good meal choices and drinks too. Th e bedroom are ok and clean (most important thing!)The only thing is the the decoration is not too much modern but that doesn't matter if you only use to sleep, breakfast and get a shower. It's a very recommendable place. The parking fee is expensive in a city where is very difficult to park your car in the street, that is the only con that the hotel have.

I travelled on my own and enjoyed staying at this hotel - especially the friendliness of the staff - everyone was friendly and helpful from the housekeeping staff to the front desk, tour desk (I didn't want a tour but to organize a shuttle back to the airport) and the valet. It was so easy to organize getting back to the airport - no need for me to ring and try and book a pickup - that was done for me. I loved the atmosphere at the restaurant and bar - I usually would not sit and have a drink on my own but the scene was friendly and bar open looking out onto the street, that I did, and thoroughly enjoyed it. Again staff super friendly - prices good.The rooms were spacious and clean, with a good view (I had a corner room). The bed was very comfortable.The price is very good and at least there is some breakfast (toast, fruit, juice, tea/coffee - which is all I needed) to start the day off on, and free.Good comfortable friendly value for money. Yes there may be noise, but I have stayed at other hotels and there still is traffic noise) but that is Waikiki.I would stay here again if I visited.

Very good value & location. Rooms are clean and staff are nice and polite. However do not expect 5 star accommodation. Rooms are basic but you get value for money.Note the location is pretty noisy as its on one of the main roads.

This was the first hotel we stayed in when we arrived in Honolulu, and had the deluxe room looking in the general direction of the beach, but even with the cool balcony on two sides of the corner room, the amount of ocean we could see was only a tiny sliver due to other buildings in the way.We booked directly through the hotel to get discount valet parking which was a nice perk - I suspect they have a tiny carpark and it's easier for them to have a staff member park the cars. They were prompt in parking/retrieving the car for us, so no complaints there.We had a free breakfast included in the booking so went down to the dining area to discover our choice of 2, 3, or 4 pieces of tiny bread toasted for us, and a few grape jelly packets. We don't eat grape jelly (horrid stuff!) so they managed to rustle up a couple of strawberry jam packets instead. We also received a small glass of watered-down pineapple juice and a small cup of tinned pineapple. We think they were draining the pineapple syrup from the tins into the beverage dispenser, then topping it up with water. In any event, it was pathetic and ought to be culled immediately. The hotel would be better off shaving $5 off the cost of accommodation, and dropping the breakfast - it's dragging down the experience of staying there.Location-wise, it's easy to find, and an easy walk to the beach.We subsequently stayed in the Aloha Aqua Surf Hotel which is directly across the street - I didn't realise at the time because they have different addresses on different streets, but they're directly opposite the small street. I would choose this hotel over that one due to the better shower, larger balcony, and wifi in each guest room (not just the lobby), and they were almost identically priced.

Good things first - Waikiki Sand Villa is perfect if all you need is a place to sleep and shower. Loved the location, traffic is traffic no matter where you are in Waikiki. On the same street as Kings Village, enjoyed the easy access to the strip. Staff (minus Valet) was helpful and friendly. The rooms were eco-friendly, which we liked. Nice Lanai area if you absolutely MUST smoke. Cute restaurant with an airy feel downstairs, decently priced food and cheap drinks! Never made it out to the pool/jacuuzi, but checked it out and looked well kept. Real glass cups in the room were also appreciated, along with real ceramic mugs for coffee. Fridge was perfect, cant complain! The bad - Didnt like that I reserved a queen bed, but got 2 twins. Also, Valet. Did not appreciate the extra 20$ a day that was not listed on their site, plus they were never there. We always waited 5-10 minutes just for them to come up to the valet stand, they were never even in sight. Once, the security guard came and got our car for us, unacceptable in my book. Also, the beds were SO uncomfortable. Maybe in a more expensive room they were better but on floor 2, we may as well have been back in the stone ages. Loved the TV, hated the remote that seemed to work on it's own terms. The shower was an excellent size, but they could stand to update their shower heads. Free beach towel rental was much appreciated. All in all, it serves it's purpose, but don't expect anything fancier than a motel 6.

This hotel is very well located 5min from the beach. Spacious room with a balcony but not a great view.Very bad soundproofing: very noisy outside and hallway.Breakfast very poor too, just few slides of bread and a juice.Staff very helpful and friendly.

This economy hotel is a bit rough 'round the edges and good value for money, clean. As for continental breakfast.... so-so... restaurant/bar was great for lunch and supper... seemed to be a nice local pub in the evening with it's open airy concept. Employees very accommodating and very pleasant/friendly. VERY comfortable beds. Wi-Fi in rooms but also guests have access to a common area for use of computers and also in the bar/restaurant. Nice pool and hot tub, and not very busy. Great location to beach [a few block walk], close to all kinds of shops and island transit. One way road along canal is noisy on weekends... used by emergency vehicles to head toward Honolulu. Other than that it's a QUIET Hotel. Would highly recommend if you're on a tight budget. We would definitely stay there again when we return to the Island in future.

Good things first--the location is great. You're just three blocks from Kalakaua Blvd which is the main shopping, see-and-be-seen drag that parallels the beach, and you enter Kalakaua right where there's beach access. Other hotels further west force you to walk along Kalakaua for quite a ways before you can get through the shops onto the beach. Also, the staff is great, they really went out of their way to be helpful. There's an Enterprise car rental location just a block away which is also nice. But the very best thing of all is the "Hospitality Room." This is a room with computers, two full baths, and a couple of small couches which you can access all day and night after you check out at no charge. That way you can check out and store your bags, go to the beach, go out to supper, and still come back and shower and change into your travel clothes for the night flight back to the US. It's wonderful not to be wandering the streets hotel-less on your last day, or have to pay for another full night's stay. And the bell captain was very easy-going about letting us get into our bags over and over during the day. It was a priceless convenience which outweighs all of the negatives I'm about to list!Negatives -- The circle drive comes right to the edge of the narrow lobby with the two elevators so close it almost feels like you're in a parking garage rather than a hotel lobby. The hotel is a 1960s concrete block with cottage-cheese textured ceilings and a horrible avacado green/mustard yellow paint job in the hallways. Our room had a musty, unused smell, but thankfully we were able to open the door to the tiny balcony and air it out in just one evening. I've never given two thoughts to thread counts on sheets before, but these sheets were so thin they should have been turned in to rags long ago. I thought toast and coffee/tea was adequate to start the day, but it was absolutely tacky to have a roll of industrial paper towels sitting on the counter that you had to tear off a sheet to use as a napkin. Not regular paper towels, mind you, but industrial brown paper with no perforations you had to grab with two hands and rip. Seriously? You can't afford napkins. That really bothered me.All in all, it was fine if you are only staying for a few days and just want a place to shower and sleep.
