If you want anything more, pay the extra $20/night for the Ohana East or $40/night for the Sheraton Princess, both on the same street as this hotel.

One of the cheapest decent places to stay in Oahu. We were upgraded from a hotel room to a "suite" (essentially an efficiency). It was clean, and the service from the friendly hotel staff was very good. The hotel is clearly not new, but the room was nicely renovated with good beds, a decent sofa, and a basic kitchen. I was shocked to find a $1K toilet in the bathroom. Parking is valet, with good service, and they never ran out of space (unlike some of their local competitors).Be sure to try the restaurant. They serve very good food at some of the most reasonable prices in Waikiki.The only real down side was the "free breakfast". It consisted of coffee, tea or water, a 4-oz cup with some canned pineapple in it, and 1-4 slices of toasted white bread.

Was ok, however could use some improvements.When checked in, bathroom sink faucet wasn't wiped clean. Can see regular use and grime build up, kinda gross. As well, under dresser was a pile of dust. Seemed they swept up and just swept it under the dresser.Low quality room, but considering I paid a good rate, can't complain. Figured you get what you pay for.Staff were friendly. Daily room cleaning was good, clean towels every day, toilet paper refilled, etc.Toilet has an electronic bidet, which seemed fancy for the hotel being low quality.Read a previous review about bringing your own pillow, definitely agree. I did, and was happy I did. Their pillows are flat and hard.If you want to use their in room safe, you have to ask for a key from the front desk. I didn't bother, as didn't want to take a chance losing a key, there's a $35 charge if you do.Breakfast was basic, but I didn't mind. Chose 4 toast, along with small cup of pineapple, small cup of juice, small croissant, and best part was coffee. So never did need to make coffee in the room.Only big issue I had was noise, no sound proof whatsoever. Lucky we had quiet neighbours for the most part, loudest noise was babies crying, loud pple walking past the door. Other big issue I had was doors slam loud, when pple coming and going you hear their doors. Not good if you're a light sleeper. Wish they'd fix that. Suggest bringing ear plugs.

Rather than staying on the beach and paying lots of $$ we stayed at this value hotel 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Its and older hotel with clean room and the basics. The first night was complimentary coffee for our room coffee pot, however additional nights you had to pay to have the little packets of coffee for the pot. The breakfast buffet was simple, but hot and had good coffee. The computer room had a couple of computers to use at no charge and was open 24 hrs. There is a small bar/resturante located on the first floor, reservations are required. Also, had a nice small pool area.

Am currently at the hotel now. I've been to Waikiki a few times previously for this sort of short break. I'm not inclined to drop a lot of money on something on the beach. Other trips, other destinations, perhaps, but not Waikiki.The hotel is fine, but a bit rough around the edges. The room (premium corner category) is basic: hardwood floors (sensible) a queen sized bed, night tables, dresser, and a tiny desk and tinier wall mounted TV. Bathroom is small, with a tub that my 1,67m/5'6" frame can just stretch out in. Balcony is a wrap-around with partial beach and canal views. Wiki Wiki breakfast is a joke: toast, juice and a shooter glass of tinned pineapple. Staff are pleasant, but when we enquired about a late check-out for Monday (which we are willing to pay for), they said "we're sold out Monday night". Just got back to my room and could book the room on their site or Booking.com, with the latter 25$ cheaper for the night.Compared to similar hotels of this standard, there are better options. Won't be back as a result. This place isn't awful, but it's not very good either.

Just returned from a 10 day stay in Waikiki and had a wonderful time. The Sand Villa was perfect for our budget conscious vacation. The staff was awesome, especially Pili, she was so friendly and assisted us when one of our shuttles failed to show up, thank you Pili. Our room was on the 10th floor in the front (I had requested the back) however it was fine and didn't bother to request a change. The view of the canal, golf course and mountains was perfect. It was only a 5 minute walk to the beach and all the action. Down the street was a great farmer's market, perfect for a quick snack, which we probably would not have known about staying somewhere else.The Wiki breakfast was just fair. 1-4 pcs of toast, 1 croissant and some canned pineapple. We picked up some bagels and cream cheese at the nearby food pantry.The pool area is very pretty with lots of plants, a nice place to have breakfast.The room was just what was needed, very clean, 2 double beds, dresser, desk, fridge, a safe and a balcony. The floors were laminate wood which I think is much cleaner than carpeting.The only issue we had was one of our tours got switched to the morning of our last day and I wanted to extend our check-out time. When I asked they said I would have to wait until the last day to see if it was possible. Not knowing before meant we had to pack up everything the night before just in case they said no, they ended up letting us stay until 12 instead of 11.We also took advantage of the Hospitality room, our flight was not until 11:30 pm. We were able to spend the day at the beach and come back to have a shower before we left. Having that room available was great.Overall, we had a great vacation and I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you are on a budget.

Chose this hotel by reading previous TripAdvisor reviews. Location and price were main perks. Hotel is located 3 short blocks (about 1 city block) from Waikiki Beach. Even closer was the downtown district with lots of shopping, dinings and International Market. Room, pool and breakfast area were always clean. Though the free breakfast only included toast/jam, pineapple chunks, pineapple juice & coffee, it was definitely adequate for us. Fridge was nice perk in the room......could have used a microwave. Numerous ABC stores nearby to pick up snacks, liquor and incidentals.

Room wise is good enough for 2 pax however cleanliness needed improvementService wise, requested for free upgrade and early checkin ... Upgraded free but not allowed for early checkin.Location location and location .. Right on the lesser noise part of Waikiki and yes it's good in its location. Price wise and be cheaper if booked earlier.In a nutshell , will stay again if I am in a budget.

My 4th time staying here for 1 night each time as a stopover to the US mainland. It is great value for someone on a smaller budget,the rooms are more than adequate and pretty clean (could possible do with a microwave though), and the front desk staff quite friendly and helpful. An adequate continental brekky is provided, and nice swimming pool, a great bar and restaurant that stays open late and has happy hour, across the road from the Food Pantry supermarket, 2 blocks from the beach, and close to heaps of restaurants and shops. What more can you ask for considering you don't spend much time in you room anyway. Yes I would recommend this hotel to all on a limited budget or a short term stay.

This is a budget hotel, however it is very good value for money and close to many popular areas in Waikiki. The staff were excellent, exceptionally friendly and helpful and most have an excellent knowledge of the area. They were also quick to respond to any of our needs. The rooms were very clean, but a little tired looking,having said that, this hotel is excellent value for money. Access to buses were a few yards away, and these buses can take you to many of the wonderful sights of Honolulu like Pearl Harbour, shopping, Waikiki beach etc. Breakfast was very basic-toast,fruit and fruit juice/coffe/tea. However, once again I stress, given the small amount paid for our stay, breakfast was a bonus. I would most definitely stay here again!

This is a very clean friendly hotel..we are for sure going back..the staff were great..and the location was just right..food also was good and the bar staff were very friendly..overall it was a amazing time staying in this hotel

Waikiki sands villa was in a decent location, within waikiki, and along side of the ala wai river bank area.Very close to downtown waikiki and beach areas.The hotel was kept up, clean and decent every day during our say. Very very good window view of the ala wai river bank and surrounding area, in the rear of hotel.The window views in the rear of the hotel are very good, beyond the 10th floor and up.

The winter in New Zealand seemed rather long so another visit to the Waikiki Sand Villa seemed like a good idea. I landed at Honolulu Airport at 10pm and the free prearranged (by the hotel) Minivan collected me and after a 30 minute trip was at the hotel.Arrival:The reception staff were friendly and helpful and updated me on the changes to the Air Conditioning System and Lighting since I last stayed one year previously. Breakfast vouchers were supplied and a code given for the free wireless internet. A key for the free room safe was also supplied along with two room swipe cards.To receive these benefits it pays to book directly with the hotel through their website rather than a third party provider. If you have any issues with the online booking (in my instance booking for over two weeks at a special rate was not possible online) send reservations an email as they are very helpful and you will receive friendly personalised service.The Room:The room was a nice corner unit with two opening sliding doors onto a corner Lanai with a table and two chairs. The view was of the Golf Course, Ala Wai Canal and Diamond Head.The room was clean and tidy and came with a double and single bed. The bathroom was supplied with a washlet on the toilet and the bath was supplied with overhead removable hand shower. Soap and shampoo were via dispensers adjacent to the hand basin and in the shower/bath area.The rooms Central Air-Conditioning worked well and had a digital display showing desired temperature and current room temperature. The noise from this unit when running was not obtrusive. A coffee machine was supplied along with two porcelain cups and a starter pack or coffee with utensils. The fridge was of a good size and accommodated half gallon size milk container and had an icemaker. An Insulated ice bucket is provided and ice machines are available on alternate floors.Breakfast:The breakfast is basic but free with your vouchers. Expect Toast (1 to 4 slices as requested), Butter, Jam (Jelly) Pineapple pieces, Pineapple juice, Croissant and Coffee and Tea. Milk is of the powder variety so I suggest you purchase this and bring your own to breakfast. You can eat your breakfast poolside which is a great environment or in the bar area if this is your preference.Pool and Spa:The Pool and Spa area is large for a Waikiki Hotel and is one of the nicest ones I have seen in Waikiki in the under $300 a night hotel range. The pool is 70ft long with a good shallow end suitable for children with wide steps. An island on one side provides a jet stream to swim against for some variety. Loungers are provided and tables with shade umbrellas surround the pool. The Spa is very hot and appears well maintained. The pool is open late which is great for a refreshing swim post tour or shopping. Toilets and showers are adjacent to the pool and a gymnasium is also present. (see reception for access key).Bar service is available poolside if requested and prices are very reasonable.You are welcome to consume your own drinks poolside but sensibly no glass is allowed. The pool area is checked by security every 30 minutes or so though things tend to be calm and safe at The Sand Villa.Security: In regard to security it seems well monitored as I left my door propped open on its lock for 10 minutes one evening and a security person was soon on hand advising me to secure my door. Safes are provided in the rooms and the locks and doors are well constructed. There are security cameras poolside, in elevators (lifts) and other key areas around the hotel.Waikiki is generally a safe destination and the area accessing the hotel and nearby streets are well lit and seem safe. Of course don’t go wandering down backstreets at night or into parks. Stick to the main streets and the beach area and shops.Shopping:There are numerous food outlets nearby including a small supermarket called Food Pantry with 150ft (50 Metres). Here you will pay tourist prices. A much more economical choice(with great variety) for the reasonably fit is the Safeway Supermarket on Kapahula Ave . Just walk along the canal toward Diamond Head till it ends at Kapahula Ave and turn left walking along past the Golf Course till you reach the Supermarket on you left (you can’t miss it, just stay on Kapahula) 1.3miles (26 minutes’ walk).Ask for a Safeway card and they will sign you up straight away for discounted products.Macys Department Stores also offer a discount of 15% off most items. Show them your hotel room key/card and they will give you a 2 week discount card.Checkout Ross Dress for Less stores for general clothing, Forever 21 for the younger set is very reasonable. Sports Authority near Ward Warehouse (Ward Avenue) is the place for Sports Shoes and clothing. Famous Footwear (on the Cnr of Kamakee adjacent to Ward Warehouse) has a good range of shoes at discounted prices including Timberland and Nike.Dining out:So many places, checkout “The Shorebird” for its great all you can eat salad bar and beachside location (use the voucher in “This Week Mag” available on any street). Cha Cha Cha Mexican on Seaside Ave for outdoor seating and good food at cheap prices.Conclusion:The Waikiki Sand Villa keeps getting better and for an economical stay in a great location is unbeatable in my opinion. Enjoy your stay!

the sand villa has clean comfortable rooms with balcony overlooking the canal and golf course.the bar serves fantastic food and is open from 9am till 4am....the swimming pool area is great to relax. the bar staff and local customers make you feel very welcome and is a definate plus if you have travelled alone. the fantastic atmosphere of waikiki beach is a stroll of 5mins. from the hotel. the whole resort is like paradise,go and you will have memories forever.

I just returned from a stay at this hotel in disgust. Not only did the room curtains have visible dirt and the bathroom floor and shower contain daily hair from the service staff and the a/c not work well but we awoke to our wakeup call to roaches on the phone and in the shower. The staff was nice but way too accepting of these conditions. Therefore I would not recommend anyone stay there until there is either a complete change in staff or new ownership as problems of this type start from the top.

I'm giving this place 2 out of 5 because this hotel was annoying. Location of this place was great. We ran along the canal a couple of the mornings. Its a short walk to the beach, to the Food Pantry, International Market, other shopping... They offer free wi-fi - we did not use it but realize its a bonus for some travellers. The restaurant/bar in the hotel is good service and food. The hotel is dated, the bathroom was a bit dirty with leftover hair... How the hotel annoyed me was by placing our two room bookings into the hotel across the street "Aloha Surf Hotel" although the paperwork calls it Aloha Surf Building. The amenities are slightly different. I needed to have a bathtub in my mothers room - she got only a shower... They could not change us the first night but did change us the next day and allowed us to move into the main hotel. The manager, Nancy, was nice but her and the rep the night before repeated that I did not read the fine print. Very annoying. My questions - why put it in fine print and what does the fine print say? If you do book this hotel, buy bug spray. In the evenings there are insects. We stamped out about 5 per night.

A very nice start to our trip. We were being budget conscious and were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. On our first night we ate downstairs and the food was good. The service is slow but the server was friendly. We ended up with a corner room and a view of Ala Wai Canal. The beds were ok - mine was too hard, the other one too soft. The toilet “sang” everytime you sat on it and had all sorts of heating and cleaning features; but no lid so be careful of leaving stuff on the counter. Overall the room was clean and the view was awesome.The breakfast was very basic – but a trip to the Food Pantry for some cream cheese made it more complete. There is a room coffee maker but after the first package of coffee you have to pay $1 for each additional. I just stuck with the Wiki Wiki breakfast coffee since they start serving at 6:30am. There is a Hospitality room with showers and computers. Just be sure to check with housekeeping for clean towels. We used the ones there and did not see it replenished before we left.

we were only in Waikiki for one night as a stop over on the way home so for the price you cant go wrong! Good-ish location... rooms were clean and quiet... shower was good... bed was small but somewhat comfy... and hey the staff were friendly and accommodating!keep in mind if breakfast is included and you leave the hotel at 6am to go to the airport.... sorry no breakfast for you (and no refund)

Great price for Honalulu. Rooms were small but clean and had a balcony. Employees were friendly and very helpful. There is no hair conditioner or body lotion provided so you need to bring your own. Valet parking is available for a small fee.I did really enjoy my stay here and will be back again on my next visit to Honalulu.If you want a nice Hotel in a good location and for a reasonable price, this is the place for you.

Waikiki is such a bustling place, so it was nice for the hubby and I to come back to a quiet, relaxing part of town just a few blocks away from the crowds. We stayed at the Sand Villa for 7 days, which included free internet and a small continental breakfast, which consisted of: 1 croissant, 2-4 pieces of toast, canned Dole pineapple, pineapple juice, and coffee or tea. For the price well under $100/nt, we had a clean room, AC, a bidet, and friendly service. While we were there in late-July to early-August, they painted and repainted the elevators at least 3 times, so usually only one of them worked. Their happy hour was pretty popular, with friendly servers & bartenders, and we even met some of the locals who stopped by every few days to shmooze and drink. We rented some bicycles for a few days, and the front desk told us we could keep the bikes on our lanai upstairs to be safe, which was a pleasant surprise for us. We did our laundry once during the stay ($2 wash, $1.50 dry), printed our boarding passes downstairs ($0.10/copy), and utilized their free pool towel service many times.Overall, I was happy with our experience. It's not a luxury hotel, but it was a good location, friendly service, and a great deal.

Great value for Waikiki, and centrally located to the beach, Diamond Head, stores, and Ala Wai Canal. They have a wiki wiki breakfast, which is pretty plain, but still free. Their hotel bar had friendly bartenders, and their food wasn't too bad. They also have a pool and hot tub to relax in after a long day at the beach or sight seeing. If you're on a budget, and looking for a clean quiet place to stay, than this place is for you.

During my stay I paid just over a $90- a night, the rooms are neat, tidy, air conditioned and mine had a great corner balcony. The foyer area was good and staff were available to help with bookings. The bar had a nice menue and a light breakfast was included in the nightly rate. Free internet with use of a photocopier for a minimal fee as well as a laundary was available to wash your clothes. Under building parking available for under $20- a night.The hallways are in need of new carpet and a coat of paint though.

I stayed at the Sand Villa for one week. We were on the tenth floor with a canal view. The beach was within walking distance: 5 or 10 minutes, depending on the lights at the crosswalks. (Don't jaywalk in Waikiki; if you're caught, it's like a $150 fine.)The staff was friendly, and everything was clean. The breakfast, as everyone on Tripadvisor mentions, was minimal, but since we knew that going into it, that wasn't a big deal. The beds in our room were definitely harder than we're used to, but not too hard to sleep. The pillows were very, very flat. I have some neck problems, so that was a bit of an issue for me. In the interest of fairness to the hotel, I did not ask the hotel if they had any better pillows. I had read a few reviews saying asking for that sort of thing was fruitless, so I didn't bother.We had free wifi and had no trouble with connectivity. The valet parking was quick and professional.Most nights were fairly quiet as far as street noise. A few times we were awoken by sirens or by noise from the bar downstairs. Generally, it wasn't much of an issue.Because of the value, I would probably stay here again, but I would bring my Tempurpedic pillow.

I stayed at the Sand Villa on 2 occasions during a recent trip. The staff were awesome, helpful, accommodating and treated me like family. If you want a friendly hotel, in a great location, value for money, safe, clean, bar open till 4am, good food, then I recommended the Sand Villa. I never went down for breakfast (I don't get up for breakfast @ any hotel-I'm on holidays), but ate lunch and dinner at the restaurant numerous times. The staff at the bar were all friendly and provided great service and every item I ate from the menu was well cooked and of great quality.As a single female traveller I felt safe at this hotel and walked the streets at the early hours. All the rooms I stayed in were clean and provided all the facilities I required. Great value and I will be staying at the Sand Villa on every return trip to Oahu. The valet parking took the headache out of looking for parking and the valet staff promptly retrieved my car. Recommend this hotel to anyone for a truly ALOHA experience.

This place is good value for money if you are on a budget but want to be central. Close to the beach and close to lots of shopping and food options. Also very close to bus stops which was very good. Rooms were okay. Clean and tidy. Just the asbestos ceilings that weren't very nice and the sound proofing was a bit lacking. Also the message light on our phone didn't work so we didn't know when our sailing trip had been cancelled and still got up at 5am. Overall though it is a good value option for the location. We didn't really eat the breakfast because it was just toast, we got cereal and milk from a near by Food Pantry instead.

We took two of our grandchildren, ages 9 and 12, to Hawaii in June. It was their first trip to Hawaii. This was our fifth trip to Oahu. We stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa on prior occasions but this time we got the suite with a kitchen overlooking the pool. The Sand Villa is not a fancy hotel. If that is what you want, there are plenty of choices in Waikiki but they will have a price tag to match. The Sand Villa is within walking distance to the International Market Place and Waikiki Beach. The room rate is hard to beat. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The lady at the the concierge desk has booked many excursions for us and she is wonderful. If you want to travel to Waikiki and not spend a fortune on a hotel room, this is the hotel for you.

I got married in Honolulu a couple of months back. All of the younger people with less money stayed here and it was solid for the price. Location was great as we could make the walk to the beach in 8-10min. The bar was cheap (for Hawaii) with an interesting mix of locals who frequent it. Rooms weren't all that great, but who spends time in their room in Hawaii? Odd part is having to insert your room key into this thing in your room for the electricity to turn on. Also, they seem to have an arrangement with a few of the other local budget hotels. If you book here, you might not actually be staying here. One group ended up being across the street and another group was a couple blocks over. They were comparable hotels, so it wasn't that big of a deal. Other than that, for $85 this isn't a bad option for those on a budget.

The hotel is located near the strip of lake, if you get the corner room (like us on the first night) – then you will have real good view from the hotel room. The room itself a standard hotel room – clean, comfortable with usual necessity. It is about 5 mins walk to the shopping area and 10-15 mins walk to Waikiki beach. The one I like the most about this hotel is that it provides beach towel – so we just grab the towels from the laundry place and no need to worry about having no towel for showering at night after a day at the beach since we used the towel from the hotel’s bathroom! Staffs are hit and miss, some staffs are very friendly to us – but some are quite rude as well. So, depend on your luck really.. The “free“ breakfast was rubbish though. At the end we never used our coupons for breakfast – we just ate breakfast out….And... the area itself quite dodgy. Every time we passed the apartment next to the hotel on our way to the shops, EVERYDAY we smell weed. Plus my partner actually saw a girl sitting outside casually rolling one. Another 2 blocks from the hotel (where the shops/supermarkets are) there are A LOT of prostitutes on the street. My friends got asked couple of times on different nights whether he's "free to play". Mind you, we walked around the area every day for a week – and it was all good, no troubles or anything.. I think it will be ok if you are staying as young couples/with friends, but I wouldn’t recommend this hotel if you are travelling as family. Nothing against the hotel, just area little bit dodge..

Had a great time here. Im 19 and I went with my 22 year old bestie.The staff were friendly and accomodating, the rooms were clean and the food from the bar was brilliant.- The burger being the bestThe pool was clean and not to busy. Am booking to go back again =]

Our stay was for 6 nights I am a 27 year old taking me and my girl to Hawaii (for perspective). I can honestly say I really like Waikiki Sand Villa. I was looking for a cheap trip for (2) to Waikiki and this hotel kept coming up. I kept reading the negative reviews and was concerned but went for it. There are a couple hotels for cheaper right on the beach but you don't get an ocean view for that price. There is absolutely nothing to say negatively about the hotel other than possible noise from outside traffic. Just ask for a room higher in the hotel. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk to the beach. On that walk you pass the two main streets for restaurants and stores. You are right next to everything. The rooms were OK. I don't really like tile floors and the room was pretty plain with no frills. Nice corner balcony with views of the Canal and city. The Bar downstairs has a good happy hour (try a firestone) as well as decent food. If you are trying to go to Hawaii on a budget this is a great choice of hotel. You will not want to hang out at the hotel anyway there is tons of stuff to do.. Go to Hanauma Bay and do a Circle Island tour (Enoa tours)

We stayed here for 3 weeks in Aug. 2011 and loved it. To see the negative reviews saddens me and I must see for myself if things have changed since our stay. Nancy was super to us, as was the rest of the staff...very accomodating! The rooms were always being cleaned, ours was very clean, even our balcony was cleaned daily!!! We were very pleased for the price we paid!!!! We don't require a 5 star hotel, for 3 weeks in Waikiki this was fantastic! I absolutely LOVED the bar area downstairs!!!! Great food and drinks and affordable!!! We shared a huge omelet every morning....for $7!!!! The bar staff was awesome...Tammy always greeted us with a huge smile and wonderful service!!! We got to know them all!! Then a short walk to the beach...heaven!!!!

Checking In -----------------A guy at the front desk made us wait because our room wasn't ready although we arrived there around 2:20pm, but when we finally checked in, someone did a lousy job cleaning the room. Our feet were literally dirty after 5 minutes of walking around in the room unpacking. Also, we requested king sized bed, but instead we got 2 double beds because they couldn't make accommodation for us. BED BUGS-------------------My girlfriend and I suffered bites from bed bugs because of the room uncleanliness. My girlfriend got bitten all over her left leg and I was bitten on my chest and thigh. She was really upset so she went down to make a compliant, they moved us up to the higher floor, same type of room. I did not want to take a chance with this hotel so I decided to check out and stay elsewhere. I booked and paid for my our stay at this hotel till Sat 5/5/12, but I DID NOT want to take a chance sleeping in the room full of bed bugs. We check out 3 days earlier, and the hotel manager didn't seem concerned at all when we told her that we got bit. She thought we were lying and told me that they were going to investigate. I requested them to waived the parking fees total of $60 and she said she was unable to do so. I was so furious at them for NOT taking care of their customers. We ended up staying at Modern Honolulu Hotel where my girlfriend and I were treated with utmost respect and valued customers. Thank you Modern Honolulu for saving what's left of our first time vacation at Hawaii.

We stayed for 12 days in February--we booked the lowest priced room online,($89--floor 1-5) and got a "premium" room on an upper floor (11th). We were travelling with an infant and 4 year old, so things were a little cramped with a playpen, strollers, etc. We saw a sign at the front desk to upgrade to a suite for $30 extra a night, which we were able to get into after the 4th night. I believe it is the same price as you would pay online. The first room was much cleaner, but the extra space in the suite was nice. As there was a kitchenette, there were some food stains, etc. on the walls and just not as clean as you would like it to be. All of the suites overlook the pool. We were on the third floor (there are only three floors in that building), but there is no elevator for the suites--we left our stroller at the bottom of the stairs out of the way when we had to be upstairs, and it worked very well. Because we booked online we also got free shuttle service to and from the airport, which was great, although we had to pay for the third person ($10 I think). All in all, it was alright. My 4 year old LOVED the pool, although it wasn't heated and he could only stand at the one end by the stairs. The pool area was great--very clean. We only had breakfast once at the hotel, we had read the reviews before, and knew we weren't missing out on anything, but normally we just have toast for breakfast anyhow, so not a major deal. There is an AWESOME noodle house a block or so away--can't remember the name, but for $5.00 you can have a great meal--there is always a line, but it moves very quickly. We ate there three times in three days. Overall, the hotel is a fine deal, but would have liked the cleaners to do a bit better job in the rooms--especially places like walls, etc. Great location. If you aren't a super picky clean-freak person and you like a good deal, it could be for you.

Great place!The 2 main advantages:-After you check-out, you can still come back and take a shower before going to the airport.-The desk-staff is VERY friendly and helpfulOne thing to improve: They give a free coffee-bag (for the cofee-machine in the room), just on the day of arrival

I have been to Hawaii many times both as a tourist and for business. I reserved a room at the Sand Villa months in advance, but when I arrived the room was unclean to the point that there were condoms (used and unused) scattered around the room and filth on the floors and furniture. I was moved and downgraded to a different room, when I requested a rate adjustment due to being downgraded I was moved again. I assume the last room was one of the best they had, since it was a corner room on the top floor, but was no more then an average room in any other hotel. Even if you exclude questionable maid service, the hotel is obviously still poorly managed. The beds are more of a cot with thin, lumpy mattresses but the toilets are high tech electronically controlled thrones out of place in such a scruffy hotel. The "wiki wiki" breakfast, as it is advertised, is a cold slice of toast, a cup of weak coffee, a glass of orange drink, and a cup of canned pineapple. The location is great and the price is about average for an off beach hotel, but is so poorly managed that it is a disappointment at any price. I will never stay here again.

make SURE your room is located in the backside. Then you will be blessed with amazing sunrise views from your room / balcony. Also you will be able to see the ocean.Streetside rooms will face the hotel right across the street, which is really sad...Another thing is the poor breakfast. probably already mentioned a 1000 times. You will get some toasts, juice coffee and jam. Thats it. To upgrade your breakfast, you simply go to a 7eleven, buy some yoghurt (which you can keep in your fridge in the room)The hotel BAR is quite good. Open till 04.00 and fun place to hang out.The pool is good enough.If you book through their own website, you will get a 10 $ discount on daily car parking fee!Overall I would say: Its a bit of an old hotel, which could need some improvements, but good enough for a fun stay, and price and location makes it a good pick.

The rooms at the Waikiki Sand Villa are fine, considering what you are paying. The location is very central for Waikiki and everything is easy to walk to. There is also free wifi in the hotel which is accessible from your room. All the staff we encountered, including the cleaning staff, were helpful and courteous. The only downside is the included breakfast, which is very naf. We ended up eating elsewhere, or buying our own food!

Yuck - the rooms were so old we could not tell if they were clean! The towel rack was rusted - the tub tiles were terrible - the bathroom vanity had a hole in it.We were not impressed with the pool area although the pool itself was very clean.The front desk people were nice.It was the worst continental breakfast we have EVER had in a hotel. We tried to save money by staying here - but you get what you pay for! We will NOT return.

We stayed here in 2008, came back in 2010 and have just booked our 3rd trip for 2011. The hotel is in a great location overlooking the golf course. It is only a 10min walk to the beach and main drag. You have the shuttles buses around the corner, ABC on the corner and restaurants galore. The hotel offers all the facilities you ask for in a hotel, internet, pool, room safe, balcony, cofee / tea making facilities, fridge. The best paet about the hotel is the value for money. It is a really inexpensive place to stay and the rooms are very clean and the staff are always there and very helpful. There is a free airport transfer for guest staying more than 4 nights. All up we love coming back here again and again. It is like a home away from home/

We have stayed in many hotels all over and this one is the first we are rating this way - because we wanted to let others know that this place is not what they say it is. Agree that it is cheap but thats about the best thing to report. We stayed there for a week. The room was from a prior century and was not well maintained. There was an odor that was quite bad. The TV never worked well - informed them twice with absolutely no response. So no TV for a week!!! Shower head broke and caused an injury - again the stuff is of very poor quality!The Valet parking deserves a very special mention here - it is quite pitiful! Better to spend 15 bucks daily in a nicer hotel for parking than depending on the mercies of the guys managing the service. Sometimes you have to wait a very long time to get your car. And a tip seems to be expected every time you take your car.. which when you do it a few times daily for a week adds up to a lot of cash! Otherwise they seem to ignore you the next time you come by. I heard one of the valet guys commenting about someone - '10 dollars for 5 days - what a cheap guy!' Quite rude behavior - to say the least! Also the space for pulling up into the valet must have been designed by a sadist as almost every time there is no room and you often get yelled at by airport shuttle drivers dropping off people. I have to say that the place seems to be frequented by a lot of Japanese and Chinese tourists and I think the management seems to have things set up well for them rather than your average US tourist.
user_name:
cooldc
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed in this hotel last September 2010 and I must say that this hotel is value for your money. This is close to downtown Waikiki without its matching price. best of all, you dont need to ask for an upgrade, once they realize they have better rooms for you, they automatically give it to you. We stayed for 2 nights at the hotel and booked their most basic room, we were given a superior room with the coolest bidet water closet. We checked out because we spent 2 nights in Big Island and when we returned we were upgraded to a Family room without us asking. 2 upgrades, what more can i ask for.

My girlfriend and I stayed here for around one week. We were only looking dor a clean place to sleep because we were gonna be out surfing all day long... The staff were nice and polite. The Valet parking was a bit annoying because you always had to wait for the guy.The hotel is well situated in downtown Waikiki, walking distance from everything (5-10 mins max.) including the beach. In the morning we would leave the hotel with nothing but our boards and swimwear walk barefoot to the beach. We didn't expect much of our room for the price but we were pleasently sruprised. Not much view on the beach, but a good one on the golf course and the mountains, which is as good to me as the ocean. But like I said we weren't there to spend our days in the room. If you're expecting a big 5-star resort you should choose another hotel. Our room was small, yet very clean, which was the most important criteria for us. Breakfast was a bit disapointing in size, but you can always pay extra and go to the hotel's restaurant, but toast, fruit and juice was enough for us.

I've returned from a lengthy stay at the Sand Villa and really can't say enough good things about it. My room was exactly what I asked for: high floor with a view of the canal and Diamond Head. Every request I made was taken care of promptly. for example, one day, soon after checking in, I mentioned to the housekeeper that the sliding glass door to the lanai was difficult to open and that the fridge wasn't cold enough. Then I went to the beach. When I returned, the door was greased and I had a new fridge. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I got a thank you note from the housekeeper for leaving her a few dollars. The desk person helped to print out our boarding passes. And, on the last day, the bartender managed to serve our lunch poolside although she was the only one there.I loved the pool and the spa which was nice and hot--it felt great for my arthritis. When I travel in the midwest, a pet peeve of mine, is that the spas are lukewarm because they function as kiddie pools. this one was clearly for adults.The bar and restaurant is terrific. Food is reasonably priced, the customers are friendly, and, once again, the bartender, Deb, couldn't have been nicer.I will definitely stay here again.

This hotel is not even a one star. It has never been updated..never. The first nite they had to come and change the sheets as they were dirty! The blanket on the bed was so old they took that away also.When u turned on the bathroom taps they ran all over leaking on everything .They had one old ratty towel per person .When the person in the next room sneezed it was like they were beside u ...u could hear everything...it is a terrible hotel to stay at.

This was our third stay at Waikiki Sand Villa. First trips were in 2006 and 2007. We chose this hotel because of the cheap fares, the location (canal view but from a walking distance to Waikiki beach), the free wi-fi internet and the breakfast included in the price.In February 2012, we came back at this hotel, this time with our daughter. The hotel has barely changed (some renovations) but some changes disappointed us. First, the breakfast. They gave us 7 coupons to get a free breakfast. Now, you don't help yourself as in the past, you have to wait in line in a narrow space to receive toasts, butter and an awful and dry croissant. And worst, canned pineapples! In Hawaii, yes...I guess the coupons thing was to avoid people from outside the hotel to get free breakfasts, but it's annoying to be a guest and be served like in a cafeteria. You want another breakfast, you need another coupon. I disliked that.Otherwise, this hotel is still ok. The pool is nice, the spa too (but too warm, I haven't seen anyone who was able to stay in the water more than 10 min). One more thing I dislike: you need a key to go to the fitness room. No, your room key won't work, you need another one. When you ask for the key, it works for a day only, if you want to go back to workout, you need to reactivate the key at the front desk. The staff is nice, nothing wrong to say. The rooms are OK, no more carpet (yeah!) so more cleanliness I guess. But look, the air filter in the bathroom was DIRTY. The humidity will stick in the bathroom. I mean, I don't really mind as it's not my property, but all of the humidity goes inside the walls so sooner or later, Waikiki Sand Villa is gonna have serious problems to face.We like the restaurant bar at this hotel, food and drinks are good, decent prices...but LOOK CLOSELY AT YOUR BILL. We have been served by a lady named TAMMY, she wasn't nice to us, asked us for ID's and even asked us for our date of birth to make sure the id's were ours (even if we were obviously in our 30's with a 4 year old girl) and later she came back with the bill (with no pen to sign the receipt) she added 20% for her tips...!! Hey, I'm the one who decide how much I give based on your service and it's certainly doesn't worth 20%! She received 12% only because of her bad attitude. But the second time we came to eat there we got served by a very nice lady so I guess we weren't lucky the first time. Of course, this nice waitress got a good tip.I would still recommend this hotel if you are on a budget, don't mind to be in a modest hotel and planned to go outdoor all day to enjoy Hawaii.

Lets start off I do not like writing bad reviews unless it is deserved.. Check in staff was friendly till money was charged slept in the hospitality room till about 2pm waiting on room to be ready, Up on getting room key they said oh yea we need a $75.00 security deposit??? Room rate $$$$ for what you get was not good slept in 30.00 places and had a cleaner room, 1 Double Queen Room, 2 towels 1 wash cloth and 1 hand towel, Sheets are Flat and Not Fitted, Vinyl on the mattresses that are hard as a rock and pillows are hard and flat. TV was small and signal was poor, Internet speed is slow and always disconnects you. AC would only bring the room to about 72 degrees. Breakfast is a joke Toast, Coffee, and Juice. I guess they call that a light breakfast. I would have rather homeless money to sleep in their card board box.

We just got back from a 7 night stay at this hotel.The price was reasonable and we got exactly what we paid for i.e. nothing fancy but suited our needs. The room was small but kept clean. The staff were always pleasant to us and very helpful. The breakfast was included but VERY limited in what it offered (toast and small amount of fruit-along with tea,coffee and juice which we supplemented with peanut butter and bananas from the nearby ABC store). The five minute walk to the beach was pleasant and the hotel hot tub was warm.We couldn't ask for more. One unpleasant thing happened outside the hotel on the street to an older gentleman pulling his small luggage (on its' rollers). A young jerk on a bicycle came up from behind and ripped the luggage from the man and kept on going. We couldn't catch up to the thief as he just sped up pulling the luggage along. This is not a reflection on the hotel,just a reminder to everyone to be careful-thieves are not on "vacation mode"

Located 3 blocks from beach and directly across the road from the river. We're quite happy with basic accommodation for a good price and quite central in Waikiki as we spend most our time at the beach or on day trips. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and there is free wifi on every floor. Plus there are washing machines and dryers downstairs so you can do your own laundry. Most days we swam at the beach but a few times we tried the pool (also clean) but could never get a lounge chair (people seem to save their spot with a towel and then disappear for a few hours...) I did read reviews before booking and noticed alot of complaints about the continental breakfast... yes it is basic but all I require is toast and coffee which I got, so if you want anything else, just go out for breakfast. I would stay here again.

Having just one night in Honolulu we didn't want to pay huge dollars for a room so we found WSV for $100.00 per night. It is back towards the canel so not as busy. It does include a continental breakfast which we didn't go to so not sure how that was. The room was small ours was suppose to have 2 beds which it did but 1 was a single our other traveling partner had 2 doubles no queens at all.They did give us use of the hospitality room as we had a late check out and there were computers to use and lazy boy chairs and 2 sofas which made it nice as it was raining most of the day and we were done wandering around.The staff were friendly and polite and helpful. The rooms were very basic no upgrades done in years but did us fine for 1 night but I wouldn't want to spend to many days there just to cramped. Ok for a quick stop over.

This was my second stay at Sand Villa. It is located across the street from the Ala Wai Canal, great location for joggers/walkers. It's about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach. The hotel is clean and well kept, with a lovely pool area. The staff is friendly. They serve a free continental breakfast daily with toast, croissants, pineapple, coffee and pineapple juice. There is also a bar and grill in the lobby, with good food and friendly staff. Less than a block away are a large grocery store (Food Pantry) and an ABC store. Lots of restaurants, shopping, etc., in close walking distance. On both stays our room had a nice view of the canal, golf course, mountains, palm trees, etc., and there was a balcony with 2 chairs and a table. I would not hesitate to stay at Sand Villa again or to recommend it to friends, unless they were looking for a fancy hotel, were picky or wanting to spend more money. We met a lot of return guests.

We had read the reviews when choosing this hotel, so knew that it was a value priced place in a good location. We chose the upgrade studio because we wanted to be able to eat in some of the time. The studios are all situated so they over look the beautifully landscaped pool. We had an end unit with windows in 3 directions, so could look out to the hillside as well as pool. Lovely natural light. In the evening there was some of the best lighting we have had in a room ever. We like to read, and could easily do this either in bed, on the sofa, or at the kitchen table. The kitchenette was poorly supplied with one butter knife, 2 small serated knives, one fry pan and one large sauce pan, and no dish clothes or towels (we used the bathroom's). It did however have a toaster which was great for reheating the toast that is supplied for the minimal breakfast they serve. We did find that the place could have been cleaner, and we did wash the dishes, cutlery and pans prior to using them. The only other unpleasant feature is that the mattresses had plasticised protectors. Since we understand that hotels have to be careful about bed bugs these days, we understood why they did this, but it does make for less pleasant sleeping. The staff were cheerful and able to answer all questions. They sent a doorman up to the computer room to help us when I needed to print something, and couldn't figure out how to do this. I concur with all other reviews about the wonderful locale. We walked everywhere we wanted to go in Waikiki. We stayed 4 nights this time, and would definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the Sands Villa for 4 nights in January and it was a great location for the price we paid.We were on a budget and so not having to pay the high prices of the big hotels along the beach strip was very good for us. It was only a 5 minute walk to the beach and 20 minute walk to the zoo. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was adequate - seeing that it was free. You could have up to 4 pieces of toast, a croissant, a small pineapple cup, a glass of pineapple juice and coffee or tea. We would go down and get a tray and take our breakfast back to our room and sit on the lanai and watch the goings on down on the Ala Wai Blvd. Then we would head out for the day. Late afternoon at the pool was a welcome place from the heat and it was never crowded. Sometimes we were the only ones there.I think for the price that you pay, this hotel was a great deal. The staff were very friendly and helped with anything you asked for. They went out of their way to help us when our airport shuttle bus was delayed, making phone calls to find out where they were and when they would be at the hotel to pick us up. I would stay at this hotel again if I were back in Waikiki.

A hole in the wall.The Bar Staff is unfriendly to everyone except their druggie friends.If you feel comfortable in a shady atmosphere with shady characters and a rude bar staff, this is a cheap place with all the above.

We were on a tight budget and were looking for a clean enough, well located and calm hotel room for a 10 nights stay in Waikiki. After many days of research and reading on TA and elsewhere, we chose the Sand Villa hotel and we are happy we did.Location: Well located to get in or out of Waikiki, near The bus stops, a grocery store, 8 minutes walk to the beach, walking distance of everywhere in Waikiki, we even walk to Diamond Head and Ala Moana Shopping Center. Check-in/check-out: Check-in was easy so was the check out. Our departure was on a 11pm flight so we were able to store our luggage in their locked facilities to enjoy our last day in Waikiki. We also use the hospitality room to refresh before leaving to the airport. Nice touches!Staff: Everyone (valet, receptionist, housekeepers, barmaid, etc.) we met during our stay was smiling, friendly, willing to help, and made our stay even more enjoyable. Room: We were staying in room facing Diamond Head on the 8th floor. The view was beautiful and I woke up each morning at 6:30am to look the sunrise on the large balcony. Room was clean enough on arrival (could have been cleaner) and refresh during our stay (quick quick refresh). Bed were good and I didn't mind the plastic cover. The room was quiet during our stay and we didn't hear our neighbours. We needed a room to sleep and we slept well (I am a light sleeper).Amenities: The A/C was working fine but each time the fan was kicking in it made some noise but nothing to wake us up. The fridge and the in-room safe were very handy. Free wi-fi in the room and around the hotel was a definite plus. Breakfast: It has been said over and over, the breakfast is nothing special (2-3 or 4 slice of bread). But, on a tight budget (and good luck with that in Waikiki), it can make you save a few buck daily. We took the breakfast almost every morning, but we went to the Food pantry and got strong coffee, fruits and cheese to add a little twist to it.Pool: Nice pool (4foot deep) and neat Jacuzzi. Seemed well maintained. Everything closes at 9pm. Bar: Ok place to hang out and ok food (I had some sushi). It is crowded during happy hour (cheap beer) and much less afterward. Overall, reading lots of reviews, we knew what to expect choosing the Sand Villa and we're glad we did. For the price we've paid, it fulfilled our exceptions and I would go back again.

Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. Overall the hotel is in a great location and its about a 10 minute walk to the beach. The room was nice but the decor was a little dated. The hotel pool was great and it was a nice place to relax and read my book. The hotel staff were very friendly and i would return for the price i paid.

We stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa for Christmas. This hotel is value hotel compared to others in Waikiki. We checked in knowing we were getting a good deal on the rate and not expecting much in return. Location- It is located along the Ala Wai but only 2 blocks from the beach. It is also in the middle of Waikiki, very central if you want to walk around day or night. Room- We stayed in the older section because we booked on hotels.com. Our room was on the 11th floor and we had 2 lanais. They gave us 2 double beds but we pushed them together for a nice big king. There was a mini fridge and a desk. We had a nice mountain/ Ala Wai/ Sunrise view. The bathroom was small but decent. For the low rate of the room, it was basically what we were expecting. The room was clean and maids were nice.Valet- Slow but good and $20 per day.Free Breakfast- This was truly laughable. We receieved tickets for free breakfast and were expecting at least continental breakfast. It was literally toast, pineapple juice and coffee. Luckily, Dennys and Starbucks are only a few blocks away (along with a number of local options) so we just went elsewhere for breakfast. Pool- We didnt use the pool but it appeared shady and kid filled when we returned from the beach in the afternoon. Its on the east side of the hotel. Restraunt- We didnt eat there. We read previous reviews about the "fun bar" there but it was definately not our crowd so we did not go.

I had read some great reviews of this hotel and also,I stayed across the street at the Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel on a previous visit to Waikiki.I ate and drank in the bar at the Sand Villa and had an excellent time.The food was very good and the drinks were so well priced.How could I go wrong? The pool area is very nice and the pool itself is a good size. When we checked in we were assigned a "premium room" as they call it,meaning a higher floor (11 floor). The carpets in the hallway are old,tired and dirty.The hallways are painted in a drab color.The carpets in the rooms have been taken out and replaced with a nice laminate flooring.But the sheers on the windows were stained and dirty.The small balcony area was not maintained and needed a good cleaning.The taps in the bathroom sink leaked everytime we turned them on as the washers inside were worn out.The television had poor reception when we arrrived and I notified the desk.They had a list of other people with the same television issues, and they added my room number to the list.The reception did improve so I was satisfied with that part. The business centre had computers with filthy dirty keyboards.Where is the maintenance staff? I did not want to spend my holidays running after them complaining about everything or I would be there all day.The beds were comfortable but nothing great.When we checked in,the lady did not tell us about the key card and how it works so we were left to figure it out for ourselves.It is the type that you put into a slot and the power turns on.When you leave the room,you pull the card out, and the power shuts off.One big problem: it also disconnects the power to the fridge! So everything we put in the fridge begins to get warm! We returned to the room to find warm liquids in our fridge.Who did all these crazy renovations? The free breakfast meant lining up with huge groups of Japanese tour groups (this hotel really caters to large groups from Japan and Korea) and eating toast and pineapple (the free continental breakfast) but finding a table was a challenge,so we ate outside where it rained that morning. The pool area is lovely but with one problem: it borders on a run-down apartment building next door which overlooks the pool area.There were screams coming from some kids in that building a few times when we were by the pool.The pool is not heated as far as I know. The staff,in general, will answer your questions and appear to be friendly.The problem is that they are not proactive in anything they do.They wait until you approach them first.I found this to be very unprofessional.Being friendly is easy,being helpful and outgoing means actually working. I was really looking forward to my stay at the Sand Villas but in the end,I felt let down and disappointed.I donot think I would stay here again.It also borders on the busy Ali Wai Boulevard which the police and ambulance use in Waikiki.So we could hear sirens from our "premium room".There are better alternatives in Waikiki.I would not recommend staying here.Its got some real issues that need attention.
We stayed here for 4 nights in December and it was great. Walking distance to the beach, restaurants and stores. Room was basic, but very clean. I loved the hardwood floors.

We stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa in September.We loved it here. The location is great it is only a 5 to 10 minute casual walk to the beach. Our room faced Diamond head and we overlooked the canal and golf course. Our room was basic,but clean and bed was comfortable and plenty of storage space. We were on the 9th floor and we didn't have a noise problem except for the odd expected fire engine. There is a ABC store on the corner for supplies and you can catch the Pink trolley to Ala Moana a little further down out front of the Ohana Waikiki West hotel. We ate at the Sand bar grill twice after long gruelling sight seeing days and enjoyed both meals, the prices were not bad. Breakfast was funny , you could request either 1, 2 ,3 or 4 pieces of toast but they still only gave you 1 butter and 1 jam and a small glass of pineapple juice. This was ok for me as I don't eat much for breakfast, but for some it may be a problem. Nothing was a problem for the reception staff. We never used the pool as we were always out and about, but it looked clean and plenty of sun lounges and chairs etc. There was also a spa, a gym and a laundry area.I booked the hotel online and I got the free airport shuttle as we stayed more than 4 nights. I ended up tipping the driver very well as he drove us to the hotel the long way and gave us a tour at the same time, I knew everything I needed to know about Oahu by the time we got to the hotel, he didn't shut up and it was at great first impression of the extremely friendly Hawaiian people. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again on my next visit.

I stayed here for 4 nights in October/November 2011. This was my second visit to this hotel (my previous visit was in August 2008). I had one of the rooms in the tower. It was very spacious and had a wrap around balcony with 2 chairs and a table. It was a much nicer room than I had expected. It got the sun in the morning but had good black out curtains. I wished I had something suitable to stick over the control panel for the AC as this was really bright. There was free wifi which worked really well. I had the free breakfast a couple of mornings. It is basically coffee and toast but it is ok for getting out in the morning (I missed it 2 mornings because I left so early). The people on the front desk were lovely – especially when I arrived very late at night after being on the go for about 26 hours. Different person was equally lovely when I left at 5.15am. There is an ATM in the lobby which charges a low fee for withdrawals which was handy as it felt nice and secure to withdraw cash there rather than on the street.I recommend this hotel. I would definitely stay here again. It is very reasonably priced. The beach is about 5 mins away and the bus stops are about a minute away. I have always felt safe walking from the hotel down the street to Kuhio Avenue.

Don't get fooled by the breakfast included rate because what you'll get are choices of 1pc of toast OR 2pcs of toasts OR 3 pcs of toasts with jam and butter. That's it!When we tried borrowing ( from the hotel's bar) for a wine bottle opener (corkscrew) , they didnt have one. Can u believe? We had to buy one instead. It's 10-15 mins away from the beach.

We stayed at the Sand Villa and were very plesaed. The location is good and it is clean and comfortable. The front desk staff was professional. Book on line from their web site for 4 or more nights and receive free shuttle service.The beds were very comfortable and we had no problem with noise. It is about a 5 minute walk to the beach and shops.The included breakfast was 4 pieces of toast and some pineapple, juice and coffee. The pool looked good but we never made it in, we were too busy elsewhere. There is a fridge and a flat screen TV and plenty of drawers for clothes. From our pleasant lanai we could see the Green Mountains and the canal.

We were looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in Waikiki. This Hotel is good value free light breakfast, free airport shuttle if you book online & stay more then four nights. We had a corner room with a double lanai over looking the golf course which was clean & comfortable. Close to the beach, & other places of interest. Nobody goes to Waikiki to spend time in a hotel room!!!!

I surveyed the budget hotels in Waikiki before choosing this place. It seemed to cover all the bases. For around $80 you get a light breakfast, pool, jacuzzi, a good size room in nice condition and completely clean, free in room Internet. It also has a hospitality floor with PCs, etc. There is a large bar area with outdoor seating and restaurant with good priced food, which is very useful for a quick meal given the scarcity of good priced options in Waikiki. It's popular with tour groups, but overall, I really liked the friendly atmosphere.

I've stayed here twice now and both times I couldn't fault it. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are of a reasonable size and priced for the money concious traveller. The pool and spa are great. The free continental breakfast could be improved upon but it's FREE so I certainly wasn't complaining. High speed internet in all rooms and foyer and it's conveniently situated near the International Market. I will definately be staying again and have friends who also stayed and loved itkeep up the good work Sand Villa :)

If you are looking for a 5 star hotel this isn't for you...but we found it perfect for our vacation and budget!! We booked thru Orbitz and got a fantastic price for air and hotel!! We stayed for 3 weeks, were upgraded to a corner room with double lanai...perfect! The bar/rest. is fantastic!!! Open air to the wonderful tradewinds....great prices and the food is wonderful!!! Where else can you get a fantastic omelet for $5.50??!! Or Bloody Mary in the a.m. for $3.75! This is in Hawaii!! Their Fish and Chips are $7.50 & fantastic, as well as the sizzling $9.95 steak/fajitas!!! !The Bartenders are wonderful! The bar is open until FOUR a.m. and serve all their wonderful food until 3:30!! LOTS of locals go there..great way to meet them and tourists!!A short walk to the beach and everything else Waikiki has to offer!! Right on the canal...very nice. The staff was wonderful...so many guests but they still called me by name anytime they saw me!! The rooms are very clean and all sand is eliminated daily!!! They even clean the lanai! Any requests you have will be honored the best they can!There IS some street noise depending on where your room is...that's just Waikiki..unless you stay ON the beach and spend much more!! Free internet in your room!! We had best results with cat5 wire we took with us. All other hotels charge for internet! As well as parking...here it is $18.85 per day so that is the norm there. We only had a car for a day as we walked everywhere or took the abundant amount of busses!!! Check out Aloha Bus...the trolley and city bus! I can't see renting a car for weeks.. Waikiki has soooo much!! But Pearl Harbor is a must if you are there!!! Again...go via Aloha Bus! Quite fun!The little ref. in our room was perfect! Maid service was great! Each day we returned to a nice clean room..and clean sheets! And no sand! Trust me, we tracked in plenty. I have seen some negative reviews about this hotel, but have to say we found it perfect for us! And really, can you complain about free breakfast? You can order that wonderful omelet for $5...and much more if you choose. Enjoy it around the pool...which is very nice...large and wonderful tropical setting! Always clean, as well as the nice hot tub! We will go back...very soon I hope!!

What started off on a bad note, actually turned into a highlight by staying here. Upon arrival, not being from Oahu and with no signs present to indicate entrance and exit, we went in what was apparently the exit. The valet was very sarcastic until he realized that I was tired, cranky and not a person who was taking kindly to his remarks. He got much friendlier when he realized we would be utilizing valet parking for our entire week stay. The rest of the staff was very friendly and the room, while small, was clean and comfortable which is all we look for when it comes to travel. We had some trouble with our TV one night and within just a few minutes they had a repairman there to repair it. The bar and grill downstairs was fairly priced and the best food we had the entire time we were on the island ! It is easy access to everything you would want to do in and around Waikiki Beach. The beach is just a short 3 block walk from the front door of the hotel. All in all, we could not have asked for a better room, better food, or better service from a hotel. We spent a week here for our Anniversary and it was absolutely amazing ! We will definitely consider Waikiki Sand Villa the next time we come to Oahu. We are already making plans for our 20 year Anniversary... To the staff I say Mahalo and Aloha from Missouri !!

We picked this hotel just for one night after a long flight. We weren't expect too much from it. With ~$90 in summer, it is lower than most hotels in Waikiki area. The room is big enough but absolutely very basic, no frills at all. It looks like an 30-year Day Inn at a remote place. Parking is $18 valet. The free "light" breakfast is really quite light. Up to four french toasts and a small drink.Later, we moved to Sheraton Princess across the street. It costs around $25 more with tax, but the $12 resort fee includes a free parking which saves $6 compared with the valet here. But you get a much much nicer room and more comfortable bed. So, as I said, $20 is the gap between this hotel and a much nicer one in the same area.

It had been two years since I had stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa so I was interested in what changes may have been made in that time. As I booked online there was a free bus service provided by the hotel and I was met at the airport by an agent with a sign. The service was also free for my departure trip.The reception staff were friendly and I was given an upgrade (unrequested) to a corner room with two balcony’s (lanai). I used a 10% discount voucher I was given upon check-in when i last stayed (2 yrs.’ earlier) and this was accepted with no problems. The room overlooked the Ala Wai Canal and looked towards the mountains and Diamond Head. This side of the hotel is my preference as it is quieter and the lanai gets the daytime sun to dry swimsuits. I always take an elastic clothes line to attach to the balcony chairs as the lanais can be quite windy places at times.The room was clean and tidy and the TV had been upgrades to a flat screen unit which meant more bench top area for storage which was appreciated. The bathroom was clean tidy and kept well stocked. Soap and shampoo were provided in dispensers attached to the wall. Tissues were provided and kept restocked during my two week stay. The room maid service was quick and friendly and too a good standard. The air conditioner is of the central type and was not noisy and did its job well. I turned it off at night as is my preference. The extractor fan in the bathroom was quite loud however it is only activated when the lights are on in the bathroom so this wasn’t a problem. There was a refrigerator in the room which did a good job of keeping things cool and was very quiet in operation. A coffee machine was also provided and came with a starter pack for your first brew. Ice was available from an ice machine on every 2nd floor and an ice bucket was provided. The lifts worked well no excessive wait times were noticed.A very basic breakfast is provided in the room charge and vouchers are provided. This consisted of coffee, pineapple juice, toast, jam, butter, pineapple pieces, and upon request a croissant. I used this service each day and used my own cup for the coffee with milk from my room as only a powdered creamer is provided which is not to my taste. This breakfast is perfectly acceptable considering the low cost of the accommodation.Pool towels are available from reception each day and the pool area has toilets and showers. There is a Spa pool and a beautiful clean pool. Loungers (no shade) and tables with sun shades are provided poolside and the bar will bring you drinks upon request. The pool is open in the evenings till around 9pm which is nice if you want a swim after a long day shopping. The bar on the ground floor adjacent to the lobby is open long hours and provides good food at a very reasonable price.Free wireless internet is provided in all rooms and the pool area. There is also cabled internet in the guest rooms and an Internet room with computers available at no charge. I found the wireless internet weak with my smart phone and found the pool area provided the best connection. If you are taking a laptop (they have larger aerials this may not be an issue) but I would take a cat5 cable just in case.Overall all and excellent trouble free stay and again for the budget traveller thoroughly recommended.Nearby restaurants that stood out during my two week stay were Jinroku Pacific Teppan Yaki, ground floor Pacific Monarch hotel (excellent) Lulus Restaurant on Kalakaua at the far end by the zoo (very good) with nice open window seating and Cha Cha Cha Mexican restaurant in Seaside Ave (very good) with outdoor seating).

Just spent 11 nights here and will go back next year.The hotel was only 5 minutes walk to the beach and the neighbourhood was safe day and night. We had read about noise from traffic, but we had a room at the back and it was very quiet. The rooms have been modernised, new furniture and flat screen tv, fridge,wooden floors,and were very clean.The breakfast is VERY basic, but is just meant to be a get-you-by snack. There is an ABC store 2 minutes away to get boiled eggs, cornflakes, milk etc if you really need it. There are so many restaurant choices nearby as well as a good restaurant in the hotel, with cheap childrens meals. The hotel pool is massive and has a shallow end for younger children. Towels for the pool were not always readily available but you just go to housekeeping and ask for some. The courtesy room has 6 computers with free internet, 2 massage chairs, tv, setees, free reading books to swap/take, toilet and shower facilities. There is also a laundry room.This is a bargain hotel for the location.

We were looking for reasonable accommodation in Waikiki and this hotel was perfect for our budget. If you don't expect 5 star accommodation you will be happy with this hotel as its centrally located on the the Ala Moana canal and close to the beach. The hotel caters mainly for Japanese tour groups so it can be very busy in the lobby. Our room was clean and neat (although the decor is outdated) and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel caters mainly for Japanese tourists

I found this place by doing a Google search of "cheap hotels near waikiki" and this came up as the least expensive option ($60/night). After reading a couple of sketchy reviews, I was a bit skeptical, but I was too anxious to get a great price. This is a really great place for the price. We had the standard double room which included a nice kitchenette with 2-burner stove, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, mini-fridge, sink, and table with 4 chairs. The room was not too small and overlooked their FABULOUS pool. There is even a screen/storm door in case you wanna leave the front door open for some fresh air. In addition to a temperature control A/C unit, there is also a ceiling fan in the room over the sofa. The front desk was very friendly and helpful and gave us coupons for a complimentary 'Wiki Wiki' breakfast - a light meal that included 2, 3, or 4 pieces of toast (your choice), a croissant, butter and jam, a cup of diced pineapple, and juice/coffee. If you wanna save more money, take bus 19 or 20 from Honolulu International Airport - it stops a short one block from the hotel on Kuhio Ave and Kanekapolei St. The beach is so close. I will stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a nice, clean, affordable hotel in Waikiki.

We have stayed at Sand Villas on several occasions, there have been quite a few changes, especially with the breakfast now being supplied via coupon and food items being placed on tray. We did find it a wee bit miserable with jam & butter which some nationalities use more than others. The rooms are still kept clean, but could do with a bit of a spruce up. Overall another lovely stay, at a convenient, clean and friendly hotel. We will be back!

I traveled between June 7-14th, 2011 with my two daughters. I chose this Hotel because of the location & price which was booked online through Hotels.com ($78/night) & was pleasantly surprised. Upon our arrival, though, there was a mix-up as I requested three single beds. This was one of the reasons also that I chose this Hotel. All of the Triple rooms had been taken but they had a room on the top (12th) floor ready for us. They said that they could give us a Roll-a way bed but upon seeing the room, there was not going to be any room for one. We made do with the 2 double beds. They did suggest that if we wanted the Triple room, we could switch in two days when it became available.We were on the side facing Honolulu which I would of preferred the other side facing Diamond Head because of the morning sun so it was a little cool while sitting out there enjoying your coffee.Breakfasts were ok. Not much to rave about. 4 pieces of toast, 1 coissant, pineapple tidbits, juice & tea or coffee. It was good to get something inside of you before heading out for the day. Aside from the room being small, everything else here seemed very good & took advantage of the Hospitality room when we needed to use the computer & also on our last day as we had a late flight. We were able to shower & get ready after spending the day at the pool which by far is one of the nicest ones in Waikiki & very private.The Island Sun Tour Desk & Misako were wonderful. She helped us with choosing & booking the best outings. She is very experienced & very knowledgable.The staff at this Hotel was very nice. If you had any concerns, they were quick to resolve. Always had fresh towels when requested.This hotel is by far not anything fancy but for the price it is really good. It is an old hotel but they are trying to renovate slowly & replaced all the carpets with laminant flooring which is nice but not too nice when you come back from the beach because of the extra sand on your feet. The location was really good. I liked that it wasn't busy around the Hotel which would of been a problem if we were down on Kalakua or Kuhio. ABC store down the street & a good sized Grocery Store on the next block over but can cut through parking lot across the street. This was a great place to get ready made food which you could just put in your fridge to eat throughout the day. We had a great time in Waikiki. There is so much to do & see, so why spend unessessary money on a Hotel Room when you are hardly in it.

I was looking for economy on this trip because of a tight budget and found it. For the price, it was 'good enough'. Not in the best of shape, but it met my needs, I did like the Japanese toilet, and it was close enough to waikiki beach, and public transportation. If you want 'nice' go somewhere else, but if you just need a place to stay, check it out.

i would say the few good things about the sand villa would be the view from our room, wifi in our room and the advanced toliet which seemed to be why the room cost as much as is did, other than that, the room was small and beds were not comfortable. The front desk was very rude from the start, an example would be the parking, we did not intend to pay for parking because we know where to park for free in the area, and they were not happy about that, just because they saw we had car keys were set on selling us their hotel parking. Another issue was guest not being able to come up to our room, i understand they wouldnt want people staying at the hotel for free with out paying, but come on, after certain activites you just want to relax and shower and just chill, and the fact that our friends staying at another hotel was not allowed up was just a no no for me. so in the end we decided to just go to another hotel and they said because we booked through expedia we would have to call them, nothing they could do and were really rude about it, so we did and expedia was super nice and helpful and had no problem refunding our room and even gave us a $50 coupon for future bookings. So we called front desk and let them know and now they had a change of heart, telling us that the day was already payed for so we might as well stay the rest of the day but we didnt want them trying to sneak in any charges and we really just didnt want to be there any longer so we just left.

This hotel was the ideal location. Less than a 10 minute walk from Waikiki Beach and had a bus stop right around the corner to take you to all of the attractions such as Pearl Harbour and Diamond Head. I stayed with 4 friends and we had 2 rooms and it cost us less than $50 each per night. The rooms were lovely, nothing special but everything you need for the price you pay. The best part of the hotel was the restaurant. It had delicious and affordable food; we ate there nearly everyday! The pool and hot tub were also wonderful.

The WAIKIKI SAND VILLA brochure does not reflect the true condition of this DRUGIE hotel. Meth users at the hotel bar, rude bartenders, and thieves. My wife and I are on our honeymoon here.
