We have had to move 4 times for cause. 1st room, a/c didn't work after we fully unpacked for a 12 day stay. 2nd no view as booked. 3rd room, massive amounts of liquid coming from the a/c. Finally the 4th, little to no a/c, defective a/c controller causing high humidity and little to no air circulation in the room. The parking is a total rip-off. $18/day.

This was our second stay at the Sand Villa and we liked it even more the second time around. This trip we had an updated room with new hardwood floors and flat screen tv. It was very clean and comfortable. The staff at this hotel is the best around. Everyone there makes you feel so at home. If you need anything they jump to take care ofnyou immediately. The valets are the nicest guys...especially Bobby!We really liked yhe restaurant. Good food,afforsable price.The spa was so nice and relaxing. Not too exspensive. Love the massage chairs in the hospitality room. Quick walk to the beach. Thank you Sand Villa for an enjoyable vacation. See you next time!

For economy and value this is a gem in the wacky Waikiki market. Good location, renovated rooms, nice pool, an easy walk to the beach and free wifi. Happy hour in the Sand Bar is relaxed and fun. Try the mahi mahi tacos- mmm! Highly recommended.

This hotel is basic but good, very friendly and helpful staff. Impressed by the Hospitality room with up to date free computers and other facilities, also books to read and swap. The bar/diner on lobby floor served cheap and lovely meals, drinks were cheap especially at happy hour. As a sole traveler in poor health, I found the hotel very easy and comfortable, nice soft towels, and good lighting. Bedding could be a bit updated, pillows were hard but I asked a maid and she found me 3 soft ones, Doonas would be nice. very clean. My only complaint is the Wiki wiki breakfast, very poor, just pineapple, canned juice, toast or croisant and coffee. I used to go to b/fast at 8.55,and get my coffee and toast and at 9am the diner opened and you can get a gorgeous omelette for $5, all in all a no fuss, basic but v ery pleasant hotel

We have just returned from a month stay at Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel, our 4th stay in the past 5 years, and we have enjoyed it every time. During our visits there, we have met many people who have come back year after year, some over 25 times, and all are well satisfied with the accommodations, so it is a bit difficult to understand some of the complaints made in some of the other reviews. It is not a 5 star hotel so anyone expecting 5 star luxury will be disappointed, but if one accepts that, it is a great place to stay and the cost is very reasonable. Our room was on the 8th floor, and had recently been remodelled and, although small, it was clean, fresh and comfortable. Our bed was very comfortable and the room had nice new flooring, a new LCD TV, good lighting, a bright bathroom, quiet air conditioning, free safe and a coffee maker, and a nice lanai. Staff was very friendly and accommodating; Our maid, Erlinda did a good job of cleaning our room every day and appreciated the small tip left each morning. Nancy at the front desk was always pleasant, and wonderful if there was a problem. The valet, bellman, security and maintenance staff and bartenders were all very pleasant and helpful. The complementary continental breakfast buffet is modest - but all the toast, coffee/tea/juice, croissants, and pineapple that you want, located inside but the food can be eaten poolside. It is a free continental breakfast buffet, so don't expect a hearty breakfast served at your table - for that there are lots of full service restaurants nearby. On some evenings the restaurant service was lax but the menu has excellent fish & chips as well as a good variety of tasty snacks and entrees. The pool is beautiful, surrounded by palm trees with tables and chairs and lounges for those who prefer relaxing and visiting poolside rather than going to the beach, which is only a long two blocks away. There is also an outdoor hot tub. We enjoyed our 4 weeks at the Waikiki Sand Villa in Jan and Feb, 2011, and we hope to go there again next winter.

This was the 3rd time that we have stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel,( Jan.25/11 to Feb. 22/11,) so obviously we liked it. But it is NOT a 5 star hotel so anyone expecting 5 star luxury will be disappointed. Our room was on the 8th floor, and had recently been remodeled and, although small, it was clean, fresh and comfortable. Our bed was very comfortable, and the room had nice new flooring, a new LCD TV, good lighting, a bright bathroom, quiet air conditioning, free safe and a coffee maker, and a nice lanai. Staff was very friendly and accommodating; Erlinda was a sweetheart who cleaned our room every day and appreciated the small tip left each morning. Nancy at the front desk was always pleasant, and wonderful if there was a problem. The valet, bellman, security and maintenance staff and bartenders were all very pleasant and helpful. The complementary continental breakfast buffet is modest - all the toast, coffee/tea/juice, croissants, and pineapple that you want, located inside but the food can be eaten poolside. It is a free continental breakfast buffet, so don't expect steak &eggs served at your table for gods sake. On some evenings the the restaurant service was very poor but the menu has EXCELLENT fish & chips as well as a good variety of tasty snacks and entrees. The pool is beautiful, surrounded by palm trees with tables and chairs and lounges for those who prefer relaxing poolside rather than going to the beach, which is a long two blocks way. There is also an outdoor hot tub. We enjoyed our 4 weeks at the Waikiki Sand Villa in Jan and Feb, 2011, and we hope to go there again next winter.

My wife and I stayed two weeks at the Sand Villa and found it to be a great experienxe. Helpful staff, good food and drink.. We had a corner room with hardwood floors and clean comfortable beds and bathroom. The Tour Desk guide, Misa, was very good and arranged tours to the outer Islands for us. If you go tell Misa that the guy who worked on her laptop said stop by. We will be staying here again.

I was disappointed with my No Shore accommodations and loved Waikiki so much I found this hotel for price reasons only. I was at the end of a 3 week stay in Hawaii, the first 2 weeks spent at another Waikiki hotel with my 20 yr old son who left 5 days before I set toleave.I was given an upgrade as soon as I checked into the hotel, 3rd floor by the pool. The room was very large with a kitchenette, comfortable and clean.I originally booked a standard room with a city view, the cheapest thing they had to offer so the upgrade was a nice surprise. The 2 draw backs for me with this hotel is the location and the so-called "Continental Breakfast" you receive as part of your cost of the room. It's a loooonnnnggggg walk to the beach, especially with a surfboard. But, If you like hangin' around the downstairs hotel bar/restaurant and pool, you'll love this place. The Jacuzzi was great too, especially after a long day of surfing!! Ok, now the so-called breakfast....they give you paper vouchers enough for each morning of your stay which is understandable but the breakfast is simply toast, watered down pineapple juice and canned pineapple, oh yea and coffee. That's it! All I can say is prisoners get better breakfasts, essentially it's "bread and water" folks. If I was running this hotel I'd either remove the breakfast totally or spring for an extra few bucks and at least offer cold cereal.

While the staff at this hotel couldn't be better - very friendly and helpful, our room itself was terrible: a hard, old matress covered in plastic which made us sweat every and all night. The carpet was stained and disguisting, and there were paint chips throughout the bathroom.The second disadvantage was the noice factor ... very noisy every night. We have been to Hawaii over 20 times, and next to the Waikiki Banyan this was our worst hotel experience. Avoid it if you can.

We stayed at the Sand Villa with our 3 sons ages 11,17 and 23. We've stayed at other very nice hotels right on the beach so in comparison this was not that as bad as I've read.The staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel lobby itself seems a little dirty and could use some cleaning. Rooms were "Okay" Didn't like the twin beds in the room at all.The restaurant was great. Good food. Good prices. Bartender was really nice.For the price it's a good value. Close walk to the beach and other places to eat like Smorgies buffet...good if you have big boys with big appetites with you. Also close enough to busy night life if you want to go out and explore in the evening.The one true thing that I keep reading is their continental breakfast IS in fact, a joke. You'd think after all the reviews they'd improve on that a big. Gogurt? No thanks. Old cold toast? Pass. For the price it's not bad though. If you just want a place to sleep that's not too shabby or scary it's good. I'd stay again.

Stayed 5 nights with my boyfriend. The booking process was slowed down because the site doesn't accept european addresses so I had to finalise the booking by phone, all went well in the end and communication with reception has been smooth.The room had a fancy machine on the toilet with water jets... I guess it was something that the many Japanese guests appreciate.The bar is open to outside guests. One of the bartender was very rude to us on one occasion, that was a bit of a turnoff and lowers my score on service, altough the rest of the staff have been averagely helpful.Pro: location (Waikiki, canal side, near the bus stops - we have used public transport to explore the whole island). The hotel offers a free airport shuttle but need to be booked in advace. Free wireless connection in the room, altough was very slow and we have asked fot a cable, that was much better. A free tour info desk is also available. The view on the canal was quite nice. Breakfast included... but... see next point :)Cons: OK it's free breakie, but prepare for the tiniest hotel treat ever. Gym: super tiny room with a couple machines only. I haven't tried it but it look unkempt.Overall we have enjoyed our stay and can recommend the hotel for those on a budget.

My husband I spent 6 nights at the Sand Villa in December, 2010. It was a very pleasant experience. We had a corner room with hardwood floors, a wraparound balcony overlooking the canal and the golf course, and that funny but useful toilet all for under $100 per night. Other positives included : the bar/restaurant with a special shoutout to Deb, the bartender, the quietness of the room, very reasonable parking fee, shuttle service to and from the airport, and the hospitality room with free computers.Minor complaints are that the bed was a tad lumpy and that one day the room didn't get cleaned.All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would return.

We stayed for five nights at the Waikiki Sand Villa over Thanksgiving and while the walking distance to everything was great the hotel was not. The room had terribly worn carpet and was very dirty, the bathroom sink had been cracked all the way across the basin and the floor was filthy in there as well. the inside wall had coffee or something that color splattered all over it from the top to the bottom of the way the room was so small you had to walk sideways to go between the bottom of the bed and the dresser where the tv was. We will not stay here again I felt unclean and dirty every time i went in the room. We had a view of the ala moana canal and the roof of the building we also had a view of was littered with hypodermic needles. We were also right above the back of the restaurant/bar so had a great view of all the garbage bins and had to listen to twice daily bottle dumpings in the garbage bins. The only good thing was we were in hawaii so did not have to spend much time in that filthy room. Never again would definately not recommend

The Good:Central location in Waikiki, inexpensive, attentive front desk staff, nice pool & hot tub, plenty of towels available for the beach, valet parking is the cheapest in Waikiki at $15.00 per day (don't forget to tip the valet a buck or two), about a 3 block walk to beautiful beaches, clean. The Bad: very uncomfortable/ hard plastic wrapped mattresses, the car/bus/semi traffic noise is overwhelming on the front and rear of the building, the city view is actually a view of the hotel across the street, the continental breakfast (breakfasts lite) consisted of tiny Costco croissants, canned pineapple in small cups and toast.Final thoughts: its a cheap room in an expensive venue. Request a room on floors 6-9 facing Diamond head. The view is much better and the traffic noise is less overwhelming. The restaurant offers a decent steak dinner with rice for about $10.00. Be prepared to sweat all night long on the plastic wrapped, hard as concrete mattresses.

Let me preface this by saying the following: This hotel is located right next to low budget apartments, right above Ala Wai Blvd..The reason we stayed here is because we extended our trip a whole extra week..... and our original Hotel Aston at the Beach was already booked those dates... To summate our stay here, let's see:1. We booked for a king Size bed in the room.... upon arrival we were told that they were sold out of King size bed room suites..... and they only have 5 King size rooms in the whole hotel. Please keep this in mind, they really mean it when they say bookings are not guranteed.- They check us into an OK room hardwood floor, Japanese Bidet in the bathroom.. however, the only rooms available had 1 full size bed and 1 twin bed....Make a long story short..... we put the two beds together.....My husband did not deserve a twin size bed...come on now!1. First night, we are awoke at 4am, to a drunken couple " doing it" ...... we could hear grunts and the manly sounding lady saying " oooh baby.... ooohhh baby" ..... LOL! i immediately was on the phone with the front desk, who didn't do much about it.- I followed up at 8am, complained again to Nancy... she was great at her job!Nancy said the loud drunken couple were checking out that day so it wouldn't be a prob...however.... she later called, to our dismay, to tell us that the couple would not be checking out.!!!!!!!!!!!....... but she was able to find us our king size bed suite. Rm. 420. Corner room. too good to be true right?Please see my attached pictures :Room 420 , did not have hardwood floors or a bidet...... it has old really dirty nasty dingy carpet, so disgusting that we chose to wear our shoes indoors, and just a regular toilet seat, and soap and shampoo dispensers.....There were bugs living on top of the Armoire drawer..... they almost looked like little white fleas... .In addition :- There were holes in the curtains/draperies- Bird poop all over the " balcony" and chairs/table-Rooms are not cleaned until about 5pm each day....... we had to call the front desk each day; we purposely did our excursions first....... and left the room to be cleaned... I mean , how crappy is that, you come back to a dirty hotel room after a long day out when all you want to do is come home and relax.....- Also, the " stainless steel" towel rack in our bathroom had mold growing all over it.- DIRTY DIRTY CARPETS !!!!!Yes, this hotel is definitely a " budget" hotel, and as i said before, if you don't mind sleeping in a dump, then stay here....however......In Oahu, you really do get what you pay for........... i expected this to be a budget hotel but i wasn't expecting it to be soo damn rundown. It's like, they are so many guests/$$$ checking in, and they can't be bothered to clean the carpet, clean the fungus/mold growing on the towel rack, .......The only good things :-Somewhat walking distance to all the downtown stuff..only 3 blocks away from International Marketplace....-Free Internet ( you actually need key card to open the door but some people who are not guests will come to this hotel, get into the elevator and knock on the door for you to open it... i mean what are you going to say, " um sorry against the rules" ....-Decent Happy hour at the Sand Bar and grill, however food is very limited in choices and in addition, very prices.....10 bucks for a breakfast, small portions!OOH WAIT! I almost forgot to mention the "Free Continental Breakfast" ......I guess we were spoiled, having just checked out of the Aston On the beach Hotel.... but wow, really low marks for this continental breakfast....... All you can eat burnt toast, coffee, watered down pineapple juice, and a sliver of pineapple served in a tiny 6 oz cup.They do serve croissants but the attendant lady is serving them one by one on a single small plate, and will make sure to tell you " only one per person".. she practically will snatch it out of your hand....they run out quick ! They literally hide the croissants and dole them out ONLY one per person..... I actually took my toast up to my room, who is going to say no!

We seem to keep gravitating back to the Sand Villa whenever we go to Oahu for a holiday. The hotel always offers good value, clean rooms, friendly staff, an adequate and sunny pool, an excellent kitchen in the Sand Bar, an outstanding - if pricey - sushi restaurant, an ok fitness centre, Hospitality Room for free internet access, and a simple continental breakfast. The hotel is smallish by Waikiki standards, with only about 200 rooms and 10 kitchenette suites, but most of those rooms offer a decent view, as the building benefits from low rise apartments to the west. This makes for great happy hours on the lanai of your room, as you relax in the warm tropical climate and watch the lovely sunsets. And it is close to the heart of Waikiki, the divine beaches, the Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium, Kapiolani Park, a million ABC stores, TheBus routes to Hanauma Bay, Sea Life Park, Ala Moana shopping. This hotel is highly recommended to all Hawaiian vacationers who seek the active Waikiki lifestyle.

I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a conference just so I could enjoy honolulu for a few more days. Don't expect a view of waikiki despite the name of the hotel. But it does have cute view of the Ala Wai Canal. The room was alright for the price. Had everything I needed because I just wanted to explore honolulu and mostly needed a place to sleep at night. Had free wifi access, a decent size tv, refrigerator for my beers and leftovers, and a nice little deck to sit and drink at the end of the day. Nothing fancy, but definitely comfortable. The hotel staff was above and beyond nice and helpful with everything from early check in (because I had to move my stuff from the Royal Hawaiian at the end of my conference) to the getting cabs, and finally booking the airport shuttle. Very accomodating and friendly for the price and type of hotel. Also the hotel is only a 5-7 min walk (depending on your speed) to beautiful waikiki beach and all the shopping. Plenty of restaurants and convenience stores around and starbucks too! The only complaint I had was on the morning before I was checking out there was no hot water in the shower! This was 4 in the morning and who knows why. I just took a cold shower because it was warm weather and wasn't a huge deal..

The hotel is an older building, and the rooms are fairly small. Most rooms have either 3 twin beds or 1 double and 1 twin. The rooms are clean, and we were upgraded to a room on the 9th floor facing east so we had a gorgeous view of the sunrise, the canal, and Diamond Head. Decent size mini fridge in the room, free wifi (get the password at the front desk), but it's painfully slow. Ask for an ethernet cable at the front desk to save yourself some trouble. Pool and jacuzzi were nice, but they close on the early side at 9pm. There's a complimentary fitness room, business center with computers and printers (10 cents a page), and co-op laundry. Valet parking only for $16/day, which isn't too bad compared to other hotels in Waikiki. If you book online through their website, parking is 50% off ($8/day) or you can park at the Waikiki Banyan for $10/day or $60/week. It's a few blocks away, ~10 min walk.The free breakfast is pretty lame, but it's free, so I won't knock it too much. Toast, mini croissants (which they run out of fast), canned Dole peaches, canned pineapple juice, coffee, and tea. If you bring your own thermos, they might fill it with coffee for you. Some of the staff were nicer than others. We stayed for a week, and only had 1 problem. The cleaning staff left our door room ajar, but luckily nothing was missing. We complained to the front desk, and the manager apologized and sent us a gift basket. Overall, it was a decent hotel. Don't go with high expectations.

Great location, within walking distance to the strip/beach, shuttles; parking on the grounds; very friendly workers; great view; quiet (11th floor); great prices, especially for someone on a budget; (2) queen size beds that were comfortable; laundry facilities; nice pool and hot tub; only one thing that could have been better is the breakfast, but then it was only a continental breakfast.

this hotel for the price was pretty good, we were not looking for any big expectations from the hotel, we were just using for sleeping but good place. we used the swimming pool in the hotel the very last day most of the time we spend out.little the front desk staff was not that nice with good greeting each time we ask for help or we just pass over there, but that why the housekeepers we doing great job with our room and were very nice each time they saw us, happen to meet the housekeeping manager in the other floor while i get lost and ask for directions and I must say he was very nice person and even he asked us about our happiness and satisfies from the cleanliness on the room. thank him personally for the housekeeping stuff doing good work in our room. our room was on the 7th floor and the view from the room was pretty nice i like, each morning i wake up i was at the balcony.
user_name:
Aleksandar S
Glens Falls, New York

review_body: Just returned from our second stay at this hotel (the first being 2 years ago). The hotel is great value compared to the many somewhat overpriced hotels that dominate this area. Located just a 5 minute walk from the beach unless you want to stay right on the beach itself, this hotel couldn't be better located.The rooms are basic with flat screen TV and fridge/small freezer. They are kept very clean by the staff with bed linen and towels changed daily. There is free WiFi in all the rooms and bar/reception area and there is also a small business centre providing free computer usage and printing at a cost of 10c per sheet.The hotel arranges free airport pick-up and drop-off for stays over 5 nights with Ilima and this went very smoothly and was a big saving on the usual $35 one-way taxi fare.Overall I can't recommend this hotel highly enough for anyone wanting a near beach location in Waikiki on a budget. This was our second stay at this hotel and we'll definitely be back at this hotel the next time we're in Waikiki.

We stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks. The hotel needed some maintenance. On the first nite , we could hear sirens, trucks, buses and trolleys zipping by and people making generally having a good time noises. After a few days, we got use to the sounds , we were able to sleep. The location was very close ,approximately 2 blocks away from the beach and tourist hot spot..The house keeping staff kept our room clean and fresh smelling daily. No complains about the cleanliness of the hotel.The Breakfast was a quicky breakfast, toast, coffee, juice and pineapple, which was just enought to get the day started.There were many travellers in the hotel that were from the orient. The majority were friendly and courteous.If you want an elaborate decor and a fancy lobby, this hotel is not for you. It' s a no frills type of hotel that you want to just shower and crash.

I was simply looking for a clean quiet hotel near Waikiki. I don't need fancy. Yet the Sand Villa still managed to disappoint me. The front staff was quiet curt at check in. We didn't get the king bed room we requested, and the rooms were tiny....almost Europen tiny. There were "leftovers" from the previous guest in the fridge...and the A/C didn't work. So, we asked to be moved to another room. After telling the front desk staff that I am a VERY light sleeper, I wasgiven a room on the 6th floor over looking a major street. The street noise wasn't as bad as I expected, but the sound proofing between floors was nonexsistant. All night it sounded like the people above us were about to come through my ceiling. It was so bad that the first 2 nights I slept out on the balcony, because it was quieter. The next morning I discovered that the shower pressure was terrible and their morning "breakfast" was a joke. Coffee, cold toast and a few bites of canned pineapple. It was about a 15 minute walk to Waikiki, which was fine for 2 adults, but I can't imagine doing it two or three times a day with little ones. I will never stay at the Sand Villa again!

My friend and I stayed here for a week and it was the worst place I have ever stayed in my life! The beds were incredibly uncomfortable and I'm not sure if it was the detergent or the lack of washing-bed bugs? but I broke out in a rash and bites all over which led to me sleeping on top of the comforter for the remaining nights. The bar/restaurant downstairs was horrible. Every drink we had were watered down and nasty tasting. The only plus was the lack of people at the pool which was nice to have all to ourselves and the location-being 2 blocks from Waikiki. Continental breakfast consisted of previously toasted bread thrown into a basket which was cold, chunks of pineapple from a can, and then the water/juice from said can of pineapple acting as "pineapple juice". This place was definitely good for a budget but had nothing else to offer. Do not go here unless you are desperate!

This is our 4th time at this hotel, it is clean, the staff friendly and helpful, the pool area just magic, OK the breakfast isn't much but it is onl;y breakfast, the rooms are kept clean, I will return again for another visit hopefully not too far in the future

Stayed for 4 nights on our way from mainland USA to Australia. Room on the 9th floor OK although carpet in hallway needed replacing. Great pool and Bar areas Enjoyed the food. Thanks to Sharon and Bobby

We were staying in Kauai and booked an airplane/hotel deal through Expedia for two nights at about $400 total. I checked the hotel on line and noticed they offered free WiFi, a continental breakfast and the pictures looked really nice- I thought I was really getting a bargain. Ha, what a rip off. We took a shuttle from the airport to the hotel, making several stops along the way at real nice hotels and resorts. I as really getting my hopes up. When they came to the Sand Villa, it might as well been name the Sand Flea-ah. What an old looking, run down dump. Good thing we didn't have a car rental as they would have charged us $20 a night to store it. The person checking us in was really "short" with us. The room was small and the bed was a full size-both my wife and I are tall so our feet hung off the bed all night long. They had a small fridge and range. The A/C sits above the bed and was noisy and dusty. There was no ocean view, only brick from the one window and the pool from the other. The Wifi didn't work and it took the IT guy a day to show up to my room and fix it. When we got up the first morning, the lobby was full of Asian tourists- elbow to elbow. The breakfast consisted of toast, a small cup of pineapples, water and coffee. I took four pieces up to the room and two glasses of pineapple. When we got back to the hotel from Pearl Harbor the next night, we wanted to go to the pool, but again, it was full of Asians, literally hundreds of them. I guess they must really advertise in China and Japan, and cater to this group of people because I didn't see any other race there the whole time. They converted two rooms at night to a sushi restaurant, but it looked private so we didn't attempt to enter in. The bellhop was the only thing nice about the whole stay, as he stored our luggage for us and shared small talk while we waited for our ride back to the airport. I don't think we'll have to worry about coming back, especially since Honolulu is a joke as well- Pearl harbor unfortunately was a disappointment too. At least the flea market at Aloha stadium was worthwhile. The bus system takes too long to go anywhere and the beaches are full of 1960 wannabees. Stay away from here.

We went to hawaii for 3 weeks and stayed at this hotel the first 3 days of our stay on Oahu; the room was quite big, we had everything we needed..king size bed, lanai, refrigerator, tv...perfect for the price and the location. After a month looking for a hotel under 100 $ this one was the best...one of the few including breakfast...(just a simple wiki-wiki breakfast) but good enough ;)...We went back to Oahu for our last 2 days and choose again this hotel..we knew what we were going to find, and that was good enough for us ;)

I researched for over 5 months for a hotel in Hawaii near Waikiki beach. I also read many many reviews on all the hotels in the area. The Waikiki Sand Villa is the best in the area in my opinion. The hotel not only is very reasonable in terms of price but it is just 3 short blocks from the beach and it is a nice walk with many lovely shops along the way. Also you can take a nice walk along the canel just right across the street from the hotel. If you can please get a corner room above the 9th floor because it will give you view of the canel and decent view of the ocean. The hotel's location is close to the beach but yet far enough away so that you can have your peace. The staff especially Nancy Thong are the best with always willing to help you with anything you require. Other staff members Robert, Rey, Judith, Oscar, Henry and Bobby are there to meet your every need. So if you want a nice hotel within a limited price range please consider the Waikiki Sand Villa, I know that I will be back next year that is for sure.

We were so surprised about this hotel. For less than 50 euro's per night we didn't expect anything! But the hotel was clean and the room was specious enough. I loved the toilet with the watertap that cleans your bottom....;-) It was just a short walk to the beach. And yes , breakfast was poor, but it is so nice that it is included! Just drop by and grab a yoghurtstick and you're off to the beach!

Stayed here in March 2010, with my husband, kids 9 & 13, and grandma too. We picked the Sand Villa due to its proximity to the beach and shopping, as well as the price. A bonus for us, was that the hotel included continental breakfast, and had a hot tub. Not many hotels we researched in Waikiki had those 2 ammenities. We found the Sand Villa to be well used, but also clean and very friendly. It was great for us to get rooms that had 3 single beds (no kids fighting about sleeping arrangements) and the toilet/bidet was an interesting addition to the washroom. The bathroom has a dispenser for liquid soap and shampoo in the bathtub/shower area. I brought my own conditioner and was glad I did. Our room had a little fridge, coffeemaker and tv. The coffee is free only the first day, and then you can buy the packets at the front desk if you choose. We knew this in advance and packed some filters and coffee so we could enjoy coffee whenever we wanted. We used the valet parking which was easy and billed to our room at the end of our stay. This cost 15.75 per day. Our car rental was from Dollar, and we got a great rate by using the Entertainment book. Free breakfast was great to get us started in the morning, and saved on our overall budget. Two blocks to the beach was convenient, although the pool and hot tub area of the hotel was very nice and secluded with tropical foliage throughout, making it a nice retreat at the end of a busy day. Shopping and restaurants were only a block away. A nice feature of the hotel was free internet access in the hospitality room, and free use of the room at the end of the day when our flight left late in the evening. It had internet access so we could check our flight status, and a small bath with shower to freshen up. We asked for some pool towels before we checked out so we could enjoy the beach/pool area one last time before our flight. The hotel is located right on the corner of the Ali Wai Canal, and so there is a bit of noise from the traffic, and the emergecy vehicle station (the odd ambulance every day) but still less than if you stay right on Kuhio. Bottom line, we would stay again.

If you're a snob,this is not the place for you..But if you want to feel like family and really enjoy yourself..this is the place to be..The bar and restaraunt were awesome,price and quality was unbelievable...bedding was a liitle hard for me,(at home I sleep on a 6 inch feather bed)but if we went back we would go over to macys and get a featherbed for the stay and ship it home on our last day..THE VIEW AND OUR ROOM WAS AWESOME!!!Cant't wait to see Dee and the others...lol

I went here for my honeymoon and the tubs were not clean. The water smelled like urine and i didn't like the wall headboard. The elevators were broken. So there was only one elevator and our last night some woman was walking through downtown screaming and crying in the streets. (No fault of the hotel). Other than the dirty bathroom it was an okay stay but my honeymoon would have been better if it was a luxury resort. I will say this though, the pool was great and the staff was friendly!

Very clean and well maintained (decor ready for an update though) - Beds really comfy, shower good, good views front and back, Staff helpful and efficient (asked for more pillows - they took less than 5 mins to respond)..wee bit noisy, but this is the price of a central location. The electric toilet with seat warmer and built in bidet hilarious....I want one! Breakfast (Toast/jam/juice/coffee/fruit/yoghurt) kept the hunger at bay till dinnertime. Happy hour and bar good fun and good value (good steak). The in-house travel advisor is to be taken with a pinch of salt...scary..... was insistant on telling us where we should go.....I wanted an 'round the island trip' just to get my head around things quickly...'Oh! we don't' do those...and you don't want to take The Bus......' she raved on a bit...with the result I booked a trip on the street (well you gotta gamble sometimes) through a company called Explore Hawaii - $24 all day from 8.30 - 5.30 with Donny the Driver - fantastic Value also booked a BOB (Breathable Observation Bubble) -my only crit was the value of the Hanauma Bay trip - $18.99 - should have got 'TheBus' and rented snorkelling gear there - cheaper and would have given us more time on this Brill Beach - If you want the turtles they hide round the back of the rocks where the current's stronger, so hire a life vest first --- I'm saving to go back it was so great - and we only saw 5 flies the whole time - Amazing!

very reasonable price. hotel needs updating, but clean and comfortable. short walk to beach. breakfast wasn't much but it was somethinkg to carry you through until lunch.rooms are small but clean. And you aren't in the room all that much anyway

This hotel is a great value and is an easy walk to just about anything that Waikiki has to offer if you are willing to walk a few minutes to save hundreds of dollars. It is rated as two and a half stars on most travel websites which I think is fair. It really would be nicer with just a little touching up: some paint and some carpet cleaning, especially in the guest rooms and hallways. I don't want to imply that it was dirty, because the rooms were given plenty of attention by housekeeping and the staff took good care of the place, ownership just needs to give a little attention to detail. The pool area is small but well kept and beautiful. The wiki breakfast is exactly what they advertise and had toast, canned pineapple, donuts, croissants,coffee and juice. It was plenty if you don't need a huge breakfast each day. The best part of the place is the Sand Bar downstairs, reasonably priced with good food and drinks (Cocktails for $3 at happy hour and they were NOT watered down!). The bar staff is awesome and make you truly feel welcome as a visitor. They not only take care of guests but draw a regular local group that are equally friendly. The hotel staff were friendly and will help you in any way the can but they don't necessarily go out of their way to make sure you are ok, you have to ask for assistance. Overall, this is a hotel for folks that are independent travelers and can figure things out for themselves and are working with a budget. You can't come into it thinking you are going to be staying at the some ritzy Waikiki hotel. I would not hesitate to stay again because of the great deals to be found here.

Hello - just spent seven nights at this hotel. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Rooms are ok for the price you pay, a lot of the hotels in Waikiki are very old and dated so no surprise there. Would skip the breakfast, but meals in the bar/restaurant are good and price is reasonable. I thought the pool was huge and a highlight of the property. Would stay at this hotel again if got a cheap price.

i dont know what all these people are complaining about. this hotel is grat. Unless you wanted to spend a arm and a leg in waikiki this hotel is great. I booked for 7 nights and i loved every bit of it. got a great view of the canal and golf course. honestly who goes to waikiki and stay in the hotel? i paided 66 dollars a night and stay on the 12th floor. the bar is great and when happy hour starts its even better the pool was nice no too big not to small but for 66 a night im not one to complain. the hot tub is always hot even when its 3 in the morning. the free breakfast can be a little better just toast/pinapple/juice/mini donuts, but over all this hotel was great to me and i will for sure BOOOK again in july when i go again :]

My wife and I stayed at the hotel for three nights. The TV was a seventeen inch flatscreen (reallly small!). We asked for a king bed and got a double and a twin. There was a baday in the bathroom with heated seat. The complimentary coffee for the room is first day only afterwards you pay for it. No microwaves in the rooms but you can upgrade to a kitchen unit for around $35 extra a night. The hot tub wasn't hot and was very dirty. The pool is heated by the sun and is a bit cold for my liking. The restaraunt in the hotel is not too bad and makes good mixed drinks. They will serve you drinks out at the hot tub if you order at the counter. Average is about 5-15 dollars for a meal. They have happy hour specials for drinks at 2.25 for wells. The breakfast consists of Kona coffee, cup of pineapple (canned), croissant, donuts (mini), and "Go-Gurt" squeazable yogurt. There is also a "hidden" sushi place at the hotel which appears to be popular with many of the Japanese guests. The housekeeping is very slow so if you are near the top like we were don't expect to get your room cleaned until late afternoon. They have a hospitality room which has free internet (don't expect hotel internet in your room to work). There is a "spa" on premesis. It is nice and they give a decent massage Just watch out for the hidden fees ( you will see an advertised price of $65 for an hour and will pay about $82 for that massage). Hotel is well within walking distance to Waikiki beach but is the equivalent of about four city blocks even though they say two blocks. The hotel was fairly quiet, pretty clean, conveniently located.

We needed just one night in Waikiki since we were between a cruise and a week's stay at a resort in Ko Olina. According to the pictures online, this hotel looked lovely and was a great deal..... Our two sons had booked a night the week before for one night before our cruise and located a wonderful room in the Waikiki harbor area. Unfortunately, we were swayed by the advertisement for this hotel for "1/2 price winter rates with a continental breakfast." The rooms were old and falling apart - paint peeling off the "balcony furniture" and stained rugs. We booked two rooms because we were 5 adults - and the rooms did not look like the pictures advertised. The free "wifi" also advertised did not work in either room. Upon our arrival, we were too early to check in and our bags were put into storage. Two of our bags were misplaced. These two bags contained computers and books/papers from our son's PhD rotations. The front desk clerks (two young men who should be trained as to customer service) thought it a joke when we asked to contact the police because of the value of the contents in these bags - neither budged to help us and one was amused by our plight. Our bags were located and the only person who should be given any admiration was the employee in charge of the security room who truly was concerned and helped us. The continental breakfast was a joke.... tea and coffee in urns, toast thrown into a wicker basket, canned pineapple dumped in a bowl and some juice and frozen gogurts... all set out in a rather unsanitary area on the way to the "pool." Neither room was worth the original cost of $240 per night (and we did get the 1/2 price deal for each room) while our sons had a beautiful room the only night for $90 overlooking the harbor. Oh, I forgot to mention the beds - the most uncomfortable beds with a heavy plastic covering over the mattress covered only by a thin sheet that constantly slipped off the mattress. We had met other people following the cruise who also booked this hotel and their feelings were the same - What a mistake!

I stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa for 10 days November 2009. I had an excellent experience. I paid $67.50/night and was upgraded to a top floor room with a view of the Ala Wai canal. I was given a discount for staying more than one week & free airport transportation with Ilima for staying more than four days. There was an in-room safe, undercounter frig, coffeemaker, lanai with 2 chairs and low table. Ice machines every-other floor. Two elevators. 6 computers with free internet in the hospitality room on the 2nd floor. Coin-op laundry. The pool area is beautiful and not overly crowded during the day. This hotel is well cared for, very clean, with extremely helpful and friendly staff, in my experience. -suze

I was put in 3 different rooms during my stay. The first room was infested with mites. We could see some of them crawling on the bed and on our skin. We asked for a cleaner room. We were then given a key to a room with water (a stream going from under the AC all the way across the room and under the beds. We asked for a new room again. The third room was also infested. I could see other guests scratching in line for "breakfast," which consisted of a croissant and a piece of toast. The bathroom counter slants in such a way that items slowly slide into the toilet. There were hookers hanging out iin the lobby. Both bikes in the gym were broken. The towels on the floor were not replaced by housekeeping. All of the AC units leaked. We used our trash cans to catch the fallling water. There was no waterproof curtain in the shower, so if the (I think it was thin linen) curtain gets soaked, the floor will flood. Needless to say, we checked out early and notified the desk employees about the situation, who promised us a refund. The manager was conveniently "unavailable" for the first couple of days. With persistence (on our part only) we were able to get a refund for the two days that we did NOT stay there. This hotel is not worth the money, and it is a health/sanitation hazard. The manager's name is nancy.

I have stayed at several hotels in Waikiki. Just experienced prior to The Sand Villa a 'Ocean Resort'. I am a champagne gal on a beer budget. Give me The Sand Villa again. 2 blocks up from central Waikiki Beach. This 'beer' friendly place has free internet in their hospitality room. Their bar and restaurant has super inexpensive drinks and food. The food is great. I am a bit of a picky one too. The complimentary breakfast is just that. The location is off the super touristy strip. Take the local bus to get around. You can walk too!! {I have waited to write this review due to the fact that I can't spell 'boday' as in a very clean experience on the toilet} I will sleep on a twin futon any day to have the luxury of a 'boday' in my budget room.

After staying in a number of hotels where I experienced both racism and homophobia (as a solo Indian lesbian traveller I have had some indirect and direct discrimination), it was a relief to find a hotel where the staff were welcoming and I felt that I was treated equally to other travellers. The hotel is away from the main beach strip - but you are only 5 minutes away. It's nice to look out over the Ala Wai canal at night with all the palm trees. It's really easy access to buses and if you drive it's simple to get to the main highways. There is only valet parking at around $15 a day. There is a Foodland nearby and there is a laundry room and internet terminals (free). The continental breakfast isn't great, but in general the hotel has a friendly atmosphere.
It was a nice stay and convenient location. Only a few minutes walk to the beach and the waikiki central area.It's not a grand 5 star, but nice and neat enough for a comfortable stay.

We thought this was a great hotel for less than $60/night. Room had comfortable beds and were quiet. The bathroom had a good strong shower and fancy washlet toilet. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The decor was outdated and the Wiki Wiki breakfast was not as we had been led to believe...the yogurt and fresh pineapple was go-gurt and canned pineapple, BUT the on premise restaurant was well priced and delicious; we tried and loved the 3-item omelets and fish & chips made with mahi-mahi and local Kona Brewing Company beer. We had a 9th floor room overlooking the canal and it was an easy walk to shopping and Waikiki beach. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

We only stayed here two nights and we felt we'd hit the jackpot. The location was just perfect.......close enough to walk to Waikiki Beach and all the fun but away from the busyness when it came time to sleep. We loved our wrap around balcony that looked out on the canal and the backend of Diamond Head. The room was quite adequate, clean and comfortable.I'd read the breakfast wasn't all that much, and I would agree - croissants, toast, pineapple, juice/coffee........but it was perfect for us. (I think they also had some little donuts, but never had them to choose from when we were making our choices.) I had dreaded the valet parking, quite frankly, but no worries......we didn't go in/out that much and it was quick.Overall I was really pleased with our choice and would stay there again.

Our stay at Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel was very good, but we got ripped-off by the shuttle the hotel valet arranged for us when we went to the U.S.S. Arizona. When we asked the desk clerk about getting the city bus to the U.S.S. Arizona, he told us that would take too long but the parking valet could arrange a shuttle for us. He did and the driver from Hawaian Pacific was very pleasant. When we got to the U.S.S Arizona he gave us a cell number and told us to call when we were ready to return. We paid him, at that time, the full round-trip fair. So when we were ready to return we called the cell number he gave us four times and only got the Hawaiian Pacific answering machine. We waited over and hour and finally took the bus back. When we got back, there was not a manager on duty so they had us file a complaint with the head of security. We also talked about it on the evaluation the asked us to complete. I guess its not so much the money, but that the hotel never responded to our complaint and you would think they would be concerned about a shuttle service they use ripping off their guests. So...if a valet named Bobby offers to arrange a shuttle for you, run like hell.

Overlooks Ala Wai canal, and maybe a 10-minute walk to the beaches of Waikiki. Nice, basic room, well-appointed. Parking is valet, but pretty cheap, includes in/out, and is discounted 50% when u book online to their website (which was also cheaper than any other booking option). Pool area is lovely and quiet, though small and shaded - which we enjoyed, actually. Breakfast is fairly basic - mini donuts and croissants, pineapple and yogurt and toast and oj. And what a great, little bar! Cheap drinks (and an even cheaper Happy Hour), nice folks. The food in the restaurant (well, we ate at the bar) was really good, fresh, and cheap. I mean REALLY good - best meal we had in the islands, and i can still recall the taste of the fish dish we were served ... for $10 for the whole dinner. Gave me a discount coupon for my next stay (good for 3 years) - you'd better believe I'll be back!!!!!!

Great value for money! The hotel is pretty dated, the furniture in the rooms are a bit old and everything could use a bit of updating. However the hotel is very comfortable. Great location and great view from your own balcony in every room. The breakfast included isn't the biggest one, but does it's job.

Recently stayed and have no complaints. Price was great. Hotel was within walking distance of beach, zoo, shops and restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Upon return to the states, my son found he had left his iPod. We called hotel and they had it. He is in the service on the Island so when he returned from being on leave and went to the hotel, they had his iPod waiting for him. Our room was upgraded to one with kitchenette. Will stay here when we return to the island.

I would have been very upset with the rooms and service at the hotel if the price was not so drastically low. The hotel does not offer an airport shuttle, a long with almost every hotel in the Waikiki area, and we ended up paying $30 in advance for two round trips. At first glance the hotel appears to be very clean, however, as you start your way to the room you will quickly smell and see that this hotel is definitely not tidy. The quality of the hotel can be summed up in the fact that the mattresses are completely covered in thick plastic. I have never experienced this before and found it difficult to acclimate myself to the sounds it made as we slept. It was very uncomfortable to say the least. The hotel does have high speed internet, but it is not WiFi so upon checking in make sure to ask for an Ethernet chord for your computer. The pool area seemed to be very pleasant, but with the Waikiki beach in such close proximity it seems pointless to lay next to the hotel pool. The breakfast offered is quite limited. We were served our choice of toasted bread, croissants, pineapple from a can, diluted pineapple juice from the can, yogurt in a tube, and coffee. Luckily, we did not stay at the hotel except to sleep otherwise it would have been a depressing vacation. If you plan staying out of the hotel for the majority of the time and are under a tight budget, then this hotel is what you are looking for.

Although the hotel is just a block from Waikiki Beach the hotel had everything we were looking for at a cost that certainly was within our budget! Views of the mountains and the local canal were beautiful and the rooms, although basic, had everything we needed for our break. Everything seemed within easy walking distance and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. A bonus was the unlimited internet access and the facilities of the hospitality room on waiting for our deprature to the airport. Would certainlly stay here again if ever the opportunity arose!

We stayed on the 9th floor of this hotel. The room was not overly roomy but adequate for what we needed. Bathroom nice and clean. The staff we dealt with were fine. The pool in the hotel was great and quite big for the hotel size. The internet room was great, free use of internet, massage chairs also available in the room great massage for $5. Location was more than fine with less than a 10 minute to anything you would need.

The rooms were decent and great for the price. But when you stay hotel you don't wanna be sweating getting ready. We had them check the AC and they said nothing is wrong. But it was hot. Like it was so hot that my car AC was way cooler. The pool area is great. The bar was good. It just was Hot!!!

I have stayed at the Sand Villa twice in the past 3 years and I was thoroughly impressed. It's cheap and wonderful. The rooms are clean, the staff are very friendly, the food outlets in the hotel are great. Complimentary breakfast is not that great, but seriously you get what you pay for so I am not complaining, I was happy with what I got. The pool is beautiful and clean. The location in fantastic, five minute walk to the beach, everything is within walking distance. I love it there. On my next visit to Honolulu I will definately be staying there.

After reading some of the mixed reviews of the Sand Villa, I really wasn't sure what to expect. Seemed like most travelers liked the place, and the price was only about $60 per night. After staying there for 14 days, I was most impressed to say the least!The rooms were a little small but clean and more than adequate, The bed was perfect and sanitary, due to the plastic sheet covering the mattress. I really didn't want to sleep atop ancient body fluids and bed bugs. The sheet was covered by a thick fabric cover and bottom sheet, so I hardly knew it was there. The bathroom was functional as was the TV set, large mini fridge. The dresser was huge and the rest of the furnature and decor were nice as well, the big teakwood mirror was a nice touch. Both sides of the hotel have spectacular views of the Ala Moana Canal, and the golfcourse and mountains beyond. No I coundn't see the ocean, but the view was just fine.. The carpet was older but clean, I spent most of the time barefoot, and it was never an issue. I was on the sixth floor and road noise was never an issue. I read a few negative reviews about the carpet, noise, ect.. but I disagree, I was there for half a month, and the rooms were more than adequate. For the price, it was a downright steal!!! The rooms do have internet, just borrow a cable from the front desk. It's not the fastest, but fine for my purposes, including online phone calls.When reading other reviews, most people agreed that the location was a good one. I timed the walk to the beach, and it was exactly 7 minutes. If it look 10 minutes or longer for you then, you must be crippled or something. It's central location allows you to walk to anywhere in waikiki in 25 minutes or less. I enjoyed the International Market for a cheap place to eat, and highly recommend "Rainbow Sushi", which makes an excellent Miso soup for only a dollar. I had the 18 piece sushi tray for about $6. The "Haute' "Dog" place had an excellent Chicago dog, with fries and a coke for $7.50. Nearby "Fattys Chinese" was a fun place to eat, where you could watch the cook make your food from 5 feet away. For finer dining (and reasonable drinks), Duke's Place is my favorite beach bar and restaurant. Their you can buy a nice big sandwich for $8, or a full meal for less than $20, the drink prices were the most reasonable I found right on the water, with gin and tonics (made with the good stuff), for $5.00. There was usually a pleasant local musician with excellent but not overpowering music. What I loved the most about Dukes was the outdoor patio seating, where you could walk 20 feet to the beach, strip off your clothes (you need a swimsuit or shorts of course), and dive in the surf, then return to you seat, and it's all good. The music and tiki torches right on the beach, made for a perfect tranquil night. This is a very classy place, but easygoing and laid back at the same time. Much of the time I spent my evenings at the hotel pool and hot tub. After a long day of walking thru Waikiki, there is nothing better than to sit in the large and powerful hot tub, which would massage your aches away in no time. I found it to be a good place to meet new friends, since it's hard to sit in a tub without talking to the other guests. This was important to me, since I was alone. I met some very nice people there. The bar was perfect. The lighting was dim enough to be cosy, bright enough to where you could read the menu. The Bar staff were all professional and pleasant, and gave good advice on things to do and see. Wade is the only bartender whose name I can recall, but all the bar staff were first class. The bar's patrons were mainly locals, and talking to them gave me much insight on the "real Waikiki". The food was pretty good with decent prices, and I had nearly everything on the menu, This was a very nice place, and my favorite bar on Waikiki overall. Its was almost too conveniant since I closed the bar down more than a few times. I really liked the hard working dedicated staff of the Sand Villa, I got to know nearly everyone from the helpful front desk people, to the cleaning crew and the Valets. All were quite helpful and seemed happy with their jobs. Dee and Blaine from the front desk were always happy to help me with new room keys, pool towels, as were the rest of the front desk employees. When waiting for a tour I had some time to get to know the valet man "Bobby", he was very professional, loved his job, and always made sure I got to my tour bus on time. The pool crew and cleaning crew were kind and helpful as well.My cleaning lady had my room looking perfect every time with a smile. The Sand Villa is a great place to stay, what a makes a good hotel a great one is the ethos and dedication of the staff. At no point in my 14 nights did any staff member displease me. I will be coming back here next time I stay in Waikiki.

We stayed here in April 09. The rooms were a good size and clean. You could use your own laptop computer. The bathrooms were big. Waikiki beach was 2 blocks away. Easy walking distance to Beach and International Marketplace. Close to transport, shops and had good views of the Ala Wai Canal. Would stay here again.

We stayed at the Sandvilla in Oahu for one week. The room was barely adequate. The rug was dirty, there was a hole in the wall, the sink make a loud noise whenever the water was on, the door to the balcony was off of the track so we couldn't even go out there. We told management but it was never fixed for us. Also the deadbolt on the room door didn't work.The only good thing was the valet parking and the little restaurant that is in the lobby. We were not at the hotel that much, just to sleep, but we still expected better facilities.

I booked online through the hotel's website before I read anything about it. I was travelling alone and was looking for a decent location at a budget price. This hotel fit the description. Short walk to everything Waikiki has to offer.I booked a standard room which had two double beds (would be quite small if four people were staying there though, but for one I found it very spacious) and I managed to score a corner room which had a wonderful view of the Ala Wai Canal and golf course. The room could use a little updating, there were some stains on the carpet but overall tidy and clean. I've stayed in much worse for a much higher price. I experienced none of the problems that other reviewers have mentioned.I have to mention the Sand Villa Bar and Grill, great food and drinks, super friendly staff and friendly locals, very laid back and a nice place to spend an evening. Even if I didn't stay at the hotel I'd go back there. I stayed 7 nights and am confident that I will return to this hotel on my next visit to Oahu. If you don't mind a five minute walk to the beach and pretty basic accommodation I'd recommend this hotel. If you need beach views and all the comforts of home then look elsewhere.

I started my stay in the standard room and moved to the suite. The room is spacious and much nicer than the standard rooms. They have everything needed to prepare and serve a meal for four, small refrigerator, stove and microwave. There are no elevators to the upstairs suites. Definitely worth the price of the upgrade.

The room was quite small and the AC did not work correctly but, it seemed to be isolated to my room because others in my party did not seem to have the same issues. The amenities were as expected and the place is kept clean. We moved to the suite after one night because of the AC. The internet is quite slow, about twice the speed of dial up. The grill in the bar has great food and the staff were all friendly and helpful. Free breakfast is pretty much, toast or croissant with coffee or juice.

Stayed here for one week. We were lucky to get the king bedroom on the 8th floor...809. My friends were in the kitchen suites in the lower tower. Their room was nicer and more up to date then ours but we were just looking for a clean place to sleep. We booked directly thru the hotel and used the valet service for under $8 per day. We had a great maid and no problems. I have travelled a lot for pleasure and business the last fews years and have stayed at dozens of hotels thru my husbands work traveling and we usually book good budget hotels and I would stay here again. Sure the carpets could be cleaned and it could use some updating but for $70 a night what do you expect. The comp. breakfast was okay, used it for the free coffee and yogurt. Hotel made some great recommendations for dinner like Uncle Bos. Pool was nice, fitness room basic, free high speed internet.If you are looking for a place to rest your head, are not picky about hotels and would rather spend your money on other things in Hawaii stay here.

We stayed 4 nights here, the aircondition termostat was not working, the rooms are very old, carpet is dirty, had some bugs in bathroom and bedroom, moldy in bathroom and even with closed windows the noise from the street is terrible. The continental breakfast was a joke. The price is very low but if you like to have a decent stay have a good sleep and a good brakfast... DON'T STAY IN THIS HOTEL. If you don't care about that... the Hotel is in a good location, stuff is ok and there is a good Bar and Grill right at the Hotel.

When i was searching for a less expensive hotel to stay in in waikiki i expected budget but not THIS BUDGET. This hotel was terrible. Compared to other 2 star hotels, this was the worst. EVERYTHING is old about this hotel. The bathroom reminded me of some public bathroom in an old mall. The beds were soooooooooooooooooooo hard and lumpy!! The aircon has no control so it was really hot in the room. The carpet looked so dirty, I had to keep my shoes on the whole time. The "free" breakfast is NOT breakfast....just some bread and juice. There are plenty other hotels in the same price range that are way superior to this hotel. I was booked to stay 7 nights but i checked out after the first night and booked us in an even cheaper hotel but 100% renovated spacious very nice room with a kingsize bed!!!! So much better and I saved 10%. DO NOT STAY at waikiki sands villa unless you don't mind motel status!!!!

This is about 5 minutes walk from Kuhio Beach park. There is a high rise building with hotel rooms and a low rise (ground floor plus 2) building of studios. There is no lift for the studios and access is by spiral stairs. I would have struggled with my bag if alone.The studio had 2 double beds and a sofa. The kitchen area had a 2 ring hob, microwave, fridge and sink. China, glass and cutlery was provided. There was a table and 4 chairs. The bathroom was clean and well stocked.The studios are next to the pool which was noisy in the early evening. This was not an issue for us but might be if you have small children who go to bed early. The pool closed at 9pm and there was no noise after that.The complimentary breakfast was just about OK. There was toast, small croissants, tinned pineapple, tubes (not tubs) of yogurt, coffee, tea and juice. We were put off on the first day when there was a large party of very hungry teenagers and went out for breakfast every day. The servery did seem to close very promptly at 9.00am. There was a Japanese snack bar in the lobby and the bar served food.The guest laundry in the main building was inexpensive. There were 2 washers and 2 dryers. The only downside was having to carry your washing through the lobby. The hospitality room had 6 computers which were free to use and you could print (for a fee). Internet access was slow. The wireless internet in the room was also slow.The only probelm we had during our stay was with the TV and it was fixed very promptly.This was perfectly comfortable and good value compared with swankier looking hotels nearer the beach. I would definitely stay here again.

As soon as I arrived at Waikiki Sand Villa I was disappointed. The pictures on the website are very misleading and the hotel is actually pretty crummy looking. The lobby is not much of a lobby at all and when we got to our floor it smelt like wet stinky carpet. The service was great, however. Just not the cleanest of hotels. But it is close to everything. The beach is only a few blocks away and there are ABC stores everywhere. Most of the tours will pick you up at the hotel or at a very nearby hotel so that was very convenient. Internet access was readily available. The complimentary breakfast was horrible. All you get is tiny croissants and a tiny cup of pineapple and some gross toast and juice and if you're not there super early they run out of croissants and don't bother to put out anymore. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family. It is cheap but I would rather pay a bit more and enjoy my stay and not have to smell stench. Also the taps make ALOT of noise when you turn them and the walls are paper thin so you can hear people yelling at their girlfriends for dancing with other men at the bar.

Pay a little get a little. This was my second visit to Hawaii and after a positive first stay at Waikiki Sand Villa I decided to stay here again. The hotel website didn't accept my credit card despite more than adequate credit being available. On check-in I requested as a returning guest who attempted to book directly if I could have discounted valet parking. This request was flatly ignored. We were placed in a corner room on the 7th floor overlooking the street. It was on the smaller size with a balcony. It did get rather noisy late at night and when the garbage trucks came in the early hours of the morning. The room was tired but clean and in working order. It was comfortable with a working bar fridge.The location was great only three blocks from Waikiki beach and right near an ABC store. My son enjoyed the pool and hot tub and I used the adequate wireless internet by the pool whilst supervising him. The complimentary internet room on the hospitality floor was out of order for the duration of our stay.The valet parking was slow with often a long wait for my car to be obtained (Up to 25 minutes). The continental breakfast was basic adequate. My son enjoyed the pineapple and toast. Don't expect to sit at a table for breakfast. It can get quite busy and the only seats left are on deck chairs. I stay at no frills accommodation and have low expectations, but I found the valet parking wait frustrating and will seek to stay somewhere with self parking next time I visit if I have a vehicle.

When you need to make your buck stretch out... this is a great place. Great value for your dollar. What you pay vs. location/amenities/experience - its excellent!Don't get me wrong - I mean this isn't a 5 star hotel! I mean the beds were small (super single - definately not a double) and hard - the pillows are pancake flat. The carpets aren't the cleanest either and the rooms are small. The rooms are mediocre at best - HOWEVER - you are in Waikiki - not meant to be in your rooms all day long! It is more than adequate for sleeping! It is a quiet hotel - the staff were great - the pool is super clean and very nice - the Continental breakfast was alright - the hospitality room was always accessible and the free internet was ideal - the Sand Bar was great for value and taste... and the location - was perfect!The views were good - we had a view of the canal on the 8th floor. Again - it was a quiet hotel which was GREAT! Only two blocks away from the beach, near a lot of attractions, near public transportation... it truly is good value for your dollar. I am not disatisfied at all!If you can live with mediocre rooms - then you are all set! Don't expect the Ritz Carlton because this ain't it. But for the budget traveller, in challenging economic times - this was a FANTASTIC deal. I would definately stay there again, no problems!Keep your expectations in check and you'll be more than fine!

We stayed for one full week. An for a cheap hotel it was great. Rooms where very very clean. Beds were hard as a rock though. Also, when you request a queen you probably wont get it, it is only a request that can be made upon availability. The grill and pool are great. We actually used the activities lady. Who was very helpful the prices for activities through them where very competitive with what I found online. The best thing was it was not far from the beach but it was not so close you get all the tourists. The hospitality room was very nice: Tv,computers,copier, and couches. Pool and hot tub we used a lot. We even ate at the grill there a few times. The people at the front desk where not overly friendly but most of the staff was. For the price and location we where very happy. The problems where very small and that we have found in other Hotels that cost tons more. It seems great even for families or just couples visiting. Not really for honeymooners or special occasions.

I have been an annual guest at the Waikiki Sand Villa for the last 10 years or so. Prior to that I stayed in several Outrigger Hotels, plus the Pacific Monarch and the Waikiki Banyan.For location, consistency, value, pool, internet, and many other reasons you will find this hard to beat. It is one of the lowest priced hotels in Waikiki and yet performs so well in many areas. Its not the Sheraton or the Hyatt and by all means if you want 5 star stay there and pay the dollars. But if like me you want clean, safe, central location, nice pool(better than many much more expensive hotels pools), great staff, quiet, gym, free internet, inhouse bar, restaurants nearby (Perrys Smorgy on the corner), then this is the place for you. Kiwis and Aussis will love it. Balconys are good sized, Air Con is central so no noise in room, and a free basic breakfast thrown in. A great base for your Hawaii holiday. Highly recommended by this frequent guest.

Spent four nights vacationing and wanted to be in center of Waikiki. This hotel fit the bill. I had none of the posted problems others complained of and I am a finicky, bargain hunter traveler. the breakfast is fine -- simple but filling and for a change of pace there are some great luxury resorts nearby to give yourself a full blown experience in the AM . The coffee, Columbian, was esp. good. The hotel is just off the main bus lines, making trips from airport, to the Bay snorkeling, and major beach areas quite accessible. The fitness room, not very much used, was adequate. And the free internet, not crowded, was also nice.The hotel had a large number of Japanese tour groups, which can be both a plus and minus. For example i shared a breakfast table with some young Japanese tourists who were friendly and animated. I wandered into the bigger beach side hotels and didn't find the crowds all that different -- Waikiki hotels are a tourist destination. Rooms had adequate water pressure, good beds, good TV. It's a 60's level of luxury so forget about W Hotel amenities. But given the plethora of ways to spend money -- from drinks to tours to good meals -- this is a way to save. If you're on your honeymoon, this is not your hotel, though.

The hotel is on the South side of the Ali Wai canal, pretty far away from Wakiki beach etc. but only cost $99 plus $15 for parking. The parking was a necessity as there was no offsite parking available. Room was clean but dated. Good enough for a cheap short stay.

We only needed a decent room for one night before we went to Kauai. Clean / quiet room, upper non smoking floor. We don't eat much for breakfast so the continental breakfast of toast, juice, croisant and coffee sufficed. 1/2 price on valet parking. Minutes walk to the beach. 10% coupon off for next visit, I'll sure consider it

This was our third stay ( we stay 3 to 4 weeks) and the carpets in the rooms badly needed changing the first time we stayed there in 2006 & they were still filthy in 2009. The staff was really good, especially the lady who made the breakfast altho many didn't even tip her. We don't go in the hot pool as children in diapers are allowed in.Pool area is very nice but water is cold. Only valet parking but they were very good when we had friends visit.We talked to many people and it seems most of us paid the same regardless of where our rooms were. We paid for deluxe & our room was no different than those who paid for standard. Some got upgraded & others not. Desk person said there are only 3 king size beds in the whole hotel. Rest are 3/4. or singles. But as long as they keep the prices down its still a good place to stay.with friendly staff.

I actually called the Waikiki Gateway hotel to make reservation but the operator transfer me to the Sand without telling me. When I arrived to the Gateway, the supervisor on duty knew right away just from looking at my reservation number that I was booked at the Sand. I told her it was impossible because I called their number and spoke to Ashley. She said yes, there is a front desk agent at the Sand name Ashley. She called the Sand and for sure there was Ashley. I asked them if they are under the same management, the supervisor at Gateway said no, but Ashley said yes, they are sister hotel. I was suspicious about this whole thing. Why would they transfer me without telling me where I booked the hotel. The Gateway hotel called a taxi for us and told Ashley to reimburse us for the fare. Which I had to argue with the manager on duty when we check out. He told me that there was no record of the situation but after our long argument, he gave us back the fare out of his own pocket. I told him that I don't want his own money but the hotel should easily refund a $10 fare, he said he has no authority to do this. I wonder what kind of company that first hide about their relations with their sister hotel and second does not give their manager an authority to refund a $10 taxi fare. Here is the rundown of all our disapointment:1. The Pualeilani Studio is dirty. We had to rearrange the furniture before we can hook up our computer to the internet cable. Which is not fast at all, front desk told us that they only have one server to be devided among the rooms. 2. The deepest part of the pool is only 4 feet and the water is cold. No one swim in that pool during our 4 nights stay only 2 little boys. 3. Breakfast was tiny donuts, toast, water down coffee, juice and small cup of fruits. You better off going to the supermarket down the street and get freshly baked goods for about $2.4. The studio is next to the bar which open until 4 AM. The noise from the bar drifted into our room. I asked the front desk to close the door from the bar to the pool area so we don't have to hear to noise all night but she was too stupid to understand my repeated request. She kept saying that the bar is open until 4 AM and she can not close the bar earlier. She would not call the bar manager so I can speak to them directly so I finally went to the bar my self. The waitress there right away apologize and said she would close the door for us. BUT the door was BROKEN! Bottom line, this hotel is not what it advertise to be.

My husband and I spent two nights at the Sand Villa in Honolulu before heading to Kauai, we enjoyed our stay so much we booked for two more nights when we got back. It had tons of amenities: a hospitality room which includes two full bathrooms, television and couches, massage chairs, six computers with internet access, xerox machine, it also had a small spa, pool, restaurant and bar with aan dditional two computers with internet access, coin laundry, continental breakfast , only a few blocks from the beach and shopping, and very friendly and helpful service. On the day of our final departure we had to check out at 11:00am, but were able to store our luggage in a locked room behind the front desk and were still allowed access to the hospitality room to clean up before our flight. The rooms were a bit small and outdated but were clean! It was reasonably priced too! We would definitly recommend this hotel.

We booked a room on the Hawaiian Air website. It seemed like a great deal at the the time for $67. As my friend and I read more reviews we learned that there's a construction project going on there. There was no indication of this on the Hawaiian Air site.I found a tiny link about it on the hotel's site, but it was unclear how extreme the construction was or an end date. It was really hard to find out any information about it online.I called the hotel to find out more. The front desk guy seemed uninformed and put me on hold. I learned that the project was going into March (not the February date on the site) and that all the balconies are boarded off. I asked if I could get a room away from the construction. The man I spoke to said they would not guarantee us a room away from the construction.Worse yet, I have an extreme allergy to construction dust and must avoid it or I can have serious medical problems. I explained this but the hotel sounded extremely unaccommodating.We decided to cancel the reservation. Even though we explained the situation and had given plenty of notice, they still charged a $25 fee. They really need to update their website and their ad on Hawaiian Air.I would not stay here. I just got a bad vibe from the staff and the whole way it was handled.

We stayed here for 7 nights then moved to Queen Kapilano for 2 nights as it was booked out for the last 2 nights when we booked.Waikiki Sand killed the other hotel with all the inclusions they gave you. Breakfast was toast, pineapple and yoghurt for me and this was excellent and got you going for the day, it was also free. The hospitality room which had computers to use for free was excellent, never had to wait more than 5 minutes to get a computer, excellent for researching things for the next day, or booking a trip.In room safe again free.Close to all buses that we needed, they were just down the corner, and only 2 blocks at the most to the beach.Would go back to this accomadation every time, would not return to the other one as nothing was included, everything costed you.

Traveled with my husband and 3 teenagers. We stayed here because it was our second trip and we wanted to stay on the cheaper side so we could stay somewhere nice for the last few nights. Not bad until I went outside my room to get ice and a man with 2 prostitutes were hiding around the corner from the ice machine. FUNNY BUSINESS.
