If you want a cheap room with a decent breakfast and pool, this is it. Luxury and ideal other guests, not this place. Then my kids were on the other side of the hall looking at another building and someone from the building across the street was looking at them through binoculars. CREEPY. There is no such thing as "views" at this place. You can look at the Ala Wei canal or some of the mountains and thats it. It was a 15-20 minute walk to the beach and the only restaurant around was the one at the hotel which we sat at for 15 minutes and left after recieving no service. I was glad to leave this place and go to the Sheraton Waikiki

We found this hotel adequate--clean, etc, but not fantastic. The beds were fairly uncomfortable and the room was very small. We did have a balcony (also very small) and the room had a mini fridge which was nice. For the price, we thought it was acceptable, but we were glad we only stayed there one night. (Later we stayed on the Windward coast, where we had a MUCH nicer place for about the same price.) But I guess if you want an affordable place in Waikiki, this one fits the bill.

Decent and clean hotel in Waikiki. 2 weeks ago I stayed directly across the road at Aloha Surf Hotel, which is very similar to Waikiki Sand Villa but overall I prefer Aloha Surf.Pros:* Free breakfast, good croissants and they toast bread for you so it saves you time from standing there waiting for the toaster* Internet access in room* Location & value for money* Good business center and cheap printing 10c per pageCons:* Separate beds. Had to pay extra if we wanted a King bed.* Valet parking only. Had to use the valet guy everytime we wanted to take the car out. I prefer self-parking.

Great place at a great price. The staff was full of Aloha spirit especially the valet parking guy. The internet room was convenient. Nice pool and bar. The complimentary breakfast was lacking. Rooms are a little worn and could use new carpet and paint.Otherwise friendly, safe and walk to everything.

Great deal hotel! Even if you arrive in the hotel before check-in time you can use shower room before you get in your room. There is a kind of customer service room which has shower and high speed internet. You need to get security card in the reception beforehand. Or you can use internet at the bar in front of reception. There is a small pool surrounded and blinded by tree. It's good to sunbathing, not so many customers there.Very nice hotel, I'd love to spend the time there again.

Great cheap hotel , few blocks from main part of Waikiki , ordinary rooms and breakfast but has great extras such as free internet & computer use both upstairs and downstairs in lobby - always able to get on as at least 5 computers. if you arrive too early there is complimentary room with shower internet and tv and comfy chairs .also great little bar with food at great prices and freindly services.nice views and only 5 min walk to shops beach etc .. we stayed some else also but preferred this place .. the rooms and okay and it is abut tatty but has some many other positives i would recommend it to people who dont want to spend a fortune .

We stayed here for 7 nights and loved it. We didn't expect too much from the hotel since we paid a very low price for it but it was actually much better than we expected. The staff were very nice and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was very tasty even though it only included doughnuts, (excellent) croissants, toast, coffee, and pineapple juice, butter and jelly. The jacuzzi and pool are quite nice. The pool is only 4ft deep, so it's very nice for children. Another good aspect is that every room has a balcony. And the greatest feature is LOCATION. This hotel is located on Ala Wai Blvd. and Kanepolei Ave. It is only a block away from shops, restaurants, nightclubs, and convenience stores and only about 3 blocks from the beach. For really good and affordable food I recommend Keoni at the corner of Kuhio and Kanepolei Streets for breakfast and the Blue Water Shrimp Co. on Kuhio about 4 blocks west of Kanepolei (please note that this rest. is actually a blue bus. Can't miss it. Don't be fooled by its appearance. The food is actually very good.) One last note, please TIP the maids and the breakfast lady at the hotel, your tour guides, the waiters/waitresses, the guy who brings your chair or umbrellas out to the beach. Please TIP, TIP, TIP. People who work in these industries rely on your tips. So please do not be cheap and TIP.

For a really great stay of any length in Waikiki try the "Sand Villa".The guests are mainly repeat visitors & the locals also take advantage of the bar prices & Happy hour [from 4-7pm daily].Ask for a corner or north facing room for fantastic views from the Ali Wai canal, across the Golf Course to the mountain tops, or from Diamond Head to the Punchbowl. Rooms are basic but clean, with balconies & all facilities including a basic continental b'fast.Staff are just great, & the cross section of local colour you meet in the huge bar/pool area gives you terriffic insights into where you should explore next.

This hotel needs some work. The carpet in our room was dirty but the staff kept the room very clean otherwise. We had a twin and double bed so we slept in separate beds. The continental breakfast has a limited selection, mini-donuts, mini-croissants, toast, canned pineapple, coffee or tea. We used the room just to sleep. Don't plan on relaxing and enjoying the sumptuous room. Nice but small lanai/patio. The facilities need considerable maintenance such as replacing the missing tiles around the otherwise very nice shaded pool. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. A fair deal for the money.

The Waikiki Sand Villa is a great budget option located in central Waikiki. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and the lady at the tour desk knows everything you need to know about O'ahu! The hotel is located next to the Ala Wai Canal and featured a nice pool, but still only a 4min walk to the beach. All amenities were nearby, always a short walk away to everything. We booked directly through the hotel website for four nights stay and received a complimentary return hotel transfer and room upgrade to a higher level - our room was spacious, we had two double beds, two balcony's with views over the canal, and was nice and clean. The hotel is very outdated and old, but basically all buildings in Waikiki/Honolulu are old in general, the whole city needs one big refurbishment. Check out the restaurant bar downstairs, they have great drink specials during happy hour and the bartenders are fantastic!

If it weren't for the uncomfortable bed with the thin vinyl covered mattress, I'd give this place a 4.The location and value were great. Right across the street from the canal, and a very short walk (5 min or so) from the beach. There are plenty of amenities very nearby - including a small grocery store, an ABC store, and several restaurants and bars.The room was clean, albiet a bit dingy. The decor could definitely use an update - but, it was perfectly adequate. Some of the highlights for us included:- free internet access (we brought a laptop)- the pool/hottub area- short walk to the beach- price (we only paid around $80/night, plus $8/night for in/out parking - directly from their website)- free breakfast- short walk to the beachThe breakfast isn't anything to write home about - just some mini-doughnuts, mini croissants, canned pinapple, toast, and yogurt. But, it held us over for a bit each morning. We gave the breakfast lady a couple bucks tip each morning, and she didn't seem to mind as much that we were pigging out on the croissants. :)We found the bar downstairs to be quite convenient, with decent food. The fish & chips was pretty good, with a generous portion of fish. They also have a cheap happy hour 2 times a night (4-7PM, and then one later...)

My friend booked this hotel and it is a good option for Honolulu. It is in a great location, near Waikiki closer to Ali Wai Canal. Much quieter and the TradeWinds at night are fantastic. Each room had a great balcony. The room size was ok, the bed horrible. We had two beds, one was a twin, the other called a queen but it was smaller than a double. We managed. Great pool and common area with a helpful concierge and friendly staff. Nice bar, which was often packed. The Japanese lady that runs the coffee shop could cut the attitude. In my travels to Honolulu, this was my favorite location, a mere 5 minute walk to Waikiki but without the late night parties. Great, safe option for families and single travelers. It is heavily marketed to Japanese tourists, as many hotels in Hawaii are now.

I planned a girl's getaway for my 7 yr old daughter and myself for 4 days. I knew I wanted to save money on the hotel since we planned on spending most of our money on activities and meals. We have stayed here before with my husband, it was fine. It is run down and not the most lovely room, but i love the bar with good, easy food to be had while my daughter is swimming in the pool. The review said they redid it, but it is exactly the same pool as the year before. The staff is the best, the front desk people are just so nice. I found it a bit harder to take the walk back from the busier streets at night with my child and I alone, so wouldn't stay here again with just the 2 of us, but there really were no incidents at all. Some bad points: never clean towels at the pool, awful stained vanity that sagged in the bathroom, louuuud fan in bathroom, vomit stained carpet right by the bed, plastic wrapped mattresses that give you cold sweats all night, we were right near the ice machine and people partied alllll night long and were LOUD in the hallway. Good points: great price, great staff, food, pool. Saved $ for the good stuff.
Didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the hotel, and if that's your plan this is the place to go! very clean, very accomodating & friendly staff. Cheap and affordable. Good times!

I know its been a while since my stay, but i thought id put in my two cents. Ive stayed in several different hotels in Waikiki, and for the price location and amenities I like this one. The other hotels ive stayed at cost more, no breakfast and expensive parking.The rooms were a good size, compared to other hotels. I had a view of the canal, but in the morning its really pretty. Because I always go in November, theres a nice breeze and its not so hot, so I cant say anything about the AC.The staff was great, especially the Valet. They were always asking if we knew how to get to where we wanted to go, and also gave suggestions. Although I didnt use it, they do have a gym. I do plan to stay here again in November, overall its worth it.

stayed at this hotel after booking it on Kayak.com Hotel room was dirty, and there were numerous bugs in the bathroom and in our bed. We stayed a couple years ago and it was okay then but has really gone down hill. The breakfast was horrible and they would not allow us to eat very much. I would recommend staying at the Monarch over this hotel and it is slightly cheaper. At check in the front desk seemed unhappy about something and they lost our reservations. I produced the confirmation number and it took 20 minutes to get check in. Under no circumstances would I stay there again. If you do bring Raid!

The location was great - though a couple of streets back from the beach we had fantastic views of the mountains and the canal. Our room was quiet and a bit snug but perfect for what we needed - somewhere to sleep! Do not get too excited but the prospect of breakfast included - stale miniature croissants, pieces of toast and tea/coffeee in styrofoam cups is certainly nothing for this hotel to boast about as a 'Continental Breakfast'. The front desk staff were also quite rude and unhelpful.

My husband and I stayed here in May 2007. I'm a bit late with my review but figured someone would enjoy the pictures! Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel and would certainly stay here again. The rooms were clean. They are not fancy and there were some scuffs on the wall that were repainted, etc. These aren't the types of things that bother me. I was comfortable and the price was right so it was very easy to overlook some cosmetic things. The pool area was fantastic. I thought it was really beautiful & very tropical. We spent most of an afternoon hanging around the pool area and I consider it time well spent since it was so pretty. The free breakfast was good enough to get us going in the morning. While there wasn't a ton of variety, it tasted good and it was very pleasant to eat on the patio next to the pool. This is a great way to start your day in Hawaii!! The location of the hotel is terrific. Just a few blocks from the ocean, we could easily walk to many other hotels and restaurants, as well as Waikiki Beach. I felt comfortable walking back to the hotel after dark because there always seemed to be people out & about. However, some people might be wary of this since you go through a small area of less touristy (more residential type apartments) and it is not brightly lit (although there are streetlights...it isn't dark by any means...just be aware that the main street--Kalakaua Ave.--is brighter). The view from our hotel room was lovely. We had a wrap around balcony so I could see both the view towards Waikiki (even a bit of the ocean) and the golf course that is on the back side of the hotel. Both were beautiful views.

I booked the room quite some time ago online via the hotel's website. Since I booked online I got 50% off parking. What would have been $15/daily parking was offered to me at $7.50. That was quite a deal because hotels all around us were offering parking for $15-$25. When we got to the hotel, we found out that self-park was not available and it was all valet parking. $7.50 per day was a steal! The staff were very friendly and helpful. Upon our check in, I thought it was a little odd when they asked that all parties staying at the hotel each show a picture ID. Other hotels need only one ID out of their group but since It was part of the Waikiki Sand Villa's security policy, I didn't mind complying. The hospitality room had up-to-date computers, fast connection, and a copier/fax machine. We were placed in a room overlooking Diamond Head. According to the hotel's room map, we were in a deluxe room. The room was just okay. The beds in the room were a double and a single bed and they were comfortable. The air conditioner was not functioning properly. Since the air conditioner wasn't generating enough cold air to cool the room, we opted to sleep with the sliding door open. In the middle of the night and the early morning hours, we were woken by loud music or shouts from the street below. The carpet was just absolutely filthy and needed to be replaced like three years ago. In my book this property is considered a low-budget hotel. The pros outweight the cons and if you don't mind a filthy carpet and being only a 5-minute walk to the beach, then you should consider staying at this hotel.

Just got back from a two week stay at the Waikiki Sand Villa. What a bargain!All the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The pool area was always tidy and lovely and quiet.Yes, the breakfast was nothing to write home about, but it was free and fresh and you could always go down the road to Dennys or IHOP if you fancied the full works.The internet room was excellent. So convenient to check your e-mails or look into trips, though the lady who runs the travel desk in the lobby was more than helpful.The location was fantastic. Just a short walk to the beach and all the razzle dazzle of Waikiki!The only negative was the bar. We decided to eat in there one night, but found that the bar staff could not be dragged away from the locals around the bar. The food was acceptable but not great.Shop around for excursions. We found a round island trip for half the price that Expedia were offering and it was great. We saw everything the other trips were offering and were taken to a great shrimp wagon for lunch.Would definitely go back to the Sand Villa. For the price it is in an excellent location and has everything you need.
user_name:
MelonsUK
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The front desk was very nice, a bit hard to understand if you call for directions. I was only there for a day and a half but i wished I could stay longer. The rooms are basic but the views make up for it and it was definitely nice to dip in the very large and clean pool. the towel racks were empty both times I went to the pool, but I brought my own, that was fine. I let it dry on the beautiful balcony. I never saw breakfast, slept in.... and the parking was valet, but they were all great. I read another review where the bartender was not nice and I had the same experience when the locals were in there, I didn't feel welcomed. Hopefully he got a different job.The Japanese little place, I did try, but it was expensive and I really didn't like it. I should have tried the bar food. Just not enough time! I almost stayed somewhere else for this trip but I'm giving it another try because the price is right and the pool really was great.

We stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa for two nights while we stopped over in Honolulu before going to Maui. The rooms were clean and quiet. Nothing extravagant but for a place to stay in the center of activity, it did the trick. The pool area was beautiful, we had our continental breakfast there. The breakfast just about held you over until you could go for a real meal. Our only complaint was that one of the two elevators was not working while we were there and the wait sometimes was incredibly long. It was nice to be only two short blocks from the beach and nightlife and the market was equally close. If we ever returned to Honolulu we might stay here again. But we honestly preffered the slower lifestyle on Maui.

I admit I was cheaping out on the first week of our trip to Waikiki but the hotel was a pleasant surprise. Sure the rooms (we stayed in a Pualeilani Studio) needed updating (carpet mostly) but overall it served it's purpose. And like many other times stated, how much time do you spend in your room anyways?The pool (area) was very pretty and hotel staff (especially maid service) were wonderful and very helpful. My kids loved the breakfast and I found it very handy that we could go grab some toast, yogurt, pineapple, whatever. If you need bacon and eggs every morning, you won't be happy but there is a Denny's up the block. Loved the free internet access and the cheap valet parking! Don't forget to tip...they sure work hard! We didn't eat at the hotel but they made a mean Lava Flow and a very cheap happy hour.

My daughter & I just got back from 7 days at the Waikiki Sand Villa & we could not have been happier. This hotel had everything we needed. No, it is not a 5 star hotel, but if you just want a clean,safe room to sleep in, this will do the trick! It has a nice pool area with a hot tub & the bar/sports grill was great also(it does get crowded with locals for their great happy hour though). The internet room was great to keep in contact with everyone while we were there. It was definitely better than I expected for the price & if you need to book a tour, use the tour desk in their lobby, it is wonderful. My only complaints were the free breakfast(not much but hey, it is free) and the beds were not the most comfortable. We were very happy over all & all the employees were very helpful. If you book now on the hotels website they will give you free transfers to/from the airport if you stay 4 or more nights. We did take advantage of that. Great location also, only a few blocks from everything!!

I wouldn't say this hotel is above average in looks or amenities, but it is definitely above average for the price.If you are like us and use your hotel room mostly just to sleep, then this hotel is great. It's not fancy, and although the carpeting and some elements of the room are worn, it is very clean. The beds were comfortable and the hotel had all the services we needed (free computer use, in-room fridge, laundry facilities, lovely pool). Breakfast is very basic - croissants, mini donuts, yogurt, pineapple and coffee/juice - but everything is very fresh and was a great way to start the day. The location is fantastic! There was some traffic noise (we were on the 6th floor), but nothing out of the ordinary for a city. The staff was very nice and helpful, and the tour desk was really fantastic.I only have two complaints. One is that I could not find a set of stairs that went to the lobby, so I had to wait for/take the elevator whether I wanted to or not. The second is that we requested three rooms and didn't get any of them in the configuration we requested.I would stay there again, especially for the price.

Location- Right next to the river, away from the beach front. But only a 5-10minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Close to shops and restaurant. Quiet street.Rooms- The Pualeilani Suites are over the pool and have a kitchenette and sofa bed. Quite roomy, but dark inside. Only problem was the constant noise during the night (possibly the spa or pool filter). Rooms in the tower were very small. Smallest we came across on our trip. But, they did have 3 single beds which was a bonus for us. Service- Very friendly! Porters were extremely helpful and nice.Front desk- AdequateAmenities- Pool and spa were lovely and always clean. Did not try the gym. Food- The hotel has a bar that does meals and onsite cafe and an asian takeaway food shop. Did not try these.Breakfast- Croissants, toast, mini doughnuts, yoghurt, tea, and juice. We enjoyed it. It's not 5 star, but it's breakfast and everyone around us in the mornings seemed to be taking a lot of it! So not too many complaints! Tourist info- This hotel has a little tourism booth with a lovely local lady as the agent. She is FANTASTIC! Will book anything for you and give you advice on travel etc. Extras- It's lovely sitting and eating breakfast at the tables next to the pool in the morning.

the room is ok ,nice bathroom, good location but the surprise was in the morning when I decided to take my breakfast with my boyfriend....they served us terrible food like some small dry left pieces of doughnuts and croissant with "chemical "jam and a weak coffee!i understand that it s a complimentary breakfast but I will be shame to serve this kind of breakfast to my customers it s not respectfull to us.If they DONT know how to do breakfast SO dont do it! the next day we decided to skip their breakfast to take our breakfast to mariott hotel, expensive but it was a breakfast at least

Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel, located about 6-7 blocks from Waikiki Beach, if you're willing to take public transportation, "The Bus" which is rated # 1 bus service all over the states... stops about 3-4 blocks from it (buses # 19,20 and 42 as long as the buses say Waikiki Hotels) hotel is right beside Ala Wai Canal, nice view as well, for the price this hotel is on the lower end, also one good thing was the free pick up from the Airport on arrival although on your departure you would have to get your own transportation back to the airport...no WIRED high speed internet access in every room, probably wireless, but i didnt see a plug for my laptop, all in all, still a bit expensive at $105 a night since i found a hotel for $20 less than this one...down the street.

We stayed one night in the Sand Villa, in a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool. The room was comfortable. There was a loud rumbling noise, seemingly from something like a big central air conditioner, that continued all night. It was about as loud as a plane during flight -- certainly not unendurable, but not pleasant either.The staff was pleasant and helpful, but because of the noise I would not stay there again.

We have just got back from staying at this hotel and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with it. The location is great, yes it is not right on the beach but it takes about 5 minutes to walk to it. It is also 1 minute from a supermarket (Food Pantry) and short walks to lots of restaurants and bars. The hotel itself is a little dated and could do with some modern decor in the rooms, but it is clean and has plenty of amenities (a bar, pool, jacuzzi, a sushi bar etc). The rooms themselves were an adequate size with a queen bed and a single (maybe upgrading the beds to doubles would be better though), with a balcony - we were very high up and had great views over the golf course and up to the mountains. The staff were very nice and always helpful. Overall a reasonably priced hotel where I would most definitley stay again, maybe not in December though as we did get quite a few cloudy and rainy days - not that I can blame the hotel for this though.

I stayed in 6 different locations in Waikiki in the spring.The standard room was dated and somewhat small with old carpet by comparison to the other 5.I rate the hotel above average because of the pool.The highlight was definately the pool area.If you are a traveller that really looks for the pool then this would be more pick.It was very serine,quiet and beautiful and memorable in the way it was designed with palm trees, birds in the trees and vegetation around.

Very clean hotel for a decent price. We paid $89 USD for a room with two beds and a balcony overlooking the Ala Wai Canal. RElatively roomy, well lit. Had a computer room where internet access was available and it was free to use. Nice little restaurant downstairs that served decent food and drinks and it wasn't very expensive either! There was also a little booth that sold some japanese food...also not expensive. All in all, i would definitley stay there again!

If you're on a tight budget with some class, I would recommend to stay at the STUDIO hotel rooms at the Sand Villa Hotel. Hotels with kitchens can be a problem anyways so I usually don't pick that criteria especially if I'm going to be out and about all day. Service was great and the people were very nice. I didnt expect so much before getting to the room since it has a 2 star rating. However, I was surprise that we did get a great view, and the room was actually pretty good. We slept comfortably, the bathrooms were fine and clean, and the service was great. Everyone there was friendly to us. So if you're on a tight budget, you're planning to be out most of the day during your stay, and you want to stay in a room equivalent to a holiday inn or something, then pick this place.

After a week's stay my family and I were watching TV one evening when suddenly a rat ran across the kitchen floor. The family screamed and scurried up onto they beds while I contacted the desk. They were polite but unsurprised and moved us to another room. No hotel staff so much as came up to help us move or to investigate the situation. All week long some of our food and snacks seemed to be disappearing from the kitchen area but we thought little of it. Now we know why. We had been sleeping in a room frequented by at least one rat that entered through a hole in the wall behind the entertainment center. This experience served to destroy our entire trip and has had a lasting effect on my family. I politely asked for one evening's room compensation but was granted only about $100 - about half a night's rate, which I believe was unfair and added to our disgust as well. The on-duty manager was polite but apparently at the mercy of his superior.I would certainly advise one to find different accommodations. No price is low enough for staying at a rodent rest stop. The entire episode is unfortunate and should never have happened. P.S. Watch for ants in the kitchenette drawers.Disgusted

waikiki sand villa has an easy to navigate website and a responsive email help desk which was part of the reason i booked a room there. the price was attractive too.the hotel pool was the scene of many late afternoon naps, and not just by me. other guests had cottoned on to this excellent activity. the pool was cold, thank goodness. and was open until nine at night. the cocktail bar in the hotel also had a super cheap happy hour (but they wouldn't let you take glass pool side so you had to drink it out of plastic cups - only a minor downside). the hotel room itself was small but very functional and seemed to have pretty effective air conditioning. we even got a nice view of the canal and golf course. given the concrete build up of waikiki this was an unexpected delight. the free internet in the hospitality room and the free (fairly minimal) breakfasts were a bonus too. everything you need in waikiki is in walking distance, with an abc store all of about twenty paces away.

We have just returned from 14 days in Honolulu, staying at the Sand Villas. We cannot fault this hotel, the rooms are clean, the staff friendly. The breakfast is enough to start the day, you can always add fruit/yoghurt if need be. We will stay again when we return for another holiday. Thank you Sand Villas for making our holiday an enjoyable one.

I stayed 4 nights recently for a business trip. The hotel is centrally located right on Ala Wai Blvd and Kaiulani Ave--it is next to some older low-rise apartments (NOT crack houses!) and only a 150 yards from Kuhio Ave which is one the main streets of Waikiki.  I had room 1207 which was a standard room on the 12th floor right behind the elevator shaft. The room had a single and queen size bed, and a small desk. The bath was adequate, the carpet was excellent and the room was very clean. The linens were also more than adequate. The furnishings were in very good to excellent condition. There was a Panasonic TV and a nice size refrigerator. The rooms have a small safe with Medeco high security locks (no charge). Overall, I was very pleased with the room.  The only negative for the room was that it was noisy. One reason is no fault of the hotel--Ala Wai Blvd is main street out of Waikiki and Waikiki itself is a densely packed and noisy environment. The other factor is that the elevator shaft was right behind the wall of this room and every time the elevators moved you could hear the noise elevators.  The parking valets were extremely friendly and really hustled. The normal parking rate is $15/day but I got it for $7.50 by making my reservations through AAA. This is cheap parking for Waikiki.  I don't drink so I can't comment on the bar. I did try the fish and chips from the menu, though. It was $8.95 and was excellent. The food prices were very reasonable for Waikiki--I don't know who thought the prices were expensive.  The hotel had a lot of Japanese tourists and caters to this clientele. There is a food service in the lobby that makes "bento" boxes for the Japanese crowd--I didn't try them but given that the proprietors were from Japan, the bento lunches looked very appetizing and authentic.  The Hospitality room had 6 computers and I used them to check my email and surf the web.  The pool was large and very nice but I did not use it. The continental breakfast was served at poolside from 6:30-9am. This was very basic with coffee, cereal, toast, bagels and donuts and some kind of juice. (There might have been a few other items as well). This was the only disappointing aspect of the hotel.  Overall, the public areas of the hotel were very clean and well maintained and the staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Since the hotel breakfast wasn't appealing, you can walk to several restaurants within 2-5 minutes. There is a great restaurant 150 yards away in the Ohana West Hotel which offers fast and reasonable meals.  Just a half a block away is an ABC Stores--it's like an upscale 7-Eleven and they are everywhere on the islands. The hotel is centrally located and close to the beach or if you are driving, as you exit the hotel you're right on Ala Wai Blvd with takes you out of Waikiki. Best of all the average cost per night for my 4 nights (one weekend night) including tax was only $97!  This hotel wasn't luxurious but it was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and the price was more than reasonable. I will definitely stay there again when visiting Honolulu.

I stayed at this hotel for a week with my fiancee in July of 2005 and it was ok. I know it has been a while but I am on here now looking at our honeymoon destination, The El Dorado Royale, for October and I thought I would write up my review. Let me start with the good things. The best thing about this hotel by far is the pool and bar area. The pool was large and clean and we had a lot of fun. It was rarely overcrowded and we loved it. The drinks at the lobby bar were reasonably priced and the bartenders were very nice, although the appetizers and food you could get at the bar were over priced and not very good. The atmosphere was pretty cool as they had a pool table, juke box, and computers with internet access. It was really nice to sit down for a few cold ones after the 8 hour flight believe me.The rooms were pretty clean and we got a corner room overlooking the canal which was nice. The A/C worked really well but the weather in Hawaii is so mild you almost don't need it at night. When I am on vacation I don't really worry too much about the rooms because I rarely spend a lot of time in them. All I ask is that they are clean and the A/C and/or heat works. Ours also had a TV and a mini fridge which was nice.Now for the not so good. The continental breakfast was a joke. It consisted of some stale bagels and mini muffins. There was cereal one day and some juice but that was about it. The service was not all that great either. When we got there they had us booked into the wrong room and then tried to charge us for the correct room. They were pretty snotty about it until we contacted Travelocity and they got it straightened out. And of course the aforementioned food in the bar which wasn't great.Overall this hotel is a pretty nice place for the money. It is within comfortable walking distance to Waikiki Beach and is kept pretty clean. For the price we paid I don't have any major complaints. If you have never been to Hawaii and are planning to go my advice to you is to go to Maui. There is a lot more to do there. Aloha!

I just came home from a 10-day stay at the Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel, which was also my first trip to Hawaii. I was looking for a place that was decent, clean, and close to everything, but wasn't going to ruin my budget since I didn't plan to be in the room much anyway--and I was pleased that it more than fit the bill for me!!! The staff was fantastic--so friendly--the spirit of Aloha is alive and well here. Everyone I came into contact with was helpful and kind. The valet parking staff was superb! I hurt my foot while I was there, and four days later, one of the parking guys asked me how it was. I hadn't seen him for 4 days and yet he remembered, even though they were super busy! Getting a maintenance person to come see about my TV only took about 5 minutes--the front desk called back to tell me he was outside the door, and then he knocked and announced himself--safety is a big deal with them. The hotel was kept clean and although I only chose to have maid service every other day, I could have had it every day. They did a great job cleaning and straightening the room.I will say two things: 1) The room carpeting needs replacing. I realize it gets trampled on every day of the year, but it is time for an upgrade. The carpets in the hallways were beautiful, so it's time to do the rooms! And, 2) Their "continental breakfast" is not quite that...watery OJ, yesterday's pastries, and coffee that was only lukewarm. So, if you need a good breakfast to start the day (like I did, so I could go for hours!), check out the many places that offer a decent-sized breakfast for $2.99 - $4.99. In all fairness, I did leave these comments with them on their little survey sheet. However, overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I would stay there again in a moment. In fact, I wasn't even on the return flight before I was planning my next trip!!! Hawaii is truly paradise come true.

Hello all, I stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa in June 2005 and June 2006. The first time I stayed here in June 2005, I was pushed out of the Waikiki Gateway due to overbooking. So they gave me a corner view and a beautiful room at the Sand Villa. No regrets here because the room was clean. I loved the 24 hour access to the internet room.In June 2006, I came back to the Sand Villa and I loved it again.I was there to sleep, shower, have some breakfast and head out to see Hawaii. I was close to King's Village and I could visit my friend, Wayne Gabaylo of Art In Motion paint nightly. Check out [--]This hotel is reasonable, clean, good location and I highly recommend it to everyone.

Despite the previous 2 reviews, I thought this hotel was perfect, from the location to the amneties to the price. I would recomment staying in the main part of the hotel, and not the part with kitchenettes

Absolutely awful. We had ants in the kitchen area, in the drawers and in the cupboards, it was a very musty smelling room as well. The continental breakfast consisted of dry toast, canned pineapple, diluted juice and protein bars. Not exactly a continental breakfast that should be advertised if you ask me. Room service did not come until, some days, after 5:00 in the evening. This became somewhat of a problem when we would come back to the room to make dinner, and the maid still hadn't been there. But what threw this hotel over the edge were the rats. Food was missing from the room the entire week and finally one night, while watching tv, we saw why. There were two large holes in the wall behind the tv cabinet and the rats came out while we were still awake to look for more food. The hotel was much less than accomodating when we asked for some type of compensation, as any person would. They said we had no proof and all they were willing to do was give us half of one nights stay for free. My advice, Stay ANYWHERE else.

This place was cheap, but it still wasn't worth it. We requested early check-in since we were coming from Japan and we were going to arrive in the early morning. We arrive and the front desk said our room wasn't ready even though we requested early check-in. The front desk said "a request is just a request, it doesn't mean you'll get it". She also said no other room was available for us. Then she said told us it cost extra for early check-in, so I asked her if we paid for that, would a room be availible. She checked the computer and amazingly enough, there was a room availible. Imagine that. It's not a problem about paying more, it just the fact that first we weren't told about the extra cost when we booked and then the front desk told us a room wasn't availble when there was at an extra cost. We had to wait 30 min for a room, so we went to the breakfast. Which was very dissapointing. It consisted of bagel chunks, small powdered donuts and fruit juice. There was also a tip jar for the person working the toaster, as if you didn't tip, he wouldn't get paid for the task of toasting bread.The room was pretty run down and the bathroom had mildew and a terrible paint job. The location was pretty decent. We should have paid more to stay at a nicer place.

This is one of the best deals in Waikiki. It is a few blocks from the beach, has some of the best staff I have ever encountered, and the Price is Right! I was there alone without my 3 kids - and it was so welcoming, so relaxing, and so helpful. I always felt cared for and welcomed 100%. I recommend it highly and will definitely return! Thank you Waikiki Sand Villa Hotel!

We are a couple with a 2yr old from Australia stopping over in Honolulu on our way to the US. This was one of the cheapest hotels I could find when booking & we were more than happy with our choice. Rooms were basic but clean, hotel was centrally located although away from the beach (easy walk down to beach). There was a small bar area with internet access. Were were given access to our room a couple of hours early. Hospitality room was fantastic, offering male& female bathroom with shower (exactly the same as offered in rooms); we used this to freshen up having checked out early for a late onward evening flight. Best part of the hotel is the POOL which was great for a budget property. It was of a good size, intimate and comfortable to use, not overcrowded. Our 2yr old loved it! No baby pool but was not a problem. We absolutely loved the pool and would return on this basis alone. We highly recommend this property for travellers on a budget; was GREAT VALUE & can't wait to go back.

We stayed at the Sand Villa for the last day of our trip. This is a no-nonsense hotel -- it is about 3 or 4 blocks from the beach (but very close to the Ala Wai Canal), so there is no ocean view; the rooms are not fancy, but generally clean and tidy. We paid $100 plus tax for one night, which is about half the price we paid for another hotel in Waikiki.A continental breakfast is included, as is free internet access in the room (the much more expensive hotel charges $10 a day for internet access!). The staff is friendly and courteous. On top of all this, they have a hospitality center which has computers with internet access, massage chairs, and showers! It being our last day and we had a late flight, we used the hospitality center to take a shower, rest, pack and check flight info, etc. I greatly appreciate their providing this free service.I think this is a great place to stay at -- everything is so expensive in Hawaii, if you can save some funds by staying at a relatively affordable hotel which is clean and safe like the Sand Villa, you can free up some funds to do a lot more other things. I would give a 4-star for the hotel itself, but because of the hospitality center, I am giving it a 5-star!

My partner and I stayed at Waikiki Sand Villa for four days after a cruise. We were happily surprised; the room was large, we had a good size 'fridge and coffeemaker. The bathroom was huge, with a hair dryer and tropical shampoos and soaps. The beds were fantastic! The mattress must have been new, because they were so comfortable. We had two balconies, with great views of the mountains, the Ali Wai Canal, where we watched outrigger canoe teams practice. The location was excellent; we were close to ABC store, Smorgy's, Keo's, and Food Pantry.The staff was very friendly and helpful, valet parking was effieient.The pool was great, and so was the hot tub. The landscaping was outstanding.Even tho' its rated at '2 stars', I give it 3 stars for Waikiki. The room was $88 a night and that included taxes.

The two best things about this hotel are the pool and the location. We spent a lot of time out by the pool, including before check-in and after check-out. They have a hospitality room, with free computers, full bathrooms, and massage chair where you can hang out and change your clothes before and after your stay. They were pretty strict on the check-in time, but between storing the luggage with the concierge, the pool, and the hospitality room, it was no big deal. The two worst things about the hotel were the condition of the carpets in the rooms and the fact that you have to use valet parking. The carpets were very threadbare and stained. The valet parking would have been very convenient, except that we had errands to run 4 or 5 times during our one day stay, so it was a bit of a pain. The flip side is that we didn't have to try to squeeze a full-size car into tiny parking spots. The parking was $15.50/day. The rooms are about what I expect in a Waikiki economy hotel...smallish with cheaper beds. We had a sleeps-three room with a double bed and a twin. It was a corner room, so the balcony went around both sides of the corner.

For the price, an excellent place to stay. Location is great, close enough to everything. A few blocks to the beach. The Ala Wai is great for morning runs and you can jog to diamond head on a nice street.Hotel is clean, pool and workout room if you need it. Rooms are above average - not the luxury, but clean. Balcony is a plus, in -room internet sevice, smallish bathroom, quiet air conditioning, no microwave. (A lot of hotels in this range have noisy AC units!). What did I least like? small bathroom, did not have a queen or king bed available, really limited continental breakfast, valet parking. We would prefer self park. Breakfast in the morning is minimal, but what can I say since we took advantage of it everyday! I usually see which hotel is offering the best deal at the time I book. That said, if the rate is comparable, I would book there again!

My wife and i Satyed here for 2 days to get over Jet Lag before heading to Las Vegas.When we arrived we were given the keys to the hospitality suite... Not what you think. This is a room with a couch a tv and 4 computers and was availble to used by al in the hotel. When iasked if we could get a room earlier than the recommend 3pm as it was 8 am around 7 hours away Ross was fantastic and i had a room within 15 min.The room itself was more than adiqute with a nice view of the mountians and 2 double beds.....The only real problem that i found was the traffic noise but as i was there for 2 nights it didnt bother us too much.The best thing about this place was the Bar... A fully stocked for the size of the palce and the bar staff were great getting more more that amppley pissed......If you are reading this and you are from the hotel Thnk you for a good few days......

I stayed in a studio with a kitchenette at the Waikiki Sand Villa and I loved it (April 2007). It was very cute and cozy and for $160 per night, I thought it was a deal. There is a small pool and clean bar/restaurant area in the lobby. The free breakfast in the morning was mini-doughnuts, toast, coffee, OJ and mini-croissants (something to hold you over until lunch). The hotel is about 2 to 3 blocks from the beach so that was the only thing I didn't like but it was across the street from a grocery store which was very, very convenient! The service was okay; I liked the free Internet access in the computer room (2nd) floor. The computers are new and there were about 10 computers so I never had to wait. I would recommend staying at one of the studios; definitely better than the regular rooms.

I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for 1 week. We were travelling the USA for 3 weeks and this was our last stop so we were looking for a 'cheaper' hotel to stay in. We found our stay very relaxing. The location is near to the canal and only a 5 minute stroll to waikikki beach. The staff were very helpful and booked our dolphin excursion and airport transfers for us. I agree with most people that the carpet does need changing it's a bit dated but still seemed to be clean. The pool area and hot tub was lovely and never too busy. I would recommend the Sand Villa for a short stay max 1 week or for low budget travellers who are not looking for 5* luxury.

The room was quite what I was expecting, some furniture were too big, and the rest were small. The conceriege(sp) gal made various mistakes on my tours i reserved, some where never booked when I got to the tour ticket stations. The breakfast could be better and healthier. The guys who helped us get shuttle service gave us wrong time for pick ups hence we never got to some tours. When I asked the front desk for a microwave to use they told me to look on some floors. Liked the balcony, the housekeepers spoke English (the mainland housekeepers say no speak english) and were very nice and helpful. The desk and the guys up front should take lessons from them in customer service.

This hotel is a good value for the money. The rooms are clean, and they have nice balconies with a great view of Waikiki. Its also within short walking distance of a lot of stores and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a free continental breakfast – which was pretty basic. If you’re looking for a budget hotel in Waikiki, I would recommend this place.

The hotel is full of amenities, providing much more value than other comparably priced hotels. The staff are great, the location is great (close to the Food Pantry supermarket) and there is free wired in-room internet (wireless at the pool). We were happy that we were upgraded to the seventh floor with a better view.The only let down was that the walls are somewhat not sound absorbent, and we were constantly woken up by rowdy neighbors next door who thought it was OK to scream and laugh loudly at 3:00 AM every morning when they got in. A quick call to the front desk solved the problem, but it would have been nice not to have to have been bothered in the first place.All in all, great value and I would stay there again.

This was a great hotel to stay at while in Waikiki. First off I would like to say that my wife and I stayed there for 5 nights and never had any problems.A few people put down that they had a horrible stay and problems with the staff. I believe that they went into their trip with a chip on their shoulders. Because I couldn't find any problems with the hotel or staff.The reseveration lady I did bussiness with was name Sally, and she gave me A++++ service. She's the best!The hotel had everything you wanted, Surfboard rentals, a coffee shop, sushi counter, a nice bar, a nice size pool, a very nice and clean lobby, and A VERY FRIENDLY and HELPFULL STAFF. The rooms where always very clean when we would come back from doing whatever we went out to do. The location was great, we walk to everything, International Market, Resturants, Shows, Ticket companies, shops, and of course the beach. Everything was about a 3 minute walk. We rented a SUV for our stay which we only used twice, not including the trip to and from the airport.One thing that we liked about the hotel was the hospitality suite, which had two massage chairs, ($1 dollar for 5 minutes), 5 free internet computers, a TV, a couple of couches, and 2 showers and restrooms. which came in handy on our last day.Also they will hold your bags for you, for no charge, after you have checked out, which in our case our flight left at 12 midnight so it came in good use. They have valet parking only, and the cost for a days parking is $9.00. I understood why they have valet parking, it's because the garage is VERY tight. Will I stay here again, YES, and I will. They treat you first class all the way. I have stayed at other hotels, including a high priced one on Waikiki beach, and I didn't have the same quality of hospitality that the Waikiki Sand Villa gave us. This was by far the BEST hotel that I have stayed at anywhere. Hats off to the people that work there.

This place is okay if you're just looking for a place to shower and sleep, and if you can get a really cheap rate. If you're planning to spend any downtime in the hotel at all, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.My main problem was that the air conditioner in my room did not work at all, so I slept with the lanai doors open all night for ventilation. In humid Hawaii, air conditioning is a must have, at least for me. The beds are hard and uncomfortable, but if you're tired enough you might not notice. Otherwise, the place was decent and fairly clean, except for the carpet which was really dingy. I stayed here for 5 nights, and by the end of my trip I was more than ready to leave. If I ever go back to Honolulu, I'll definitely stay someplace nicer. The barebones hotel had more of an impact on my vacation than I thought it would. Oh, and as other reviews have noted, the building next door really does look like a crackhouse. I wouldn't feel comfortable hanging around that street at night, honestly. When we walked back to the hotel in the evening, we walked quickly.

Plus: very clean rooms, balcony with breathtaking views of the Ala Wai Canal, Ala Wai Country Club and the mountains, free internet, 3 minutes from Waikiki beach, close to ABC storeMinus: free "breakfast" was nothing more than toast and orange juice, lounge is not so spectacular, the building next door looks like a crack house

I think this hotel is a great deal, especially for Waikiki. The rooms were very clean, they have refrigerators and coffee makers, free continental breakfast and free internet. The management and front desk are very friendly. Our first room had a beautiful view and was very clean and in good condition, but because the wall of windows got the morning sun, the room was hot. So they upgraded us to a lovely corner room overlooking this waterway with a great view. No hassels. This is not a 4 star hotel, but then, it had one of the lowest prices on the internet. The location is about 2 blocks from the ocean, in the middle of the shopping area and has a nice pool/patio/hot tub area. I would definitely recommend it for the budget conscious traveler.

We were very pleased with this hotel. We needed a place to stay in Waikiki for only one night on our way home from Kauai. We asked them for a nice room as it was the last night of our honeymoon. Well, they certainly did accommodate our request. They gave us a beautiful corner suite with a gorgeous view. The staff was very pleasant and the room was clean. Check out time was noon and our flight didn't leave until after midnight so the hotel let us use their hospitality room. After our morning check-out they stored all of our bags for us in a locked room. A couple of times during the day we came back for a change of clothes and shower in the hospitality room. There is a television and computers with internet access in there. It was wonderful to have use of that room for the day. Considering that we paid less that $70 for the night, we're very pleased.

Based on what I paid (about $70/night), this was good value in Waikiki. The room was rather small and for some reason I found it a bit depressing. Nothing wrong with it though. It was clean and relatively quiet. The air conditioning was a bit weak. Overall, not a bad value with $9.50 onsite parking being another plus. They were renovating the lobby while I was there, which was a bit annoying, but nothing major. I may stay again, but it would be only because of the price.

I stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa overnight in the middle of a mileage run. The hotel is in the middle of upgrading things (at least the lobby, as they has parts of it roped off as workers were laying down shiny new tile; the elevator cabs appear to be brand new, too). In the lobby area there is a small bar, a Japanese food stand (selling various rolls and other mysterious items), and then another cafe off to the side that didn't have anything appetizing looking at all (I remember seeing the words "Ham & Lettuce Wrap, $4" on the chalkboard). Positives: free internet(!) They have a lounge with machines you can use or you can borrow an Ethernet cable (from the front desk) and hook it up to a jack in your room and surf the net from your laptop. There is also a wireless router in the pool area (the signal from which is too weak to be picked up anywhere else in the hotel, including the lobby area).Booking through the hotel website, I paid for the cheapest room possible (the charge for my one night stay appeared on my card right away, I am not sure if it is a one night deposit or if they will charge for the entire stay ahead of time). While the room they gave me (1015) was very basic, I really liked that I had two balconies. One with a nice view of the canal and the hills. The other one you can kinda make out the ocean between the buildings of the Hyatt. The beach is only a few streets away.I parked my rental car in their valet parking (just under $10 per night), which I believe was a pretty good deal for Waikiki. The valet guy was really nice and let me park a few extra hours beyond my checkout without charge, although they say they reserve the right to charge a half day valet parking rate ($5).The pool appeared to be really clean and nice. They have a whirlpool as well (the timer switch to turn it on is on the other side of the pool.. I saw a few people sitting in the inactive whirlpool without realizing it could be switched on). The bathrooms next to the pool were fetid, but functional.Negatives: The "breakfast" was a joke... you can take your choice of any or all of 1) mini doughnuts 2) various danishes cut in half 3) toast with butter or jam. There's also a juice machine and I think coffee as well. If you are looking for fresh fruit or something more appetizing you can pick up groceries at the ABC store (they're ubiquitous in Waikiki) on the corner and store them in your room fridge. For the price I paid, I was quite satisfied with my stay. I'd stay there again.

We stayed here for 10 nights in October. The hotel itself is a bit dated and basic and needs upgrading but its nice and clean although they were decorating the lobby during our stay. We had a delux room on the 8th floor which was ok, but not what Id call delux. It had a nice view over the canal and mountains in the background. Waikik ibeach is 5mins walk and there are plenty of restaurants, bars, shopping and clubs within walking distance. Breakfast was nice, serving toast, coffee,tea and pastries every morning. The pool area was nice enough too , with a hot tub. The bar is open from 12am-4am every day and is fairley cheap, also selling snacks. They also have a hospitality room with a TV and internet connection. Id stay here again, though I doubt I will ever return to Hawaii as we were disappointed with it.

I stayed there for a couple of days on my way back from Australia on a business trip. As I was by myself, had limited time and didn't plan to spend much time in the hotel (Waikiki beach is a 10-minute walk away), I was't interested in a new, posh hotel experience.The hotel is in need of updating. My room felt old and dated. They serve some pastries, juice and coffee for breakfast out by the pool, which I didn't bother after the first morning.The BEST feature of the hotel is the fact that they hold your bags after you check out and have a room set up where you can clean up including a hot shower. I checked out at noon and was able to use that facility 7 that evening before I left for the airport. Maybe all the hotels in Hawaii do that, but I thought it was excellent.This place is ok if you get a good price but if I went back with my family I'd spend the extra to stay at a nicer place.tip: make sure you do the surfing lessons at Waikiki beach - it's a blast!

We stayed eleven nights in August 2006. Good rates for the area and conveniently located. Staff helpful, especially at the Travel Desk. Elevators quit once and water was shut off twice, but rooms were comfortable with a great view. Would definitely stay again.

My visit to the Waikiki Sand Villa took place Sept 29-Oct 8 2006...I've been to Waikiki many times and usually stay at another budget hotel about a block away but their rates were pretty high this time. I found an EXCELLENT rate on Expedia for the WSV and decided to give it a try. There were good and bad things about this hotel....First-the good things:The staff was very friendly and helpful-front desk, valet and housekeeping. Upon checking in and checking out, the front desk really made me feel that they were happy to have me as a guest. That alone might make me want to return!The pool area is very nice! There is not alot of sun in the morning but by afternoon there are quite a few sunny areas. There are tables and chairs as well as lounge chairs and many people had lunch or coctails poolside. Nice place to hang out if you tire of the sand at the beach :)Nice little workout room right by the pool with several treadmills and other equipment. I did not use it because I ran by the canal and the running path by the zoo, but it would be nice for someone who likes to work out in air conditioning.The Sand Bar sports bar with big screen TVs is a great place to hang out. Located right inside the lobby of the hotel, it's a fun place to have cocktails. They have happy hour daily from 4-7 with $2 beer and $2 glasses of wine (although I wish they would change their brand of wine. There are so many good ones that are inexpensive that taste a whole lot better :) They are in the process of renovating the bar area and it looks like it will be about 3 times the size when they are finished. Free internet service is located in the bar and it's nice to have a drink and check your email. Freddy the bartender is great...very friendly and he makes a great Mai Tai (which are $1 cheaper at happy hour). I met alot of nice locals that hang out here too.The location of the hotel is convenient. Just about two blocks from the beach and right across the street from the Ala Wai Canal. There is a Food Pantry across the street that is fully stocked with grocery items with a little bakery and deli. They also have a large selection and good prices and on beer and wine.The hotel and hotel room was clean. I stayed in room 620-a room with a double bed and a twin bed (considered a premium city corner room). While it was evident that the carpet was a bit worn and the bathroom really needs updated, it was clean although small. The housekeeping service was better some days than others but I always had clean towels and they always cleaned the bathroom daily. The room also had a nice size mini refrigerator which I stocked with some items from the Food Pantry. There was also a 4 cup coffee maker with 1 free pack of coffee. (You could purchase more at the front desk for $1 if you so desired). The only problem was that the plug for the coffee maker did not reach the outlet in the back of the wall so I had to sit the tray on the floor to make coffee. No big deal really. There was ample drawer space and a place to hang your clothes with hangers furnished. The cable TV offered plenty of stations if you want to unwind with tv at the end of the night or catch the news in the morning. A desk with one chair sat in the corner. This room was comfortable enough for 2 people. A bit small but I've been in smaller rooms.The hotel did have a safe available in the room to use for $2.50 a day. What I appreciated the most about this is that they did not automatically charge you, like alot of hotels do. If you wanted to use the safe you asked the front desk for a key for it. Otherwise there was no charge. Nice.There is valet parking available for approx $9.50 per day with in and out privilleges. We were always able to park no matter what time of the day we went in and out. I did, on occasion see parking available at the meters on the side street.Now the cons---none of which ruined my vacation!I would not book a 'premium' room again. They consider it a premium room because it has 2 balconies. The balconies are very small and NOT worth the extra cost. It was still nice to sit outside and have a glass of wine. (there are 2 chairs and a small table). I had a city premium corner room but still had a bit of a view of the Ala Wai Canal (very pretty, with the golf course in the background). The view of the city was nothing pretty.The noise in the morning of the 'beeping' of the garbage trucks was annoying. It started pretty early (like 5 am) and lasted what seemed like forever! :) after a few days I started getting use to it but it might be less noisy on a higher floor. I was on the 6th.Both the bathroom sink and the bathtub drain backed up daily. I had to learn just how much I could turn the faucets on to avoid the tub and sink filling up. Annoying but I finally got a system down! :) Perhaps management could occasionally 'snake' the pipes to avoid this.The complementary breakfast by the pool was a nice gesture but it's mainly white toast and prepackaged doughnut holes. It would be nice if they just offered some wheat toast, bagels or fruit with coffee. The coffee cups were very small styrofoam cups that you could drink down in two gulps. Perhaps bigger cups with lids so you could fill your cup and hit the road. Also, they only serve until 9am. After a night on the town it's nice to sleep in since it's vacation :) Still, it was nice that they made an effort to offer something to their guests.My stay here was pleasant and I had a wonderful time while on Oahu. I climbed Diamond Head one morning and it was a nice workout! Make sure you take a water bottle! The view from the top is beautiful. Lots of wonderful restaurants. I especially like Chuck's Cellar located a block away in the Ohana East. Wonderful prime rib with a nice soup and salad bar. It's also a piano bar-dark with lots of ambiance and high leather booths. A great place for a mai tai with a gorgeous view is the Hale Koa Hotel located next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Barefoot Bar is really nice and we met some great people there.I hope your future travels are happy ones!Lisa

I wasn't too sure about this hotel beforehand, but once we had settled in we loved the place! Ok, the food isn't great but there are so many places to eat in Waikiki that it wasn't a problem. We had a premium corner room with a great view of the golf course and Diamond Head. It was a bonus to be able to watch the sun rise in the morning from our bed. If you're looking for a comfortable hotel on a budget then this is the one. If you're looking for luxury then go to the Hilton. You don't spend that much time in your room when you're in Waikiki anyway. All in all, the reception staff were helpful (although the bar staff were rude) housekeeping was pleasant, room and bed was comfortable....My advice is spend the money you save by staying here on enjoying yourself in Waikiki.

Ok, so I took a chance, I read the reviews, and thought it wouldn't be so bad, I had seen some reviews like "this place is awful, I would never stay here again", so I was very surprised to see what a wonderful hotel it was. First of all, the carpet was perfect, it wasn't dirty torn up or stained, second of all, the service was terrific, I was a little surprised that they only gave us one pack of coffie, but I got over it. The rooms were very clean, no mold in any of them, and the hotel is only a very short walk from the beach, at most 10 minutes, there is a small restauraunt on the first floor that serves great smoothies, and a sushi bar. The hotel has a beautifully decorated and furnished hospitality floor, with 8 or nine windows xp computers, and a printer for 20 cents a copy. The continental Breakfast consisted of some filling but rather cheap pastrys, with hot toast, and coffie, and the pool looked beautiful though I didnt go in. All in all I think this was a great hotel, and I would gladly stay here again.

We stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villas after reading several good reviews. We are a family of 4, two adults with two children aged 11 & 13. The room we had contained two double beds, with everything you'd expect, tv, coffee facilities, fridge etc. The room was clean as was the bathroom. The pillows were flat, so after one night i requested three more, and they were left behind whilst we were out. The hospitality room is a god send, as we checked out at 11am, then had to wait until 8pm before we went to the airport. The hotel also has a laundry room, which after travelling for some time is also a must! We used the gym a couple of times and swam in the pool, both being clean and comfortable. One little problem which happened a few times was the lifts would stop working, so we had to walk down several flights of stairs, for us not a problem, but for older people could prove difficult. The hotel is on a corner, and there is some traffic noise throughout the night, but the location makes up for that small inconvenience. We were close to shops, supermarkets and the beach. We took a tour to the Arizona and Missouri, and had a great day out with our tour guide. We booked this through the lovely lady in the hotel lobby.I'd stay here again!

Great hotel and location! Our room had a mountain and golf course view that was breath taking. The room had a Hawaiian feel to it. It is only a short two and a half blocks to the beach. The front desk was very helpful. The computers on the Hospitality floor were priceless. We were able to e-mail friends and family and print our boarding passes. Wonderful shopping and restaurants can be found within a one and two block distance. Try Keolani's--great Thai! We booked the combination Pearl Harbor and Circle Island Tour with Discovery Hawaii Tours suggested by this hotel. What a fun day! Our tour guide was informative and hilarious. He stayed with us through most of the Pearl Harbor trip giving us additional information and key tips for the exhibit on how to get the best location and pictures. Most of the other tour companies dropped off their customers and left them. I think that most of the negative reviewers expect a five star hotel when they pay low prices to stay at this hotel. If they want a five star hotel, then they should stay at the Hyatt or Sheraton and pay $600/night. The Waikiki Sand Villa met our needs and then some. It was clean and well appointed. My husband and I will definitely be back!

The place was very slum like ... even the paint colors reminded me of a low budget motel somewhere. People walked around yelling and screaming and slamming doors. I wondered if I was in an apartment building. The "continental breakfast" is watered down orange soda, toast thrown on a plate after you sign a paper saying you got some food, and coffee that makes your stomache hurt all day. The pillows were rock hard and the bed sounded like it would break as you sat on it. You can hear the TV in the next room. The place is real lowly... but if it's just friends hanging out, it might be perfect. The pool is great, the bar and pool tables make you feel like you're hanging out. Valet is one person for like 30 people, so leave your room early (there's ONLY valet parking $10 a day). Not recommended.

Stayed there for three nights in July 2006. For the price it really is a clean, well maintained place. Not on the beach but is within walking distance. We had a standard room on the top floor so the view was of the Ala Wai canal and the city, which was nice. The bar and pool are full of people having a great time. There is an internet connection in the rooms but the WiFi is down in the lobby only. The bathroom was clean but the shower backed up every time. The parking rate was decent (about ten dollars a day) but it is valet parking only and the system is not terribly organized. No room service, but snack food avaliable at the bar. If you must stay in Waikiki (and I don't recommend doing so) you might as well save some money and stay in this place.

We stayed in the Waikiki Sand Villa for 3 nights in May. The wireless internet for only guests was a plus and the free continental breakfast was decent. We had a corner room so we were able to open the 2 linai doors for the fresh breezes. The decor was dated and the room was on the damp side, but most of our hotels in Hawaii were a little damp. (We stayed in 6 hotels in various parts of the islands.) We really only used the hotel to sleep and toured the island during the day. Decent budget hotel if you are just looking for a place to lay your head and aren't overly picky. What do you expect for $79???

This is a great hotel.... The decor is a little dated but thats the only complaint I have!! Location is perfect, staff are friendly, complimentary breakfast is served by the pool each morning, theres free internet access for guests and a lovely bar for a quiet evening drink. You will not find this for the price anywhere else in Waikiki. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Sand Villa for 3 days in June '06. Considering the hotel is just 3 short blocks away from the beach and its dirt cheap compared to the other hotels on the beach, I felt it was a steal! I've stayed at 3,4, and 5 star hotels and yes they may be more luxurious, but why pay an arm and a leg to look at your eyelids (sleeping) if you know you'll be out and about in beautiful Hawaii. It looked like and older Holiday Inn and the staff was courteous and our requests (just for an ironing board and directions) were met quickly. Valet parking is $9.50, but that seems to be anywhere near Waikiki. We paid just $79!!!!! per night. We just walked over the the larger 4 and 5 star hotels to hang out, but laid our head at the pretty decent Sand Villa. If you want to be pampered and stay in your hotel most of the day, don't stay here. But if you're looking for a bargin and plan to sleep in you room for a pit stop each day, then you can find a bargin here.

As a business traveller; I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. The High Speed in the rooms was great (bring your cable!) The new work out room is super and the hotel is right on the Ala Wai to get out to the H1. They also have a business room with computers and copier-I didn't use it as I didn't need it. The carpeting is well worn, but the bathrroom is immaculate with great pressure in the shower, the staff is nice (helpful, but they won't kill themselves for you) and the elevators are slow...but they are putting in new ones.That said, I'd never bring my wife or family here as they would hate it. The rooms are small, the aircon doesn't work very well (they need ceiling fans!), don't be fooled by breakast - it is just donuts and coffee, the pool is nice and the bar is not bad. But, if you come here with the family, you need to be by the beach.The Valet Parking is a nice touch, but at certain times it can be really bad as they are really tight on space...but at $9.37 per day, it is a good deal. They also have done some cool things with their wifi by the pool and their internet access by the bar.As a business traveller, this place fit all of my needs. If you are looking for something with a lot of extras, spend the bucks and stay in one of the big hotels by the beach.

I didn't go to Hawaii to stay in my room all day, so for the prices and service this Hotel was great. The staff was very friendly and accomadating. If I was looking for Hilton Hawaiian or Royal Hawaiian service and amenities then I would have to pay thousands extra for it. I find that most of the people that slam this hotel and others like it, are looking for that type of service but don't want to pay for it. Close to all shopping, beaches and a nice view of the golf course. This was our first trip to Hawaii and it was awesome,we came away with wonderful memories, and that's what's important.

I stayed at Sand Villa during first week of April 2006. I had read some reviews criticizing the hotel for the carpet, size of rooms, old feel, etc. This isn't the Sheraton and it doesn't charge exorbitant rates. If you want a beautiful fancy hotel, don't stay here and then be unhappy about it. It is what it is. If you are comfortable with modest accomodations, well, this is the place for you.I loved this place as did the rest of the people who I met there. We had an little room with a view of the canal and golf course. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and did a great job of making sure we had clean towels. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful with their knowledge of the local area. Dennis was fantastic with great directions and information.The parking fees are low for that area and the valet service was excellent. There was one time we had to wait for our car but that was the exception.The pool area is quiet and relaxing. The pool was a bit chilly. The Sand bar was a great little place to relax and the free internet access was excellent. The proximity to the beach, bars, shopping and restaurants was only 2 blocks.This is a great place to stay if you are an economy traveller and don't plan on staying in your room to often.

We arrived on the Island a few days early to explore the place so we booked into this hotel for four nights before moving to a nicer hotel for a conference. We were aware that we had booked into a budget hotel so weren't expecting anything fantastic. It suited us to do so as we intended to be out visiting the Islands sights most of the time but we didn't expect what we got.Firstly the room we stayed in was very damp & cold. We were unable to get any heat into it. The carpet had most certainly seen better days-you would not feel comfortable walking on it in bare feet & the bathroom was very very grotty. The whole place felt dirty. Decor was very old.The domestic staff were very pleasant & our room was cleaned each day but sleeping in a damp musky room was just not at all pleasant. We found all bar one of the front desk staff very rude & unhelpful. The bar staff were unbelievable & the waitresses had more interest in standing smoking cigarettes during their shift in full view of customers then serving customers. My girlfriend tried asking one of the wairesses were the restroom was one evening but she was more interested in giggling with two guys then answering her question. We could not actually believe how little respect for their jobs most of the staff have. We obviously will not be staying at this hotel again. Dr Gavin Convey

Stayed over New Years for a week with my fiance, Upon arrival as we had just gotten engaged (at Christmas) I asked the receptionist whether we could be upgraded F.O.C, To my delight they did, and we ended-up with a lovely corner delux room with stunning views of the canel and skyline. Hotel is generally a little tired, and could do with a 'bob or two' spent on it to bring it up to date, however I found the rooms to be of a good size, clean, and the receptionist staff both friendly and efficient. Overall for the money, its a very decent hotel with a fabulous pool!

My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights in November 2005 after booking last minute through Expedia. We were a bit weary about staying at this hotel after reading previous reviews. However, can I just say that, the first time we stayed in Waikiki, it was in a top class hotel and once we closed our hotel room door, there was little comparison between the Sands Villa and the top class hotel room - both were clean, slightly old fashioned in decor but a great base to stay. We stayed on the 7th floor and overlooked the local canal which was picturesque. We thought the hospitality room was a nice touch, with free internet access and the facilities in the bar, ie Pool, Darts. The complimentary breakfast was extremely basic - altough surprisingly enjoyable - after all we had not paid to eat there. All in all we found this hotel to be a good base and would stay here again.

I stayed here as part of a group. The pool and jaccuzi were large for a Waikiki hotel. Room was clean. Check in staff were friendly. It was nice to be able to check email at the bar area. Reasonable parking(valet $9) A great value for <$100. Would come back again.

We'd been staying with a friend who lives in Waikiki, but needed to get a room at the last minute due to unforseen circumstances. Unfortunately we thought we'd save some money by staying at the Sand Villa for two nights before moving on to the very expensive Hyatt (which is the only hotel available this weekend due to the NFL Pro Bowl.) Big mistake.We requested a non-smoking room because I'm pregnant and very sensitive to smells. We were told at check-in that they're full and so we were being given a smoking room, but "there's a brisk wind so if you open the door to the lanai, it should be okay." Well it is not. The room smells so bad it's almost unbearable. I did leave the door to the lanai open until 3 a.m. at which point I had to shut it in order to finally sleep.
